10:107.t: And if Allāh should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

10:108.t: Say, "O mankind, the truth has come to you from your Lord, so whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a manager."

10:11.t: And if Allāh was to hasten for the people the evil [they invoke] as He hastens for them the good, their term would have been ended for them. But We leave the ones who do not expect the meeting with Us, in their transgression, wandering blindly.

10:12.t: And when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, whether lying on his side or sitting or standing; but when We remove from him his affliction, he continues [in disobedience] as if he had never called upon Us to [remove] an affliction that touched him. Thus is made pleasing to the transgressors that which they have been doing.

10:13.t: And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.

10:2.t: Have the people been amazed that We revealed [revelation] to a man from among them, [saying], "Warn mankind and give good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their Lord"? [But] the disbelievers say, "Indeed, this is an obvious magician."

10:20.t: And they say, "Why is a sign not sent down to him from his Lord?" So say, "The unseen is only for Allāh [to administer], so wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."

10:21.t: And when We give the people a taste of mercy after adversity has touched them, at once they conspire against Our verses. Say, "Allāh is swifter in strategy." Indeed, Our messengers [i.e., angels] record that which you conspire.

10:22.t: It is He who enables you to travel on land and sea until, when you are in ships and they sail with them by a good wind and they rejoice therein, there comes a storm wind and the waves come upon them from every place and they expect to be engulfed, they supplicate Allāh, sincere to Him in religion, "If You should save us from this, we will surely be among the thankful."

10:23.t: But when He saves them, at once they commit injustice upon the earth without right. O mankind, your injustice is only against yourselves, [being merely] the enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.

10:24.t: The example of [this] worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky that the plants of the earth absorb - [those] from which men and livestock eat - until, when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they have capability over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain in detail the signs for a people who give thought.

10:25.t: And Allāh invites to the Home of Peace [i.e., Paradise] and guides whom He wills to a straight path.

It will be as if their faces are covered with pieces of the night - so dark [are they]. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

10:3.t: Indeed, your Lord is Allāh, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne, arranging the matter [of His creation]. There is no intercessor except after His permission. That is Allāh, your Lord, so worship Him. Then will you not remember?

There is no intercessor except after His permission.
That is Allāh, your Lord, so worship Him.
Then will you not remember?

10:30.t: There, [on that Day], every soul will be put to trial for what it did previously, and they will be returned to Allāh, their master, the Truth, and lost from them is whatever they used to invent.

segments.t: There, [on that Day],

10:31.t: Say, "Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? Or who controls hearing and sight and who brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and who arranges [every] matter?" They will say, "Allāh," so say, "Then will you not fear Him?"

10:32.t: For that is Allāh, your Lord, the Truth. And what can be beyond truth except error? So how are you averted?

segments.t: For that is Allāh, your Lord, the Truth.

10:33.t: Thus the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord has come into effect upon those who defiantly disobeyed - that they will not believe.

10:34.t: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who begins creation and then repeats it?" Say, "Allāh begins creation and then repeats it, so how are you deluded?"

10:36.t: And most of them follow not except assumption. Indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of what they do.

10:37.t: And it was not [possible] for this Qur’ān to be produced by other than Allāh, but [it is] a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of the [former] Scripture, about which there is no doubt, from the Lord of the worlds.

10:38.t: Or do they say [about the Prophet (ﷺ)], "He invented it?" Say, "Then bring forth a sūrah like it and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allāh, if you should be truthful."

10:39.t: Rather, they have denied that which they encompass not in knowledge and whose interpretation has not yet come to them. Thus did those before them deny. Then observe how was the end of the wrongdoers.

10:4.t: To Him is your return all together. [It is] the promise of Allāh [which is] truth. Indeed, He begins the [process of] creation and then repeats it that He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds, in justice. But those who disbelieved will have a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment for what they used to deny.

10:40.t: And of them are those who believe in it, and of them are those who do not believe in it. And your Lord is most knowing of the corrupters.

segments.t: And of them are those who believe in it,

10:41.t: And if they deny you, [O Muḥammad], then say, "For me are my deeds, and for you are your deeds. You are disassociated from what I do, and I am disassociated from what you do."

10:42.t: And among them are those who listen to you. But can you cause the deaf to hear [i.e., benefit from this hearing], although they will not use reason?

But can you cause the deaf to hear [i.e., benefit from this hearing],
although they will not use reason?

10:43.t: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind although they will not [attempt to] see?

segments.t: And among them are those who look at you.
But can you guide the blind
although they will not [attempt to] see?

10:44.t: Indeed, Allāh does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who are wronging themselves.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh does not wrong the people at all,
but it is the people who are wronging themselves.

10:45.t: And on the Day when He will gather them, [it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day, [and] they will know each other. Those will have lost who denied the meeting with Allāh and were not guided.

segments.t: And on the Day when He will gather them,
[it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world]
but an hour of the day,
[and] they will know each other.
Those will have lost who denied the meeting with Allāh
and were not guided.

10:46.t: And whether We show you some of what We promise them, [O Muḥammad], or We take you in death, to Us is their return; then, [either way], Allāh is a witness concerning what they are doing.

segments.t: And whether We show you some of what We promise them, [O Muḥammad],
or We take you in death,
to Us is their return;
then, [either way], Allāh is a witness concerning what they are doing.

10:47.t: And for every nation is a messenger. So when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: And for every nation is a messenger.
So when their messenger comes,
it will be judged between them in justice,
and they will not be wronged.

10:48.t: And they say, "When is [the fulfillment of] this promise, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: And they say,
"When is [the fulfillment of] this promise,
if you should be truthful?"

10:49.t: Say, "I possess not for myself any harm or benefit except what Allāh should will. For every nation is a [specified] term. When their time has come, then they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it]."

segments.t: Say, "I possess not for myself any harm or benefit
except what Allāh should will.
For every nation is a [specified] term.
When their time has come,
then they will not remain behind an hour,
nor will they precede [it]."

10:5.t: It is He who made the sun a shining light and the moon a derived light and determined for it phases - that you may know the number of years and account [of time]. Allāh has not created this except in truth. He details the signs for a people who know.

segments.t: It is He who made the sun a shining light
and the moon a derived light
and determined for it phases -
that you may know the number of years and account [of time].
Allāh has not created this except in truth.
He details the signs for a people who know.

10:50.t: Say, "Have you considered: if His punishment should come to you by night or by day - for which [aspect] of it would the criminals be impatient?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if His punishment should come to you by night or by day -
for which [aspect] of it would the criminals be impatient?"

10:51.t: Then is it that when it has [actually] occurred you will believe in it? Now? And you were [once] for it impatient.

segments.t: Then is it that when it has [actually] occurred
you will believe in it?
Now?
And you were [once] for it impatient.

10:52.t: Then it will be said to those who had wronged, "Taste the punishment of eternity; are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?"

segments.t: Then it will be said to those who had wronged,
"Taste the punishment of eternity;
are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?"

10:53.t: And they ask information of you, [O Muḥammad], "Is it true?" Say, "Yes, by my Lord. Indeed, it is truth; and you will not cause failure [to Allāh]."

segments.t: And they ask information of you, [O Muḥammad],
"Is it true?"
Say, "Yes, by my Lord.
Indeed, it is truth;
and you will not cause failure [to Allāh]."

10:54.t: And if each soul that wronged had everything on earth, it would offer it in ransom. And they will confide regret when they see the punishment; and they will be judged in justice, and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: And if each soul that wronged had everything on earth,
it would offer it in ransom.
And they will confide regret when they see the punishment;
and they will be judged in justice,
and they will not be wronged.

10:55.t: Unquestionably, to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Unquestionably, the promise of Allāh is truth, but most of them do not know.

segments.t: Unquestionably, to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth.
Unquestionably, the promise of Allāh is truth,
but most of them do not know.

10:56.t: He gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned.

segments.t: He gives life and causes death,
and to Him you will be returned.

10:57.t: O mankind, there has come to you instruction from your Lord and healing for what is in the breasts and guidance and mercy for the believers.

segments.t: O mankind,
there has come to you instruction from your Lord
and healing for what is in the breasts
and guidance and mercy for the believers.

10:58.t: Say, "In the bounty of Allāh and in His mercy - in that let them rejoice; it is better than what they accumulate."

segments.t: Say, "In the bounty of Allāh
and in His mercy -
in that let them rejoice;
it is better than what they accumulate."

10:59.t: Say, "Have you seen what Allāh has sent down to you of provision of which you have made [some] lawful and [some] unlawful?" Say, "Has Allāh permitted you [to do so], or do you invent [something] about Allāh?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you seen what Allāh has sent down to you of provision
of which you have made [some] lawful and [some] unlawful?"
Say, "Has Allāh permitted you [to do so],
or do you invent [something] about Allāh?"

10:6.t: Indeed, in the alternation of the night and the day and [in] what Allāh has created in the heavens and the earth are signs for a people who fear Allāh.

segments.t: Indeed, in the alternation of the night and the day
and [in] what Allāh has created in the heavens and the earth
are signs for a people who fear Allāh.

10:60.t: And what will be the supposition of those who invent falsehood about Allāh on the Day of Resurrection? Indeed, Allāh is the possessor of bounty for the people, but most of them are not grateful.

segments.t: And what will be the supposition of those who invent falsehood about Allāh
on the Day of Resurrection?
Indeed, Allāh is the possessor of bounty for the people,
but most of them are not grateful.

10:61.t: And, [O Muḥammad], you are not [engaged] in any matter and do not recite any of the Qur’ān and you [people] do not do any deed except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it. And not absent from your Lord is any [part] of an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven or [anything] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register.

segments.t: And, [O Muḥammad], you are not [engaged] in any matter
and do not recite any of the Qur’ān
and you [people] do not do any deed
except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it.
And not absent from your Lord is any [part] of an atom's weight
within the earth or within the heaven
or [anything] smaller than that or greater
but that it is in a clear register.

10:62.t: Unquestionably, [for] the allies of Allāh there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve -

segments.t: Unquestionably,
[for] the allies of Allāh
there will be no fear concerning them,
nor will they grieve -

10:63.t: Those who believed and were fearing Allāh.

segments.t: Those who believed
and were fearing Allāh.

10:64.t: For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. No change is there in the words [i.e., decrees] of Allāh. That is what is the great attainment.

segments.t: For them are good tidings
in the worldly life and in the Hereafter.
No change is there in the words [i.e., decrees] of Allāh.
That is what is the great attainment.

10:65.t: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs to Allāh entirely. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: And let not their speech grieve you.
Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs to Allāh entirely.
He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

10:66.t: Unquestionably, to Allāh belongs whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth. And those who invoke other than Allāh do not [actually] follow [His] "partners." They follow not except assumption, and they are not but misjudging.

segments.t: Unquestionably, to Allāh belongs whoever is in the heavens
and whoever is on the earth.
And those who invoke other than Allāh do not [actually] follow [His] "partners."
They follow not except assumption,
and they are not but misjudging.

10:67.t: It is He who made for you the night to rest therein and the day, giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

segments.t: It is He who made for you the night to rest therein
and the day, giving sight.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

10:68.t: They have said, "Allāh has taken a son." Exalted is He; He is the [one] Free of need. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. You have no authority for this [claim]. Do you say about Allāh that which you do not know?

segments.t: They have said, "Allāh has taken a son."
Exalted is He;
He is the [one] Free of need.
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is in the earth.
You have no authority for this [claim].
Do you say about Allāh that which you do not know?

10:69.t: Say, "Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allāh will not succeed."

segments.t: Say,
"Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allāh
will not succeed."

10:7.t: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel secure therein and those who are heedless of Our signs -

segments.t: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us
and are satisfied with the life of this world
and feel secure therein
and those who are heedless of Our signs -

10:70.t: [For them is brief] enjoyment in this world; then to Us is their return; then We will make them taste the severe punishment because they used to disbelieve.

segments.t: [For them is brief] enjoyment in this world;
then to Us is their return;
then We will make them taste the severe punishment
because they used to disbelieve.

10:71.t: And recite to them the news of Noah, when he said to his people, "O my people, if my residence and my reminding of the signs of Allāh has become burdensome upon you - then I have relied upon Allāh. So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.

segments.t: And recite to them the news of Noah,
when he said to his people,
"O my people,
if my residence and my reminding of the signs of Allāh
has become burdensome upon you -
then I have relied upon Allāh.
So resolve upon your plan and [call upon] your associates.
Then let not your plan be obscure to you.
Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.

10:72.t: And if you turn away [from my advice] - then no payment have I asked of you. My reward is only from Allāh, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims [i.e., those who submit to Allāh]."

segments.t: And if you turn away [from my advice] -
then no payment have I asked of you.
My reward is only from Allāh,
and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims [i.e., those who submit to Allāh]."

10:73.t: And they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship and made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.

segments.t: And they denied him,
so We saved him and those with him in the ship
and made them successors,
and We drowned those who denied Our signs.
Then see how was the end of those who were warned.

10:74.t: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors.

segments.t: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples,
and they came to them with clear proofs.
But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before.
Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors.

10:75.t: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people.

segments.t: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron
to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs,
but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people.

10:76.t: So when there came to them the truth from Us, they said, "Indeed, this is obvious magic."

segments.t: So when there came to them the truth from Us,
they said, "Indeed, this is obvious magic."

10:77.t: Moses said, "Do you say [thus] about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But magicians will not succeed."

segments.t: Moses said,
"Do you say [thus] about the truth
when it has come to you?
Is this magic?
But magicians will not succeed."

10:78.t: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have grandeur in the land? And we are not believers in you."

segments.t: They said,
"Have you come to us to turn us away
from that upon which we found our fathers
and so that you two may have grandeur in the land?
And we are not believers in you."

10:79.t: And Pharaoh said, "Bring to me every learned magician."

segments.t: And Pharaoh said,
"Bring to me every learned magician."

10:8.t: For those their refuge will be the Fire because of what they used to earn.

segments.t: For those their refuge will be the Fire
because of what they used to earn.

10:80.t: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you will throw."

segments.t: So when the magicians came,
Moses said to them,
"Throw down whatever you will throw."

10:81.t: And when they had thrown, Moses said, "What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, Allāh will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, Allāh does not amend the work of corrupters.

segments.t: And when they had thrown,
Moses said,
"What you have brought is [only] magic.
Indeed, Allāh will expose its worthlessness.
Indeed, Allāh does not amend the work of corrupters.

10:82.t: And Allāh will establish the truth by His words, even if the criminals dislike it."

segments.t: And Allāh will establish the truth by His words,
even if the criminals dislike it."

10:83.t: But no one believed Moses, except [some] offspring [i.e., youths] among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors.

segments.t: But no one believed Moses,
except [some] offspring [i.e., youths] among his people,
for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment
that they would persecute them.
And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land,
and indeed, he was of the transgressors.

10:84.t: And Moses said, "O my people, if you have believed in Allāh, then rely upon Him, if you should be Muslims [i.e., submitting to Him]."

segments.t: And Moses said,
"O my people,
if you have believed in Allāh,
then rely upon Him,
if you should be Muslims [i.e., submitting to Him]."

10:85.t: So they said, "Upon Allāh do we rely. Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people

segments.t: So they said,
"Upon Allāh do we rely.
Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial
for the wrongdoing people

10:86.t: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people."

segments.t: And save us by Your mercy
from the disbelieving people."

10:87.t: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [facing the] qiblah and establish prayer and give good tidings to the believers."

segments.t: And We inspired to Moses and his brother,
"Settle your people in Egypt in houses
and make your houses [facing the] qiblah
and establish prayer
and give good tidings to the believers."

10:88.t: And Moses said, "Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment."

segments.t: And Moses said,
"Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment
splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord,
that they may lead [men] astray from Your way.
Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts
so that they will not believe
until they see the painful punishment."

10:89.t: [Allāh] said, "Your supplication has been answered." So remain on a right course and follow not the way of those who do not know."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Your supplication has been answered."
So remain on a right course
and follow not the way of those who do not know."

10:9.t: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - their Lord will guide them because of their faith. Beneath them rivers will flow in the Gardens of Pleasure.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds -
their Lord will guide them because of their faith.
Beneath them rivers will flow in the Gardens of Pleasure.

10:90.t: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."

segments.t: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea,
and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity
until, when drowning overtook him, he said,
"I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe,
and I am of the Muslims."

10:91.t: Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters?

segments.t: Now?
And you had disobeyed [Him] before
and were of the corrupters?

10:92.t: So today We will save you in body that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless.

segments.t: So today We will save you in body
that you may be to those who succeed you a sign.
And indeed, many among the people,
of Our signs, are heedless.

10:93.t: And We had certainly settled the Children of Israel in an agreeable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until [after] knowledge had come to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

segments.t: And We had certainly settled the Children of Israel
in an agreeable settlement
and provided them with good things.
And they did not differ until [after] knowledge had come to them.
Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection
concerning that over which they used to differ.

10:94.t: So if you are in doubt, [O Muḥammad], about that which We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.

segments.t: So if you are in doubt, [O Muḥammad],
about that which We have revealed to you,
then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you.
The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord,
so never be among the doubters.

10:95.t: And never be of those who deny the signs of Allāh and [thus] be among the losers.

segments.t: And never be of those who deny the signs of Allāh
and [thus] be among the losers.

10:96.t: Indeed, those upon whom the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord has come into effect will not believe,

segments.t: Indeed, those upon whom the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord
has come into effect
will not believe,

10:97.t: Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful punishment.

segments.t: Even if every sign should come to them,
until they see the painful punishment.

10:98.t: Then has there not been a [single] city that believed so its faith benefited it except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time.

segments.t: Then has there not been a [single] city that believed
so its faith benefited it
except the people of Jonah?
When they believed,
We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life
and gave them enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time.

10:99.t: And had your Lord willed, those on earth would have believed - all of them entirely. Then, [O Muḥammad], would you compel the people in order that they become believers?

segments.t: And had your Lord willed,
those on earth would have believed -
all of them entirely.
Then, [O Muḥammad],
would you compel the people
in order that they become believers?

110:1.t: When the victory of Allāh has come and the conquest,

segments.t: When the victory of Allāh has come
and the conquest,

110:2.t: And you see the people entering into the religion of Allāh in multitudes,

segments.t: And you see the people
entering into the religion of Allāh
in multitudes,

110:3.t: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.

segments.t: Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord
and ask forgiveness of Him.
Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.

111:1.t: May the hands of Abū Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.

segments.t: May the hands of Abū Lahab be ruined,
and ruined is he.

111:2.t: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.

segments.t: His wealth will not avail him
or that which he gained.

111:3.t: He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame

segments.t: He will [enter to] burn
in a Fire of [blazing] flame

111:4.t: And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.

segments.t: And his wife [as well] -
the carrier of firewood.

111:5.t: Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.

segments.t: Around her neck is a rope
of [twisted] fiber.
Say, "He is Allāh,
[who is] One,
Allāh,
the Eternal Refuge.

112:3.t: He neither begets nor is born,

segments.t: He neither begets
nor is born,

112:4.t: Nor is there to Him any equivalent."

segments.t: Nor is there to Him any equivalent."

113:1.t: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak

segments.t: Say, "I seek refuge
in the Lord of daybreak

113:2.t: From the evil of that which He created

segments.t: From the evil
of that which He created

113:3.t: And from the evil of darkness when it settles

segments.t: And from the evil of darkness
when it settles

113:4.t: And from the evil of the blowers in knots

segments.t: And from the evil of the blowers in knots

113:5.t: And from the evil of an envier when he envies."

segments.t: And from the evil of an envier
when he envies."

114:1.t: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,

segments.t: Say, "I seek refuge
in the Lord of mankind,
The Sovereign of mankind,
The God of mankind,

114:4.t: From the evil of the retreating whisperer -

segments.t: From the evil of the retreating whisperer -

114:5.t: Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -

segments.t: Who whispers [evil]
into the breasts of mankind -

114:6.t: From among the jinn and mankind."

segments.t: From among the jinn and mankind."

11:1.t: Alif, Lām, Rā. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Aware

segments.t: Alif, Lām, Rā.
[This is] a Book whose verses are perfected
and then presented in detail
from [one who is] Wise and Aware

11:10.t: But if We give him a taste of favor after hardship has touched him, he will surely say, "Bad times have left me." Indeed, he is exultant and boastful -

segments.t: But if We give him a taste of favor
after hardship has touched him,
he will surely say,
"Bad times have left me."
Indeed, he is exultant and boastful -

11:100.t: That is from the news of the cities, which We relate to you; of them, some are [still] standing and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].

segments.t: That is from the news of the cities,
which We relate to you;
of them, some are [still] standing
and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].

11:101.t: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. And they were not availed at all by their gods which they invoked other than Allāh when there came the command of your Lord. And they did not increase them in other than ruin.

segments.t: And We did not wrong them,
but they wronged themselves.
And they were not availed at all by their gods
which they invoked other than Allāh
when there came the command of your Lord.
And they did not increase them in other than ruin.

11:102.t: And thus is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.

segments.t: And thus is the seizure of your Lord
when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong.
Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.

11:103.t: Indeed in that is a sign for those who fear the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which the people will be collected, and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.

segments.t: Indeed in that is a sign
for those who fear the punishment of the Hereafter.
That is a Day for which the people will be collected,
and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.

11:104.t: And We do not delay it except for a limited term.

segments.t: And We do not delay it
except for a limited term.

11:105.t: The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous.

segments.t: The Day it comes
no soul will speak
except by His permission.
And among them will be the wretched
and the prosperous.

11:106.t: As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.

segments.t: As for those who were [destined to be] wretched,
they will be in the Fire.
For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.

11:107.t: [They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.

segments.t: [They will be] abiding therein
as long as the heavens and the earth endure,
except what your Lord should will.
Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.

11:108.t: And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted.

segments.t: And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous,
they will be in Paradise,
abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure,
except what your Lord should will -
a bestowal uninterrupted.

11:109.t: So do not be in doubt, [O Muḥammad], as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.

segments.t: So do not be in doubt, [O Muḥammad],
as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping.
They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before.
And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.

11:11.t: Except for those who are patient and do righteous deeds; those will have forgiveness and great reward.

segments.t: Except for those who are patient
and do righteous deeds;
those will have forgiveness
and great reward.

11:110.t: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning it [i.e., the Qur’ān], in disquieting doubt.

segments.t: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture,
but it came under disagreement.
And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord,
it would have been judged between them.
And indeed they are, concerning it [i.e., the Qur’ān],
in disquieting doubt.

11:111.t: And indeed, each [of the believers and disbelievers] - your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Aware of what they do.

segments.t: And indeed, each [of the believers and disbelievers] -
your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds.
Indeed, He is Aware of what they do.

11:112.t: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, [you] and those who have turned back with you [to Allāh], and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

segments.t: So remain on a right course
as you have been commanded,
[you] and those who have turned back with you [to Allāh],
and do not transgress.
Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

11:113.t: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than Allāh any protectors; then you would not be helped.

segments.t: And do not incline toward those who do wrong,
lest you be touched by the Fire,
and you would not have other than Allāh any protectors;
then you would not be helped.

11:114.t: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember.

segments.t: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day
and at the approach of the night.
Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds.
That is a reminder for those who remember.

11:115.t: And be patient, for indeed, Allāh does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.

segments.t: And be patient,
for indeed, Allāh does not allow to be lost
the reward of those who do good.

11:116.t: So why were there not among the generations before you those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth - except a few of those We saved from among them? But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein, and they were criminals.

segments.t: So why were there not among the generations before you
those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth -
except a few of those We saved from among them?
But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein,
and they were criminals.

11:117.t: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly while their people were reformers.

segments.t: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly
while their people were reformers.

11:118.t: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ,

segments.t: And if your Lord had willed,
He could have made mankind one community;
but they will not cease to differ,

11:119.t: Except whom your Lord has given mercy, and for that He created them. But the word of your Lord is to be fulfilled that, "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men all together."

segments.t: Except whom your Lord has given mercy,
and for that He created them.
But the word of your Lord is to be fulfilled that,
"I will surely fill Hell with jinn and men all together."

11:12.t: Then would you possibly leave [out] some of what is revealed to you, or is your breast constrained by it because they say, "Why has there not been sent down to him a treasure or come with him an angel?" But you are only a warner. And Allāh is Disposer of all things.

segments.t: Then would you possibly leave [out] some of what is revealed to you,
or is your breast constrained by it because they say,
"Why has there not been sent down to him a treasure
or come with him an angel?"
But you are only a warner.
And Allāh is Disposer of all things.

11:120.t: And each [story] We relate to you from the news of the messengers is that by which We make firm your heart. And there has come to you, in this, the truth and an instruction and a reminder for the believers.

segments.t: And each [story] We relate to you
from the news of the messengers
is that by which We make firm your heart.
And there has come to you, in this, the truth
and an instruction and a reminder for the believers.

11:121.t: And say to those who do not believe, "Work according to your position; indeed, we are working.

segments.t: And say to those who do not believe,
"Work according to your position;
indeed, we are working.

11:122.t: And wait; indeed, we are waiting."

segments.t: And wait;
indeed, we are waiting."

11:123.t: And to Allāh belong the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it, so worship Him and rely upon Him. And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do.

segments.t: And to Allāh belong the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth
and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it,
so worship Him and rely upon Him.
And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do.

11:13.t: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Say, "Then bring ten sūrahs like it that have been invented and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allāh, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Or do they say,
"He invented it"?
Say, "Then bring ten sūrahs like it
that have been invented
and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allāh,
if you should be truthful."

11:14.t: And if they do not respond to you - then know that it [i.e., the Qur’ān] was revealed with the knowledge of Allāh and that there is no deity except Him. Then, would you [not] be Muslims?

segments.t: And if they do not respond to you -
then know that it [i.e., the Qur’ān] was revealed
with the knowledge of Allāh
and that there is no deity except Him.
Then, would you [not] be Muslims?

11:15.t: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and they therein will not be deprived.

segments.t: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments -
We fully repay them for their deeds therein,
and they therein will not be deprived.

11:16.t: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire. And lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.

segments.t: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire.
And lost is what they did therein,
and worthless is what they used to do.

11:17.t: So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]? And a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy. Those [believers in the former revelations] believe in it [i.e., the Qur’ān]. But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions - the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.

segments.t: So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]?
And a witness from Him follows it,
and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy.
Those [believers in the former revelations] believe in it [i.e., the Qur’ān].
But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions -
the Fire is his promised destination.
So be not in doubt about it.
Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord,
but most of the people do not believe.

11:18.t: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allāh? Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, "These are the ones who lied against their Lord." Unquestionably, the curse of Allāh is upon the wrongdoers

segments.t: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allāh?
Those will be presented before their Lord,
and the witnesses will say,
"These are the ones who lied against their Lord."
Unquestionably, the curse of Allāh is upon the wrongdoers

11:19.t: Who averted [people] from the way of Allāh and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they, concerning the Hereafter, were disbelievers.

segments.t: Who averted [people] from the way of Allāh
and sought to make it [seem] deviant
while they, concerning the Hereafter, were disbelievers.

11:2.t: [Through a messenger, saying], "Do not worship except Allāh. Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings,"

segments.t: [Through a messenger, saying], "Do not worship except Allāh.
Indeed, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of good tidings,"

11:20.t: Those were not causing failure [to Allāh] on earth, nor did they have besides Allāh any protectors. For them the punishment will be multiplied. They were not able to hear, nor did they see.

segments.t: Those were not causing failure [to Allāh] on earth,
nor did they have besides Allāh any protectors.
For them the punishment will be multiplied.
They were not able to hear,
nor did they see.

11:21.t: Those are the ones who will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

segments.t: Those are the ones who will have lost themselves,
and lost from them is what they used to invent.

11:22.t: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.

segments.t: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter
who will be the greatest losers.

11:23.t: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.

segments.t: Indeed, they who have believed
and done righteous deeds
and humbled themselves to their Lord
- those are the companions of Paradise;
they will abide eternally therein.

11:24.t: The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?

segments.t: The example of the two parties
is like the blind and deaf,
and the seeing and hearing.
Are they equal in comparison?
Then, will you not remember?

11:25.t: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner

segments.t: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people,
[saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner

11:26.t: That you not worship except Allāh. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."

segments.t: That you not worship except Allāh.
Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."

11:27.t: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars."

segments.t: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said,
"We do not see you but as a man like ourselves,
and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion.
And we do not see in you over us any merit;
rather, we think you are liars."

11:28.t: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord while He has given me mercy from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?

segments.t: He said,
"O my people, have you considered:
if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord
while He has given me mercy from Himself
but it has been made unapparent to you,
should we force it upon you
while you are averse to it?

11:29.t: And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allāh. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.

segments.t: And O my people,
I ask not of you for it any wealth.
My reward is not but from Allāh.
And I am not one to drive away those who have believed.
Indeed, they will meet their Lord,
but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.

11:3.t: And [saying], "Seek forgiveness of your Lord and repent to Him, [and] He will let you enjoy a good provision for a specified term and give every doer of favor his favor [i.e., reward]. But if you turn away, then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.

segments.t: And [saying], "Seek forgiveness of your Lord
and repent to Him,
[and] He will let you enjoy a good provision for a specified term
and give every doer of favor his favor [i.e., reward].
But if you turn away,
then indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.

11:30.t: And O my people, who would protect me from Allāh if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded?

segments.t: And O my people,
who would protect me from Allāh
if I drove them away?
Then will you not be reminded?

11:31.t: And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allāh or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel, nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down that Allāh will never grant them any good. Allāh is most knowing of what is within their souls. Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers [i.e., the unjust]."

segments.t: And I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allāh
or that I know the unseen,
nor do I tell you that I am an angel,
nor do I say of those upon whom your eyes look down
that Allāh will never grant them any good.
Allāh is most knowing of what is within their souls.
Indeed, I would then be among the wrongdoers [i.e., the unjust]."

11:32.t: They said, "O Noah, you have disputed [i.e., opposed] us and been frequent in dispute of us. So bring us what you threaten us, if you should be of the truthful."

segments.t: They said,
"O Noah,
you have disputed [i.e., opposed] us
and been frequent in dispute of us.
So bring us what you threaten us,
if you should be of the truthful."

11:33.t: He said, "Allāh will only bring it to you if He wills, and you will not cause [Him] failure.

segments.t: He said,
"Allāh will only bring it to you if He wills,
and you will not cause [Him] failure.

11:34.t: And my advice will not benefit you - although I wished to advise you - if Allāh should intend to put you in error. He is your Lord, and to Him you will be returned."

segments.t: And my advice will not benefit you -
although I wished to advise you -
if Allāh should intend to put you in error.
He is your Lord,
and to Him you will be returned."

11:35.t: Or do they say [about Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)], "He invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime; but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit."

segments.t: Or do they say [about Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)],
"He invented it"?
Say, "If I have invented it,
then upon me is [the consequence of] my crime;
but I am innocent of what [crimes] you commit."

11:36.t: And it was revealed to Noah that, "No one will believe from your people except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.

segments.t: And it was revealed to Noah that,
"No one will believe from your people
except those who have already believed,
so do not be distressed by what they have been doing.

11:37.t: And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned."

segments.t: And construct the ship
under Our observation and Our inspiration
and do not address Me
concerning those who have wronged;
indeed, they are [to be] drowned."

11:38.t: And he constructed the ship, and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.

segments.t: And he constructed the ship,
and whenever an assembly of the eminent of his people passed by him,
they ridiculed him.
He said, "If you ridicule us,
then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule.

11:39.t: And you are going to know who will get a punishment that will disgrace him [on earth] and upon whom will descend an enduring punishment [in the Hereafter]."

segments.t: And you are going to know
who will get a punishment that will disgrace him [on earth]
and upon whom will descend an enduring punishment [in the Hereafter]."

11:4.t: To Allāh is your return, and He is over all things competent."

segments.t: To Allāh is your return,
and He is over all things competent."

11:40.t: [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed, We said, "Load upon it [i.e., the ship] of each [creature] two mates and your family, except those about whom the word [i.e., decree] has preceded, and [include] whoever has believed." But none had believed with him, except a few.

segments.t: [So it was], until when Our command came and the oven overflowed,
We said, "Load upon it [i.e., the ship] of each [creature] two mates and your family,
except those about whom the word [i.e., decree] has preceded,
and [include] whoever has believed."
But none had believed with him, except a few.

11:41.t: And [Noah] said, "Embark therein; in the name of Allāh [are] its course and its anchorage. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: And [Noah] said,
"Embark therein;
in the name of Allāh [are] its course and its anchorage.
Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."

11:42.t: And it sailed with them through waves like mountains, and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them], "O my son, come aboard with us and be not with the disbelievers."

segments.t: And it sailed with them through waves like mountains,
and Noah called to his son who was apart [from them],
"O my son, come aboard with us
and be not with the disbelievers."

11:43.t: [But] he said, "I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water." [Noah] said, "There is no protector today from the decree of Allāh, except for whom He gives mercy." And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.

segments.t: [But] he said,
"I will take refuge on a mountain
to protect me from the water."
[Noah] said,
"There is no protector today from the decree of Allāh,
except for whom He gives mercy."
And the waves came between them,
and he was among the drowned.

11:44.t: And it was said, "O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain]." And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and it [i.e., the ship] came to rest on the [mountain of] Jūdiyy. And it was said, "Away with the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: And it was said,
"O earth, swallow your water,
and O sky, withhold [your rain]."
And the water subsided,
and the matter was accomplished,
and it [i.e., the ship] came to rest on the [mountain of] Jūdiyy.
And it was said,
"Away with the wrongdoing people."

11:45.t: And Noah called to his Lord and said, "My Lord, indeed my son is of my family; and indeed, Your promise is true; and You are the most just of judges!"

segments.t: And Noah called to his Lord and said,
"My Lord, indeed my son is of my family;
and indeed, Your promise is true;
and You are the most just of judges!"

11:46.t: He said, "O Noah, indeed he is not of your family; indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous, so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge. Indeed, I advise you, lest you be among the ignorant."

segments.t: He said,
"O Noah,
indeed he is not of your family;
indeed, he is [one whose] work was other than righteous,
so ask Me not for that about which you have no knowledge.
Indeed, I advise you,
lest you be among the ignorant."

11:47.t: [Noah] said, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers."

segments.t: [Noah] said,
"My Lord,
I seek refuge in You from asking that of which I have no knowledge.
And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me,
I will be among the losers."

11:48.t: It was said, "O Noah, disembark in security from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment; then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment."

segments.t: It was said,
"O Noah, disembark in security from Us
and blessings upon you
and upon nations [descending] from those with you.
But other nations [of them] We will grant enjoyment;
then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment."

11:49.t: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muḥammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

segments.t: That is from the news of the unseen
which We reveal to you, [O Muḥammad].
You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this.
So be patient;
indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

11:5.t: Unquestionably, they [i.e., the disbelievers] turn away their breasts to hide themselves from him. Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing, He [i.e., Allāh] knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

segments.t: Unquestionably, they [i.e., the disbelievers] turn away their breasts
to hide themselves from him.
Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing,
He [i.e., Allāh] knows what they conceal and what they declare.
Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

11:50.t: And to ʿAad [We sent] their brother Hūd. He said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].

segments.t: And to ʿAad [We sent] their brother Hūd.
He said, "O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him.
You are not but inventors [of falsehood].

11:51.t: O my people, I do not ask you for it [i.e., my advice] any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?

segments.t: O my people,
I do not ask you for it [i.e., my advice] any reward.
My reward is only from the one who created me.
Then will you not reason?

11:52.t: And O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. And do not turn away, [being] criminals."

segments.t: And O my people,
ask forgiveness of your Lord
and then repent to Him.
He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers
and increase you in strength [added] to your strength.
And do not turn away, [being] criminals."

11:53.t: They said, "O Hūd, you have not brought us clear evidence, and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so. Nor are we believers in you.

segments.t: They said,
"O Hūd,
you have not brought us clear evidence,
and we are not ones to leave our gods on your say-so.
Nor are we believers in you.

11:54.t: We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil [i.e., insanity]." He said, "Indeed, I call Allāh to witness, and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate with Allāh

segments.t: We only say that some of our gods
have possessed you with evil [i.e., insanity]."
He said, "Indeed, I call Allāh to witness,
and witness [yourselves] that I am free from whatever you associate with Allāh

11:55.t: Other than Him. So plot against me all together; then do not give me respite.

segments.t: Other than Him.
So plot against me all together;
then do not give me respite.

11:56.t: Indeed, I have relied upon Allāh, my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature but that He holds it by its forelock [i.e., controls it]. Indeed, my Lord is on a path [that is] straight.

segments.t: Indeed, I have relied upon Allāh,
my Lord and your Lord.
There is no creature but that He holds it by its forelock [i.e., controls it].
Indeed, my Lord is on a path [that is] straight.

11:57.t: But if you turn away, then I have already conveyed that with which I was sent to you. My Lord will give succession to a people other than you, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed my Lord is, over all things, Guardian."

segments.t: But if you turn away,
then I have already conveyed that with which I was sent to you.
My Lord will give succession to a people other than you,
and you will not harm Him at all.
Indeed my Lord is, over all things, Guardian."

11:58.t: And when Our command came, We saved Hūd and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us; and We saved them from a harsh punishment.

segments.t: And when Our command came,
We saved Hūd and those who believed with him,
by mercy from Us;
and We saved them from a harsh punishment.

11:59.t: And that was ʿAad, who rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.

segments.t: And that was ʿAad,
who rejected the signs of their Lord
and disobeyed His messengers
and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.

11:6.t: And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allāh is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.

segments.t: And there is no creature on earth
but that upon Allāh is its provision,
and He knows its place of dwelling
and place of storage.
All is in a clear register.

11:60.t: And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, ʿAad denied their Lord; then away with ʿAad, the people of Hūd.

segments.t: And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse
and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection.
Unquestionably, ʿAad denied their Lord;
then away with ʿAad, the people of Hūd.

11:61.t: And to Thamūd [We sent] their brother Ṣāliḥ. He said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him. He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it, so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him. Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive."

segments.t: And to Thamūd [We sent] their brother Ṣāliḥ.
He said, "O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him.
He has produced you from the earth and settled you in it,
so ask forgiveness of Him and then repent to Him.
Indeed, my Lord is near and responsive."

11:62.t: They said, "O Ṣāliḥ, you were among us a man of promise before this. Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped? And indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

segments.t: They said,
"O Ṣāliḥ,
you were among us a man of promise before this.
Do you forbid us to worship what our fathers worshipped?
And indeed we are,
about that to which you invite us,
in disquieting doubt."

11:63.t: He said, "O my people, have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Himself, who would protect me from Allāh if I disobeyed Him? So you would not increase me except in loss.

segments.t: He said,
"O my people, have you considered:
if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord
and He has given me mercy from Himself,
who would protect me from Allāh if I disobeyed Him?
So you would not increase me except in loss.

11:64.t: And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allāh - [she is] to you a sign. So let her feed upon Allāh's earth and do not touch her with harm, or you will be taken by an impending punishment."

segments.t: And O my people,
this is the she-camel of Allāh - [she is] to you a sign.
So let her feed upon Allāh's earth
and do not touch her with harm,
or you will be taken by an impending punishment."

11:65.t: But they hamstrung her, so he said, "Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days. That is a promise not to be denied [i.e., unfailing]."

segments.t: But they hamstrung her,
so he said,
"Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days.
That is a promise not to be denied [i.e., unfailing]."

And He was certainly good to me when He took me out of prison and brought you [here] from bedouin life after Satan had induced [estrangement] between me and my brothers. Indeed, my Lord is Subtle in what He wills. Indeed, it is He who is the Knowing, the Wise.

or conspicuous [among others] by day.

13:11.t: For him [i.e., each one] are successive [angels] before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allāh intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron.

segments.t: For him [i.e., each one] are successive [angels]
before and behind him
who protect him by the decree of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh will not change the condition of a people
until they change what is in themselves.
And when Allāh intends for a people ill,
there is no repelling it.
And there is not for them besides Him any patron.

13:12.t: It is He who shows you lightning, [causing] fear and aspiration, and generates the heavy clouds.

segments.t: It is He who shows you lightning,
[causing] fear and aspiration,
and generates the heavy clouds.

13:13.t: And the thunder exalts [Allāh] with praise of Him - and the angels [as well] from fear of Him - and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills while they dispute about Allāh; and He is severe in assault.

segments.t: And the thunder exalts [Allāh] with praise of Him -
and the angels [as well] from fear of Him -
and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills
while they dispute about Allāh;
and He is severe in assault.

13:14.t: To Him [alone] is the supplication of truth. And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches his hands toward water [from afar, calling it] to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it [thus]. And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error [i.e., futility].

segments.t: To Him [alone] is the supplication of truth.
And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing,
except as one who stretches his hands toward water [from afar, calling it] to reach his mouth,
but it will not reach it [thus].
And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error [i.e., futility].

13:15.t: And to Allāh prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and their shadows [as well] in the mornings and the afternoons.

segments.t: And to Allāh prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth,
willingly or by compulsion,
and their shadows [as well] in the mornings and the afternoons.

13:16.t: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and earth?" Say, "Allāh." Say, "Have you then taken besides Him allies not possessing [even] for themselves any benefit or any harm?" Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Or is darkness equivalent to light? Or have they attributed to Allāh partners who created like His creation so that the creation [of each] seemed similar to them?" Say, "Allāh is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Prevailing."

segments.t: Say, "Who is Lord of the heavens and earth?"
Say, "Allāh."
Say, "Have you then taken besides Him allies
not possessing [even] for themselves any benefit or any harm?"
Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing?
Or is darkness equivalent to light?
Or have they attributed to Allāh partners who created like His creation
so that the creation [of each] seemed similar to them?"
Say, "Allāh is the Creator of all things,
and He is the One, the Prevailing."

13:17.t: He sends down from the sky, rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a rising foam. And from that [ore] which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils, is a foam like it. Thus Allāh presents [the example of] truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off; but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth. Thus does Allāh present examples.

segments.t: He sends down from the sky, rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity,
and the torrent carries a rising foam.
And from that [ore] which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils,
is a foam like it.
Thus Allāh presents [the example of] truth and falsehood.
As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off;
but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth.
Thus does Allāh present examples.

13:18.t: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward], but those who did not respond to Him - if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby. Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.

segments.t: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward],
but those who did not respond to Him -
if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it,
they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby.
Those will have the worst account,
and their refuge is Hell,
and wretched is the resting place.

13:19.t: Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? They will only be reminded who are people of understanding -

segments.t: Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth
like one who is blind?
They will only be reminded who are people of understanding -

13:2.t: It is Allāh who erected the heavens without pillars that you [can] see; then He established Himself above the Throne and made subject the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. He arranges [each] matter; He details the signs that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain.

segments.t: It is Allāh who erected the heavens
without pillars that you [can] see;
then He established Himself above the Throne
and made subject the sun and the moon,
each running [its course] for a specified term.
He arranges [each] matter;
He details the signs that you may,
of the meeting with your Lord, be certain.

13:20.t: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allāh and do not break the contract,

segments.t: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allāh
and do not break the contract,

13:21.t: And those who join that which Allāh has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,

segments.t: And those who join that which Allāh has ordered to be joined
and fear their Lord
and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,

13:22.t: And those who are patient, seeking the face [i.e., acceptance] of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of [this] home -

segments.t: And those who are patient,
seeking the face [i.e., acceptance] of their Lord,
and establish prayer
and spend from what We have provided for them
secretly and publicly
and prevent evil with good -
those will have the good consequence of [this] home -

13:23.t: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their forefathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],

segments.t: Gardens of perpetual residence;
they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their forefathers,
their spouses and their descendants.
And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],

13:24.t: "Peace [i.e., security] be upon you for what you patiently endured." And excellent is the final home.

segments.t: "Peace [i.e., security] be upon you
for what you patiently endured."
And excellent is the final home.

13:25.t: But those who break the covenant of Allāh after contracting it and sever that which Allāh has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.

segments.t: But those who break the covenant of Allāh
after contracting it
and sever that which Allāh has ordered to be joined
and spread corruption on earth -
for them is the curse,
and they will have the worst home.

13:26.t: Allāh extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.

segments.t: Allāh extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it].
And they rejoice in the worldly life,
while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.

13:27.t: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, Allāh leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] -

segments.t: And those who disbelieved say,
"Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?"
Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Indeed, Allāh leaves astray whom He wills
and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] -

13:28.t: Those who have believed and whose hearts are assured by the remembrance of Allāh. Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allāh hearts are assured."

segments.t: Those who have believed
and whose hearts are assured
by the remembrance of Allāh.
Unquestionably, by the remembrance of Allāh hearts are assured."

13:29.t: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.

segments.t: Those who have believed
and done righteous deeds -
a good state is theirs
and a good return.

13:3.t: And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates; He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

segments.t: And it is He who spread the earth
and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers;
and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates;
He causes the night to cover the day.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

13:30.t: Thus have We sent you to a community before which [other] communities have passed on so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you, while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful. Say, "He is my Lord; there is no deity except Him. Upon Him I rely, and to Him is my return."

segments.t: Thus have We sent you to a community
before which [other] communities have passed on
so you might recite to them that which We revealed to you,
while they disbelieve in the Most Merciful.
Say, "He is my Lord;
there is no deity except Him.
Upon Him I rely,
and to Him is my return."

13:31.t: And if there was any Qur’ān [i.e., recitation] by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur’ān], but to Allāh belongs the affair entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allāh willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh does not fail in [His] promise.

segments.t: And if there was any Qur’ān [i.e., recitation] by which the mountains would be removed
or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur’ān],
but to Allāh belongs the affair entirely.
Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allāh willed,
He would have guided the people, all of them?
And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity -
or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh does not fail in [His] promise.

13:32.t: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you, and I extended the time of those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

segments.t: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you,
and I extended the time of those who disbelieved;
then I seized them,
and how [terrible] was My penalty.

13:33.t: Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul, [knowing] what it has earned, [like any other]? But to Allāh they have attributed partners. Say, "Name them. Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth or of what is apparent [i.e., alleged] of speech?" Rather, their [own] plan has been made attractive to those who disbelieve, and they have been averted from the way. And whomever Allāh sends astray - there will be for him no guide.

segments.t: Then is He who is a maintainer of every soul,
[knowing] what it has earned, [like any other]?
But to Allāh they have attributed partners.
Say, "Name them.
Or do you inform Him of that which He knows not upon the earth
or of what is apparent [i.e., alleged] of speech?"
Rather, their [own] plan has been made attractive to those who disbelieve,
and they have been averted from the way.
And whomever Allāh sends astray -
there will be for him no guide.

13:34.t: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allāh any protector.

segments.t: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world,
and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe.
And they will not have from Allāh any protector.

13:35.t: The example [i.e., description] of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.

segments.t: The example [i.e., description] of Paradise,
which the righteous have been promised,
is [that] beneath it rivers flow.
Its fruit is lasting, and its shade.
That is the consequence for the righteous,
and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.

13:36.t: And [the believers among] those to whom We have given the [previous] Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], but among the [opposing] factions are those who deny part of it [i.e., the Qur’ān]. Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allāh and not associate [anything] with Him. To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."

segments.t: And [the believers among] those to whom We have given the [previous] Scripture
rejoice at what has been revealed to you, [O Muḥammad],
but among the [opposing] factions are those who deny part of it [i.e., the Qur’ān].
Say, "I have only been commanded to worship Allāh
and not associate [anything] with Him.
To Him I invite, and to Him is my return."

13:37.t: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allāh any ally or any protector.

segments.t: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation.
And if you should follow their inclinations
after what has come to you of knowledge,
you would not have against Allāh any ally or any protector.

13:38.t: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allāh. For every term is a decree.

segments.t: And We have already sent messengers before you
and assigned to them wives and descendants.
And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign
except by permission of Allāh.
For every term is a decree.

13:39.t: Allāh eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book.

segments.t: Allāh eliminates what He wills or confirms,
and with Him is the Mother of the Book.

13:4.t: And within the land are neighboring plots and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, [growing] several from a root or otherwise, watered with one water; but We make some of them exceed others in [quality of] fruit. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

segments.t: And within the land are neighboring plots
and gardens of grapevines
and crops and palm trees,
[growing] several from a root or otherwise,
watered with one water;
but We make some of them exceed others in [quality of] fruit.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

13:40.t: And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.

segments.t: And whether We show you part of what We promise them
or take you in death,
upon you is only the [duty of] notification,
and upon Us is the account.

13:41.t: Have they not seen that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allāh decides; there is no adjuster of His decision. And He is swift in account.

segments.t: Have they not seen that We set upon the land,
reducing it from its borders?
And Allāh decides;
there is no adjuster of His decision.
And He is swift in account.

13:42.t: And those before them had plotted, but to Allāh belongs the plan entirely. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.

segments.t: And those before them had plotted,
but to Allāh belongs the plan entirely.
He knows what every soul earns,
and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.

13:43.t: And those who have disbelieved say, "You are not a messenger." Say, [O Muḥammad], "Sufficient is Allāh as Witness between me and you, and [the witness of] whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."

segments.t: And those who have disbelieved say,
"You are not a messenger."
Say, [O Muḥammad],
