"Sufficient is Allāh as Witness between me and you,
and [the witness of] whoever has knowledge of the Scripture."

13:5.t: And if you are astonished, [O Muḥammad] - then astonishing is their saying, "When we are dust, will we indeed be [brought] into a new creation?" Those are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord, and those will have shackles upon their necks, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: And if you are astonished, [O Muḥammad] -
then astonishing is their saying,
"When we are dust,
will we indeed be [brought] into a new creation?"
Those are the ones who have disbelieved in their Lord,
and those will have shackles upon their necks,
and those are the companions of the Fire;
they will abide therein eternally.

13:6.t: They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good, while there has already occurred before them similar punishments [to what they demand]. And indeed, your Lord is the possessor of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing, and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty.

segments.t: They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good,
while there has already occurred before them similar punishments [to what they demand].
And indeed, your Lord is the possessor of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing,
and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty.

13:7.t: And those who disbelieved say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" You are only a warner, and for every people is a guide.

segments.t: And those who disbelieved say,
"Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?"
You are only a warner,
and for every people is a guide.

13:8.t: Allāh knows what every female carries and what the wombs lose [prematurely] or exceed. And everything with Him is by due measure.

segments.t: Allāh knows what every female carries
and what the wombs lose [prematurely] or exceed.
And everything with Him is by due measure.

13:9.t: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Grand, the Exalted.

segments.t: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed,
the Grand, the Exalted.

14:1.t: Alif, Lām, Rā. [This is] a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light by permission of their Lord - to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -

segments.t: Alif, Lām, Rā.
[This is] a Book which We have revealed to you,
[O Muḥammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light
by permission of their Lord -
to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -

14:10.t: Their messengers said, "Can there be doubt about Allāh, Creator of the heavens and earth? He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins, and He delays you [i.e., your death] for a specified term." They said, "You are not but men like us who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping. So bring us a clear authority [i.e., evidence]."

segments.t: Their messengers said,
"Can there be doubt about Allāh,
Creator of the heavens and earth?
He invites you that He may forgive you of your sins,
and He delays you [i.e., your death] for a specified term."
They said,
"You are not but men like us
who wish to avert us from what our fathers were worshipping.
So bring us a clear authority [i.e., evidence]."

14:11.t: Their messengers said to them, "We are only men like you, but Allāh confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants. It has never been for us to bring you evidence except by permission of Allāh. And upon Allāh let the believers rely.

segments.t: Their messengers said to them,
"We are only men like you,
but Allāh confers favor upon whom He wills of His servants.
It has never been for us to bring you evidence
except by permission of Allāh.
And upon Allāh let the believers rely.

14:12.t: And why should we not rely upon Allāh while He has guided us to our [good] ways. And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us. And upon Allāh let those who would rely [indeed] rely."

segments.t: And why should we not rely upon Allāh
while He has guided us to our [good] ways.
And we will surely be patient against whatever harm you should cause us.
And upon Allāh let those who would rely [indeed] rely."

14:13.t: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers, "We will surely drive you out of our land, or you must return to our religion." So their Lord inspired to them, "We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.

segments.t: And those who disbelieved said to their messengers,
"We will surely drive you out of our land,
or you must return to our religion."
So their Lord inspired to them,
"We will surely destroy the wrongdoers.

14:14.t: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them. That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."

segments.t: And We will surely cause you to dwell in the land after them.
That is for he who fears My position and fears My threat."

14:15.t: And they requested decision [i.e., victory from Allāh], and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.

segments.t: And they requested decision [i.e., victory from Allāh],
and disappointed, [therefore],
was every obstinate tyrant.

14:16.t: Before him is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.

segments.t: Before him is Hell,
and he will be given a drink of purulent water.

14:17.t: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.

segments.t: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it.
And death will come to him from everywhere,
but he is not to die.
And before him is a massive punishment.

14:18.t: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.

segments.t: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes
which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day;
they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing.
That is what is extreme error.

14:19.t: Have you not seen [i.e., considered] that Allāh created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.

segments.t: Have you not seen [i.e., considered] that Allāh created the heavens and the earth in truth?
If He wills,
He can do away with you and produce a new creation.

14:2.t: Allāh, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe [i.e., destruction] to the disbelievers from a severe punishment -

segments.t: Allāh,
to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And woe [i.e., destruction] to the disbelievers
from a severe punishment -

14:20.t: And that is not difficult for Allāh.

segments.t: And that is not difficult for Allāh.

14:21.t: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allāh all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, "Indeed, we were your followers, so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allāh?" They will say, "If Allāh had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is for us no place of escape."

segments.t: And they will come out [for judgement] before Allāh all together,
and the weak will say to those who were arrogant,
"Indeed, we were your followers,
so can you avail us anything against the punishment of Allāh?"
They will say, "If Allāh had guided us,
we would have guided you.
It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient:
there is for us no place of escape."

14:22.t: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allāh had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allāh] before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."

segments.t: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded,
"Indeed, Allāh had promised you the promise of truth.
And I promised you, but I betrayed you.
But I had no authority over you except that I invited you,
and you responded to me.
So do not blame me; but blame yourselves.
I cannot be called to your aid,
nor can you be called to my aid.
Indeed, I deny your association of me [with Allāh] before.
Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."

14:23.t: And those who believed and did righteous deeds will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord; and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"

segments.t: And those who believed and did righteous deeds
will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow,
abiding eternally therein by permission of their Lord;
and their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"

14:24.t: Have you not considered how Allāh presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?

segments.t: Have you not considered how Allāh presents an example,
[making] a good word like a good tree,
whose root is firmly fixed
and its branches [high] in the sky?

14:25.t: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allāh presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.

segments.t: It produces its fruit all the time,
by permission of its Lord.
And Allāh presents examples for the people
that perhaps they will be reminded.

14:26.t: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.

segments.t: And the example of a bad word
is like a bad tree,
uprooted from the surface of the earth,
not having any stability.

14:27.t: Allāh keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allāh sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allāh does what He wills.

segments.t: Allāh keeps firm those who believe,
with the firm word,
in worldly life and in the Hereafter.
And Allāh sends astray the wrongdoers.
And Allāh does what He wills.

14:28.t: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allāh for disbelief and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?

segments.t: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allāh for disbelief
and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?

14:29.t: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.

segments.t: [It is] Hell,
which they will [enter to] burn,
and wretched is the settlement.

14:3.t: The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allāh, seeking to make it [seem] deviant. Those are in extreme error.

segments.t: The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter
and avert [people] from the way of Allāh,
seeking to make it [seem] deviant.
Those are in extreme error.

14:30.t: And they have attributed to Allāh equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."

segments.t: And they have attributed to Allāh equals
to mislead [people] from His way.
Say, "Enjoy yourselves,
for indeed, your destination is the Fire."

14:31.t: [O Muḥammad], tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange [i.e., ransom], nor any friendships.

segments.t: [O Muḥammad], tell My servants who have believed
to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them,
secretly and publicly,
before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange [i.e., ransom],
nor any friendships.

14:32.t: It is Allāh who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.

segments.t: It is Allāh who created the heavens and the earth
and sent down rain from the sky
and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you
and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command
and subjected for you the rivers.

14:33.t: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.

segments.t: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon,
continuous [in orbit],
and subjected for you the night and the day.

14:34.t: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor [i.e., blessings] of Allāh, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.

segments.t: And He gave you from all you asked of Him.
And if you should count the favor [i.e., blessings] of Allāh,
you could not enumerate them.
Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.

14:35.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [i.e., Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when Abraham said,
"My Lord, make this city [i.e., Makkah] secure
and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols.

14:36.t: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: My Lord,
indeed they have led astray many among the people.
So whoever follows me - then he is of me;
and whoever disobeys me -
indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.

14:37.t: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.

segments.t: Our Lord,
I have settled some of my descendants
in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House,
our Lord,
that they may establish prayer.
So make hearts among the people incline toward them
and provide for them from the fruits
that they might be grateful.

14:38.t: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allāh on the earth or in the heaven.

segments.t: Our Lord,
indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare,
and nothing is hidden from Allāh
on the earth or in the heaven.

14:39.t: Praise to Allāh, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.

segments.t: Praise to Allāh,
who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac.
Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.

14:4.t: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allāh sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: And We did not send any messenger
except [speaking] in the language of his people
to state clearly for them,
and Allāh sends astray [thereby] whom He wills
and guides whom He wills.
And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

14:40.t: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

segments.t: My Lord,
make me an establisher of prayer,
and [many] from my descendants.
Our Lord,
and accept my supplication.

14:41.t: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers the Day the account is established."

segments.t: Our Lord,
forgive me and my parents
and the believers the Day the account is established."

14:42.t: And never think that Allāh is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them [i.e., their account] for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].

segments.t: And never think that Allāh is unaware
of what the wrongdoers do.
He only delays them [i.e., their account]
for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].

14:43.t: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void.

segments.t: Racing ahead,
their heads raised up,
their glance does not come back to them,
and their hearts are void.

14:44.t: And, [O Muḥammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term; we will answer Your call and follow the messengers." [But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?

segments.t: And, [O Muḥammad], warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them
and those who did wrong will say, "Our Lord, delay us for a short term;
we will answer Your call and follow the messengers."
[But it will be said], "Had you not sworn, before, that for you there would be no cessation?

14:45.t: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them. And We presented for you [many] examples."

segments.t: And you lived among the dwellings of those who wronged themselves,
and it had become clear to you how We dealt with them.
And We presented for you [many] examples."

14:46.t: And they had planned their plan, but with Allāh is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.

segments.t: And they had planned their plan,
but with Allāh is [recorded] their plan,
even if their plan had been [sufficient]
to do away with the mountains.

14:47.t: So never think that Allāh will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

segments.t: So never think that Allāh will fail in His promise to His messengers.
Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

14:48.t: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and they [i.e., all creatures] will come out before Allāh, the One, the Prevailing,

segments.t: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth,
and the heavens [as well],
and they [i.e., all creatures] will come out before Allāh,
the One, the Prevailing,

14:49.t: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in irons,

segments.t: And you will see the criminals that Day
bound together in irons,

14:5.t: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying], "Bring out your people from darknesses into the light and remind them of the days of Allāh." Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

segments.t: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs, [saying],
"Bring out your people from darknesses into the light
and remind them of the days of Allāh."
Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

14:50.t: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire

segments.t: Their garments of liquid pitch
and their faces covered by the Fire

14:51.t: So that Allāh will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.

segments.t: So that Allāh will recompense every soul for what it earned.
Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.

14:52.t: This [Qur’ān] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.

segments.t: This [Qur’ān] is notification for the people
that they may be warned thereby
and that they may know that He is but one God
and that those of understanding will be reminded.

14:6.t: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when Moses said to his people, "Remember the favor of Allāh upon you when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who were afflicting you with the worst torment and were slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

segments.t: And [recall, O Children of Israel],
when Moses said to his people,
"Remember the favor of Allāh upon you
when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh,
who were afflicting you with the worst torment
and were slaughtering your [newborn] sons
and keeping your females alive.
And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

14:7.t: And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.'"

segments.t: And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed,
'If you are grateful,
I will surely increase you [in favor];
but if you deny,
indeed, My punishment is severe.'"

14:8.t: And Moses said, "If you should disbelieve, you and whoever is on the earth entirely - indeed, Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy."

segments.t: And Moses said,
"If you should disbelieve,
you and whoever is on the earth entirely -
indeed, Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy."

14:9.t: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and ʿAad and Thamūd and those after them? No one knows them [i.e., their number] but Allāh. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

segments.t: Has there not reached you the news of those before you -
the people of Noah and ʿAad and Thamūd and those after them?
No one knows them [i.e., their number] but Allāh.
Their messengers brought them clear proofs,
but they returned their hands to their mouths and said,
"Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent,
and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

15:1.t: Alif, Lām, Rā. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].

segments.t: Alif, Lām, Rā.
These are the verses of the Book
and a clear Qur’ān [i.e., recitation].

15:10.t: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muḥammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

segments.t: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muḥammad],
among the sects of the former peoples.

15:11.t: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

segments.t: And no messenger would come to them
except that they ridiculed him.

15:12.t: Thus do We insert it [i.e., denial] into the hearts of the criminals.

segments.t: Thus do We insert it [i.e., denial]
into the hearts of the criminals.

15:13.t: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

segments.t: They will not believe in it,
while there has already occurred
the precedent of the former peoples.

15:14.t: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

segments.t: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven
and they continued therein to ascend,

15:15.t: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

segments.t: They would say,
"Our eyes have only been dazzled.
Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

15:16.t: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

segments.t: And We have placed within the heaven great stars
and have beautified it for the observers.

15:17.t: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allāh]

segments.t: And We have protected it
from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allāh]

15:18.t: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

segments.t: Except one who steals a hearing
and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

15:19.t: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

segments.t: And the earth -
We have spread it
and cast therein firmly set mountains
and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

15:2.t: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

segments.t: Perhaps those who disbelieve
will wish that they had been Muslims.

15:20.t: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

segments.t: And We have made for you therein means of living
and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

15:21.t: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known [i.e., specified] measure.

segments.t: And there is not a thing
but that with Us are its depositories,
and We do not send it down
except according to a known [i.e., specified] measure.

15:22.t: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.

segments.t: And We have sent the fertilizing winds
and sent down water from the sky
and given you drink from it.
And you are not its retainers.

15:23.t: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.

segments.t: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death,
and We are the Inheritor.

15:24.t: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].

segments.t: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you,
and We have already known the later [ones to come].

15:25.t: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord will gather them;
indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

15:26.t: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.

segments.t: And We did certainly create man
out of clay
from an altered black mud.

15:27.t: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.

segments.t: And the jinn We created before
from scorching fire.

15:28.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when your Lord said to the angels,
"I will create a human being out of clay
from an altered black mud.

15:29.t: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

segments.t: And when I have proportioned him
and breathed into him of My [created] soul,
then fall down to him in prostration."

15:3.t: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.

segments.t: Let them eat and enjoy themselves
and be diverted by [false] hope,
for they are going to know.

15:30.t: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

segments.t: So the angels prostrated -
all of them entirely,

15:31.t: Except Iblees; he refused to be with those who prostrated.

segments.t: Except Iblees;
he refused to be with those who prostrated.

15:32.t: [Allāh] said, "O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"O Iblees,
what is [the matter] with you
that you are not with those who prostrate?"

15:33.t: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."

segments.t: He said,
"Never would I prostrate to a human
whom You created out of clay
from an altered black mud."

15:34.t: [Allāh] said, "Then depart from it, for indeed, you are expelled.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Then depart from it,
for indeed, you are expelled.

15:35.t: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."

segments.t: And indeed, upon you is the curse
until the Day of Recompense."

15:36.t: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

15:37.t: [Allāh] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"So indeed, you are of those reprieved

15:38.t: Until the Day of the time well-known."

segments.t: Until the Day of the time well-known."

15:39.t: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them [i.e., mankind] on earth, and I will mislead them all

segments.t: [Iblees] said,
"My Lord,
because You have put me in error,
I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them [i.e., mankind] on earth,
and I will mislead them all

15:4.t: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

segments.t: And We did not destroy any city
but that for it was a known decree.

15:40.t: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

segments.t: Except, among them,
Your chosen servants."

15:41.t: [Allāh] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

15:42.t: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.

segments.t: Indeed, My servants -
no authority will you have over them,
except those who follow you of the deviators.

15:43.t: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.

segments.t: And indeed,
Hell is the promised place for them all.

15:44.t: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them [i.e., Satan's followers] a portion designated."

segments.t: It has seven gates;
for every gate is of them [i.e., Satan's followers] a portion designated."

15:45.t: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs,

segments.t: Indeed, the righteous will be
within gardens and springs,

15:46.t: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."

segments.t: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."

15:47.t: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.

segments.t: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment,
[so they will be] brothers,
on thrones facing each other.

15:48.t: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

segments.t: No fatigue will touch them therein,
nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

15:49.t: [O Muḥammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful,

segments.t: [O Muḥammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving,
the Merciful,

15:5.t: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.

segments.t: No nation will precede its term,
nor will they remain thereafter.

15:50.t: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

segments.t: And that it is My punishment
which is the painful punishment.

15:51.t: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

segments.t: And inform them
about the guests of Abraham,

15:52.t: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful [i.e., apprehensive] of you."

segments.t: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace."
[Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful [i.e., apprehensive] of you."

15:53.t: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

segments.t: [The angels] said,
"Fear not.
Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

15:54.t: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

segments.t: He said,
"Have you given me good tidings
although old age has come upon me?
Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

15:55.t: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."

segments.t: They said,
"We have given you good tidings in truth,
so do not be of the despairing."

15:56.t: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"

segments.t: He said,
"And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord
except for those astray?"

15:57.t: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

segments.t: [Abraham] said,
"Then what is your business [here],
O messengers?"

15:58.t: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,

segments.t: They said,
"Indeed, we have been sent
to a people of criminals,

15:59.t: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all

segments.t: Except the family of Lot;
indeed, we will save them all

15:6.t: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.

segments.t: And they say,
"O you upon whom the message has been sent down,
indeed you are mad.

15:60.t: Except his wife." We [i.e., Allāh] decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

segments.t: Except his wife."
We [i.e., Allāh] decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

15:61.t: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

segments.t: And when the messengers
came to the family of Lot,

15:62.t: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."

segments.t: He said,
"Indeed, you are people unknown."

15:63.t: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,

segments.t: They said,
"But we have come to you
with that about which they were disputing,

15:64.t: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.

segments.t: And we have come to you with truth,
and indeed, we are truthful.

15:65.t: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."

segments.t: So set out with your family
during a portion of the night
and follow behind them
and let not anyone among you look back
and continue on to where you are commanded."

15:66.t: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

segments.t: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter:
that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

15:67.t: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

segments.t: And the people of the city
came rejoicing.

15:68.t: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.

segments.t: [Lot] said,
"Indeed, these are my guests,
so do not shame me.

15:69.t: And fear Allāh and do not disgrace me."

segments.t: And fear Allāh
and do not disgrace me."

15:7.t: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"

segments.t: Why do you not bring us the angels,
if you should be among the truthful?"

15:70.t: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"

segments.t: They said,
"Have we not forbidden you
from [protecting] people?"

15:71.t: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."

segments.t: [Lot] said,
"These are my daughters -
if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."

15:72.t: By your life, [O Muḥammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.

segments.t: By your life, [O Muḥammad],
indeed they were, in their intoxication,
wandering blindly.

15:73.t: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

segments.t: So the shriek seized them
at sunrise.

15:74.t: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

segments.t: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest
and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

15:75.t: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

segments.t: Indeed in that are signs
for those who discern.

15:76.t: And indeed, they [i.e., those cities] are [situated] on an established road.

segments.t: And indeed, they [i.e., those cities] are [situated]
on an established road.

15:77.t: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

segments.t: Indeed in that is a sign
for the believers.

15:78.t: And the companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] were [also] wrongdoers,

segments.t: And the companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan]
were [also] wrongdoers,

15:79.t: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

segments.t: So We took retribution from them,
and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

15:8.t: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and they [i.e., the disbelievers] would not then be reprieved.

segments.t: We do not send down the angels
except with truth;
and they [i.e., the disbelievers] would not then be reprieved.

15:80.t: And certainly did the companions of al-Ḥijr [i.e., the Thamūd] deny the messengers.

segments.t: And certainly did the companions of al-Ḥijr
[i.e., the Thamūd] deny the messengers.

15:81.t: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.

segments.t: And We gave them Our signs,
but from them they were turning away.

15:82.t: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.

segments.t: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses,
feeling secure.

15:83.t: But the shriek seized them at early morning,

segments.t: But the shriek seized them
at early morning,

15:84.t: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

segments.t: So nothing availed them [from]
what they used to earn.

15:85.t: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

segments.t: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them
except in truth.
And indeed, the Hour is coming;
so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

15:86.t: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord -
He is the Knowing Creator.

15:87.t: And We have certainly given you, [O Muḥammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur’ān.

segments.t: And We have certainly given you, [O Muḥammad],
seven of the often repeated [verses]
and the great Qur’ān.

15:88.t: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of them [i.e., the disbelievers], and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to the believers.

segments.t: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment
to [certain] categories of them [i.e., the disbelievers],
and do not grieve over them.
And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to the believers.

15:89.t: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -

segments.t: And say,
"Indeed, I am the clear warner" -

15:9.t: Indeed, it is We who sent down the message [i.e., the Qur’ān], and indeed, We will be its guardian.

segments.t: Indeed, it is We who sent down the message [i.e., the Qur’ān],
and indeed, We will be its guardian.

15:90.t: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

segments.t: Just as We had revealed [scriptures]
to the separators

15:91.t: Who have made the Qur’ān into portions.

segments.t: Who have made
the Qur’ān into portions.

15:92.t: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all

segments.t: So by your Lord,
We will surely question them all

15:93.t: About what they used to do.

segments.t: About what they used to do.

15:94.t: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

segments.t: Then declare what you are commanded
and turn away from the polytheists.

15:95.t: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers

segments.t: Indeed, We are sufficient for you
against the mockers

15:96.t: Who make [equal] with Allāh another deity. But they are going to know.

segments.t: Who make [equal] with Allāh another deity.
But they are going to know.

15:97.t: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

segments.t: And We already know
that your breast is constrained
by what they say.

15:98.t: So exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

segments.t: So exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord
and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

15:99.t: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty [i.e., death].

segments.t: And worship your Lord
until there comes to you the certainty [i.e., death].

16:1.t: The command of Allāh is coming, so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

segments.t: The command of Allāh is coming,
so be not impatient for it.
Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

16:10.t: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].

segments.t: It is He who sends down rain from the sky;
from it is drink
and from it is foliage
in which you pasture [animals].

16:100.t: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allāh.

segments.t: His authority is only over those
who take him as an ally
and those who through him associate others with Allāh.

16:101.t: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allāh is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muḥammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.

segments.t: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse -
and Allāh is most knowing of what He sends down -
they say, "You, [O Muḥammad], are but an inventor [of lies]."
But most of them do not know.

16:102.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "The Pure Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"The Pure Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] has brought it down from your Lord in truth
to make firm those who believe
and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."

16:103.t: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches him [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)]." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this [recitation, i.e., Qur’ān] is [in] a clear Arabic language.

segments.t: And We certainly know that they say,
"It is only a human being who teaches him [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)]."
The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign,
and this [recitation, i.e., Qur’ān] is [in] a clear Arabic language.

16:104.t: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allāh - Allāh will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.

segments.t: Indeed, those who do not believe
in the verses of Allāh -
Allāh will not guide them,
and for them is a painful punishment.

16:105.t: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allāh, and it is those who are the liars.

segments.t: They only invent falsehood
who do not believe in the verses of Allāh,
and it is those who are the liars.

16:106.t: Whoever disbelieves in [i.e., denies] Allāh after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allāh, and for them is a great punishment;

segments.t: Whoever disbelieves in [i.e., denies] Allāh after his belief...
except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion]
while his heart is secure in faith.
But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief,
upon them is wrath from Allāh,
and for them is a great punishment;

16:107.t: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allāh does not guide the disbelieving people.

segments.t: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter
and that Allāh does not guide the disbelieving people.

16:108.t: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allāh has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.

segments.t: Those are the ones over whose hearts
and hearing and vision Allāh has sealed,
and it is those who are the heedless.

16:109.t: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.

segments.t: Assuredly, it is they,
in the Hereafter,
who will be the losers.

16:11.t: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and of all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

segments.t: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and of all the fruits.
Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

16:110.t: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to say words of disbelief] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allāh] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful

segments.t: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated
after they had been compelled [to say words of disbelief]
and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allāh]
and were patient -
indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful

16:111.t: On the Day when every soul will come disputing [i.e., pleading] for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged [i.e., treated unjustly].

segments.t: On the Day when every soul will come disputing [i.e., pleading] for itself,
and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did,
and they will not be wronged [i.e., treated unjustly].

16:112.t: And Allāh presents an example: a city [i.e., Makkah] which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allāh. So Allāh made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.

segments.t: And Allāh presents an example:
a city [i.e., Makkah] which was safe and secure,
its provision coming to it in abundance from every location,
but it denied the favors of Allāh.
So Allāh made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear
for what they had been doing.

16:113.t: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

segments.t: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves,
but they denied him;
so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

16:114.t: Then eat of what Allāh has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allāh, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

segments.t: Then eat of what Allāh has provided for you [which is] lawful and good.
And be grateful for the favor of Allāh,
if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

16:115.t: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allāh. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: He has only forbidden to you dead animals,
blood,
the flesh of swine,
and that which has been dedicated to other than Allāh.
But whoever is forced [by necessity],
neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] -
then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

16:116.t: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allāh. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allāh will not succeed.

segments.t: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth,
"This is lawful and this is unlawful,"
to invent falsehood about Allāh.
Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allāh will not succeed.

16:117.t: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.

segments.t: [It is but] a brief enjoyment,
and they will have a painful punishment.

16:118.t: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.

segments.t: And to those who are Jews
We have prohibited that which We related to you before.
And We did not wrong them [thereby],
but they were wronging themselves.

16:119.t: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Then, indeed your Lord,
to those who have done wrong out of ignorance
and then repent after that and correct themselves -
indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

16:12.t: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

segments.t: And He has subjected for you the night and day
and the sun and moon,
and the stars are subjected by His command.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

16:120.t: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allāh, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allāh.

segments.t: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader,
devoutly obedient to Allāh,
inclining toward truth,
and he was not of those who associate others with Allāh.

16:121.t: [He was] grateful for His favors. He [i.e., Allāh] chose him and guided him to a straight path.

segments.t: [He was] grateful for His favors.
He [i.e., Allāh] chose him
and guided him to a straight path.

16:122.t: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

segments.t: And We gave him good in this world,
and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

16:123.t: Then We revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allāh.

segments.t: Then We revealed to you, [O Muḥammad],
to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth;
and he was not of those who associate with Allāh.

16:124.t: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

segments.t: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it.
And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection
concerning that over which they used to differ.

16:125.t: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.

segments.t: Invite to the way of your Lord
with wisdom and good instruction,
and argue with them in a way that is best.
Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way,
and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.

16:126.t: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.

segments.t: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers],
punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed.
But if you are patient -
it is better for those who are patient.

16:127.t: And be patient, [O Muḥammad], and your patience is not but through Allāh. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

segments.t: And be patient, [O Muḥammad],
and your patience is not but through Allāh.
And do not grieve over them
and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

16:128.t: Indeed, Allāh is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh is with those who fear Him
and those who are doers of good.

16:13.t: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

segments.t: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth
of varying colors.
Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

16:14.t: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

segments.t: And it is He who subjected the sea for you
to eat from it tender meat
and to extract from it ornaments which you wear.
And you see the ships plowing through it,
and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty;
and perhaps you will be grateful.

16:15.t: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,

segments.t: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains,
lest it shift with you,
and [made] rivers and roads,
that you may be guided,

16:16.t: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.

segments.t: And landmarks.
And by the stars they are [also] guided.

16:17.t: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?

segments.t: Then is He who creates
like one who does not create?
So will you not be reminded?

16:18.t: And if you should count the favors of Allāh, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And if you should count the favors of Allāh,
you could not enumerate them.
Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

16:19.t: And Allāh knows what you conceal and what you declare.

segments.t: And Allāh knows
what you conceal
and what you declare.

16:2.t: He sends down the angels, with the inspiration [i.e., revelation] of His command, upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."

segments.t: He sends down the angels,
with the inspiration [i.e., revelation] of His command,
upon whom He wills of His servants,
[telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me;
so fear Me."

16:20.t: And those they invoke other than Allāh create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.

segments.t: And those they invoke other than Allāh create nothing,
and they [themselves] are created.

16:21.t: They are [in fact] dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.

segments.t: They are [in fact] dead,
not alive,
and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.

16:22.t: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.

segments.t: Your god is one God.
But those who do not believe in the Hereafter -
their hearts are disapproving,
and they are arrogant.

16:23.t: Assuredly, Allāh knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

segments.t: Assuredly, Allāh knows what they conceal
and what they declare.
Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

16:24.t: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" they say, "Legends of the former peoples,"

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"What has your Lord sent down?"
they say,
"Legends of the former peoples,"

16:25.t: That they may bear their own burdens [i.e., sins] in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without [i.e., by lack of] knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

segments.t: That they may bear their own burdens [i.e., sins] in full on the Day of Resurrection
and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without [i.e., by lack of] knowledge.
Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

16:26.t: Those before them had already plotted, but Allāh came at [i.e., uprooted] their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

segments.t: Those before them had already plotted,
but Allāh came at [i.e., uprooted] their building from the foundations,
so the roof fell upon them from above them,
and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

16:27.t: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -

segments.t: Then on the Day of Resurrection
He will disgrace them and say,
"Where are My 'partners'
for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?"
Those who were given knowledge will say,
"Indeed disgrace, this Day,
and evil are upon the disbelievers" -

16:28.t: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." But, yes! Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of what you used to do.

segments.t: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves,
and [who] then offer submission, [saying],
"We were not doing any evil."
But, yes!
Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of what you used to do.

16:29.t: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.

segments.t: So enter the gates of Hell
to abide eternally therein,
and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.

16:3.t: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.

segments.t: He created the heavens and earth in truth.
High is He above what they associate with Him.

16:30.t: And it will be said to those who feared Allāh, "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -

segments.t: And it will be said to those who feared Allāh,
"What did your Lord send down?"
They will say,
"[That which is] good."
For those who do good in this world is good;
and the home of the Hereafter is better.
And how excellent is the home of the righteous -

16:31.t: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allāh reward the righteous -

segments.t: Gardens of perpetual residence,
which they will enter,
beneath which rivers flow.
They will have therein whatever they wish.
Thus does Allāh reward the righteous -

16:32.t: The ones whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."

segments.t: The ones whom the angels take in death,
[being] good and pure;
[the angels] will say,
"Peace be upon you.
Enter Paradise for what you used to do."

16:33.t: Do they [i.e., the disbelievers] await except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allāh wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.

segments.t: Do they [i.e., the disbelievers] await except that the angels should come to them
or there comes the command of your Lord?
Thus did those do before them.
And Allāh wronged them not,
but they had been wronging themselves.

16:34.t: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

segments.t: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did
and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

16:35.t: And those who associate others with Allāh say, "If Allāh had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?

segments.t: And those who associate others with Allāh say,
"If Allāh had willed,
we would not have worshipped anything other than Him,
neither we nor our fathers,
nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him."
Thus did those do before them.
So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?

16:36.t: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allāh and avoid ṭāghūt." And among them were those whom Allāh guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed [i.e., travel] through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.

segments.t: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger,
[saying], "Worship Allāh
and avoid ṭāghūt."
And among them were those whom Allāh guided,
and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed.
So proceed [i.e., travel] through the earth
and observe how was the end of the deniers.

16:37.t: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muḥammad], indeed, Allāh does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.

segments.t: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muḥammad],
indeed, Allāh does not guide those He sends astray,
and they will have no helpers.

16:38.t: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths [that] Allāh will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.

segments.t: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths [that] Allāh will not resurrect one who dies.
But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him,
but most of the people do not know.

16:39.t: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.

segments.t: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ
and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.

16:4.t: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once he is a clear adversary.

segments.t: He created man from a sperm-drop;
then at once he is a clear adversary.

16:40.t: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.

segments.t: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it
is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.

16:41.t: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allāh after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.

segments.t: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allāh
after they had been wronged -
We will surely settle them in this world in a good place;
but the reward of the Hereafter is greater,
if only they could know.

16:42.t: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.

segments.t: [They are] those who endured patiently
and upon their Lord relied.

16:43.t: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures] if you do not know.

segments.t: And We sent not before you except men
to whom We revealed [Our message].
So ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures]
if you do not know.

16:44.t: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message [i.e., the Qur’ān] that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.

segments.t: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances.
And We revealed to you the message [i.e., the Qur’ān]
that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them
and that they might give thought.

16:45.t: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allāh will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?

segments.t: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure
that Allāh will not cause the earth to swallow them
or that the punishment will not come upon them
from where they do not perceive?

16:46.t: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure [i.e., escape from Him]?

segments.t: Or that He would not seize them
during their [usual] activity,
and they could not cause failure [i.e., escape from Him]?

16:47.t: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]? But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

segments.t: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]?
But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

16:48.t: Have they not considered what things Allāh has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allāh, while they [i.e., those creations] are humble.

segments.t: Have they not considered what things Allāh has created?
Their shadows incline to the right and to the left,
prostrating to Allāh,
while they [i.e., those creations] are humble.

16:49.t: And to Allāh prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.

segments.t: And to Allāh prostrates whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth of creatures,
and the angels [as well],
and they are not arrogant.

16:5.t: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.

segments.t: And the grazing livestock He has created for you;
in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits,
and from them you eat.

16:50.t: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

segments.t: They fear their Lord above them,
and they do what they are commanded.

16:51.t: And Allāh has said, "Do not take for yourselves two deities. He [i.e., Allāh] is but one God, so fear only Me."

segments.t: And Allāh has said,
"Do not take for yourselves two deities.
He [i.e., Allāh] is but one God,
so fear only Me."

16:52.t: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allāh that you fear?

segments.t: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth,
and to Him is [due] worship constantly.
Then is it other than Allāh that you fear?

16:53.t: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allāh. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.

segments.t: And whatever you have of favor -
it is from Allāh.
Then when adversity touches you,
to Him you cry for help.

16:54.t: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord

segments.t: Then when He removes the adversity from you,
at once a party of you associates others with their Lord

16:55.t: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

segments.t: So they will deny what We have given them.
Then enjoy yourselves,
for you are going to know.

16:56.t: And they assign to what they do not know [i.e., false deities] a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allāh, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.

segments.t: And they assign to what they do not know [i.e., false deities]
a portion of that which We have provided them.
By Allāh, you will surely be questioned
about what you used to invent.

16:57.t: And they attribute to Allāh daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire [i.e., sons].

segments.t: And they attribute to Allāh daughters - exalted is He -
and for them is what they desire [i.e., sons].

16:58.t: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

segments.t: And when one of them is informed
of [the birth of] a female,
his face becomes dark,
and he suppresses grief.

16:59.t: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.

segments.t: He hides himself from the people
because of the ill of which he has been informed.
Should he keep it in humiliation
or bury it in the ground?
Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.

16:6.t: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].

segments.t: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty
when you bring them in [for the evening]
and when you send them out [to pasture].

16:60.t: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description [i.e., an attribute] of evil; and for Allāh is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter
is the description [i.e., an attribute] of evil;
and for Allāh is the highest attribute.
And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.

16:61.t: And if Allāh were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon it [i.e., the earth] any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

segments.t: And if Allāh were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing,
He would not have left upon it [i.e., the earth] any creature,
but He defers them for a specified term.
And when their term has come,
they will not remain behind an hour,
nor will they precede [it].

16:62.t: And they attribute to Allāh that which they dislike [i.e., daughters], and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.

segments.t: And they attribute to Allāh that which they dislike [i.e., daughters],
and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him].
Assuredly, they will have the Fire,
and they will be [therein] neglected.

16:63.t: By Allāh, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is their [i.e., the disbelievers] ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.

segments.t: By Allāh,
We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you,
but Satan made their deeds attractive to them.
And he is their [i.e., the disbelievers] ally today [as well],
and they will have a painful punishment.

16:64.t: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muḥammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

segments.t: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muḥammad],
except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed
and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

16:65.t: And Allāh has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.

segments.t: And Allāh has sent down rain from the sky
and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness.
Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.

16:66.t: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

segments.t: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson.
We give you drink from what is in their bellies -
between excretion and blood -
pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

16:67.t: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.

segments.t: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines
you take intoxicant and good provision.
Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.

16:68.t: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses [i.e., hives], and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.

segments.t: And your Lord inspired to the bee,
"Take for yourself among the mountains, houses [i.e., hives],
and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.

16:69.t: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

segments.t: Then eat from all the fruits
and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]."
There emerges from their bellies a drink,
varying in colors,
in which there is healing for people.
Indeed in that is a sign
for a people who give thought.

16:7.t: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

segments.t: And they carry your loads to a land
you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves.
Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

16:70.t: And Allāh created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Competent.

segments.t: And Allāh created you;
then He will take you in death.
And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age
so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing.
Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Competent.

16:71.t: And Allāh has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored [i.e., given more] would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess [i.e., slaves] so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allāh they reject?

segments.t: And Allāh has favored some of you over others in provision.
But those who were favored [i.e., given more] would not hand over their provision
to those whom their right hands possess [i.e., slaves]
so they would be equal to them therein.
Then is it the favor of Allāh they reject?

16:72.t: And Allāh has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allāh they disbelieve?

segments.t: And Allāh has made for you from yourselves mates
and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren
and has provided for you from the good things.
Then in falsehood do they believe
and in the favor of Allāh they disbelieve?

16:73.t: And they worship besides Allāh that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.

segments.t: And they worship besides Allāh
that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision
from the heavens and the earth at all,
and [in fact], they are unable.

16:74.t: So do not assert similarities to Allāh. Indeed, Allāh knows and you do not know.

segments.t: So do not assert similarities to Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh knows and you do not know.

16:75.t: Allāh presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allāh! But most of them do not know.

segments.t: Allāh presents an example:
a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing
and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision,
so he spends from it secretly and publicly.
Can they be equal?
Praise to Allāh!
But most of them do not know.

16:76.t: And Allāh presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?

segments.t: And Allāh presents an example of two men,
one of them dumb and unable to do a thing,
while he is a burden to his guardian.
Wherever he directs him, he brings no good.
Is he equal to one who commands justice,
while he is on a straight path?

16:77.t: And to Allāh belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth.
And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer.
Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

16:78.t: And Allāh has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect] that perhaps you would be grateful.

segments.t: And Allāh has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers
not knowing a thing,
and He made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]
that perhaps you would be grateful.

16:79.t: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allāh. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

segments.t: Do they not see the birds controlled
in the atmosphere of the sky?
None holds them up except Allāh.
Indeed in that are signs
for a people who believe.

16:8.t: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.

segments.t: And [He created] the horses,
mules and donkeys
for you to ride and [as] adornment.
And He creates that which you do not know.

16:80.t: And Allāh has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time.

segments.t: And Allāh has made for you from your homes a place of rest
and made for you from the hides of the animals tents
which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment;
and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time.

16:81.t: And Allāh has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows [i.e., shade] and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments [i.e., coats of mail] which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].

segments.t: And Allāh has made for you,
from that which He has created, shadows [i.e., shade]
and has made for you from the mountains, shelters
and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat
and garments [i.e., coats of mail] which protect you from your [enemy in] battle.
Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].

16:82.t: But if they turn away, [O Muḥammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.

segments.t: But if they turn away,
[O Muḥammad] - then only upon you
is [responsibility for] clear notification.

16:83.t: They recognize the favor of Allāh; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.

segments.t: They recognize the favor of Allāh;
then they deny it.
And most of them are disbelievers.

16:84.t: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness [i.e., their prophet]. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allāh].

segments.t: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness [i.e., their prophet].
Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses],
nor will they be asked to appease [Allāh].

16:85.t: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

segments.t: And when those who wronged see the punishment,
it will not be lightened for them,
nor will they be reprieved.

16:86.t: And when those who associated others with Allāh see their "partners," they will say, "Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke [in worship] besides You." But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."

segments.t: And when those who associated others with Allāh see their "partners,"
they will say, "Our Lord,
these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke [in worship] besides You."
But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."

16:87.t: And they will impart to Allāh that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

segments.t: And they will impart to Allāh that Day [their] submission,
and lost from them is what they used to invent.

16:88.t: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allāh - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.

segments.t: Those who disbelieved
and averted [others] from the way of Allāh -
We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment
for what corruption they were causing.

16:89.t: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves [i.e., their prophet].
