And We will bring you, [O Muḥammad], as a witness over these [i.e., your nation]. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

segments.t: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation
a witness over them from themselves [i.e., their prophet].
And We will bring you, [O Muḥammad],
as a witness over these [i.e., your nation].
And We have sent down to you the Book
as clarification for all things
and as guidance and mercy
and good tidings for the Muslims.

16:9.t: And upon Allāh is the direction of the [right] way, and among them [i.e., the various paths] are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

segments.t: And upon Allāh is the direction of the [right] way,
and among them [i.e., the various paths] are those deviating.
And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

16:90.t: Indeed, Allāh orders justice and good conduct and giving [help] to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh orders justice and good conduct
and giving [help] to relatives
and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression.
He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.

16:91.t: And fulfill the covenant of Allāh when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allāh, over you, a security [i.e., witness]. Indeed, Allāh knows what you do.

segments.t: And fulfill the covenant of Allāh when you have taken it, [O believers],
and do not break oaths after their confirmation
while you have made Allāh, over you, a security [i.e., witness].
Indeed, Allāh knows what you do.

16:92.t: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allāh only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.

segments.t: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread
after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you
because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community.
Allāh only tries you thereby.
And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection
that over which you used to differ.

16:93.t: And if Allāh had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

segments.t: And if Allāh had willed,
He could have made you [of] one religion,
but He sends astray whom He wills
and guides whom He wills.
And you will surely be questioned
about what you used to do.

16:94.t: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allāh, and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.

segments.t: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you,
lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm,
and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allāh,
and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.

16:95.t: And do not exchange the covenant of Allāh for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allāh is best for you, if only you could know.

segments.t: And do not exchange the covenant of Allāh for a small price.
Indeed, what is with Allāh is best for you,
if only you could know.

16:96.t: Whatever you have will end, but what Allāh has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

segments.t: Whatever you have will end,
but what Allāh has is lasting.
And We will surely give those who were patient
their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

16:97.t: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.

segments.t: Whoever does righteousness,
whether male or female,
while he is a believer -
We will surely cause him to live a good life,
and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter]
according to the best of what they used to do.

16:98.t: So when you recite the Qur’ān, [first] seek refuge in Allāh from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].

segments.t: So when you recite the Qur’ān,
[first] seek refuge in Allāh
from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].

16:99.t: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.

segments.t: Indeed, there is for him no authority
over those who have believed
and rely upon their Lord.

17:1.t: Exalted is He who took His Servant [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] by night from al-Masjid al-Ḥarām to al-Masjid al-Aqṣā, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

segments.t: Exalted is He who took His Servant [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] by night
from al-Masjid al-Ḥarām to al-Masjid al-Aqṣā,
whose surroundings We have blessed,
to show him of Our signs.
Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

17:10.t: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

segments.t: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter -
We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

17:100.t: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.

segments.t: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories
of the mercy of my Lord,
then you would withhold out of fear of spending."
And ever has man been stingy.

17:101.t: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."

segments.t: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs,
so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them
and Pharaoh said to him,
"Indeed I think, O Moses,
that you are affected by magic."

17:102.t: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"You have already known that none has sent down these [signs]
except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence,
and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."

17:103.t: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.

segments.t: So he intended to drive them from the land,
but We drowned him and those with him all together.

17:104.t: And We said after him [i.e., Pharaoh] to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise [i.e., appointment] of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."

segments.t: And We said after him [i.e., Pharaoh]
to the Children of Israel,
"Dwell in the land,
and when there comes the promise [i.e., appointment] of the Hereafter,
We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."

17:105.t: And with the truth We have sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

segments.t: And with the truth We have sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down,
and with the truth it has descended.
And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad],
except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

17:106.t: And [it is] a Qur’ān which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.

segments.t: And [it is] a Qur’ān
which We have separated [by intervals]
that you might recite it to the people
over a prolonged period.
And We have sent it down progressively.

17:107.t: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe." Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,

segments.t: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe."
Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it -
when it is recited to them,
they fall upon their faces in prostration,

17:108.t: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."

segments.t: And they say,
"Exalted is our Lord!
Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."

17:109.t: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and it [i.e., the Qur’ān] increases them in humble submission.

segments.t: And they fall upon their faces weeping,
and it [i.e., the Qur’ān] increases them in humble submission.

17:11.t: And man supplicates for evil [when angry] as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.

segments.t: And man supplicates for evil [when angry]
as he supplicates for good,
and man is ever hasty.

17:110.t: Say, "Call upon Allāh or call upon the Most Merciful [ar-Raḥmān]. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.

segments.t: Say, "Call upon Allāh
or call upon the Most Merciful [ar-Raḥmān].
Whichever [name] you call -
to Him belong the best names."
And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer
or [too] quietly
but seek between that an [intermediate] way.

17:111.t: And say, "Praise to Allāh, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."

segments.t: And say,
"Praise to Allāh,
who has not taken a son
and has had no partner in [His] dominion
and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness;
and glorify Him with [great] glorification."

17:12.t: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.

segments.t: And We have made the night and day two signs,
and We erased the sign of the night
and made the sign of the day visible
that you may seek bounty from your Lord
and may know the number of years and the account [of time].
And everything We have set out in detail.

17:13.t: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.

segments.t: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck,
and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record
which he will encounter spread open.

17:14.t: [It will be said], "Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant."

segments.t: [It will be said], "Read your record.
Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant."

17:15.t: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

segments.t: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul.
And whoever errs only errs against it.
And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another.
And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

17:16.t: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word [i.e., deserved decree] comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.

segments.t: And when We intend to destroy a city,
We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein;
so the word [i.e., deserved decree] comes into effect upon it,
and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.

17:17.t: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Aware and Seeing.

segments.t: And how many have We destroyed
from the generations after Noah.
And sufficient is your Lord,
concerning the sins of His servants,
as Aware and Seeing.

17:18.t: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.

segments.t: Whoever should desire the immediate -
We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend.
Then We have made for him Hell,
which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.

17:19.t: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allāh].

segments.t: But whoever desires the Hereafter
and exerts the effort due to it
while he is a believer -
it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allāh].

17:2.t: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

segments.t: And We gave Moses the Scripture
and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel
that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

17:20.t: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.

segments.t: To each [category] We extend -
to these and to those -
from the gift of your Lord.
And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.

17:21.t: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.

segments.t: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others.
But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.

17:22.t: Do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

segments.t: Do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity
and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

17:23.t: And your Lord has decreed that you worship not except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.

segments.t: And your Lord has decreed that you worship not except Him,
and to parents, good treatment.
Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you,
say not to them [so much as], "uff,"
and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.

17:24.t: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."

segments.t: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy
and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them
as they brought me up [when I was] small."

17:25.t: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.

segments.t: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves.
If you should be righteous [in intention] -
then indeed He is ever,
to the often returning [to Him],
Forgiving.

17:26.t: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.

segments.t: And give the relative his right,
and [also] the poor and the traveler,
and do not spend wastefully.

17:27.t: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.

segments.t: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils,
and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.

17:28.t: And if you [must] turn away from them [i.e., the needy] awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.

segments.t: And if you [must] turn away from them [i.e., the needy]
awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect,
then speak to them a gentle word.

17:29.t: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.

segments.t: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck
or extend it completely
and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.

17:3.t: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

segments.t: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah.
Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

17:30.t: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Aware and Seeing.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills
and restricts [it].
Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Aware and Seeing.

17:31.t: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.

segments.t: And do not kill your children
for fear of poverty.
We provide for them and for you.
Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.

17:32.t: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.

segments.t: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse.
Indeed, it is ever an immorality
and is evil as a way.

17:33.t: And do not kill the soul [i.e., person] which Allāh has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

segments.t: And do not kill the soul [i.e., person] which Allāh has forbidden,
except by right.
And whoever is killed unjustly -
We have given his heir authority,
but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life.
Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

17:34.t: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.

segments.t: And do not approach the property of an orphan,
except in the way that is best,
until he reaches maturity.
And fulfill [every] commitment.
Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.

17:35.t: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even [i.e., honest] balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.

segments.t: And give full measure when you measure,
and weigh with an even [i.e., honest] balance.
That is the best [way] and best in result.

17:36.t: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.

segments.t: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge.
Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart -
about all those [one] will be questioned.

17:37.t: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.

segments.t: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly.
Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart],
and you will never reach the mountains in height.

17:38.t: All that [i.e., the aforementioned] - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.

segments.t: All that [i.e., the aforementioned] -
its evil is ever,
in the sight of your Lord, detested.

17:39.t: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.

segments.t: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you,
[O Muḥammad], of wisdom.
And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity,
lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.

17:4.t: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, "You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness."

segments.t: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that,
"You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice,
and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness."

17:40.t: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken [i.e., adopted] from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.

segments.t: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons
and taken [i.e., adopted] from among the angels daughters?
Indeed, you say a grave saying.

17:41.t: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur’ān that they [i.e., mankind] may be reminded, but it does not increase them [i.e., the disbelievers] except in aversion.

segments.t: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur’ān
that they [i.e., mankind] may be reminded,
but it does not increase them [i.e., the disbelievers] except in aversion.

17:42.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say,
then they [each] would have sought
to the Owner of the Throne a way."

17:43.t: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.

segments.t: Exalted is He
and high above what they say
by great sublimity.

17:44.t: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allāh] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.

segments.t: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him.
And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allāh] by His praise,
but you do not understand their [way of] exalting.
Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.

17:45.t: And when you recite the Qur’ān, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.

segments.t: And when you recite the Qur’ān,
We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter
a concealed partition.

17:46.t: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur’ān, they turn back in aversion.

segments.t: And We have placed over their hearts coverings,
lest they understand it,
and in their ears deafness.
And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur’ān,
they turn back in aversion.

17:47.t: We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

segments.t: We are most knowing of how they listen to it
when they listen to you
and [of] when they are in private conversation,
when the wrongdoers say,
"You follow not but a man affected by magic."

17:48.t: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

segments.t: Look how they strike for you comparisons;
but they have strayed,
so they cannot [find] a way.

17:49.t: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"

segments.t: And they say,
"When we are bones and crumbled particles,
will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"

17:5.t: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.

segments.t: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them,
We sent against you servants of Ours -
those of great military might,
and they probed [even] into the homes,
and it was a promise fulfilled.
Say, "Be you stones
or iron

17:51.t: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -

segments.t: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts."
And they will say, "Who will restore us?"
Say, "He who brought you forth the first time."
Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?"
Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -

17:52.t: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."

segments.t: On the Day He will call you
and you will respond with praise of Him
and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."

17:53.t: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.

segments.t: And tell My servants to say that which is best.
Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them.
Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.

17:54.t: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], over them as a manager.

segments.t: Your Lord is most knowing of you.
If He wills, He will have mercy upon you;
or if He wills, He will punish you.
And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad],
over them as a manager.

17:55.t: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

segments.t: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth.
And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways],
and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

17:56.t: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."

segments.t: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him,
for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you
or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."

17:57.t: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.

segments.t: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord,
[striving as to] which of them would be nearest,
and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment.
Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.

17:58.t: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

segments.t: And there is no city but that We will destroy it
before the Day of Resurrection
or punish it with a severe punishment.
That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

17:59.t: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs [i.e., miracles] except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamūd the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.

segments.t: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs [i.e., miracles]
except that the former peoples denied them.
And We gave Thamūd the she-camel as a visible sign,
but they wronged her.
And We send not the signs except as a warning.

17:6.t: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower.

segments.t: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them.
And We reinforced you with wealth and sons
and made you more numerous in manpower.

17:60.t: And [remember, O Muḥammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur’ān. And We threaten [i.e., warn] them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.

segments.t: And [remember, O Muḥammad],
when We told you,
"Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people."
And We did not make the sight which We showed you
except as a trial for the people,
as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur’ān.
And We threaten [i.e., warn] them,
but it increases them not except in great transgression.

17:61.t: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"

segments.t: And [mention] when We said to the angels,
"Prostrate to Adam,"
and they prostrated,
except for Iblees.
He said,
"Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"

17:62.t: [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me [i.e., my death] until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."

segments.t: [Iblees] said,
"Do You see this one whom You have honored above me?
If You delay me [i.e., my death] until the Day of Resurrection,
I will surely destroy his descendants,
except for a few."

17:63.t: [Allāh] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of [all of] you - an ample recompense.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Go, for whoever of them follows you,
indeed Hell will be the recompense of [all of] you -
an ample recompense.

17:64.t: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

segments.t: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice
and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers
and become a partner in their wealth and their children
and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

17:65.t: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.

segments.t: Indeed, over My [believing] servants
there is for you no authority.
And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.

17:66.t: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.

segments.t: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea
that you may seek of His bounty.
Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.

17:67.t: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.

segments.t: And when adversity touches you at sea,
lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him.
But when He delivers you to the land,
you turn away [from Him].
And ever is man ungrateful.

17:68.t: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

segments.t: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you
or send against you a storm of stones?
Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

17:69.t: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into it [i.e., the sea] another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

segments.t: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into it [i.e., the sea] another time
and send upon you a hurricane of wind
and drown you for what you denied?
Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

17:7.t: [And said], "If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to them [i.e., yourselves]." Then when the final [i.e., second] promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the masjid [i.e., the temple in Jerusalem], as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.

segments.t: [And said], "If you do good, you do good for yourselves;
and if you do evil, [you do it] to them [i.e., yourselves]."
Then when the final [i.e., second] promise came,
[We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces
and to enter the masjid [i.e., the temple in Jerusalem],
as they entered it the first time,
and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.

17:70.t: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

segments.t: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam
and carried them on the land and sea
and provided for them of the good things
and preferred them over much of what We have created,
with [definite] preference.

17:71.t: [Mention, O Muḥammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].

segments.t: [Mention, O Muḥammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds].
Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records,
and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].

17:72.t: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.

segments.t: And whoever is blind in this [life]
will be blind in the Hereafter
and more astray in way.

17:73.t: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

segments.t: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away
from that which We revealed to you
in order to [make] you invent about Us something else;
and then they would have taken you as a friend.

17:74.t: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.

segments.t: And if We had not strengthened you,
you would have almost inclined to them a little.

17:75.t: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.

segments.t: Then [if you had],
We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life
and double [after] death.
Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.

17:76.t: And indeed, they were about to provoke [i.e., drive] you from the land [i.e., Makkah] to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.

segments.t: And indeed, they were about to provoke [i.e., drive] you from the land [i.e., Makkah]
to evict you therefrom.
And then [when they do],
they will not remain [there] after you,
except for a little.

17:77.t: [That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.

segments.t: [That is Our] established way
for those We had sent before you of Our messengers;
and you will not find in Our way any alteration.

17:78.t: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur’ān [i.e., recitation] of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

segments.t: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian]
until the darkness of the night
and [also] the Qur’ān [i.e., recitation] of dawn.
Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

17:79.t: And from [part of] the night, pray with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān] as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.

segments.t: And from [part of] the night,
pray with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān]
as additional [worship] for you;
it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.

17:8.t: [Then Allāh said], "It is expected, [if you repent], that your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed."

segments.t: [Then Allāh said], "It is expected, [if you repent],
that your Lord will have mercy upon you.
But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment].
And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed."

17:80.t: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."

segments.t: And say, "My Lord,
cause me to enter a sound entrance
and to exit a sound exit
and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."

17:81.t: And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."

segments.t: And say,
"Truth has come,
and falsehood has departed.
Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."

17:82.t: And We send down of the Qur’ān that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

segments.t: And We send down of the Qur’ān
that which is healing and mercy for the believers,
but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

17:83.t: And when We bestow favor upon man [i.e., the disbeliever], he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.

segments.t: And when We bestow favor upon man [i.e., the disbeliever],
he turns away and distances himself;
and when evil touches him,
he is ever despairing.

17:84.t: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."

segments.t: Say, "Each works according to his manner,
but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."

17:85.t: And they ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair [i.e., concern] of my Lord. And you [i.e., mankind] have not been given of knowledge except a little."

segments.t: And they ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the soul.
Say, "The soul is of the affair [i.e., concern] of my Lord.
And you [i.e., mankind] have not been given of knowledge except a little."

17:86.t: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.

segments.t: And if We willed,
We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you.
Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.

17:87.t: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.

segments.t: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord.
Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.

17:88.t: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur’ān, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."

segments.t: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered
in order to produce the like of this Qur’ān,
they could not produce the like of it,
even if they were to each other assistants."

17:89.t: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur’ān from every [kind of] example, but most of the people refused except disbelief.

segments.t: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur’ān
from every [kind of] example,
but most of the people refused except disbelief.

17:9.t: Indeed, this Qur’ān guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward

segments.t: Indeed, this Qur’ān guides to that which is most suitable
and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds
that they will have a great reward

17:90.t: And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring

segments.t: And they say,
"We will not believe you
until you break open for us
from the ground a spring

17:91.t: Or [until] you have a garden of palm trees and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]

segments.t: Or [until] you have a garden
of palm trees and grapes
and make rivers gush forth within them
in force [and abundance]

17:92.t: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allāh and the angels before [us]

segments.t: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments
as you have claimed
or you bring Allāh and the angels before [us]

17:93.t: Or you have a house of ornament [i.e., gold] or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"

segments.t: Or you have a house of ornament [i.e., gold]
or you ascend into the sky.
And [even then],
we will not believe in your ascension
until you bring down to us a book we may read."
Say, "Exalted is my Lord!
Was I ever but a human messenger?"

17:94.t: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allāh sent a human messenger?"

segments.t: And what prevented the people from believing
when guidance came to them
except that they said,
"Has Allāh sent a human messenger?"

17:95.t: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."

segments.t: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels
walking securely,
We would have sent down to them from the heaven
an angel [as a] messenger."

17:96.t: Say, "Sufficient is Allāh as Witness between me and you. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Aware and Seeing."

segments.t: Say, "Sufficient is Allāh as Witness between me and you.
Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Aware and Seeing."

17:97.t: And whoever Allāh guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides, We increase [for] them blazing fire.

segments.t: And whoever Allāh guides -
he is the [rightly] guided;
and whoever He sends astray -
you will never find for them protectors besides Him,
and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces -
blind, dumb and deaf.
Their refuge is Hell;
every time it subsides,
We increase [for] them blazing fire.

17:98.t: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"

segments.t: That is their recompense
because they disbelieved in Our verses and said,
"When we are bones and crumbled particles,
will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"

17:99.t: Do they not see that Allāh, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse except disbelief.

segments.t: Do they not see that Allāh,
who created the heavens and earth,
is [the one] Able to create the likes of them?
And He has appointed for them a term,
about which there is no doubt.
But the wrongdoers refuse except disbelief.

18:1.t: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, who has sent down upon His Servant [Muḥammad (ﷺ)] the Book and has not made therein any deviance.

segments.t: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh,
who has sent down upon His Servant [Muḥammad (ﷺ)] the Book
and has not made therein any deviance.

18:10.t: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."

segments.t: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said,
"Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy
and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."

18:100.t: And We will present Hell that Day to the disbelievers, on display -

segments.t: And We will present Hell that Day to the disbelievers,
on display -

18:101.t: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

segments.t: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed]
from My remembrance,
and they were not able to hear.

18:102.t: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

segments.t: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies?
Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

18:103.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Shall we [believers] inform you
of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?

18:104.t: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."

segments.t: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life,
while they think that they are doing well in work."

18:105.t: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any weight [i.e., importance].

segments.t: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord
and in [their] meeting Him,
so their deeds have become worthless;
and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any weight [i.e., importance].

18:106.t: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

segments.t: That is their recompense - Hell -
for what they denied
and [because] they took My signs
and My messengers in ridicule.

18:107.t: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

segments.t: Indeed, those who have believed
and done righteous deeds -
they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

18:108.t: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.

segments.t: Wherein they abide eternally.
They will not desire from it any transfer.

18:109.t: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it in [continual] supplement."

segments.t: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord,
the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted,
even if We brought the like of it in [continual] supplement."

18:11.t: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.

segments.t: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears
within the cave for a number of years.

18:110.t: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

segments.t: Say, "I am only a man like you,
to whom has been revealed that your god is one God.
So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord -
let him do righteous work
and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

18:12.t: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.

segments.t: Then We awakened them
that We might show which of the two factions
was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.

18:13.t: It is We who relate to you, [O Muḥammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

segments.t: It is We who relate to you,
[O Muḥammad], their story in truth.
Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord,
and We increased them in guidance.

18:14.t: And We bound [i.e., made firm] their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.

segments.t: And We bound [i.e., made firm] their hearts
when they stood up and said,
"Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth.
Never will we invoke besides Him any deity.
We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.

18:15.t: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear evidence? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh a lie?"

segments.t: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities.
Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear evidence?
And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh a lie?"

18:16.t: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allāh, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."

segments.t: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them
and that which they worship other than Allāh, retreat to the cave.
Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy
and will prepare for you from your affair facility."

18:17.t: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [lying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allāh. He whom Allāh guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He sends astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.

segments.t: And [had you been present],
you would see the sun when it rose,
inclining away from their cave on the right,
and when it set,
passing away from them on the left,
while they were [lying] within an open space thereof.
That was from the signs of Allāh.
He whom Allāh guides is the [rightly] guided,
but he whom He sends astray -
never will you find for him a protecting guide.

18:18.t: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.

segments.t: And you would think them awake,
while they were asleep.
And We turned them to the right and to the left,
while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance.
If you had looked at them,
you would have turned from them in flight
and been filled by them with terror.

18:19.t: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.

segments.t: And similarly, We awakened them
that they might question one another.
Said a speaker from among them,
"How long have you remained [here]?"
They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day."
They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained.
So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city
and let him look to which is the best of food
and bring you provision from it
and let him be cautious.
And let no one be aware of you.

18:2.t: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward [i.e., Paradise]

segments.t: [He has made it] straight,
to warn of severe punishment from Him
and to give good tidings to the believers
who do righteous deeds
that they will have a good reward [i.e., Paradise]

18:20.t: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."

segments.t: Indeed, if they come to know of you,
they will stone you or return you to their religion.
And never would you succeed, then - ever."

18:21.t: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allāh is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."

segments.t: And similarly,
We caused them to be found
that they [who found them] would know
that the promise of Allāh is truth
and that of the Hour there is no doubt.
[That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair
and [then] said,
"Construct over them a structure.
Their Lord is most knowing about them."
Said those who prevailed in the matter,
"We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."

18:22.t: They [i.e., people] will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muḥammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."

segments.t: They [i.e., people] will say there were three,
the fourth of them being their dog;
and they will say there were five,
the sixth of them being their dog -
guessing at the unseen;
and they will say there were seven,
and the eighth of them was their dog.
Say, [O Muḥammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number.
None knows them except a few.
So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument
and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."

18:23.t: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"

segments.t: And never say of anything,
"Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"

18:24.t: Except [when adding], "If Allāh wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."

segments.t: Except [when adding], "If Allāh wills."
And remember your Lord when you forget [it]
and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me
to what is nearer than this to right conduct."

18:25.t: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.

segments.t: And they remained in their cave
for three hundred years
and exceeded by nine.

18:26.t: Say, "Allāh is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."

segments.t: Say, "Allāh is most knowing of how long they remained.
He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth.
How Seeing is He and how Hearing!
They have not besides Him any protector,
and He shares not His legislation with anyone."

18:27.t: And recite, [O Muḥammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.

segments.t: And recite, [O Muḥammad],
what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord.
There is no changer of His words,
and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.

18:28.t: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His face [i.e., acceptance]. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

segments.t: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord
in the morning and the evening,
seeking His face [i.e., acceptance].
And let not your eyes pass beyond them,
desiring adornments of the worldly life,
and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance
and who follows his desire
and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

18:29.t: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

segments.t: And say, "The truth is from your Lord,
so whoever wills - let him believe;
and whoever wills - let him disbelieve."
Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire
whose walls will surround them.
And if they call for relief,
they will be relieved with water like murky oil,
which scalds [their] faces.
Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

18:3.t: In which they will remain forever

segments.t: In which they will remain forever

18:30.t: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds -
indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

18:31.t: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

segments.t: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence;
beneath them rivers will flow.
They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold
and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade,
reclining therein on adorned couches.
Excellent is the reward,
and good is the resting place.

18:32.t: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.

segments.t: And present to them an example of two men:
We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines,
and We bordered them with palm trees
and placed between them [fields of] crops.

18:33.t: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

segments.t: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit
and did not fall short thereof in anything.
And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

18:34.t: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."

segments.t: And he had fruit,
so he said to his companion
while he was conversing with him,
"I am greater than you in wealth
and mightier in [numbers of] men."

18:35.t: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.

segments.t: And he entered his garden
while he was unjust to himself.
He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.

18:36.t: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."

segments.t: And I do not think the Hour will occur.
And even if I should be brought back to my Lord,
I will surely find better than this as a return."

18:37.t: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?

segments.t: His companion said to him
while he was conversing with him,
"Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust
and then from a sperm-drop
and then proportioned you [as] a man?

18:38.t: But as for me, He is Allāh, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.

segments.t: But as for me,
He is Allāh, my Lord,
and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.

18:39.t: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allāh willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allāh'? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,

segments.t: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say,
'What Allāh willed [has occurred];
there is no power except in Allāh'?
Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,

18:4.t: And to warn those who say, "Allāh has taken a son."

segments.t: And to warn those who say,
"Allāh has taken a son."

18:40.t: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a [disastrous] penalty from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,

segments.t: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden
and will send upon it a [disastrous] penalty from the sky,
and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,

18:41.t: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."

segments.t: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth],
so you would never be able to seek it."

18:42.t: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."

segments.t: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin],
so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay]
over what he had spent on it,
while it had collapsed upon its trellises,
and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."

18:43.t: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allāh, nor could he defend himself.

segments.t: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allāh,
nor could he defend himself.

18:44.t: There the authority is [completely] for Allāh, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.

segments.t: There the authority is [completely] for Allāh, the Truth.
He is best in reward and best in outcome.

18:45.t: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allāh is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.

segments.t: And present to them the example of the life of this world,
[its being] like rain which We send down from the sky,
and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it
and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds.
And Allāh is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.

18:46.t: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.

segments.t: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life.
But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward
and better for [one's] hope.

18:47.t: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth exposed, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.

segments.t: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains
and you will see the earth exposed,
and We will gather them
and not leave behind from them anyone.

18:48.t: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."

segments.t: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows,
[and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time.
But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."

18:49.t: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.

segments.t: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open],
and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it,
and they will say, "Oh, woe to us!
What is this book that leaves nothing small or great
except that it has enumerated it?"
And they will find what they did present [before them].
And your Lord does injustice to no one.

18:5.t: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.

segments.t: They have no knowledge of it,
nor had their fathers.
Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths;
they speak not except a lie.

18:50.t: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from [i.e., disobeyed] the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.

segments.t: And [mention] when We said to the angels,
"Prostrate to Adam,"
and they prostrated, except for Iblees.
He was of the jinn and departed from [i.e., disobeyed] the command of his Lord.
Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me
while they are enemies to you?
Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.

18:51.t: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.

segments.t: I did not make them witness
to the creation of the heavens and the earth
or to the creation of themselves,
and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.

18:52.t: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call My 'partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.

segments.t: And [warn of] the Day when He will say,
"Call My 'partners' whom you claimed,"
and they will invoke them,
but they will not respond to them.
And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.

18:53.t: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.

segments.t: And the criminals will see the Fire
and will be certain that they are to fall therein.
And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.

18:54.t: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur’ān for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.

segments.t: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur’ān
for the people from every [kind of] example;
but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.

18:55.t: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.

segments.t: And nothing has prevented the people from believing
when guidance came to them
and from asking forgiveness of their Lord
except that there [must] befall them
the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples
or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.

18:56.t: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.

segments.t: And We send not the messengers
except as bringers of good tidings and warners.
And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood
to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth
and have taken My verses,
and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.

18:57.t: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord
but turns away from them
and forgets what his hands have put forth?
Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings,
lest they understand it,
and in their ears deafness.
And if you invite them to guidance -
they will never be guided, then - ever.

18:58.t: And your Lord is the Forgiving, the possessor of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.

segments.t: And your Lord is the Forgiving,
the possessor of mercy.
If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned,
He would have hastened for them the punishment.
Rather, for them is an appointment
from which they will never find an escape.

18:59.t: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

segments.t: And those cities -
We destroyed them when they wronged,
and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

18:6.t: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muḥammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

segments.t: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muḥammad],
if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

18:60.t: And [mention] when Moses said to his boy [i.e., servant], "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."

segments.t: And [mention] when Moses said to his boy [i.e., servant],
"I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas
or continue for a long period."

18:61.t: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.

segments.t: But when they reached the junction between them,
they forgot their fish,
and it took its course into the sea,
slipping away.

18:62.t: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

segments.t: So when they had passed beyond it,
[Moses] said to his boy,
"Bring us our morning meal.
We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

18:63.t: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly."

segments.t: He said,
"Did you see when we retired to the rock?
Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish.
And none made me forget it except Satan -
that I should mention it.
And it took its course into the sea amazingly."

18:64.t: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"That is what we were seeking."
So they returned,
following their footprints.

18:65.t: And they found a servant from among Our servants [i.e., al-Khiḍr] to whom We had given mercy from Us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

segments.t: And they found a servant
from among Our servants [i.e., al-Khiḍr]
to whom We had given mercy from Us
and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

18:66.t: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

segments.t: Moses said to him,
"May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me
from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

18:67.t: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

segments.t: He said,
"Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

18:68.t: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

segments.t: And how can you have patience
for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

18:69.t: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allāh wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"You will find me,
if Allāh wills, patient,
and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

18:7.t: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.

segments.t: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth
adornment for it
that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.

18:70.t: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention [i.e., explanation]."

segments.t: He said,
"Then if you follow me,
do not ask me about anything
until I make to you about it mention [i.e., explanation]."

18:71.t: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

segments.t: So they set out,
until when they had embarked on the ship,
he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] tore it open.
[Moses] said,
"Have you torn it open to drown its people?
You have certainly done a grave thing."

18:72.t: [Al-Khiḍr] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

segments.t: [Al-Khiḍr] said,
"Did I not say that with me
you would never be able to have patience?"

18:73.t: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not overwhelm me in my matter with difficulty."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"Do not blame me for what I forgot
and do not overwhelm me in my matter with difficulty."

18:74.t: So they set out, until when they met a boy, he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

segments.t: So they set out,
until when they met a boy,
he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] killed him.
[Moses] said,
"Have you killed a pure soul
for other than [having killed] a soul?
You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

18:75.t: [Al-Khiḍr] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

segments.t: [Al-Khiḍr] said,
"Did I not tell you that with me
you would never be able to have patience?"

18:76.t: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"If I should ask you about anything after this,
then do not keep me as a companion.
You have obtained from me an excuse."

18:77.t: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."

segments.t: So they set out,
until when they came to the people of a town,
they asked its people for food,
but they refused to offer them hospitality.
And they found therein a wall about to collapse,
so he [i.e., al-Khiḍr] restored it.
[Moses] said,
"If you wished,
you could have taken for it a payment."

18:78.t: [Al-Khiḍr] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.

segments.t: [Al-Khiḍr] said,
"This is parting between me and you.
I will inform you of the interpretation of that
about which you could not have patience.

18:79.t: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.

segments.t: As for the ship,
it belonged to poor people working at sea.
So I intended to cause defect in it
as there was after them a king
who seized every [good] ship by force.

18:8.t: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.

segments.t: And indeed,
We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.

18:80.t: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.

segments.t: And as for the boy,
his parents were believers,
and we feared that he would overburden them
by transgression and disbelief.

18:81.t: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

segments.t: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them
one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

18:82.t: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."

segments.t: And as for the wall,
it belonged to two orphan boys in the city,
and there was beneath it a treasure for them,
and their father had been righteous.
So your Lord intended that they reach maturity
and extract their treasure,
as a mercy from your Lord.
And I did it not of my own accord.
That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."

18:83.t: And they ask you, [O Muḥammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."

segments.t: And they ask you, [O Muḥammad],
about Dhul-Qarnayn.
Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."

18:84.t: Indeed, We established him upon the earth, and We gave him from everything a way [i.e., means].

segments.t: Indeed, We established him upon the earth,
and We gave him from everything a way [i.e., means].
So he followed a way

18:86.t: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun [i.e., the west], he found it [as if] setting in a body of dark water, and he found near it a people. We [i.e., Allāh] said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."

segments.t: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun [i.e., the west],
he found it [as if] setting in a body of dark water,
and he found near it a people.
We [i.e., Allāh] said,
"O Dhul-Qarnayn,
either you punish [them]
or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."

18:87.t: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment [i.e., Hellfire].

segments.t: He said,
"As for one who wrongs,
we will punish him.
Then he will be returned to his Lord,
and He will punish him with a terrible punishment [i.e., Hellfire].

18:88.t: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of the best [i.e., Paradise], and we [i.e., Dhul-Qarnayn] will speak to him from our command with ease."

segments.t: But as for one who believes and does righteousness,
he will have a reward of the best [i.e., Paradise],
and we [i.e., Dhul-Qarnayn] will speak to him from our command with ease."
Then he followed a way

18:9.t: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?

segments.t: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were,
among Our signs, a wonder?

18:90.t: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun [i.e., the east], he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.

segments.t: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun [i.e., the east],
he found it rising on a people
for whom We had not made against it any shield.

18:91.t: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.

segments.t: Thus.
