And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.
Then he followed a way

18:93.t: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.

segments.t: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains,
he found beside them a people
who could hardly understand [his] speech.

18:94.t: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"

segments.t: They said,
"O Dhul-Qarnayn,
indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land.
So may we assign for you an expenditure
that you might make between us and them a barrier?"

18:95.t: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength [i.e., manpower]; I will make between you and them a dam.

segments.t: He said,
"That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer],
but assist me with strength [i.e., manpower];
I will make between you and them a dam.

18:96.t: Bring me bars of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."

segments.t: Bring me bars of iron" - until,
when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls,
he said, "Blow [with bellows],"
until when he had made it [like] fire,
he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."

18:97.t: So they [i.e., Gog and Magog] were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.

segments.t: So they [i.e., Gog and Magog] were unable to pass over it,
nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.

18:98.t: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes [i.e., approaches], He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."

segments.t: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said,
"This is a mercy from my Lord;
but when the promise of my Lord comes [i.e., approaches],
He will make it level,
and ever is the promise of my Lord true."

18:99.t: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.

segments.t: And We will leave them that day surging over each other,
and [then] the Horn will be blown,
and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.
Kāf, Hā, Yā, ʿAyn, Ṣād.

19:10.t: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."

segments.t: [Zechariah] said,
"My Lord, make for me a sign."
He said,
"Your sign is that you will not speak to the people
for three nights, [being] sound."

19:11.t: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allāh] in the morning and afternoon.

segments.t: So he came out to his people
from the prayer chamber
and signaled to them
to exalt [Allāh]
in the morning and afternoon.

19:12.t: [Allāh said], "O John, take the Scripture [i.e., adhere to it] with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy

segments.t: [Allāh said], "O John, take the Scripture [i.e., adhere to it] with determination."
And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy

19:13.t: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allāh

segments.t: And affection from Us and purity,
and he was fearing of Allāh

19:14.t: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

segments.t: And dutiful to his parents,
and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

19:15.t: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

segments.t: And peace be upon him the day he was born
and the day he dies
and the day he is raised alive.

19:16.t: And mention, [O Muḥammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

segments.t: And mention, [O Muḥammad],
in the Book [the story of] Mary,
when she withdrew from her family
to a place toward the east.

19:17.t: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel [i.e., Gabriel], and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

segments.t: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen.
Then We sent to her Our Angel [i.e., Gabriel],
and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

19:18.t: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allāh."

segments.t: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me],
if you should be fearing of Allāh."

19:19.t: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy [i.e., son]."

segments.t: He said,
"I am only the messenger of your Lord
to give you [news of] a pure boy [i.e., son]."

19:2.t: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

segments.t: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord
to His servant Zechariah

19:20.t: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

segments.t: She said,
"How can I have a boy
while no man has touched me
and I have not been unchaste?"

19:21.t: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.'"

segments.t: He said, "Thus [it will be];
your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me,
and We will make him a sign to the people
and a mercy from Us.
And it is a matter [already] decreed.'"

19:22.t: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

segments.t: So she conceived him,
and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

19:23.t: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."

segments.t: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree.
She said,
"Oh, I wish I had died before this
and was in oblivion, forgotten."

19:24.t: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

segments.t: But he called her from below her,
"Do not grieve;
your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

19:25.t: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

segments.t: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree;
it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

19:26.t: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.'"

segments.t: So eat and drink and be contented.
And if you see from among humanity anyone, say,
'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention,
so I will not speak today to [any] man.'"

19:27.t: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

segments.t: Then she brought him to her people,
carrying him.
They said, "O Mary,
you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

19:28.t: O sister [i.e., descendant] of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."

segments.t: O sister [i.e., descendant] of Aaron,
your father was not a man of evil,
nor was your mother unchaste."

19:29.t: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

segments.t: So she pointed to him.
They said,
"How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

19:3.t: When he called to his Lord a private call [i.e., supplication].

segments.t: When he called to his Lord
a private call [i.e., supplication].

19:30.t: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allāh. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.

segments.t: [Jesus] said,
"Indeed, I am the servant of Allāh.
He has given me the Scripture
and made me a prophet.

19:31.t: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakāh as long as I remain alive

segments.t: And He has made me blessed wherever I am
and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakāh
as long as I remain alive

19:32.t: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

segments.t: And [made me] dutiful to my mother,
and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

19:33.t: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."

segments.t: And peace is on me the day I was born
and the day I will die
and the day I am raised alive."

19:34.t: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

segments.t: That is Jesus,
the son of Mary -
the word of truth
about which they are in dispute.

19:35.t: It is not [befitting] for Allāh to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

segments.t: It is not [befitting] for Allāh to take a son;
exalted is He!
When He decrees an affair,
He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

19:36.t: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."

segments.t: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord,
so worship Him.
That is a straight path."

19:37.t: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.

segments.t: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them,
so woe to those who disbelieved -
from the scene of a tremendous Day.

19:38.t: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

segments.t: How [clearly] they will hear and see
the Day they come to Us,
but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

19:39.t: And warn them, [O Muḥammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.

segments.t: And warn them, [O Muḥammad],
of the Day of Regret,
when the matter will be concluded;
and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness,
and they do not believe.

19:4.t: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy [i.e., disappointed].

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened,
and my head has filled with white,
and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy [i.e., disappointed].

19:40.t: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

segments.t: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth
and whoever is on it,
and to Us they will be returned.

19:41.t: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

segments.t: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham.
Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

19:42.t: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?

segments.t: [Mention] when he said to his father,
"O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear
and does not see
and will not benefit you at all?

19:43.t: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

segments.t: O my father,
indeed there has come to me of knowledge
that which has not come to you,
so follow me;
I will guide you to an even path.

19:44.t: O my father, do not worship [i.e., obey] Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

segments.t: O my father,
do not worship [i.e., obey] Satan.
Indeed Satan has ever been,
to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

19:45.t: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

segments.t: O my father,
indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment
from the Most Merciful
so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

19:46.t: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

segments.t: [His father] said,
"Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham?
If you do not desist,
I will surely stone you,
so avoid me a prolonged time."

19:47.t: [Abraham] said, "Peace [i.e., safety] will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.

segments.t: [Abraham] said,
"Peace [i.e., safety] will be upon you.
I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord.
Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.

19:48.t: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allāh and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy [i.e., disappointed]."

segments.t: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allāh
and will invoke my Lord.
I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy [i.e., disappointed]."

19:49.t: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allāh, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

segments.t: So when he had left them
and those they worshipped other than Allāh,
We gave him Isaac and Jacob,
and each [of them] We made a prophet.

19:5.t: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

segments.t: And indeed, I fear the successors after me,
and my wife has been barren,
so give me from Yourself an heir

19:50.t: And We gave them of Our mercy, and We made for them a mention [i.e., reputation] of high honor.

segments.t: And We gave them of Our mercy,
and We made for them a mention [i.e., reputation] of high honor.

19:51.t: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

segments.t: And mention in the Book, Moses.
Indeed, he was chosen,
and he was a messenger and a prophet.

19:52.t: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].

segments.t: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right
and brought him near, confiding [to him].

19:53.t: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

segments.t: And We gave him out of Our mercy
his brother Aaron as a prophet.

19:54.t: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

segments.t: And mention in the Book, Ishmael.
Indeed, he was true to his promise,
and he was a messenger and a prophet.

19:55.t: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakāh and was to his Lord pleasing [i.e., accepted by Him].

segments.t: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakāh
and was to his Lord pleasing [i.e., accepted by Him].

19:56.t: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

segments.t: And mention in the Book, Idrees.
Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

19:57.t: And We raised him to a high station.

segments.t: And We raised him
to a high station.

19:58.t: Those were the ones upon whom Allāh bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel [i.e., Jacob], and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

segments.t: Those were the ones upon whom Allāh bestowed favor
from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam
and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah,
and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel [i.e., Jacob],
and of those whom We guided and chose.
When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them,
they fell in prostration and weeping.

19:59.t: But there came after them successors [i.e., later generations] who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -

segments.t: But there came after them successors [i.e., later generations]
who neglected prayer and pursued desires;
so they are going to meet evil -

19:6.t: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."

segments.t: Who will inherit me
and inherit from the family of Jacob.
And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."

19:60.t: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

segments.t: Except those who repent,
believe and do righteousness;
for those will enter Paradise
and will not be wronged at all.

19:61.t: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been eminent.

segments.t: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence
which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen.
Indeed, His promise has ever been eminent.

19:62.t: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

segments.t: They will not hear therein any ill speech -
only [greetings of] peace -
and they will have their provision therein,
morning and afternoon.

19:63.t: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allāh.

segments.t: That is Paradise,
which We give as inheritance
to those of Our servants
who were fearing of Allāh.

19:64.t: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -

segments.t: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord.
To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between.
And never is your Lord forgetful -

19:65.t: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

segments.t: Lord of the heavens and the earth
and whatever is between them -
so worship Him
and have patience for His worship.
Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

19:66.t: And man [i.e., the disbeliever] says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

segments.t: And man [i.e., the disbeliever] says,
"When I have died,
am I going to be brought forth alive?"

19:67.t: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

segments.t: Does man not remember
that We created him before,
while he was nothing?

19:68.t: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

segments.t: So by your Lord,
We will surely gather them and the devils;
then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

19:69.t: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

segments.t: Then We will surely extract from every sect
those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

19:7.t: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."

segments.t: [He was told], "O Zechariah,
indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John.
We have not assigned to any before [this] name."

19:70.t: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

segments.t: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing
of those most worthy of burning therein.

19:71.t: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

segments.t: And there is none of you
except he will come to it.
This is upon your Lord
an inevitability decreed.

19:72.t: Then We will save those who feared Allāh and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

segments.t: Then We will save those who feared Allāh
and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

19:73.t: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"

segments.t: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences,
those who disbelieve say to those who believe,
"Which of [our] two parties is best in position
and best in association?"

19:74.t: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

segments.t: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them
who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

19:75.t: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

segments.t: Say, "Whoever is in error -
let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time]
until, when they see that which they were promised -
either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] -
they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

19:76.t: And Allāh increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.

segments.t: And Allāh increases those who were guided, in guidance,
and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward
and better for recourse.

19:77.t: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]"?

segments.t: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses
and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]"?

19:78.t: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

segments.t: Has he looked into the unseen,
or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

19:79.t: No! We will record what he says and extend [i.e., increase] for him from the punishment extensively.

segments.t: No!
We will record what he says
and extend [i.e., increase] for him
from the punishment extensively.

19:8.t: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
how will I have a boy
when my wife has been barren
and I have reached extreme old age?"

19:80.t: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.

segments.t: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions,
and he will come to Us alone.

19:81.t: And they have taken besides Allāh [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

segments.t: And they have taken besides Allāh [false] deities
that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

19:82.t: No! They [i.e., those "gods"] will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

segments.t: No!
They [i.e., those "gods"] will deny their worship of them
and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

19:83.t: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them [to evil] with [constant] incitement?

segments.t: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers,
inciting them [to evil] with [constant] incitement?

19:84.t: So be not impatient over them. We only count out [i.e., allow] to them a [limited] number.

segments.t: So be not impatient over them.
We only count out [i.e., allow] to them a [limited] number.

19:85.t: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

segments.t: On the Day We will gather the righteous
to the Most Merciful as a delegation

19:86.t: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

segments.t: And will drive the criminals
to Hell in thirst

19:87.t: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.

segments.t: None will have [power of] intercession
except he who had taken
from the Most Merciful a covenant.

19:88.t: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

segments.t: And they say,
"The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

19:89.t: You have done an atrocious thing.

segments.t: You have done an atrocious thing.

19:9.t: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.'"

segments.t: [An angel] said,
"Thus [it will be];
your Lord says,
'It is easy for Me,
for I created you before,
while you were nothing.'"

19:90.t: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

segments.t: The heavens almost rupture therefrom
and the earth splits open
and the mountains collapse in devastation

19:91.t: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

segments.t: That they attribute
to the Most Merciful a son.

19:92.t: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

segments.t: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful
that He should take a son.

19:93.t: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

segments.t: There is no one in the heavens and earth
but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

19:94.t: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

segments.t: He has enumerated them
and counted them a [full] counting.

19:95.t: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

segments.t: And all of them are coming to Him
on the Day of Resurrection alone.

19:96.t: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have believed
and done righteous deeds -
the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

19:97.t: So, [O Muḥammad], We have only made it [i.e., the Qur’ān] easy in your tongue [i.e., the Arabic language] that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

segments.t: So, [O Muḥammad],
We have only made it [i.e., the Qur’ān] easy
in your tongue [i.e., the Arabic language]
that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous
and warn thereby a hostile people.

19:98.t: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?

segments.t: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations?
Do you perceive of them anyone
or hear from them a sound?

1:1.t: In the name of Allāh, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

segments.t: In the name of Allāh,
the Entirely Merciful,
the Especially Merciful.

1:2.t: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, Lord of the worlds -

segments.t: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh,
Lord of the worlds -

1:3.t: The Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,

segments.t: The Entirely Merciful,
the Especially Merciful,

1:4.t: Sovereign of the Day of Recompense.

segments.t: Sovereign of the Day of Recompense.

1:5.t: It is You we worship and You we ask for help.

segments.t: It is You we worship
and You we ask for help.

1:6.t: Guide us to the straight path -

segments.t: Guide us to the straight path -

1:7.t: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have earned [Your] anger or of those who are astray.

segments.t: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor,
not of those who have earned [Your] anger
or of those who are astray.
Ṭā, Hā.

20:10.t: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."

segments.t: When he saw a fire
and said to his family,
"Stay here;
indeed, I have perceived a fire;
perhaps I can bring you a torch
or find at the fire some guidance."

20:100.t: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden [i.e., great sin],

segments.t: Whoever turns away from it -
then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden [i.e., great sin],

20:101.t: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -

segments.t: [Abiding] eternally therein,
and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -

20:102.t: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.

segments.t: The Day the Horn will be blown.
And We will gather the criminals,
that Day, blue-eyed.

20:103.t: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."

segments.t: They will murmur among themselves,
"You remained not but ten [days in the world]."

20:104.t: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner [i.e., wisdom or speech] will say, "You remained not but one day."

segments.t: We are most knowing of what they say
when the best of them in manner [i.e., wisdom or speech] will say,
"You remained not but one day."

20:105.t: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.

segments.t: And they ask you about the mountains,
so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.

20:106.t: And He will leave it [i.e., the earth] a level plain;

segments.t: And He will leave it [i.e., the earth] a level plain;

20:107.t: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."

segments.t: You will not see therein
a depression or an elevation."

20:108.t: That Day, they [i.e., everyone] will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

segments.t: That Day, they [i.e., everyone] will follow [the call of] the Caller
[with] no deviation therefrom,
and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful,
so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

20:109.t: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.

segments.t: That Day,
no intercession will benefit except [that of] one
to whom the Most Merciful has given permission
and has accepted his word.

20:11.t: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,

segments.t: And when he came to it,
he was called,
"O Moses,

20:110.t: He [i.e., Allāh] knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it [i.e., what He knows] in knowledge.

segments.t: He [i.e., Allāh] knows what is [presently] before them
and what will be after them,
but they do not encompass it [i.e., what He knows] in knowledge.

20:111.t: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining. And he will have failed who carries injustice.

segments.t: And [all] faces will be humbled
before the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining.
And he will have failed
who carries injustice.

20:112.t: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

segments.t: But he who does of righteous deeds
while he is a believer -
he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

20:113.t: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’ān and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.

segments.t: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur’ān
and have diversified therein the warnings
that perhaps they will avoid [sin]
or it would cause them remembrance.

20:114.t: So high [above all] is Allāh, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muḥammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur’ān before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

segments.t: So high [above all] is Allāh,
the Sovereign, the Truth.
And, [O Muḥammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur’ān
before its revelation is completed to you,
and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

20:115.t: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.

segments.t: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before,
but he forgot;
and We found not in him determination.

20:116.t: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.

segments.t: And [mention] when We said to the angels,
"Prostrate to Adam,"
and they prostrated, except Iblees;
he refused.

20:117.t: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.

segments.t: So We said,
"O Adam,
indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife.
Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.

20:118.t: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.

segments.t: Indeed, it is [promised] for you
not to be hungry therein
or be unclothed.

20:119.t: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."

segments.t: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein
or be hot from the sun."

20:12.t: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the blessed valley of Ṭuwā.

segments.t: Indeed, I am your Lord,
so remove your sandals.
Indeed, you are in the blessed valley of Ṭuwā.

20:120.t: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"

segments.t: Then Satan whispered to him;
he said, "O Adam,
shall I direct you to the tree of eternity
and possession that will not deteriorate?"

20:121.t: And they [i.e., Adam and his wife] ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

segments.t: And they [i.e., Adam and his wife] ate of it,
and their private parts became apparent to them,
and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise.
And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

20:122.t: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].

segments.t: Then his Lord chose him
and turned to him in forgiveness
and guided [him].

20:123.t: [Allāh] said, "Descend from it [i.e., Paradise] - all, [your descendants] being enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in the world] nor suffer [in the Hereafter].

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Descend from it [i.e., Paradise] - all,
[your descendants] being enemies to one another.
And if there should come to you guidance from Me -
then whoever follows My guidance
will neither go astray [in the world]
nor suffer [in the Hereafter].

20:124.t: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed [i.e., difficult] life, and We will gather [i.e., raise] him on the Day of Resurrection blind."

segments.t: And whoever turns away from My remembrance -
indeed, he will have a depressed [i.e., difficult] life,
and We will gather [i.e., raise] him on the Day of Resurrection blind."

20:125.t: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"

segments.t: He will say,
"My Lord,
why have you raised me blind
while I was [once] seeing?"

20:126.t: [Allāh] will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot [i.e., disregarded] them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."

segments.t: [Allāh] will say,
"Thus did Our signs come to you,
and you forgot [i.e., disregarded] them;
and thus will you this Day be forgotten."

20:127.t: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.

segments.t: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed
and did not believe in the signs of his Lord.
And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.

20:128.t: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

segments.t: Then, has it not become clear to them
how many generations We destroyed before them
as they walk among their dwellings?
Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

20:129.t: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it [i.e., punishment] would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].

segments.t: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord,
it [i.e., punishment] would have been an obligation [due immediately],
and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].

20:13.t: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].

segments.t: And I have chosen you,
so listen to what is revealed [to you].

20:130.t: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.

segments.t: So be patient over what they say
and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord
before the rising of the sun
and before its setting;
and during periods of the night [exalt Him]
and at the ends of the day,
that you may be satisfied.

20:131.t: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

segments.t: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment
to [some] categories of them,
[its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them.
And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

20:132.t: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.

segments.t: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people]
and be steadfast therein.
We ask you not for provision;
We provide for you,
and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.

20:133.t: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?

segments.t: And they say,
"Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?"
Has there not come to them evidence
of what was in the former scriptures?

20:134.t: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses [i.e., teachings] before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

segments.t: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him,
they would have said,
"Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger
so we could have followed Your verses [i.e., teachings]
before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

20:135.t: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."

segments.t: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting;
so wait.
For you will know who are the companions of the sound path
and who is guided."

20:14.t: Indeed, I am Allāh. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.

segments.t: Indeed, I am Allāh.
There is no deity except Me,
so worship Me
and establish prayer for My remembrance.

20:15.t: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.

segments.t: Indeed, the Hour is coming
- I almost conceal it -
so that every soul may be recompensed
according to that for which it strives.

20:16.t: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.

segments.t: So do not let one avert you from it
who does not believe in it
and follows his desire,
for you [then] would perish.

20:17.t: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"

segments.t: And what is that
in your right hand, O Moses?"

20:18.t: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."

segments.t: He said,
"It is my staff;
I lean upon it,
and I bring down leaves for my sheep
and I have therein other uses."
[Allāh] said,
"Throw it down,
O Moses."

20:2.t: We have not sent down to you the Qur’ān that you be distressed

segments.t: We have not sent down to you the Qur’ān
that you be distressed

20:20.t: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.

segments.t: So he threw it down,
and thereupon it was a snake,
moving swiftly.

20:21.t: [Allāh] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Seize it and fear not;
We will return it to its former condition.

20:22.t: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,

segments.t: And draw in your hand to your side;
it will come out white without disease - another sign,

20:23.t: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.

segments.t: That We may show you [some]
of Our greater signs.

20:24.t: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed [i.e., tyrannized]."

segments.t: Go to Pharaoh.
Indeed, he has transgressed [i.e., tyrannized]."

20:25.t: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand [i.e., relax] for me my breast [with assurance]

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"My Lord, expand [i.e., relax] for me my breast [with assurance]

20:26.t: And ease for me my task

segments.t: And ease for me my task

20:27.t: And untie the knot from my tongue

segments.t: And untie the knot
from my tongue

20:28.t: That they may understand my speech.

segments.t: That they may understand my speech.

20:29.t: And appoint for me a minister [i.e., assistant] from my family -

segments.t: And appoint for me a minister [i.e., assistant]
from my family -

20:3.t: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allāh] -

segments.t: But only as a reminder
for those who fear [Allāh] -
Aaron, my brother.
Increase through him my strength

20:32.t: And let him share my task

segments.t: And let him share my task

20:33.t: That we may exalt You much

segments.t: That we may exalt You much
And remember You much.

20:35.t: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."

segments.t: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."

20:36.t: [Allāh] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"You have been granted your request,
O Moses.

20:37.t: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,

segments.t: And We had already conferred favor upon you
another time,

20:38.t: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,

segments.t: When We inspired to your mother
what We inspired,

20:39.t: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye [i.e., observation and care].

segments.t: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest
and cast it into the river,
and the river will throw it onto the bank;
there will take him an enemy to Me
and an enemy to him.'
And I bestowed upon you love from Me
that you would be brought up under My eye [i.e., observation and care].

20:4.t: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,

segments.t: A revelation from He who created
the earth and highest heavens,

20:40.t: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.

segments.t: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said,
'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?'
So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve.
And you killed someone,
but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial.
And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan.
Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.

20:41.t: And I produced you for Myself.

segments.t: And I produced you
for Myself.

20:42.t: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.

segments.t: Go, you and your brother,
with My signs
and do not slacken in My remembrance.

20:43.t: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

segments.t: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh.
Indeed, he has transgressed.

20:44.t: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allāh]."

segments.t: And speak to him with gentle speech
that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allāh]."

20:45.t: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."

segments.t: They said,
"Our Lord,
indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us
or that he will transgress."

20:46.t: [Allāh] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Fear not.
Indeed, I am with you both;
I hear and I see.

20:47.t: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.

segments.t: So go to him and say,
'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord,
so send with us the Children of Israel
and do not torment them.
We have come to you with a sign from your Lord.
And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.

20:48.t: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.'"

segments.t: Indeed, it has been revealed to us
that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.'"

20:49.t: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"

segments.t: [Pharaoh] said,
"So who is the Lord of you two,
O Moses?"

20:5.t: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.

segments.t: The Most Merciful
[who is] above the Throne established.

20:50.t: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."

segments.t: He said,
"Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form
and then guided [it]."

20:51.t: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"

segments.t: [Pharaoh] said,
"Then what is the case
of the former generations?"

20:52.t: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record.
My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

20:53.t: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.

segments.t: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out]
and inserted therein for you roadways
and sent down from the sky, rain
and produced thereby categories of various plants.

20:54.t: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

segments.t: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock.
Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

20:55.t: From it [i.e., the earth] We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.

segments.t: From it [i.e., the earth] We created you,
and into it We will return you,
and from it We will extract you another time.

20:56.t: And We certainly showed him [i.e., Pharaoh] Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.

segments.t: And We certainly showed him [i.e., Pharaoh] Our signs - all of them -
but he denied and refused.

20:57.t: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

segments.t: He said,
"Have you come to us
to drive us out of our land
with your magic, O Moses?

20:58.t: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."

segments.t: Then we will surely bring you magic like it,
so make between us and you an appointment,
which we will not fail to keep and neither will you,
in a place assigned."

20:59.t: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"Your appointment is on the day of the festival
when the people assemble at mid-morning."

20:6.t: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.

segments.t: To Him belongs what is in the heavens
and what is on the earth
and what is between them
and what is under the soil.

20:60.t: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].

segments.t: So Pharaoh went away,
put together his plan,
and then came [to Moses].

20:61.t: Moses said to them [i.e., the magicians summoned by Pharaoh], "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allāh or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."

segments.t: Moses said to them [i.e., the magicians summoned by Pharaoh],
"Woe to you!
Do not invent a lie against Allāh
or He will exterminate you with a punishment;
and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."

20:62.t: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.

segments.t: So they disputed over their affair among themselves
and concealed their private conversation.

20:63.t: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way [i.e., religion or tradition].

segments.t: They said,
"Indeed, these are two magicians
who want to drive you out of your land with their magic
and do away with your most exemplary way [i.e., religion or tradition].

20:64.t: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."

segments.t: So resolve upon your plan
and then come [forward] in line.
And he has succeeded today who overcomes."

20:65.t: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."

segments.t: They said,
"O Moses,
either you throw
or we will be the first to throw."

20:66.t: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].

segments.t: He said,
"Rather, you throw."
And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic
that they were moving [like snakes].

20:67.t: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

segments.t: And he sensed within himself apprehension,
did Moses.

20:68.t: We [i.e., Allāh] said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.

segments.t: We [i.e., Allāh] said,
"Fear not.
Indeed, it is you who are superior.

20:69.t: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."

segments.t: And throw what is in your right hand;
it will swallow up what they have crafted.
What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician,
and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."

20:7.t: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.

segments.t: And if you speak aloud -
then indeed, He knows the secret
and what is [even] more hidden.

20:70.t: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

segments.t: So the magicians fell down in prostration.
They said,
"We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

20:71.t: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."

segments.t: [Pharaoh] said,
"You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission.
Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic.
So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides,
and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees,
and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."

20:72.t: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.

segments.t: They said,
"Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs
and [over] He who created us.
So decree whatever you are to decree.
You can only decree for this worldly life.

20:73.t: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allāh is better and more enduring."

segments.t: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord
that He may forgive us our sins
and what you compelled us [to do] of magic.
And Allāh is better and more enduring."

20:74.t: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.

segments.t: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal -
indeed, for him is Hell;
he will neither die therein nor live.

20:75.t: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:

segments.t: But whoever comes to Him as a believer
having done righteous deeds -
for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:

20:76.t: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.

segments.t: Gardens of perpetual residence
beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they abide eternally.
And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.

20:77.t: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."

segments.t: And We had inspired to Moses,
"Travel by night with My servants
and strike for them a dry path through the sea;
you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh]
nor be afraid [of drowning]."

20:78.t: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

segments.t: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers,
and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

20:79.t: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].

segments.t: And Pharaoh led his people astray
and did not guide [them].

20:8.t: Allāh - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

segments.t: Allāh -
there is no deity except Him.
To Him belong the best names.

20:80.t: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,

segments.t: O Children of Israel,
We delivered you from your enemy,
and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount,
and We sent down to you manna and quails,

20:81.t: [Saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen [i.e., perished]."

segments.t: [Saying], "Eat from the good things
with which We have provided you
and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein,
lest My anger should descend upon you.
And he upon whom My anger descends
has certainly fallen [i.e., perished]."

20:82.t: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.

segments.t: But indeed,
I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents
and believes
and does righteousness
and then continues in guidance.

20:83.t: [Allāh said], "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"

segments.t: [Allāh said], "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"

20:84.t: He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."

segments.t: He said,
"They are close upon my tracks,
and I hastened to You, my Lord,
that You be pleased."

20:85.t: [Allāh] said, "But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Sāmirī has led them astray."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed],
and the Sāmirī has led them astray."

20:86.t: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

segments.t: So Moses returned to his people,
angry and grieved.
He said, "O my people,
did your Lord not make you a good promise?
Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you,
or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you,
so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

20:87.t: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Sāmirī throw."

segments.t: They said,
"We did not break our promise to you by our will,
but we were made to carry burdens
from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh],
so we threw them [into the fire],
and thus did the Sāmirī throw."

20:88.t: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."

segments.t: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf
which had a lowing sound,
and they said,
"This is your god and the god of Moses,
but he forgot."

20:89.t: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech [i.e., response] and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?

segments.t: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech [i.e., response]
and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?

20:9.t: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

segments.t: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

20:90.t: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."

segments.t: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses],
"O my people, you are only being tested by it,
and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful,
so follow me and obey my order."

20:91.t: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to it [i.e., the calf] until Moses returns to us."

segments.t: They said,
"We will never cease being devoted to it [i.e., the calf]
until Moses returns to us."

20:92.t: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"O Aaron,
what prevented you,
when you saw them going astray,

20:93.t: From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"

segments.t: From following me?
Then have you disobeyed my order?"

20:94.t: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.'"

segments.t: [Aaron] said,
"O son of my mother,
do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head.
Indeed, I feared that you would say,
'You caused division among the Children of Israel,
and you did not observe [or await] my word.'"

20:95.t: [Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Sāmirī?"

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"And what is your case,
O Sāmirī?"

20:96.t: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."

segments.t: He said,
"I saw what they did not see,
so I took a handful [of dust]
from the track of the messenger and threw it,
and thus did my soul entice me."

20:97.t: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it [i.e., its ashes] into the sea with a blast.

segments.t: [Moses] said, "Then go.
And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.'
And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep.
And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted.
We will surely burn it and blow it [i.e., its ashes] into the sea with a blast.

20:98.t: Your god is only Allāh, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."

segments.t: Your god is only Allāh,
except for whom there is no deity.
He has encompassed all things in knowledge."

20:99.t: Thus, [O Muḥammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us a message [i.e., the Qur’ān].

segments.t: Thus, [O Muḥammad],
We relate to you from the news of what has preceded.
And We have certainly given you from Us a message [i.e., the Qur’ān].

21:1.t: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.

segments.t: [The time of] their account has approached for the people,
while they are in heedlessness turning away.

21:10.t: We have certainly sent down to you a Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?

segments.t: We have certainly sent down to you a Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
in which is your mention.
Then will you not reason?

21:100.t: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.

segments.t: For them therein is heavy sighing,
and they therein will not hear.

21:101.t: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.

segments.t: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us -
they are from it far removed.

21:102.t: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.

segments.t: They will not hear its sound,
while they are, in that which their souls desire,
abiding eternally.

21:103.t: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -

segments.t: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror,
and the angels will meet them, [saying],
"This is your Day which you have been promised" -

21:104.t: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.

segments.t: The Day when We will fold the heaven
like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records.
As We began the first creation,
We will repeat it.
[That is] a promise binding upon Us.
Indeed, We will do it.

21:105.t: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.

segments.t: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms]
after the [previous] mention
that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.

21:106.t: Indeed, in this [Qur’ān] is notification for a worshipping people.

segments.t: Indeed, in this [Qur’ān] is notification
for a worshipping people.

21:107.t: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

segments.t: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad],
except as a mercy to the worlds.

21:108.t: Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"

segments.t: Say, "It is only revealed to me
that your god is but one God;
so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"

21:109.t: But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.

segments.t: But if they turn away,
then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally.
And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.

21:11.t: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.

segments.t: And how many a city which was unjust
have We shattered
and produced after it another people.

21:110.t: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.

segments.t: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech,
and He knows what you conceal.

21:111.t: And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."

segments.t: And I know not;
perhaps it is a trial for you
and enjoyment for a time."

21:112.t: [The Prophet (ﷺ)] has said, "My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."

segments.t: [The Prophet (ﷺ)] has said,
"My Lord, judge [between us] in truth.
And our Lord is the Most Merciful,
the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."

21:12.t: And when they [i.e., its inhabitants] perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.

segments.t: And when they [i.e., its inhabitants] perceived Our punishment,
at once they fled from it.

21:13.t: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."

segments.t: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."

21:14.t: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

segments.t: They said,
"O woe to us!
Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

21:15.t: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].

segments.t: And that declaration of theirs did not cease
until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down],
extinguished [like a fire].

21:16.t: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.

segments.t: And We did not create the heaven and earth
and that between them in play.

21:17.t: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.

segments.t: Had We intended to take a diversion,
We could have taken it from [what is] with Us -
if [indeed] We were to do so.

21:18.t: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.

segments.t: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood,
and it destroys it,
and thereupon it departs.
And for you is destruction from that which you describe.

21:19.t: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him [i.e., the angels] are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.

segments.t: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth.
And those near Him [i.e., the angels] are not prevented by arrogance from His worship,
nor do they tire.

21:2.t: No mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

segments.t: No mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from their Lord
except that they listen to it while they are at play

21:20.t: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.

segments.t: They exalt [Him] night and day
[and] do not slacken.

21:21.t: Or have they [i.e., men] taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?

segments.t: Or have they [i.e., men] taken for themselves gods from the earth
who resurrect [the dead]?

21:22.t: Had there been within them [i.e., the heavens and earth] gods besides Allāh, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allāh, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

segments.t: Had there been within them [i.e., the heavens and earth] gods besides Allāh,
they both would have been ruined.
So exalted is Allāh, Lord of the Throne,
above what they describe.

21:23.t: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

segments.t: He is not questioned about what He does,
but they will be questioned.

21:24.t: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muḥammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur’ān] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.

segments.t: Or have they taken gods besides Him?
Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Produce your proof.
This [Qur’ān] is the message for those with me
and the message of those before me."
But most of them do not know the truth,
so they are turning away.

21:25.t: And We sent not before you any messenger except We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."

segments.t: And We sent not before you any messenger
except We revealed to him that,
"There is no deity except Me,
so worship Me."

21:26.t: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.

segments.t: And they say,
"The Most Merciful has taken a son."
Exalted is He!
Rather, they are [but] honored servants.

21:27.t: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.

segments.t: They cannot precede Him in word,
and they act by His command.

21:28.t: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

segments.t: He knows what is [presently] before them
and what will be after them,
and they cannot intercede
except on behalf of one whom He approves.
And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

21:29.t: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him" - that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

segments.t: And whoever of them should say,
"Indeed, I am a god besides Him"
- that one We would recompense with Hell.
Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

21:3.t: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"

segments.t: With their hearts distracted.
And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying],
"Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you?
So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"

21:30.t: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and then We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?

segments.t: Have those who disbelieved not considered
that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity,
and then We separated them
and made from water every living thing?
Then will they not believe?

21:31.t: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.

segments.t: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains,
lest it should shift with them,
and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads
that they might be guided.

21:32.t: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.

segments.t: And We made the sky a protected ceiling,
but they, from its signs, are turning away.

21:33.t: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.

segments.t: And it is He who created the night and the day
and the sun and the moon;
all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.

21:34.t: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?

segments.t: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth];
so if you die -
would they be eternal?

21:35.t: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.

segments.t: Every soul will taste death.
And We test you with evil and with good as trial;
and to Us you will be returned.

21:36.t: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muḥammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who mentions [i.e., insults] your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.

segments.t: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muḥammad],
they take you not except in ridicule, [saying],
"Is this the one who mentions [i.e., insults] your gods?"
And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.

21:37.t: Man was created of haste [i.e., impatience]. I will show you My signs [i.e., vengeance], so do not impatiently urge Me.

segments.t: Man was created of haste [i.e., impatience].
I will show you My signs [i.e., vengeance],
so do not impatiently urge Me.

21:38.t: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: And they say,
"When is this promise,
if you should be truthful?"

21:39.t: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...

segments.t: If those who disbelieved but knew the time
when they will not avert the Fire from their faces
or from their backs
and they will not be aided...

21:4.t: He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

segments.t: He [the Prophet (ﷺ)] said,
"My Lord knows whatever is said
throughout the heaven and earth,
and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

21:40.t: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.

segments.t: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them,
and they will not be able to repel it,
nor will they be reprieved.

21:41.t: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

segments.t: And already were messengers ridiculed before you,
but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

21:42.t: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.

segments.t: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day
from the Most Merciful?"
But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.

21:43.t: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

segments.t: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us?
They are unable [even] to help themselves,
nor can they be protected from Us.

21:44.t: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? Is it they who will overcome?

segments.t: But, [on the contrary],
We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers
until life was prolonged for them.
Then do they not see that We set upon the land,
reducing it from its borders?
Is it they who will overcome?

21:45.t: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

segments.t: Say, "I only warn you by revelation."
But the deaf do not hear the call
when they are warned.

21:46.t: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

segments.t: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them,
they would surely say,
"O woe to us!
Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

21:47.t: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.

segments.t: And We place the scales of justice
for the Day of Resurrection,
so no soul will be treated unjustly at all.
And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed,
We will bring it forth.
And sufficient are We as accountant.

21:48.t: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

segments.t: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion
and a light
and a reminder for the righteous

21:49.t: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.

segments.t: Who fear their Lord unseen,
while they are of the Hour apprehensive.

21:5.t: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."

segments.t: But they say,
"[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams;
rather, he has invented it;
rather, he is a poet.
So let him bring us a sign
just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."

21:50.t: And this [Qur’ān] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?

segments.t: And this [Qur’ān] is a blessed message
which We have sent down.
Then are you with it unacquainted?

21:51.t: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

segments.t: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before,
and We were of him well-Knowing

21:52.t: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

segments.t: When he said to his father and his people,
"What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

21:53.t: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."

segments.t: They said,
"We found our fathers worshippers of them."

21:54.t: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."

segments.t: He said,
"You were certainly,
you and your fathers,
in manifest error."

21:55.t: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"

segments.t: They said,
"Have you come to us with truth,
or are you of those who jest?"

21:56.t: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

segments.t: He said,
"[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth
who created them,
and I, to that, am of those who testify.

21:57.t: And [I swear] by Allāh, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."

segments.t: And [I swear] by Allāh,
I will surely plan against your idols
after you have turned and gone away."

21:58.t: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

segments.t: So he made them into fragments,
except a large one among them,
that they might return to it [and question].

21:59.t: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

segments.t: They said,
"Who has done this to our gods?
Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

21:6.t: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?

segments.t: Not a [single] city which We destroyed
believed before them,
so will they believe?

21:60.t: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

segments.t: They said,
