"We heard a young man mention them
who is called Abraham."

21:61.t: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."

segments.t: They said,
"Then bring him before the eyes of the people
that they may testify."

21:62.t: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

segments.t: They said,
"Have you done this to our gods,
O Abraham?"

21:63.t: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."

segments.t: He said,
"Rather, this - the largest of them - did it,
so ask them,
if they should [be able to] speak."

21:64.t: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

segments.t: So they returned to [blaming] themselves
and said [to each other],
"Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

21:65.t: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"

segments.t: Then they reversed themselves,
[saying], "You have already known
that these do not speak!"

21:66.t: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allāh that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

segments.t: He said,
"Then do you worship instead of Allāh
that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

21:67.t: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allāh. Then will you not use reason?"

segments.t: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allāh.
Then will you not use reason?"

21:68.t: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."

segments.t: They said,
"Burn him
and support your gods -
if you are to act."

21:69.t: We [i.e., Allāh] said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

segments.t: We [i.e., Allāh] said,
"O fire,
be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

21:7.t: And We sent not before you, [O Muḥammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures] if you do not know.

segments.t: And We sent not before you, [O Muḥammad],
except men to whom We revealed [the message],
so ask the people of the message [i.e., former scriptures]
if you do not know.

21:70.t: And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the greatest losers.

segments.t: And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm],
but We made them the greatest losers.

21:71.t: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds [i.e., peoples].

segments.t: And We delivered him and Lot
to the land which We had blessed
for the worlds [i.e., peoples].

21:72.t: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.

segments.t: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition,
and all [of them] We made righteous.

21:73.t: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakāh; and they were worshippers of Us.

segments.t: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command.
And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds,
establishment of prayer, and giving of zakāh;
and they were worshippers of Us.

21:74.t: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge,
and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds.
Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

21:75.t: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.

segments.t: And We admitted him into Our mercy.
Indeed, he was of the righteous.

21:76.t: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allāh] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great affliction [i.e., the flood].

segments.t: And [mention] Noah,
when he called [to Allāh] before [that time],
so We responded to him
and saved him and his family
from the great affliction [i.e., the flood].

21:77.t: And We aided [i.e., saved] him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.

segments.t: And We aided [i.e., saved] him
from the people who denied Our signs.
Indeed, they were a people of evil,
so We drowned them, all together.

21:78.t: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

segments.t: And [mention] David and Solomon,
when they judged concerning the field -
when the sheep of a people overran it [at night],
and We were witness to their judgement.

21:79.t: And We gave understanding of it [i.e., the case] to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].

segments.t: And We gave understanding of it [i.e., the case] to Solomon,
and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge.
And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us],
along with David and [also] the birds.
And We were doing [that].

21:8.t: And We did not make them [i.e., the prophets] forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].

segments.t: And We did not make them [i.e., the prophets] forms not eating food,
nor were they immortal [on earth].

21:80.t: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?

segments.t: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor
to protect you from your [enemy in] battle.
So will you then be grateful?

21:81.t: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.

segments.t: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind,
blowing forcefully,
proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed.
And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.

21:82.t: And of the devils [i.e., jinn] were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.

segments.t: And of the devils [i.e., jinn] were those who dived for him
and did work other than that.
And We were of them a guardian.

21:83.t: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the most merciful of the merciful."

segments.t: And [mention] Job,
when he called to his Lord,
"Indeed, adversity has touched me,
and You are the most merciful of the merciful."

21:84.t: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allāh].

segments.t: So We responded to him
and removed what afflicted him of adversity.
And We gave him [back] his family
and the like thereof with them
as mercy from Us
and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allāh].

21:85.t: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.

segments.t: And [mention] Ishmael
and Idrees
and Dhul-Kifl;
all were of the patient.

21:86.t: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

segments.t: And We admitted them into Our mercy.
Indeed, they were of the righteous.

21:87.t: And [mention] the man of the fish [i.e., Jonah], when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."

segments.t: And [mention] the man of the fish [i.e., Jonah],
when he went off in anger
and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him.
And he called out within the darknesses,
"There is no deity except You;
exalted are You.
Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."

21:88.t: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.

segments.t: So We responded to him
and saved him from the distress.
And thus do We save the believers.

21:89.t: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while You are the best of inheritors."

segments.t: And [mention] Zechariah,
when he called to his Lord,
"My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir],
while You are the best of inheritors."

21:9.t: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.

segments.t: Then We fulfilled for them the promise,
and We saved them and whom We willed
and destroyed the transgressors.

21:90.t: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.

segments.t: So We responded to him,
and We gave to him John,
and amended for him his wife.
Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds
and supplicate Us in hope and fear,
and they were to Us humbly submissive.

21:91.t: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity [i.e., Mary], so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

segments.t: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity [i.e., Mary],
so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel],
and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

21:92.t: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

segments.t: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion,
and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

21:93.t: And [yet] they divided their affair [i.e., that of their religion] among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.

segments.t: And [yet] they divided their affair [i.e., that of their religion] among themselves,
[but] all to Us will return.

21:94.t: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We [i.e., Our angels], of it, are recorders.

segments.t: So whoever does righteous deeds
while he is a believer -
no denial will there be for his effort,
and indeed We [i.e., Our angels], of it, are recorders.

21:95.t: And it is prohibited to [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return

segments.t: And it is prohibited to [the people of] a city
which We have destroyed
that they will [ever] return

21:96.t: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

segments.t: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened
and they, from every elevation, descend

21:97.t: And [when] the true promise [i.e., the resurrection] has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."

segments.t: And [when] the true promise [i.e., the resurrection] has approached;
then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror,
while they say], "O woe to us;
we had been unmindful of this;
rather, we were wrongdoers."

21:98.t: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allāh are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.

segments.t: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allāh
are the firewood of Hell.
You will be coming to [enter] it.

21:99.t: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.

segments.t: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods,
they would not have come to it,
but all are eternal therein.

22:1.t: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.

segments.t: O mankind,
fear your Lord.
Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.

22:10.t: "That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allāh is not ever unjust to [His] servants."

segments.t: "That is for what your hands have put forth
and because Allāh is not ever unjust to [His] servants."

22:11.t: And of the people is he who worships Allāh on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to unbelief]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.

segments.t: And of the people is he who worships Allāh on an edge.
If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it;
but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to unbelief].
He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter.
That is what is the manifest loss.

22:12.t: He invokes instead of Allāh that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.

segments.t: He invokes instead of Allāh
that which neither harms him nor benefits him.
That is what is the extreme error.

22:13.t: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.

segments.t: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit -
how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.

22:14.t: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allāh does what He intends.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe
and do righteous deeds
to gardens beneath which rivers flow.
Indeed, Allāh does what He intends.

22:15.t: Whoever should think that Allāh will not support him [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?

segments.t: Whoever should think that Allāh will not support him [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)]
in this world and the Hereafter -
let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath],
and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?

22:16.t: And thus have We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down as verses of clear evidence and because Allāh guides whom He intends.

segments.t: And thus have We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down
as verses of clear evidence
and because Allāh guides whom He intends.

22:17.t: Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allāh - Allāh will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allāh is, over all things, Witness.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have believed
and those who were Jews
and the Sabeans
and the Christians
and the Magians
and those who associated with Allāh -
Allāh will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection.
Indeed Allāh is, over all things, Witness.

22:18.t: Do you not see [i.e., know] that to Allāh prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allāh humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allāh does what He wills.

segments.t: Do you not see [i.e., know] that to Allāh prostrates
whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth
and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees,
the moving creatures and many of the people?
But upon many the punishment has been justified.
And he whom Allāh humiliates -
for him there is no bestower of honor.
Indeed, Allāh does what He wills.

22:19.t: These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water

segments.t: These are two adversaries
who have disputed over their Lord.
But those who disbelieved
will have cut out for them garments of fire.
Poured upon their heads will be scalding water

22:2.t: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allāh is severe.

segments.t: On the Day you see it
every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing,
and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy,
and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated
while they are not intoxicated;
but the punishment of Allāh is severe.

22:20.t: By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.

segments.t: By which is melted that within their bellies
and [their] skins.

22:21.t: And for [striking] them are maces of iron.

segments.t: And for [striking] them
are maces of iron.

22:22.t: Every time they want to get out of it [i.e., Hellfire] from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"

segments.t: Every time they want to get out of it [i.e., Hellfire] from anguish,
they will be returned to it,
and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"

22:23.t: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds
to gardens beneath which rivers flow.
They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl,
and their garments therein will be silk.

22:24.t: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

segments.t: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech,
and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

22:25.t: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allāh and [from] al-Masjid al-Ḥarām, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside - and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] by wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have disbelieved
and avert [people] from the way of Allāh
and [from] al-Masjid al-Ḥarām,
which We made for the people -
equal are the resident therein and one from outside -
and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] by wrongdoing -
We will make him taste of a painful punishment.

22:26.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform ṭawāf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying],
"Do not associate anything with Me
and purify My House for those who perform ṭawāf
and those who stand [in prayer]
and those who bow and prostrate.

22:27.t: And proclaim to the people the ḥajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -

segments.t: And proclaim to the people the ḥajj [pilgrimage];
they will come to you on foot
and on every lean camel;
they will come from every distant pass -

22:28.t: That they may witness [i.e., attend] benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allāh on known [i.e., specific] days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.

segments.t: That they may witness [i.e., attend] benefits for themselves
and mention the name of Allāh on known [i.e., specific] days
over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals.
So eat of them
and feed the miserable and poor.

22:29.t: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform ṭawāf around the ancient House."

segments.t: Then let them end their untidiness
and fulfill their vows
and perform ṭawāf around the ancient House."

22:3.t: And of the people is he who disputes about Allāh without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.

segments.t: And of the people is he who disputes about Allāh without knowledge
and follows every rebellious devil.

22:30.t: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allāh - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,

segments.t: That [has been commanded],
and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allāh -
it is best for him in the sight of his Lord.
And permitted to you are the grazing livestock,
except what is recited to you.
So avoid the uncleanliness of idols
and avoid false statement,

22:31.t: Inclining [only] to Allāh, not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates with Allāh - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.

segments.t: Inclining [only] to Allāh,
not associating [anything] with Him.
And he who associates with Allāh -
it is as though he had fallen from the sky
and was snatched by the birds
or the wind carried him down into a remote place.

22:32.t: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols [i.e., rites] of Allāh - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.

segments.t: That [is so].
And whoever honors the symbols [i.e., rites] of Allāh -
indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.

22:33.t: For you therein [i.e., the animals marked for sacrifice] are benefits for a specified term; then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.

segments.t: For you therein [i.e., the animals marked for sacrifice] are benefits
for a specified term;
then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.

22:34.t: And for every [religious] community We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] that they may mention the name of Allāh over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muḥammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]

segments.t: And for every [religious] community We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice]
that they may mention the name of Allāh
over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals.
For your god is one God,
so to Him submit.
And, [O Muḥammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]

22:35.t: Who, when Allāh is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them, and the establishers of prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.

segments.t: Who, when Allāh is mentioned,
their hearts are fearful,
and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them,
and the establishers of prayer
and those who spend from what We have provided them.

22:36.t: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols [i.e., rites] of Allāh; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allāh upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy [who does not seek aid] and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.

segments.t: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you
as among the symbols [i.e., rites] of Allāh;
for you therein is good.
So mention the name of Allāh upon them when lined up [for sacrifice];
and when they are [lifeless] on their sides,
then eat from them and feed the needy [who does not seek aid] and the beggar.
Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.

22:37.t: Their meat will not reach Allāh, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allāh for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.

segments.t: Their meat will not reach Allāh,
nor will their blood,
but what reaches Him is piety from you.
Thus have We subjected them to you
that you may glorify Allāh for that [to] which He has guided you;
and give good tidings to the doers of good.

22:38.t: Indeed, Allāh defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allāh does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh defends those who have believed.
Indeed, Allāh does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

22:39.t: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allāh is competent to give them victory.

segments.t: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought,
because they were wronged.
And indeed, Allāh is competent to give them victory.

22:4.t: It has been decreed for him [i.e., every devil] that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.

segments.t: It has been decreed for him [i.e., every devil]
that whoever turns to him -
he will misguide him
and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.

22:40.t: [They are] those who have been evicted from their homes without right - only because they say, "Our Lord is Allāh." And were it not that Allāh checks the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allāh is much mentioned [i.e., praised]. And Allāh will surely support those who support Him [i.e., His cause]. Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

segments.t: [They are] those who have been evicted from their homes without right -
only because they say, "Our Lord is Allāh."
And were it not that Allāh checks the people, some by means of others,
there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques
in which the name of Allāh is much mentioned [i.e., praised].
And Allāh will surely support those who support Him [i.e., His cause].
Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

22:41.t: [And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakāh and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allāh belongs the outcome of [all] matters.

segments.t: [And they are] those who,
if We give them authority in the land,
establish prayer and give zakāh
and enjoin what is right
and forbid what is wrong.
And to Allāh belongs the outcome of [all] matters.

22:42.t: And if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and ʿAad and Thamūd deny [their prophets],

segments.t: And if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] -
so, before them, did the people of Noah
and ʿAad and Thamūd deny [their prophets],

22:43.t: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

segments.t: And the people of Abraham
and the people of Lot

22:44.t: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

segments.t: And the inhabitants of Madyan.
And Moses was denied,
so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers;
then I seized them,
and how [terrible] was My reproach.

22:45.t: And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin - and [how many] an abandoned well and [how many] a lofty palace.

segments.t: And how many a city did We destroy
while it was committing wrong -
so it is [now] fallen into ruin -
and [how many] an abandoned well
and [how many] a lofty palace.

22:46.t: So have they not traveled through the earth and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.

segments.t: So have they not traveled through the earth
and have hearts by which to reason
and ears by which to hear?
For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded,
but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.

22:47.t: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. But Allāh will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.

segments.t: And they urge you to hasten the punishment.
But Allāh will never fail in His promise.
And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.

22:48.t: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.

segments.t: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment
while it was committing wrong.
Then I seized it,
and to Me is the [final] destination.

22:49.t: Say, "O people, I am only to you a clear warner."

segments.t: Say, "O people,
I am only to you a clear warner."

22:5.t: O people, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.

segments.t: O people, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection,
then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust,
then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot,
and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you.
And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term,
then We bring you out as a child,
and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity.
And among you is he who is taken in [early] death,
and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age
so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing.
And you see the earth barren,
but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells
and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.

22:50.t: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.

segments.t: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds -
for them is forgiveness and noble provision.

22:51.t: But the ones who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure - those are the companions of Hellfire.

segments.t: But the ones who strove against Our verses,
[seeking] to cause failure -
those are the companions of Hellfire.

22:52.t: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allāh abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allāh makes precise His verses. And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet
except that when he spoke [or recited],
Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding].
But Allāh abolishes that which Satan throws in;
then Allāh makes precise His verses.
And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

22:53.t: [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in [i.e., asserts] a trial for those within whose hearts is disease and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.

segments.t: [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in [i.e., asserts] a trial
for those within whose hearts is disease and those hard of heart.
And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.

22:54.t: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allāh the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.

segments.t: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord
and [therefore] believe in it,
and their hearts humbly submit to it.
And indeed is Allāh the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.

22:55.t: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.

segments.t: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it
until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly
or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.

22:56.t: [All] sovereignty that Day is for Allāh; He will judge between them. So they who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.

segments.t: [All] sovereignty that Day is for Allāh;
He will judge between them.
So they who believed and did righteous deeds
will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.

22:57.t: And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those there will be a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: And they who disbelieved
and denied Our signs -
for those there will be a humiliating punishment.

22:58.t: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allāh and then were killed or died - Allāh will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allāh who is the best of providers.

segments.t: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allāh
and then were killed or died -
Allāh will surely provide for them a good provision.
And indeed, it is Allāh who is the best of providers.

22:59.t: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Forbearing.

segments.t: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance
with which they will be pleased,
and indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Forbearing.

22:6.t: That is because Allāh is the True Reality and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent

segments.t: That is because Allāh is the True Reality
and because He gives life to the dead
and because He is over all things competent

22:60.t: That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allāh will surely aid him. Indeed, Allāh is Pardoning and Forgiving.

segments.t: That [is so].
And whoever responds [to injustice]
with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed
and then is tyrannized -
Allāh will surely aid him.
Indeed, Allāh is Pardoning and Forgiving.

22:61.t: That is because Allāh causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.

segments.t: That is because Allāh causes the night to enter the day
and causes the day to enter the night
and because Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.

22:62.t: That is because Allāh is the True Reality, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allāh is the Most High, the Grand.

segments.t: That is because Allāh is the True Reality,
and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood,
and because Allāh is the Most High, the Grand.

22:63.t: Do you not see that Allāh has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allāh is Subtle and Aware.

segments.t: Do you not see that Allāh has sent down rain from the sky
and the earth becomes green?
Indeed, Allāh is Subtle and Aware.

22:64.t: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

segments.t: To Him belongs what is in the heavens
and what is on the earth.
And indeed, Allāh is the Free of need,
the Praiseworthy.

22:65.t: Do you not see that Allāh has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allāh, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

segments.t: Do you not see that Allāh has subjected to you
whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command?
And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth,
unless by His permission.
Indeed Allāh, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

22:66.t: And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

segments.t: And He is the one who gave you life;
then He causes you to die
and then will [again] give you life.
Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

22:67.t: For every [religious] community We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muḥammad], let them [i.e., the disbelievers] not contend with you over the matter but invite [them] to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.

segments.t: For every [religious] community
We have appointed rites which they perform.
So, [O Muḥammad], let them [i.e., the disbelievers] not contend with you over the matter
but invite [them] to your Lord.
Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.

22:68.t: And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allāh is most knowing of what you do.

segments.t: And if they dispute with you,
then say,
"Allāh is most knowing of what you do.

22:69.t: Allāh will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ."

segments.t: Allāh will judge between you
on the Day of Resurrection
concerning that over which you used to differ."

22:7.t: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allāh will resurrect those in the graves.

segments.t: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming
- no doubt about it -
and that Allāh will resurrect those in the graves.

22:70.t: Do you not know that Allāh knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allāh, is easy.

segments.t: Do you not know that Allāh knows
what is in the heaven and earth?
Indeed, that is in a Record.
Indeed that, for Allāh, is easy.

22:71.t: And they worship besides Allāh that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

segments.t: And they worship besides Allāh
that for which He has not sent down authority
and that of which they have no knowledge.
And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

22:72.t: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire which Allāh has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."

segments.t: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences,
you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval.
They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses.
Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that?
[It is] the Fire which Allāh has promised those who disbelieve,
and wretched is the destination."

22:73.t: O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allāh will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for it [i.e., that purpose]. And if the fly should steal from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.

segments.t: O people, an example is presented,
so listen to it.
Indeed, those you invoke besides Allāh
will never create [as much as] a fly,
even if they gathered together for it [i.e., that purpose].
And if the fly should steal from them a [tiny] thing,
they could not recover it from him.
Weak are the pursuer and pursued.

22:74.t: They have not appraised Allāh with true appraisal. Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

segments.t: They have not appraised Allāh with true appraisal.
Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

22:75.t: Allāh chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.

segments.t: Allāh chooses from the angels messengers
and from the people.
Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.

22:76.t: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them. And to Allāh will be returned [all] matters.

segments.t: He knows what is [presently] before them
and what will be after them.
And to Allāh will be returned [all] matters.

22:77.t: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good -
that you may succeed.

22:78.t: And strive for Allāh with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. He [i.e., Allāh] named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakāh and hold fast to Allāh. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

segments.t: And strive for Allāh with the striving due to Him.
He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty.
[It is] the religion of your father, Abraham.
He [i.e., Allāh] named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures]
and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you
and you may be witnesses over the people.
So establish prayer and give zakāh and hold fast to Allāh.
He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

22:8.t: And of the people is he who disputes about Allāh without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening book [from Him],

segments.t: And of the people is he who disputes about Allāh
without knowledge or guidance
or an enlightening book [from Him],

22:9.t: Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allāh. For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],

segments.t: Twisting his neck [in arrogance]
to mislead [people] from the way of Allāh.
For him in the world is disgrace,
and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection
the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],

23:1.t: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:

segments.t: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:
Those are the inheritors

23:100.t: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.

segments.t: That I might do righteousness
in that which I left behind."
No!
It is only a word he is saying;
and behind them is a barrier
until the Day they are resurrected.

23:101.t: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.

segments.t: So when the Horn is blown,
no relationship will there be among them that Day,
nor will they ask about one another.

23:102.t: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.

segments.t: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] -
it is they who are the successful.

23:103.t: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.

segments.t: But those whose scales are light -
those are the ones who have lost their souls,
[being] in Hell, abiding eternally.

23:104.t: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.

segments.t: The Fire will sear their faces,
and they therein will have taut smiles.

23:105.t: [It will be said], "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"

segments.t: [It will be said], "Were not My verses recited to you
and you used to deny them?"

23:106.t: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.

segments.t: They will say,
"Our Lord,
our wretchedness overcame us,
and we were a people astray.

23:107.t: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."

segments.t: Our Lord,
remove us from it,
and if we were to return [to evil],
we would indeed be wrongdoers."

23:108.t: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.

segments.t: He will say,
"Remain despised therein
and do not speak to Me.

23:109.t: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'

segments.t: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said,
'Our Lord, we have believed,
so forgive us and have mercy upon us,
and You are the best of the merciful.'

23:11.t: Who will inherit al-Firdaus. They will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: Who will inherit al-Firdaus.
They will abide therein eternally.

23:110.t: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.

segments.t: But you took them in mockery
to the point that they made you forget My remembrance,
and you used to laugh at them.

23:111.t: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."

segments.t: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day
for their patient endurance -
that they are the attainers [of success]."

23:112.t: [Allāh] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"

segments.t: [Allāh] will say,
"How long did you remain on earth
in number of years?"

23:113.t: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."

segments.t: They will say,
"We remained a day or part of a day;
ask those who enumerate."

23:114.t: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.

segments.t: He will say,
"You stayed not but a little -
if only you had known.

23:115.t: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"

segments.t: Then did you think that We created you uselessly
and that to Us you would not be returned?"

23:116.t: So exalted is Allāh, the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.

segments.t: So exalted is Allāh,
the Sovereign, the Truth;
there is no deity except Him,
Lord of the Noble Throne.

23:117.t: And whoever invokes besides Allāh another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.

segments.t: And whoever invokes besides Allāh another deity
for which he has no proof -
then his account is only with his Lord.
Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.

23:118.t: And, [O Muḥammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."

segments.t: And, [O Muḥammad], say,
"My Lord, forgive and have mercy,
and You are the best of the merciful."

23:12.t: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.

segments.t: And certainly did We create man
from an extract of clay.

23:13.t: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb].

segments.t: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop
in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb].

23:14.t: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allāh, the best of creators.

segments.t: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot,
and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh],
and We made [from] the lump, bones,
and We covered the bones with flesh;
then We developed him into another creation.
So blessed is Allāh, the best of creators.

23:15.t: Then indeed, after that you are to die.

segments.t: Then indeed,
after that you are to die.

23:16.t: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.

segments.t: Then indeed you,
on the Day of Resurrection,
will be resurrected.

23:17.t: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.

segments.t: And We have created above you seven layered heavens,

segments.t: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount
and settled it in the earth.
And indeed, We are Able to take it away.

23:19.t: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.

segments.t: And We brought forth for you thereby
gardens of palm trees and grapevines
in which for you are abundant fruits
and from which you eat.

23:2.t: They who are during their prayer humbly intent

segments.t: They who are during their prayer
humbly intent

23:20.t: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food [i.e., olives] for those who eat.

segments.t: And [We brought forth] a tree
issuing from Mount Sinai
which produces oil and food [i.e., olives]
for those who eat.

23:21.t: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.

segments.t: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson.
We give you drink from that which is in their bellies,
and for you in them are numerous benefits,
and from them you eat.

23:22.t: And upon them and on ships you are carried.

segments.t: And upon them and on ships
you are carried.

23:23.t: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

segments.t: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people,

"O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him;
then will you not fear Him?"

23:24.t: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allāh had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.

segments.t: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said,

and if Allāh had willed [to send a messenger],
He would have sent down angels.
We have not heard of this among our forefathers.

23:25.t: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."

segments.t: He is not but a man possessed with madness,

23:26.t: [Noah] said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."

segments.t: [Noah] said,
"My Lord,
support me
because they have denied me."

23:27.t: So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows, put into it [i.e., the ship] from each [creature] two mates and your family, except him for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.

segments.t: So We inspired to him,

23:28.t: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allāh who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'

segments.t: And when you have boarded the ship,
you and those with you,
then say, 'Praise to Allāh

segments.t: And say, 'My Lord,
let me land at a blessed landing place,
and You are the best to accommodate [us].'"

23:3.t: And they who turn away from ill speech

segments.t: And they who turn away
from ill speech

23:30.t: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].

segments.t: Indeed in that are signs,
and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].

23:31.t: Then We produced after them a generation of others.

segments.t: Then We produced after them
a generation of others.

23:32.t: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

segments.t: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying],

you have no deity other than Him;
then will you not fear Him?"

23:33.t: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.

segments.t: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved

23:34.t: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.

segments.t: And if you should obey a man like yourselves,

segments.t: Does he promise you that when you have died
and become dust and bones
that you will be brought forth [once more]?

23:36.t: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.

segments.t: How far, how far,
is that which you are promised.

23:37.t: It [i.e., life] is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.

segments.t: It [i.e., life] is not but our worldly life -

23:38.t: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allāh, and we will not believe him."

segments.t: He is not but a man

segments.t: And they who are observant of zakāh

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"After a little,
they will surely become regretful."

23:41.t: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.

segments.t: So the shriek seized them in truth,
and We made them as [plant] stubble.
Then away with the wrongdoing people.

23:42.t: Then We produced after them other generations.

segments.t: Then We produced
after them other generations.

23:43.t: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].

segments.t: No nation will precede its time [of termination],
nor will they remain [thereafter].

23:44.t: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.

segments.t: Then We sent Our messengers in succession.

they denied him,

So away with a people who do not believe.

23:45.t: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

segments.t: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron
with Our signs and a clear authority

23:46.t: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.

segments.t: To Pharaoh and his establishment,
but they were arrogant
and were a haughty people.

23:47.t: They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"

segments.t: They said,
"Should we believe two men like ourselves
while their people are for us in servitude?"

23:48.t: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.

segments.t: So they denied them
and were of those destroyed.

23:49.t: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.

segments.t: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture
that perhaps they would be guided.

23:5.t: And they who guard their private parts

segments.t: And they who guard their private parts

23:50.t: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.

segments.t: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign

23:51.t: [Allāh said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Knowing.

segments.t: [Allāh said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness.

23:52.t: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me."

segments.t: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion,
and I am your Lord, so fear Me."

23:53.t: But they [i.e., the people] divided their religion among them into portions [i.e., sects] - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.

segments.t: But they [i.e., the people] divided their religion among them into portions [i.e., sects] -
each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.

23:54.t: So leave them in their confusion for a time.

segments.t: So leave them
in their confusion
for a time.

23:55.t: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children

segments.t: Do they think that what We extend to them
of wealth and children

23:56.t: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.

segments.t: Is [because] We hasten for them good things?
Rather, they do not perceive.

23:57.t: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord

segments.t: Indeed, they who are apprehensive
from fear of their Lord

23:58.t: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord

segments.t: And they who believe
in the signs of their Lord

23:59.t: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord

segments.t: And they who do not associate
anything with their Lord

23:6.t: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed -

segments.t: Except from their wives
or those their right hands possess,
for indeed, they will not be blamed -

23:60.t: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord -

segments.t: And they who give what they give
while their hearts are fearful
because they will be returning to their Lord -

23:61.t: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.

segments.t: It is those who hasten to good deeds,
and they outstrip [others] therein.

23:62.t: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: And We charge no soul
except [with that within] its capacity,
and with Us is a record which speaks with truth;
and they will not be wronged.

23:63.t: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides that [i.e., disbelief] which they are doing,

segments.t: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this,
and they have [evil] deeds besides that [i.e., disbelief] which they are doing,

23:64.t: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allāh] for help.

segments.t: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment,
at once they are crying [to Allāh] for help.

23:65.t: Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.

segments.t: Do not cry out today.
Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.

23:66.t: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels

segments.t: My verses had already been recited to you,
but you were turning back on your heels

23:67.t: In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.

segments.t: In arrogance regarding it,
conversing by night,
speaking evil.

23:68.t: Then have they not reflected over the word [i.e., the Qur’ān], or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?

segments.t: Then have they not reflected over the word [i.e., the Qur’ān],
or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?

23:69.t: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?

segments.t: Or did they not know their Messenger,

23:7.t: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -

segments.t: But whoever seeks beyond that,
then those are the transgressors -

23:70.t: Or do they say, "In him is madness"? Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

segments.t: Or do they say,
"In him is madness"?
Rather, he brought them the truth,
but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

23:71.t: But if the Truth [i.e., Allāh] had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.

segments.t: But if the Truth [i.e., Allāh] had followed their inclinations,
the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined.
Rather, We have brought them their message,
but they, from their message, are turning away.

23:72.t: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.

segments.t: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask them for payment?
But the reward of your Lord is best,
and He is the best of providers.

23:73.t: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.

segments.t: And indeed, you invite them
to a straight path.

23:74.t: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.

segments.t: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter
are deviating from the path.

23:75.t: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

segments.t: And even if We gave them mercy
and removed what was upon them of affliction,
they would persist in their transgression,
wandering blindly.

23:76.t: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]

segments.t: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning],
but they did not yield to their Lord,
nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]

segments.t: Until when We have opened before them
a door of severe punishment,
immediately they will be therein in despair.

23:78.t: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful.

segments.t: And it is He who produced for you
hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect];
little are you grateful.

23:79.t: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

segments.t: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth,
and to Him you will be gathered.

23:8.t: And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive

segments.t: And they who are to their trusts
and their promises attentive

23:80.t: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?

segments.t: And it is He who gives life and causes death,
and His is the alternation of the night and the day.
Then will you not reason?

23:81.t: Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.

segments.t: Rather, they say
like what the former peoples said.

23:82.t: They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

segments.t: They said,
"When we have died
and become dust and bones,
are we indeed to be resurrected?

23:83.t: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."

segments.t: We have been promised this,
we and our forefathers, before;
this is not but legends of the former peoples."

23:84.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"To whom belongs the earth
and whoever is in it,
if you should know?"

segments.t: They will say,
"To Allāh."
Say,
"Then will you not remember?"

23:86.t: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"

segments.t: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens
and Lord of the Great Throne?"

23:87.t: They will say, "[They belong] to Allāh." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"

segments.t: They will say,
"[They belong] to Allāh."
Say,
"Then will you not fear Him?"

23:88.t: Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"

segments.t: Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things -
and He protects while none can protect against Him -
if you should know?"

23:89.t: They will say, "[All belongs] to Allāh." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"

segments.t: They will say,
"[All belongs] to Allāh."
Say,
"Then how are you deluded?"

23:9.t: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -

segments.t: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -

segments.t: Rather, We have brought them the truth,
and indeed they are liars.

23:91.t: Allāh has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have [sought to] overcome others. Exalted is Allāh above what they describe [concerning Him].

segments.t: Allāh has not taken any son,
nor has there ever been with Him any deity.
[If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created,
and some of them would have [sought to] overcome others.
Exalted is Allāh above what they describe [concerning Him].

23:92.t: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].

segments.t: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed,
so high is He above what they associate [with Him].

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,

23:94.t: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: My Lord,
then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

23:95.t: And indeed, We are Able to show you what We have promised them.

segments.t: And indeed,
We are Able to show you
what We have promised them.

23:96.t: Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.

segments.t: Repel, by [means of] what is best,
[their] evil.
We are most knowing of what they describe.

segments.t: And say,
"My Lord,
I seek refuge in You
from the incitements of the devils,

segments.t: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord,
lest they be present with me."

24:1.t: [This is] a sūrah which We have sent down and made [that within it] obligatory and revealed therein verses of clear evidence that you might remember.

segments.t: [This is] a sūrah which We have sent down
and made [that within it] obligatory
and revealed therein verses of clear evidence
that you might remember.

24:10.t: And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy... and because Allāh is Accepting of Repentance and Wise.

segments.t: And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you
and His mercy...
and because Allāh is Accepting of Repentance and Wise.

24:11.t: Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather, it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof - for him is a great punishment [i.e., Hellfire].

segments.t: Indeed, those who came with falsehood
are a group among you.
Do not think it bad for you;
rather, it is good for you.
For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin,
and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof -
for him is a great punishment [i.e., Hellfire].

24:12.t: Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and believing women think good of themselves [i.e., one another] and say, "This is an obvious falsehood"?

segments.t: Why, when you heard it,
did not the believing men and believing women
think good of themselves [i.e., one another]
and say, "This is an obvious falsehood"?

24:13.t: Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allāh, who are the liars.

segments.t: Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses?
And when they do not produce the witnesses,
then it is they, in the sight of Allāh, who are the liars.

24:14.t: And if it had not been for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved by a great punishment

segments.t: And if it had not been for the favor of Allāh upon you
and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter,
you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved
by a great punishment

24:15.t: When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allāh, tremendous.

segments.t: When you received it with your tongues
and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge
and thought it was insignificant
while it was, in the sight of Allāh, tremendous.

24:16.t: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allāh]; this is a great slander"?

segments.t: And why, when you heard it,
did you not say,
"It is not for us to speak of this.
Exalted are You, [O Allāh];
this is a great slander"?

24:17.t: Allāh warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.

segments.t: Allāh warns you against returning
to the likes of this [conduct], ever,
if you should be believers.

24:18.t: And Allāh makes clear to you the verses [i.e., His rulings], and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And Allāh makes clear to you the verses [i.e., His rulings],
and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

24:19.t: Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allāh knows and you do not know.

segments.t: Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized]
among those who have believed will have a painful punishment
in this world and the Hereafter.
And Allāh knows and you do not know.

24:2.t: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion [i.e., law] of Allāh, if you should believe in Allāh and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

segments.t: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man

and do not be taken by pity for them
in the religion [i.e., law] of Allāh,
if you should believe in Allāh and the Last Day.
And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

segments.t: And if it had not been for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy...
and because Allāh is Kind and Merciful.

24:21.t: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allāh purifies whom He wills, and Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not follow the footsteps of Satan.
And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan -
indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing.
And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy,
not one of you would have been pure, ever,
but Allāh purifies whom He wills,
and Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

24:22.t: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allāh, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allāh should forgive you? And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth
swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy
and the emigrants for the cause of Allāh,
and let them pardon and overlook.
Would you not like that Allāh should forgive you?
And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

24:23.t: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment

segments.t: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women
are cursed in this world and the Hereafter;
and they will have a great punishment

24:24.t: On a Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.

segments.t: On a Day when their tongues,
their hands and their feet will bear witness against them
as to what they used to do.

24:25.t: That Day, Allāh will pay them in full their true [i.e., deserved] recompense, and they will know that it is Allāh who is the manifest Truth [i.e., perfect in justice].

segments.t: That Day,
Allāh will pay them in full their true [i.e., deserved] recompense,
and they will know that it is Allāh
who is the manifest Truth [i.e., perfect in justice].

24:26.t: Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words. Those [good people] are declared innocent of what they [i.e., slanderers] say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.

segments.t: Evil words are for evil men,
and evil men are [subjected] to evil words.
