and good men are [an object] of good words.
Those [good people] are declared innocent of what they [i.e., slanderers] say.
For them is forgiveness and noble provision.

24:27.t: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded [i.e., advised].

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not enter houses other than your own houses
until you ascertain welcome
and greet their inhabitants.
That is best for you;
perhaps you will be reminded [i.e., advised].

24:28.t: And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if it is said to you, "Go back," then go back; it is purer for you. And Allāh is Knowing of what you do.

segments.t: And if you do not find anyone therein,
do not enter them until permission has been given you.
And if it is said to you, "Go back,"
then go back; it is purer for you.
And Allāh is Knowing of what you do.

24:29.t: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allāh knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

segments.t: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited
in which there is convenience for you.
And Allāh knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

24:3.t: The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator or a polytheist, and that [i.e., marriage to such persons] has been made unlawful to the believers.

segments.t: The fornicator does not marry
except a [female] fornicator or polytheist,
and none marries her
except a fornicator or a polytheist,
and that [i.e., marriage to such persons]
has been made unlawful to the believers.

24:30.t: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allāh is [fully] Aware of what they do.

segments.t: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision
and guard their private parts.
That is purer for them.
Indeed, Allāh is [fully] Aware of what they do.

24:31.t: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment [i.e., beauty] except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess [i.e., slaves], or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allāh in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.

segments.t: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision
and guard their private parts
and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof
and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests
and not expose their adornment [i.e., beauty] except to their husbands,
their fathers,
their husbands' fathers,
their sons,
their husbands' sons,
their brothers,
their brothers' sons,
their sisters' sons,
their women,
that which their right hands possess [i.e., slaves],
or those male attendants having no physical desire,
or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women.
And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment.
And turn to Allāh in repentance, all of you, O believers,
that you might succeed.

24:32.t: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allāh will enrich them from His bounty, and Allāh is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

segments.t: And marry the unmarried among you
and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves.
If they should be poor,
Allāh will enrich them from His bounty,
and Allāh is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

24:33.t: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allāh enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allāh which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allāh is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage
abstain [from sexual relations]
until Allāh enriches them from His bounty.
And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation]
from among whom your right hands possess -
then make a contract with them
if you know there is within them goodness
and give them from the wealth of Allāh
which He has given you.
And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution,
if they desire chastity,
to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life.
And if someone should compel them,
then indeed, Allāh is [to them],
after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.

24:34.t: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allāh.

segments.t: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses
and examples from those who passed on before you
and an admonition for those who fear Allāh.

24:35.t: Allāh is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp; the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allāh guides to His light whom He wills. And Allāh presents examples for the people, and Allāh is Knowing of all things.

segments.t: Allāh is the Light of the heavens and the earth.
The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp;
the lamp is within glass,
the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree,
neither of the east nor of the west,
whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire.
Light upon light.
Allāh guides to His light whom He wills.
And Allāh presents examples for the people,
and Allāh is Knowing of all things.

24:36.t: [Such niches are] in houses [i.e., mosques] which Allāh has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned [i.e., praised] therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings

segments.t: [Such niches are] in houses [i.e., mosques]
which Allāh has ordered to be raised
and that His name be mentioned [i.e., praised] therein;
exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings

24:37.t: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allāh and performance of prayer and giving of zakāh. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about -

segments.t: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts
from the remembrance of Allāh
and performance of prayer
and giving of zakāh.
They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about -

24:38.t: That Allāh may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allāh gives provision to whom He wills without account [i.e., limit].

segments.t: That Allāh may reward them [according to] the best of what they did
and increase them from His bounty.
And Allāh gives provision to whom He wills without account [i.e., limit].

24:39.t: But those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allāh before him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allāh is swift in account.

segments.t: But those who disbelieved -
their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland
which a thirsty one thinks is water
until, when he comes to it,
he finds it is nothing
but finds Allāh before him,
and He will pay him in full his due;
and Allāh is swift in account.

24:4.t: And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,

segments.t: And those who accuse chaste women
and then do not produce four witnesses
- lash them with eighty lashes
and do not accept from them testimony ever after.
And those are the defiantly disobedient,

24:40.t: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allāh has not granted light - for him there is no light.

segments.t: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea
which is covered by waves,
upon which are waves,
over which are clouds -
darknesses, some of them upon others.
When one puts out his hand [therein],
he can hardly see it.
And he to whom Allāh has not granted light -
for him there is no light.

24:41.t: Do you not see that Allāh is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allāh is Knowing of what they do.

segments.t: Do you not see that Allāh is exalted
by whomever is within the heavens and the earth
and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]?
Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him],
and Allāh is Knowing of what they do.

24:42.t: And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allāh is the destination.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs the dominion
of the heavens and the earth,
and to Allāh is the destination.

24:43.t: Do you not see that Allāh drives clouds? Then He brings them together; then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightning almost takes away the eyesight.

segments.t: Do you not see that Allāh drives clouds?
Then He brings them together;
then He makes them into a mass,
and you see the rain emerge from within it.
And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail,
and He strikes with it whom He wills
and averts it from whom He wills.
The flash of its lightning almost takes away the eyesight.

24:44.t: Allāh alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.

segments.t: Allāh alternates the night and the day.
Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.

24:45.t: Allāh has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allāh creates what He wills. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

segments.t: Allāh has created every [living] creature from water.
And of them are those that move on their bellies,
and of them are those that walk on two legs,
and of them are those that walk on four.
Allāh creates what He wills.
Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

24:46.t: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allāh guides whom He wills to a straight path.

segments.t: We have certainly sent down distinct verses.
And Allāh guides whom He wills to a straight path.

24:47.t: But they [i.e., the hypocrites] say, "We have believed in Allāh and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.

segments.t: But they [i.e., the hypocrites] say,
"We have believed in Allāh and in the Messenger,
and we obey";
then a party of them turns away after that.
And those are not believers.

24:48.t: And when they are called to [the words of] Allāh and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].

segments.t: And when they are called to [the words of] Allāh
and His Messenger to judge between them,
at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].

24:49.t: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.

segments.t: But if the right is theirs,
they come to him in prompt obedience.

24:5.t: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform, for indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform,
for indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

24:50.t: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allāh will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers [i.e., the unjust].

segments.t: Is there disease in their hearts?
Or have they doubted?
Or do they fear that Allāh will be unjust to them,
or His Messenger?
Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers [i.e., the unjust].

24:51.t: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allāh and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.

segments.t: The only statement of the [true] believers
when they are called to Allāh and His Messenger
to judge between them is that they say,
"We hear and we obey."
And those are the successful.

24:52.t: And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger and fears Allāh and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.

segments.t: And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger
and fears Allāh and is conscious of Him -
it is those who are the attainers.

24:53.t: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allāh's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allāh is [fully] Aware of that which you do."

segments.t: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths
that if you ordered them,
they would go forth [in Allāh's cause].
Say, "Do not swear.
[Such] obedience is known.
Indeed, Allāh is [fully] Aware of that which you do."

24:54.t: Say, "Obey Allāh and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."

segments.t: Say, "Obey Allāh and obey the Messenger;
but if you turn away -
then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged,
and upon you is that with which you have been charged.
And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided.
And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."

24:55.t: Allāh has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: Allāh has promised those who have believed among you
and done righteous deeds
that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth
just as He granted it to those before them
and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion
which He has preferred for them
and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security,
[for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me.
But whoever disbelieves after that -
then those are the defiantly disobedient.

24:56.t: And establish prayer and give zakāh and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.

segments.t: And establish prayer
and give zakāh
and obey the Messenger -
that you may receive mercy.

24:57.t: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allāh] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.

segments.t: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allāh] upon the earth.
Their refuge will be the Fire -
and how wretched the destination.

24:58.t: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allāh make clear to you the verses [i.e., His ordinances]; and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
let those whom your right hands possess
and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you
ask permission of you [before entering] at three times:
before the dawn prayer
and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon
and after the night prayer.
[These are] three times of privacy for you.
There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods],
for they continually circulate among you -
some of you, among others.
Thus does Allāh make clear to you the verses [i.e., His ordinances];
and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

24:59.t: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses; and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And when the children among you reach puberty,
let them ask permission [at all times]
as those before them have done.
Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses;
and Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

24:6.t: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allāh that indeed, he is of the truthful.

segments.t: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery]
and have no witnesses except themselves -
then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allāh
that indeed, he is of the truthful.

24:60.t: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

segments.t: And women of post-menstrual age
who have no desire for marriage -
there is no blame upon them
for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment.
But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them.
And Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

24:61.t: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allāh, blessed and good. Thus does Allāh make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.

segments.t: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint
nor upon the lame constraint
nor upon the ill constraint
nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses
or the houses of your fathers
or the houses of your mothers
or the houses of your brothers
or the houses of your sisters
or the houses of your father's brothers
or the houses of your father's sisters
or the houses of your mother's brothers
or the houses of your mother's sisters
or [from houses] whose keys you possess
or [from the house] of your friend.
There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately.
But when you enter houses,
give greetings of peace upon each other -
a greeting from Allāh, blessed and good.
Thus does Allāh make clear to you the verses [of ordinance]
that you may understand.

24:62.t: The believers are only those who believe in Allāh and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muḥammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allāh and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission due to something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: The believers are only those who believe in Allāh and His Messenger and,
when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest,
do not depart until they have asked his permission.
Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muḥammad] -
those are the ones who believe in Allāh and His Messenger.
So when they ask your permission due to something of their affairs,
then give permission to whom you will among them
and ask forgiveness for them of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

24:63.t: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allāh knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from his [i.e., the Prophet's] order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.

segments.t: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves
as the call of one of you to another.
Already Allāh knows those of you who slip away,
concealed by others.
So let those beware who dissent from his [i.e., the Prophet's] order,
lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.

24:64.t: Unquestionably, to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allāh is Knowing of all things.

segments.t: Unquestionably,
to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth.
Already He knows that upon which you [stand]
and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him
and He will inform them of what they have done.
And Allāh is Knowing of all things.

24:7.t: And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allāh be upon him if he should be of the liars.

segments.t: And the fifth [oath will be]
that the curse of Allāh be upon him
if he should be of the liars.

24:8.t: But it will prevent punishment from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allāh that indeed, he is of the liars.

segments.t: But it will prevent punishment from her
if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allāh
that indeed, he is of the liars.

24:9.t: And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allāh be upon her if he was of the truthful.

segments.t: And the fifth [oath will be]
that the wrath of Allāh be upon her
if he was of the truthful.

25:1.t: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -

segments.t: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant
that he may be to the worlds a warner -

25:10.t: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.

segments.t: Blessed is He who,
if He willed,
could have made for you [something] better than that -
gardens beneath which rivers flow -
and could make for you palaces.

25:11.t: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.

segments.t: But they have denied the Hour,
and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.

25:12.t: When it [i.e., the Hellfire] sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.

segments.t: When it [i.e., the Hellfire] sees them from a distant place,
they will hear its fury and roaring.

25:13.t: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.

segments.t: And when they are thrown into a narrow place
therein bound in chains,
they will cry out thereupon for destruction.

25:14.t: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."

segments.t: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction
but cry for much destruction."

25:15.t: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.

segments.t: Say, "Is that better
or the Garden of Eternity
which is promised to the righteous?
It will be for them a reward and destination.

25:16.t: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.

segments.t: For them therein is whatever they wish,
[while] abiding eternally.
It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.

25:17.t: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allāh and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"

segments.t: And [mention] the Day He will gather them
and that which they worship besides Allāh
and will say,
"Did you mislead these, My servants,
or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"

25:18.t: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies [i.e., protectors]. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."

segments.t: They will say,
"Exalted are You!
It was not for us to take besides You any allies [i.e., protectors].
But You provided comforts for them and their fathers
until they forgot the message
and became a people ruined."

25:19.t: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.

segments.t: So they will deny you, [disbelievers],
in what you say,
and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help.
And whoever commits injustice among you -
We will make him taste a great punishment.

25:2.t: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.

segments.t: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth
and who has not taken a son
and has not had a partner in dominion
and has created each thing
and determined it with [precise] determination.

25:20.t: And We did not send before you, [O Muḥammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.

segments.t: And We did not send before you, [O Muḥammad],
any of the messengers except that they ate food
and walked in the markets.
And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others -
will you have patience?
And ever is your Lord, Seeing.

25:21.t: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.

segments.t: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say,
"Why were not angels sent down to us,
or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?"
They have certainly become arrogant within themselves
and [become] insolent with great insolence.

25:22.t: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."

segments.t: The day they see the angels -
no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals,
and [the angels] will say,
"Prevented and inaccessible."

25:23.t: And We will approach [i.e., regard] what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.

segments.t: And We will approach [i.e., regard] what they have done of deeds
and make them as dust dispersed.

25:24.t: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.

segments.t: The companions of Paradise,
that Day,
are [in] a better settlement
and better resting place.

25:25.t: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.

segments.t: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open
with [emerging] clouds,
and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.

25:26.t: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.

segments.t: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful.
And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.

25:27.t: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.

segments.t: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret]
he will say,
"Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.

25:28.t: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.

segments.t: Oh, woe to me!
I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.

25:29.t: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."

segments.t: He led me away from the remembrance
after it had come to me.
And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."

25:3.t: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.

segments.t: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing,
while they are created,
and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit
and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.

25:30.t: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur’ān as [a thing] abandoned."

segments.t: And the Messenger has said,
"O my Lord,
indeed my people have taken this Qur’ān
as [a thing] abandoned."

25:31.t: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.

segments.t: And thus have We made for every prophet
an enemy from among the criminals.
But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.

25:32.t: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur’ān not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.

segments.t: And those who disbelieve say,
"Why was the Qur’ān not revealed to him all at once?"
Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart.
And We have spaced it distinctly.

25:33.t: And they do not come to you with an example [i.e., argument] except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.

segments.t: And they do not come to you with an example [i.e., argument]
except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.

25:34.t: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.

segments.t: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell -
those are the worst in position
and farthest astray in [their] way.

25:35.t: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.

segments.t: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture
and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.

25:36.t: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.

segments.t: And We said,
"Go both of you to the people
who have denied Our signs."
Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.

25:37.t: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

segments.t: And the people of Noah -
when they denied the messengers,
We drowned them,
and We made them for mankind a sign.
And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

25:38.t: And [We destroyed] ʿAad and Thamūd and the companions of the well and many generations between them.

segments.t: And [We destroyed] ʿAad and Thamūd
and the companions of the well
and many generations between them.

25:39.t: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.

segments.t: And for each We presented examples [as warnings],
and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.

25:4.t: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur’ān] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.

segments.t: And those who disbelieve say,
"This [Qur’ān] is not except a falsehood he invented,
and another people assisted him in it."
But they have committed an injustice and a lie.

25:40.t: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil [i.e., stones]. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.

segments.t: And they have already come upon the town
which was showered with a rain of evil [i.e., stones].
So have they not seen it?
But they are not expecting resurrection.

25:41.t: And when they see you, [O Muḥammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allāh has sent as a messenger?

segments.t: And when they see you, [O Muḥammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying],
"Is this the one whom Allāh has sent as a messenger?

25:42.t: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.

segments.t: He almost would have misled us from our gods
had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them."
But they are going to know,
when they see the punishment,
who is farthest astray in [his] way.

25:43.t: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?

segments.t: Have you seen the one
who takes as his god his own desire?
Then would you be responsible for him?

25:44.t: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.

segments.t: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason?
They are not except like livestock.
Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.

25:45.t: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.

segments.t: Have you not considered your Lord -
how He extends the shadow,
and if He willed,
He could have made it stationary?
Then We made the sun for it an indication.

25:46.t: Then We [retract and] hold it with Us for a brief grasp.

segments.t: Then We [retract and] hold it with Us
for a brief grasp.

25:47.t: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.

segments.t: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing
and sleep [a means for] rest
and has made the day a resurrection.

25:48.t: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy [i.e., rainfall], and We send down from the sky pure water

segments.t: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings
before His mercy [i.e., rainfall],
and We send down from the sky pure water

25:49.t: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.

segments.t: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land
and give it as drink to those We created
of numerous livestock and men.

25:5.t: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."

segments.t: And they say,
"Legends of the former peoples
which he has written down,
and they are dictated to him
morning and afternoon."

25:50.t: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.

segments.t: And We have certainly distributed it among them
that they might be reminded,
but most of the people refuse except disbelief.

25:51.t: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.

segments.t: And if We had willed,
We could have sent into every city a warner.

25:52.t: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with it [i.e., the Qur’ān] a great striving.

segments.t: So do not obey the disbelievers,
and strive against them with it [i.e., the Qur’ān]
a great striving.

25:53.t: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas [i.e., bodies of water], one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.

segments.t: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas [i.e., bodies of water],
one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter,
and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.

25:54.t: And it is He who has created from water [i.e., semen] a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].

segments.t: And it is He who has created from water [i.e., semen] a human being
and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage.
And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].

25:55.t: But they worship rather than Allāh that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].

segments.t: But they worship rather than Allāh
that which does not benefit them or harm them,
and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].

25:56.t: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

segments.t: And We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad],
except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

25:57.t: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."

segments.t: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment -
only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."

25:58.t: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allāh] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, [fully] Aware -

segments.t: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die,
and exalt [Allāh] with His praise.
And sufficient is He to be,
with the sins of His servants, [fully] Aware -

25:59.t: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)].

segments.t: He who created the heavens and the earth
and what is between them in six days
and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful,
so ask about Him one well informed [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)].

25:6.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret
within the heavens and the earth.
Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."

25:60.t: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Prostrate to the Most Merciful,"
they say,
"And what is the Most Merciful?
Should we prostrate to that which you order us?"
And it increases them in aversion.

25:61.t: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.

segments.t: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars
and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.

25:62.t: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.

segments.t: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession
for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.

25:63.t: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,

segments.t: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those
who walk upon the earth easily,
and when the ignorant address them [harshly],
they say [words of] peace,

25:64.t: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]

segments.t: And those who spend [part of] the night
to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]

25:65.t: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;

segments.t: And those who say,
"Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell.
Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;

25:66.t: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."

segments.t: Indeed, it is evil
as a settlement and residence."

25:67.t: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

segments.t: And [they are] those who, when they spend,
do so not excessively or sparingly
but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

25:68.t: And those who do not invoke with Allāh another deity or kill the soul which Allāh has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.

segments.t: And those who do not invoke with Allāh another deity
or kill the soul which Allāh has forbidden [to be killed],
except by right,
and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse.
And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.

25:69.t: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -

segments.t: Multiplied for him is the punishment
on the Day of Resurrection,
and he will abide therein humiliated -

25:7.t: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?

segments.t: And they say,
"What is this messenger that eats food
and walks in the markets?
Why was there not sent down to him an angel
so he would be with him a warner?

25:70.t: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allāh will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Except for those who repent,
believe and do righteous work.
For them Allāh will replace their evil deeds with good.
And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

25:71.t: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allāh with [accepted] repentance.

segments.t: And he who repents and does righteousness
does indeed turn to Allāh with [accepted] repentance.

25:72.t: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.

segments.t: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood,
and when they pass near ill speech,
they pass by with dignity.

25:73.t: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.

segments.t: And those who,
when reminded of the verses of their Lord,
do not fall upon them deaf and blind.

25:74.t: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us a leader [i.e., example] for the righteous."

segments.t: And those who say,
"Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring
comfort to our eyes
and make us a leader [i.e., example] for the righteous."

25:75.t: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace,

segments.t: Those will be awarded the Chamber
for what they patiently endured,
and they will be received therein
with greetings and [words of] peace,

25:76.t: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.

segments.t: Abiding eternally therein.
Good is the settlement and residence.

25:77.t: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so it [i.e., your denial] is going to be adherent.

segments.t: Say, "What would my Lord care for you
if not for your supplication?"
For you [disbelievers] have denied,
so it [i.e., your denial] is going to be adherent.

25:8.t: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

segments.t: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven],
or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?"
And the wrongdoers say,
"You follow not but a man affected by magic."

25:9.t: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

segments.t: Look how they strike for you comparisons;
but they have strayed,
so they cannot [find] a way.
Ṭā, Seen, Meem.

26:10.t: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -

segments.t: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses,
[saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -

26:100.t: So now we have no intercessors

segments.t: So now we have no intercessors
And not a devoted friend.

26:102.t: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers..."

segments.t: Then if we only had a return [to the world]
and could be of the believers..."

26:103.t: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

segments.t: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

26:104.t: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

26:105.t: The people of Noah denied the messengers

segments.t: The people of Noah
denied the messengers

26:106.t: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?

segments.t: When their brother Noah said to them,
"Will you not fear Allāh?

26:107.t: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

segments.t: Indeed, I am to you
a trustworthy messenger.

26:108.t: So fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me.

26:109.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

26:11.t: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allāh?"

segments.t: The people of Pharaoh.
Will they not fear Allāh?"

26:110.t: So fear Allāh and obey me."

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me."

26:111.t: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"

segments.t: They said,
"Should we believe you
while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"

26:112.t: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?

segments.t: He said,
"And what is my knowledge
of what they used to do?

26:113.t: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.

segments.t: Their account is only upon my Lord,
if you [could] perceive.

26:114.t: And I am not one to drive away the believers.

segments.t: And I am not one
to drive away the believers.

26:115.t: I am only a clear warner."

segments.t: I am only a clear warner."

26:116.t: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."

segments.t: They said,
"If you do not desist, O Noah,
you will surely be of those who are stoned."

26:117.t: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed my people have denied me.

26:118.t: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."

segments.t: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement
and save me and those with me of the believers."

26:119.t: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

segments.t: So We saved him
and those with him
in the laden ship.

26:12.t: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed I fear that they will deny me

26:120.t: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

segments.t: Then We drowned thereafter
the remaining ones.

26:121.t: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

segments.t: Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

26:122.t: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.
ʿAad denied the messengers

26:124.t: When their brother Hūd said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?

segments.t: When their brother Hūd said to them,
"Will you not fear Allāh?

26:125.t: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

segments.t: Indeed, I am to you
a trustworthy messenger.

26:126.t: So fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me.

26:127.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

26:128.t: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,

segments.t: Do you construct on every elevation a sign,
amusing yourselves,

26:129.t: And take for yourselves constructions [i.e., palaces and fortresses] that you might abide eternally?

segments.t: And take for yourselves constructions [i.e., palaces and fortresses]
that you might abide eternally?

26:13.t: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.

segments.t: And that my breast will tighten
and my tongue will not be fluent,
so send for Aaron.

26:130.t: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.

segments.t: And when you strike,
you strike as tyrants.

26:131.t: So fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me.

26:132.t: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,

segments.t: And fear He who provided you
with that which you know,

26:133.t: Provided you with grazing livestock and children

segments.t: Provided you with grazing livestock
and children
And gardens
and springs.

26:135.t: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."

segments.t: Indeed, I fear for you
the punishment of a terrible day."

26:136.t: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.

segments.t: They said,
"It is all the same to us
whether you advise
or are not of the advisors.

26:137.t: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,

segments.t: This is not but the custom
of the former peoples,

26:138.t: And we are not to be punished."

segments.t: And we are not to be punished."

26:139.t: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

segments.t: And they denied him,
so We destroyed them.
Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

26:14.t: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."

segments.t: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin,
so I fear that they will kill me."

26:140.t: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.
Thamūd denied the messengers

26:142.t: When their brother Ṣāliḥ said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?

segments.t: When their brother Ṣāliḥ said to them,
"Will you not fear Allāh?

26:143.t: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

segments.t: Indeed, I am to you
a trustworthy messenger.

26:144.t: So fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me.

26:145.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment.
My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

26:146.t: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],

segments.t: Will you be left in what is here,
secure [from death],
Within gardens
and springs

26:148.t: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

segments.t: And fields of crops
and palm trees with softened fruit?

26:149.t: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.

segments.t: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.

26:15.t: [Allāh] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"No.
Go both of you with Our signs;
indeed, We are with you, listening.

26:150.t: So fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me.

26:151.t: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

segments.t: And do not obey
the order of the transgressors,

26:152.t: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."

segments.t: Who cause corruption in the land
and do not amend."

26:153.t: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

segments.t: They said,
"You are only of those affected by magic.

26:154.t: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."

segments.t: You are but a man like ourselves,
so bring a sign,
if you should be of the truthful."

26:155.t: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.

segments.t: He said,
"This is a she-camel.
For her is a [time of] drink,
and for you is a [time of] drink,
[each] on a known day.

26:156.t: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."

segments.t: And do not touch her with harm,
lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."

26:157.t: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

segments.t: But they hamstrung her
and so became regretful.

26:158.t: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

segments.t: And the punishment seized them.
Indeed in that is a sign,
but most of them were not to be believers.

26:159.t: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord -
He is the Exalted in Might,
the Merciful.

26:16.t: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

segments.t: Go to Pharaoh and say,
'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

26:160.t: The people of Lot denied the messengers

segments.t: The people of Lot
denied the messengers

26:161.t: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?

segments.t: When their brother Lot said to them,
"Will you not fear Allāh?

26:162.t: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

segments.t: Indeed, I am to you
a trustworthy messenger.

26:163.t: So fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: So fear Allāh
and obey me.

26:164.t: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

27:13.t: But when there came to them Our visible signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."

segments.t: But when there came to them Our visible signs,
they said,
"This is obvious magic."

27:14.t: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

segments.t: And they rejected them,
while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof,
out of injustice and haughtiness.
So see how was the end of the corrupters.

27:15.t: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allāh, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."

segments.t: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge,
and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allāh,
who has favored us over many of His believing servants."

27:16.t: And Solomon inherited David. He said, "O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty."

segments.t: And Solomon inherited David.
He said,
"O people,
we have been taught the language of birds,
and we have been given from all things.
Indeed, this is evident bounty."

27:17.t: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows

segments.t: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers
of the jinn and men and birds,
and they were [marching] in rows

27:18.t: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not."

segments.t: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants,
an ant said, "O ants,
enter your dwellings that you not be crushed
by Solomon and his soldiers
while they perceive not."

27:19.t: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."

segments.t: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech,
and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor
which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents
and to do righteousness of which You approve.
And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."

27:2.t: As guidance and good tidings for the believers

segments.t: As guidance
and good tidings
for the believers

27:20.t: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?

segments.t: And he took attendance of the birds and said,
"Why do I not see the hoopoe -
or is he among the absent?

27:21.t: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization."

segments.t: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment
or slaughter him
unless he brings me clear authorization."

27:22.t: But he [i.e., the hoopoe] stayed not long and said, "I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.

segments.t: But he [i.e., the hoopoe] stayed not long and said,
"I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed,
and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.

27:23.t: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.

segments.t: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them,
and she has been given of all things,
and she has a great throne.

27:24.t: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allāh, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,

segments.t: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allāh,
and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them
and averted them from [His] way,
so they are not guided,

27:25.t: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allāh, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -

segments.t: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allāh,
who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth
and knows what you conceal and what you declare -

27:26.t: Allāh - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne."

segments.t: Allāh -
there is no deity except Him,
Lord of the Great Throne."

27:27.t: [Solomon] said, "We will see whether you were truthful or were of the liars.

segments.t: [Solomon] said,
"We will see whether you were truthful
or were of the liars.

27:28.t: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return."

segments.t: Take this letter of mine
and deliver it to them.
Then leave them
and see what [answer] they will return."

27:29.t: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.

segments.t: She said,
"O eminent ones,
indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.

27:3.t: Who establish prayer and give zakāh, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].

segments.t: Who establish prayer
and give zakāh,
and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].

27:30.t: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it is [i.e., reads]: 'In the name of Allāh, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,

segments.t: Indeed, it is from Solomon,
and indeed, it is [i.e., reads]:
'In the name of Allāh, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,

27:31.t: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].'"

segments.t: Be not haughty with me
but come to me in submission [as Muslims].'"

27:32.t: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."

segments.t: She said,
"O eminent ones,
advise me in my affair.
I would not decide a matter
until you witness [for] me."

27:33.t: They said, "We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command."

segments.t: They said,
"We are men of strength
and of great military might,
but the command is yours,
so see what you will command."

27:34.t: She said, "Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.

segments.t: She said,
"Indeed kings -
when they enter a city,
they ruin it
and render the honored of its people humbled.
And thus do they do.

27:35.t: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."

segments.t: But indeed, I will send to them a gift
and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."

27:36.t: So when they came to Solomon, he said, "Do you provide me with wealth? But what Allāh has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.

segments.t: So when they came to Solomon,
he said, "Do you provide me with wealth?
But what Allāh has given me is better than what He has given you.
Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.

27:37.t: Return to them, for we will surely come to them with soldiers that they will be powerless to encounter, and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation, and they will be debased."

segments.t: Return to them,
for we will surely come to them with soldiers
that they will be powerless to encounter,
and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation,
and they will be debased."

27:38.t: [Solomon] said, "O assembly [of jinn], which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

segments.t: [Solomon] said,
"O assembly [of jinn],
which of you will bring me her throne
before they come to me in submission?"

27:39.t: A powerful one from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy."

segments.t: A powerful one from among the jinn said,
"I will bring it to you before you rise from your place,
and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy."

27:4.t: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.

segments.t: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter,
We have made pleasing to them their deeds,
so they wander blindly.

27:40.t: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, "This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever is ungrateful - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous."

segments.t: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture,
"I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you."
And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him,
he said,
"This is from the favor of my Lord
to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful.
And whoever is grateful -
his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself.
And whoever is ungrateful -
then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous."

27:41.t: He said, "Disguise for her her throne; we will see whether she will be guided [to truth] or will be of those who is not guided."

segments.t: He said,
"Disguise for her her throne;
we will see whether she will be guided [to truth]
or will be of those who is not guided."

27:42.t: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], "Is your throne like this?" She said, "[It is] as though it was it." [Solomon said], "And we were given knowledge before her, and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allāh].

segments.t: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], "Is your throne like this?"
She said, "[It is] as though it was it."
[Solomon said], "And we were given knowledge before her,
and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allāh].

27:43.t: And that which she was worshipping other than Allāh had averted her [from submission to Him]. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people."

segments.t: And that which she was worshipping other than Allāh had averted her [from submission to Him].
Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people."

27:44.t: She was told, "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water and uncovered her shins [to wade through]. He said, "Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass." She said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allāh, Lord of the worlds."

segments.t: She was told,
"Enter the palace."
But when she saw it,
she thought it was a body of water
and uncovered her shins [to wade through].
He said,
"Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass."
She said,
"My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself,
and I submit with Solomon to Allāh, Lord of the worlds."

27:45.t: And We had certainly sent to Thamūd their brother Ṣāliḥ, [saying], "Worship Allāh," and at once they were two parties conflicting.

segments.t: And We had certainly sent to Thamūd their brother Ṣāliḥ,
[saying], "Worship Allāh,"
and at once they were two parties conflicting.

27:46.t: He said, "O my people, why are you impatient for evil before [i.e., instead of] good? Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allāh that you may receive mercy?"

segments.t: He said,
"O my people,
why are you impatient for evil before [i.e., instead of] good?
Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allāh
that you may receive mercy?"

27:47.t: They said, "We consider you a bad omen, you and those with you." He said, "Your omen [i.e., fate] is with Allāh. Rather, you are a people being tested."

segments.t: They said,
"We consider you a bad omen,
you and those with you."
He said,
"Your omen [i.e., fate] is with Allāh.
Rather, you are a people being tested."

27:48.t: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].

segments.t: And there were in the city nine family heads
causing corruption in the land
and not amending [its affairs].

27:49.t: They said, "Take a mutual oath by Allāh that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.'"

segments.t: They said,
"Take a mutual oath by Allāh
that we will kill him by night,
he and his family.
Then we will say to his executor,
'We did not witness the destruction of his family,
and indeed, we are truthful.'"

27:5.t: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.

segments.t: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment,
and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.

27:50.t: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.

segments.t: And they planned a plan,
and We planned a plan,
while they perceived not.

27:51.t: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.

segments.t: Then look how was the outcome of their plan -
that We destroyed them and their people, all.

27:52.t: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.

segments.t: So those are their houses,
desolate because of the wrong they had done.
Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.

27:53.t: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allāh.

segments.t: And We saved those who believed
and used to fear Allāh.

27:54.t: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit immorality while you are seeing?

segments.t: And [mention] Lot,
when he said to his people,
"Do you commit immorality
while you are seeing?

27:55.t: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly."

segments.t: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women?
Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly."

27:56.t: But the answer of his people was not except that they said, "Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure."

segments.t: But the answer of his people was not except that they said,
"Expel the family of Lot from your city.
Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure."

27:57.t: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.

segments.t: So We saved him and his family,
except for his wife;
We destined her to be of those who remained behind.

27:58.t: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

segments.t: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones],
and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

27:59.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Praise be to Allāh, and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allāh better or what they associate with Him?"

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Praise be to Allāh,
and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen.
Is Allāh better or what they associate with Him?"

27:6.t: And indeed, [O Muḥammad], you receive the Qur’ān from one Wise and Knowing.

segments.t: And indeed, [O Muḥammad],
you receive the Qur’ān
from one Wise and Knowing.

27:60.t: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you rain from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof? Is there a deity with Allāh? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].

segments.t: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth
and sent down for you rain from the sky,
causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty
which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof?
Is there a deity with Allāh?
[No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].

27:61.t: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground and placed within it rivers and made for it firmly set mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allāh? [No], but most of them do not know.

segments.t: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground
and placed within it rivers
and made for it firmly set mountains
and placed between the two seas a barrier?
Is there a deity with Allāh?
[No], but most of them do not know.

27:62.t: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allāh? Little do you remember.

segments.t: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one
when he calls upon Him
and removes evil
and makes you inheritors of the earth?
Is there a deity with Allāh?
Little do you remember.

27:63.t: Is He [not best] who guides you through the darknesses of the land and sea and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy? Is there a deity with Allāh? High is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.

segments.t: Is He [not best] who guides you
through the darknesses of the land and sea
and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy?
Is there a deity with Allāh?
High is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.

27:64.t: Is He [not best] who begins creation and then repeats it and who provides for you from the heaven and earth? Is there a deity with Allāh? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Is He [not best] who begins creation
and then repeats it
and who provides for you from the heaven and earth?
Is there a deity with Allāh?
Say, "Produce your proof,
if you should be truthful."

27:65.t: Say, "None in the heavens and earth knows the unseen except Allāh, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected."

segments.t: Say, "None in the heavens and earth knows the unseen except Allāh,
and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected."

27:66.t: Rather, their knowledge is arrested concerning the Hereafter. Rather, they are in doubt about it. Rather, they are, concerning it, blind.

segments.t: Rather, their knowledge is arrested concerning the Hereafter.
Rather, they are in doubt about it.
Rather, they are, concerning it, blind.

27:67.t: And those who disbelieve say, "When we have become dust as well as our forefathers, will we indeed be brought out [of the graves]?

segments.t: And those who disbelieve say,
"When we have become dust
as well as our forefathers,
will we indeed be brought out [of the graves]?

27:68.t: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before. This is not but legends of the former peoples."

segments.t: We have been promised this,
we and our forefathers, before.
This is not but legends of the former peoples."

27:69.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Proceed [i.e., travel] through the land and observe how was the end of the criminals."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Proceed [i.e., travel] through the land
and observe how was the end of the criminals."

27:7.t: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."

segments.t: [Mention] when Moses said to his family,
"Indeed, I have perceived a fire.
I will bring you from there information
or will bring you a burning torch
that you may warm yourselves."

27:70.t: And grieve not over them or be in distress from what they conspire.

segments.t: And grieve not over them
or be in distress from what they conspire.

27:71.t: And they say, "When is [the fulfillment of] this promise, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: And they say,
"When is [the fulfillment of] this promise,
if you should be truthful?"

27:72.t: Say, "Perhaps it is close behind you [i.e., very near] - some of that for which you are impatient.

segments.t: Say,
"Perhaps it is close behind you [i.e., very near] -
some of that for which you are impatient.

27:73.t: And indeed, your Lord is the possessor of bounty for the people, but most of them are not grateful."

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord is the possessor of bounty for the people,
but most of them are not grateful."

27:74.t: And indeed, your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

segments.t: And indeed, your Lord knows
what their breasts conceal
and what they declare.

27:75.t: And there is nothing concealed within the heaven and the earth except that it is in a clear Register.

segments.t: And there is nothing concealed
within the heaven and the earth
except that it is in a clear Register.

27:76.t: Indeed, this Qur’ān relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they disagree.

segments.t: Indeed, this Qur’ān relates to the Children of Israel
most of that over which they disagree.

27:77.t: And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers.

segments.t: And indeed, it is guidance
and mercy for the believers.

27:78.t: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them by His [wise] judgement. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them
by His [wise] judgement.
And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

27:79.t: So rely upon Allāh; indeed, you are upon the clear truth.

segments.t: So rely upon Allāh;
indeed, you are upon the clear truth.

27:8.t: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: But when he came to it,
he was called,
"Blessed is whoever is at the fire
and whoever is around it.
And exalted is Allāh,
Lord of the worlds.

27:80.t: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs retreating.

segments.t: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear,
nor will you make the deaf hear the call
when they have turned their backs retreating.

27:81.t: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [i.e., submitting to Allāh].

segments.t: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error.
You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses
so they are Muslims [i.e., submitting to Allāh].

27:82.t: And when the word [i.e., decree] befalls them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain [in faith].

segments.t: And when the word [i.e., decree] befalls them,
We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth
speaking to them, [saying] that the people were,
of Our verses, not certain [in faith].

27:83.t: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather from every nation a company of those who deny Our signs, and they will be [driven] in rows

segments.t: And [warn of] the Day
when We will gather from every nation a company
of those who deny Our signs,
and they will be [driven] in rows

27:84.t: Until, when they arrive [at the place of Judgement], He will say, "Did you deny My signs while you encompassed them not in knowledge, or what [was it that] you were doing?"

segments.t: Until, when they arrive [at the place of Judgement],
He will say, "Did you deny My signs
while you encompassed them not in knowledge,
or what [was it that] you were doing?"

27:85.t: And the decree will befall them for the wrong they did, and they will not [be able to] speak.

segments.t: And the decree will befall them
for the wrong they did,
and they will not [be able to] speak.

27:86.t: Do they not see that We made the night that they may rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

segments.t: Do they not see that We made the night
that they may rest therein
and the day giving sight?
Indeed in that are signs
for a people who believe.

27:87.t: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will be terrified except whom Allāh wills. And all will come to Him humbled.

segments.t: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown,
and whoever is in the heavens
and whoever is on the earth will be terrified
except whom Allāh wills.
And all will come to Him humbled.
