27:88.t: And you see the mountains, thinking them motionless, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. [It is] the work of Allāh, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Aware of that which you do.

segments.t: And you see the mountains,
thinking them motionless,
while they will pass as the passing of clouds.
[It is] the work of Allāh,
who perfected all things.
Indeed, He is Aware of that which you do.

27:89.t: Whoever comes [at Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.

segments.t: Whoever comes [at Judgement] with a good deed
will have better than it,
and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.

27:9.t: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

segments.t: O Moses,
indeed it is I - Allāh,
the Exalted in Might,
the Wise."

27:90.t: And whoever comes with an evil deed - their faces will be overturned into the Fire, [and it will be said], "Are you recompensed except for what you used to do?"

segments.t: And whoever comes with an evil deed -
their faces will be overturned into the Fire,
[and it will be said], "Are you recompensed except for what you used to do?"

27:91.t: [Say, O Muḥammad], "I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city, who made it sacred and to whom [belongs] all things. And I am commanded to be of the Muslims [i.e., those who submit to Allāh]

segments.t: [Say, O Muḥammad], "I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city,
who made it sacred and to whom [belongs] all things.
And I am commanded to be of the Muslims [i.e., those who submit to Allāh]

27:92.t: And to recite the Qur’ān." And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself; and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."

segments.t: And to recite the Qur’ān."
And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself;
and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."

27:93.t: And say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allāh. He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."

segments.t: And say,
"[All] praise is [due] to Allāh.
He will show you His signs,
and you will recognize them.
And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."
Ṭā, Seen, Meem.

28:10.t: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

segments.t: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else].
She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him
had We not bound fast her heart
that she would be of the believers.

28:11.t: And she said to his sister, "Follow him"; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.

segments.t: And she said to his sister,
"Follow him";
so she watched him from a distance
while they perceived not.

28:12.t: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, "Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"

segments.t: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before,
so she said,
"Shall I direct you to a household
that will be responsible for him for you
while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"

28:13.t: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allāh is true. But most of them [i.e., the people] do not know.

segments.t: So We restored him to his mother
that she might be content and not grieve
and that she would know that the promise of Allāh is true.
But most of them [i.e., the people] do not know.

28:14.t: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.

segments.t: And when he attained his full strength
and was [mentally] mature,
We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge.
And thus do We reward the doers of good.

28:15.t: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."

segments.t: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people
and found therein two men fighting:
one from his faction and one from among his enemy.
And the one from his faction called for help to him
against the one from his enemy,
so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him.
[Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan.
Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."

28:16.t: He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed I have wronged myself,
so forgive me,"
and He forgave him.
Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

28:17.t: He said, "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be an assistant to the criminals."

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
for the favor You bestowed upon me,
I will never be an assistant to the criminals."

28:18.t: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure], when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."

segments.t: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure],
when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again].
Moses said to him,
"Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."

28:19.t: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders."

segments.t: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them,
he said, "O Moses,
do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday?
You only want to be a tyrant in the land
and do not want to be of the amenders."

28:2.t: These are verses of the clear Book.

segments.t: These are verses
of the clear Book.

28:20.t: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."

segments.t: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running.
He said, "O Moses,
indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you,
so leave [the city];
indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."

28:21.t: So he left it, fearful and anticipating [apprehension]. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: So he left it,
fearful and anticipating [apprehension].
He said,
"My Lord,
save me from the wrongdoing people."

28:22.t: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."

segments.t: And when he directed himself toward Madyan,
he said,
"Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."

28:23.t: And when he came to the water [i.e., well] of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks], and he found aside from them two women holding back [their flocks]. He said, "What is your circumstance?" They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks]; and our father is an old man."

segments.t: And when he came to the water [i.e., well] of Madyan,
he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks],
and he found aside from them two women holding back [their flocks].
He said, "What is your circumstance?"
They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks];
and our father is an old man."

28:24.t: So he watered [their flocks] for them; then he went back to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."

segments.t: So he watered [their flocks] for them;
then he went back to the shade and said,
"My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."

28:25.t: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: Then one of the two women came to him
walking with shyness.
She said, "Indeed, my father invites you
that he may reward you for having watered for us."
So when he came to him
and related to him the story,
he said, "Fear not.
You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."

28:26.t: One of the women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy."

segments.t: One of the women said,
"O my father, hire him.
Indeed, the best one you can hire
is the strong and the trustworthy."

28:27.t: He said, "Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters, on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years; but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you. And I do not wish to put you in difficulty. You will find me, if Allāh wills, from among the righteous."

segments.t: He said,
"Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters,
on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years;
but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you.
And I do not wish to put you in difficulty.
You will find me, if Allāh wills, from among the righteous."

28:28.t: [Moses] said, "That is [established] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete - there is no injustice to me, and Allāh, over what we say, is Witness."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"That is [established] between me and you.
Whichever of the two terms I complete -
there is no injustice to me,
and Allāh, over what we say, is Witness."

28:29.t: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves."

segments.t: And when Moses had completed the term
and was traveling with his family,
he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire.
He said to his family, "Stay here;
indeed, I have perceived a fire.
Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information
or burning wood from the fire
that you may warm yourselves."

28:3.t: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.

segments.t: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth
for a people who believe.

28:30.t: But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot - from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allāh, Lord of the worlds."

segments.t: But when he came to it,
he was called from the right side of the valley
in a blessed spot - from the tree,
"O Moses,
indeed I am Allāh, Lord of the worlds."

28:31.t: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allāh said], "O Moses, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure.

segments.t: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff."
But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake,
he turned in flight and did not return.
[Allāh said], "O Moses, approach and fear not.
Indeed, you are of the secure.

28:32.t: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white, without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

segments.t: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment;
it will come out white, without disease.
And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear,
for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment.
Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

28:33.t: He said, "My Lord, indeed I killed from among them someone, and I fear they will kill me.

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
indeed I killed from among them someone,
and I fear they will kill me.

28:34.t: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue, so send him with me as support, verifying me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me."

segments.t: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue,
so send him with me as support, verifying me.
Indeed, I fear that they will deny me."

28:35.t: [Allāh] said, "We will strengthen your arm through your brother and grant you both supremacy so they will not reach you. [It will be] through Our signs; you and those who follow you will be the predominant."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"We will strengthen your arm through your brother
and grant you both supremacy
so they will not reach you.
[It will be] through Our signs;
you and those who follow you will be the predominant."

28:36.t: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, "This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."

segments.t: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences,
they said, "This is not except invented magic,
and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."

28:37.t: And Moses said, "My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home. Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."

segments.t: And Moses said,
"My Lord is more knowing [than we or you]
of who has come with guidance from Him
and to whom will be succession in the home.
Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."

28:38.t: And Pharaoh said, "O eminent ones, I have not known you to have a god other than me. Then ignite for me, O Hāmān, [a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses. And indeed, I do think he is among the liars."

segments.t: And Pharaoh said,
"O eminent ones,
I have not known you to have a god other than me.
Then ignite for me, O Hāmān,
[a fire] upon the clay
and make for me a tower
that I may look at the God of Moses.
And indeed, I do think he is among the liars."

28:39.t: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

segments.t: And he was arrogant,
he and his soldiers, in the land, without right,
and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

28:4.t: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

segments.t: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land
and made its people into factions,
oppressing a sector among them,
slaughtering their [newborn] sons
and keeping their females alive.
Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

28:40.t: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

segments.t: So We took him and his soldiers
and threw them into the sea.
So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

28:41.t: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

segments.t: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire,
and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

28:42.t: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

segments.t: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse,
and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

28:43.t: And We gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.

segments.t: And We gave Moses the Scripture,
after We had destroyed the former generations,
as enlightenment for the people
and guidance and mercy
that they might be reminded.

28:44.t: And you, [O Muḥammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

segments.t: And you, [O Muḥammad],
were not on the western side [of the mount]
when We revealed to Moses the command,
and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

28:45.t: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].

segments.t: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses],
and prolonged was their duration.
And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan,
reciting to them Our verses,
but We were senders [of this message].

28:46.t: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.

segments.t: And you were not at the side of the mount
when We called [Moses]
but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord
to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you
that they might be reminded.

28:47.t: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"...

segments.t: And if not that a disaster should strike them
for what their hands put forth [of sins]
and they would say,
"Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger
so we could have followed Your verses
and been among the believers?"...

28:48.t: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."

segments.t: But when the truth came to them from Us,
they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?"
Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before?
They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other,
and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."

28:49.t: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allāh which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allāh
which is more guiding than either of them
that I may follow it,
if you should be truthful."

28:5.t: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors

segments.t: And We wanted to confer favor
upon those who were oppressed in the land
and make them leaders
and make them inheritors

28:50.t: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allāh? Indeed, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

segments.t: But if they do not respond to you -
then know that they only follow their [own] desires.
And who is more astray than one who follows his desire
without guidance from Allāh?
Indeed, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

28:51.t: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the word [i.e., the Qur’ān] that they might be reminded.

segments.t: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the word [i.e., the Qur’ān]
that they might be reminded.

28:52.t: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.

segments.t: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it -
they are believers in it.

28:53.t: And when it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed we were, [even] before it, Muslims [i.e., submitting to Allāh]."

segments.t: And when it is recited to them,
they say, "We have believed in it;
indeed, it is the truth from our Lord.
Indeed we were, [even] before it,
Muslims [i.e., submitting to Allāh]."

28:54.t: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.

segments.t: Those will be given their reward twice
for what they patiently endured
and [because] they avert evil through good,
and from what We have provided them they spend.

28:55.t: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we seek not the ignorant."

segments.t: And when they hear ill speech,
they turn away from it and say,
"For us are our deeds,
and for you are your deeds.
Peace will be upon you;
we seek not the ignorant."

28:56.t: Indeed, [O Muḥammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allāh guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

segments.t: Indeed, [O Muḥammad],
you do not guide whom you like,
but Allāh guides whom He wills.
And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

28:57.t: And they [i.e., the Quraysh] say, "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we would be swept from our land." Have We not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.

segments.t: And they [i.e., the Quraysh] say,
"If we were to follow the guidance with you,
we would be swept from our land."
Have We not established for them a safe sanctuary
to which are brought the fruits of all things
as provision from Us?
But most of them do not know.

28:58.t: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.

segments.t: And how many a city have We destroyed
that was insolent in its [way of] living,
and those are their dwellings
which have not been inhabited after them except briefly.
And it is We who were the inheritors.

28:59.t: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother [i.e., principal city] a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

segments.t: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities
until He had sent to their mother [i.e., principal city] a messenger
reciting to them Our verses.
And We would not destroy the cities
except while their people were wrongdoers.

28:6.t: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Hāmān and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

segments.t: And establish them in the land
and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Hāmān
and their soldiers through them
that which they had feared.

28:60.t: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allāh is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?

segments.t: And whatever thing you [people] have been given -
it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment.
And what is with Allāh is better and more lasting;
so will you not use reason?

28:61.t: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will meet [i.e., obtain] like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is, on the Day of Resurrection, among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

segments.t: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise
which he will meet [i.e., obtain]
like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but]
then he is, on the Day of Resurrection,
among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

28:62.t: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"

segments.t: And [warn of] the Day He will call them
and say, "Where are My 'partners'
which you used to claim?"

28:63.t: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we led to error. We led them to error just as we were in error. We declare our disassociation [from them] to You. They did not used to worship [i.e., obey] us."

segments.t: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say,
"Our Lord, these are the ones we led to error.
We led them to error just as we were in error.
We declare our disassociation [from them] to You.
They did not used to worship [i.e., obey] us."

28:64.t: And it will be said, "Invoke your 'partners,'" and they will invoke them; but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!

segments.t: And it will be said,
"Invoke your 'partners,'"
and they will invoke them;
but they will not respond to them,
and they will see the punishment.
If only they had followed guidance!

28:65.t: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say, "What did you answer the messengers?"

segments.t: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say,
"What did you answer the messengers?"

28:66.t: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

segments.t: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day,
so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

28:67.t: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is expected [i.e., promised by Allāh] that he will be among the successful.

segments.t: But as for one who had repented,
believed, and done righteousness,
it is expected [i.e., promised by Allāh]
that he will be among the successful.

28:68.t: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allāh and high above what they associate with Him.

segments.t: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses;
not for them was the choice.
Exalted is Allāh and high above what they associate with Him.

28:69.t: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

segments.t: And your Lord knows
what their breasts conceal
and what they declare.

28:7.t: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, "Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers."

segments.t: And We inspired to the mother of Moses,
"Suckle him;
but when you fear for him,
cast him into the river
and do not fear and do not grieve.
Indeed, We will return him to you
and will make him [one] of the messengers."

28:70.t: And He is Allāh; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the [final] decision, and to Him you will be returned.

segments.t: And He is Allāh;
there is no deity except Him.
To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter.
And His is the [final] decision,
and to Him you will be returned.

28:71.t: Say, "Have you considered: if Allāh should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allāh could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if Allāh should make for you the night continuous
until the Day of Resurrection,
what deity other than Allāh could bring you light?
Then will you not hear?"

28:72.t: Say, "Have you considered: if Allāh should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allāh could bring you a night in which you may rest? Then will you not see?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if Allāh should make for you the day continuous
until the Day of Resurrection,
what deity other than Allāh could bring you a night
in which you may rest?
Then will you not see?"

28:73.t: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

segments.t: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day
that you may rest therein
and [by day] seek from His bounty
and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

28:74.t: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"

segments.t: And [warn of] the Day He will call them
and say, "Where are My 'partners'
which you used to claim?"

28:75.t: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof," and they will know that the truth belongs to Allāh, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

segments.t: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say,
"Produce your proof,"
and they will know that the truth belongs to Allāh,
and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

28:76.t: Indeed, Qārūn was from the people of Moses, but he tyrannized them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men; thereupon his people said to him, "Do not exult. Indeed, Allāh does not like the exultant.

segments.t: Indeed, Qārūn was from the people of Moses,
but he tyrannized them.
And We gave him of treasures
whose keys would burden a band of strong men;
thereupon his people said to him,
"Do not exult.
Indeed, Allāh does not like the exultant.

28:77.t: But seek, through that which Allāh has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allāh has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allāh does not like corrupters."

segments.t: But seek, through that which Allāh has given you,
the home of the Hereafter; and [yet],
do not forget your share of the world.
And do good as Allāh has done good to you.
And desire not corruption in the land.
Indeed, Allāh does not like corrupters."

28:78.t: He said, "I was only given it because of knowledge I have." Did he not know that Allāh had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]? But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.

segments.t: He said,
"I was only given it because of knowledge I have."
Did he not know that Allāh had destroyed before him of generations
those who were greater than him in power
and greater in accumulation [of wealth]?
But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.

28:79.t: So he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, "Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qārūn. Indeed, he is one of great fortune."

segments.t: So he came out before his people in his adornment.
Those who desired the worldly life said,
"Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qārūn.
Indeed, he is one of great fortune."

28:8.t: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Hāmān and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

segments.t: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river]
so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief.
Indeed, Pharaoh and Hāmān and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

28:80.t: But those who had been given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allāh is better for he who believes and does righteousness. And none are granted it except the patient."

segments.t: But those who had been given knowledge said,
"Woe to you!
The reward of Allāh is better for he who believes and does righteousness.
And none are granted it except the patient."

28:81.t: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allāh, nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

segments.t: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home.
And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allāh,
nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

28:82.t: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say, "Oh, how Allāh extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it! If not that Allāh had conferred favor on us, He would have caused it to swallow us. Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!"

segments.t: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say,
"Oh, how Allāh extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it!
If not that Allāh had conferred favor on us,
He would have caused it to swallow us.
Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!"

28:83.t: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

segments.t: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those
who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption.
And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

28:84.t: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.

segments.t: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed
will have better than it;
and whoever comes with an evil deed -
then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed
except [as much as] what they used to do.

28:85.t: Indeed, [O Muḥammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur’ān will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."

segments.t: Indeed, [O Muḥammad],
He who imposed upon you the Qur’ān
will take you back to a place of return.
Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance
and who is in clear error."

28:86.t: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

segments.t: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you,
but [it is] a mercy from your Lord.
So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

28:87.t: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allāh after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allāh.

segments.t: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allāh
after they have been revealed to you.
And invite [people] to your Lord.
And never be of those who associate others with Allāh.

28:88.t: And do not invoke with Allāh another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.

segments.t: And do not invoke with Allāh another deity.
There is no deity except Him.
Everything will be destroyed except His Face.
His is the judgement,
and to Him you will be returned.

28:9.t: And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] a comfort of the eye [i.e., pleasure] for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not.

segments.t: And the wife of Pharaoh said,
"[He will be] a comfort of the eye [i.e., pleasure]
for me and for you.
Do not kill him;
perhaps he may benefit us,
or we may adopt him as a son."
And they perceived not.
Alif, Lām, Meem.

29:10.t: And of the people are some who say, "We believe in Allāh," but when one [of them] is harmed for [the cause of] Allāh, he considers the trial [i.e., harm] of the people as [if it were] the punishment of Allāh. But if victory comes from your Lord, they say, "Indeed, We were with you." Is not Allāh most knowing of what is within the breasts of the worlds [i.e., all creatures]?

segments.t: And of the people are some who say,
"We believe in Allāh,"
but when one [of them] is harmed for [the cause of] Allāh,
he considers the trial [i.e., harm] of the people
as [if it were] the punishment of Allāh.
But if victory comes from your Lord,
they say, "Indeed, We were with you."
Is not Allāh most knowing of what is within the breasts of the worlds [i.e., all creatures]?

29:11.t: And Allāh will surely make evident those who believe, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.

segments.t: And Allāh will surely make evident those who believe,
and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.

29:12.t: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Follow our way, and we will carry your sins." But they will not carry anything of their sins. Indeed, they are liars.

segments.t: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe,
"Follow our way,
and we will carry your sins."
But they will not carry anything of their sins.
Indeed, they are liars.

29:13.t: But they will surely carry their [own] burdens and [other] burdens along with their burdens, and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.

segments.t: But they will surely carry their [own] burdens
and [other] burdens along with their burdens,
and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection
about what they used to invent.

29:14.t: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.

segments.t: And We certainly sent Noah to his people,
and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years,
and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.

29:15.t: But We saved him and the companions of the ship, and We made it a sign for the worlds.

segments.t: But We saved him
and the companions of the ship,
and We made it a sign for the worlds.

29:16.t: And [We sent] Abraham, when he said to his people, "Worship Allāh and fear Him. That is best for you, if you should know.

segments.t: And [We sent] Abraham,
when he said to his people,
"Worship Allāh and fear Him.
That is best for you,
if you should know.

29:17.t: You only worship, besides Allāh, idols, and you produce a falsehood. Indeed, those you worship besides Allāh do not possess for you [the power of] provision. So seek from Allāh provision and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned."

segments.t: You only worship, besides Allāh, idols,
and you produce a falsehood.
Indeed, those you worship besides Allāh
do not possess for you [the power of] provision.
So seek from Allāh provision and worship Him
and be grateful to Him.
To Him you will be returned."

29:18.t: And if you [people] deny [the message] - already nations before you have denied. And there is not upon the Messenger except [the duty of] clear notification.

segments.t: And if you [people] deny [the message] -
already nations before you have denied.
And there is not upon the Messenger
except [the duty of] clear notification.

29:19.t: Have they not considered how Allāh begins creation and then repeats it? Indeed that, for Allāh, is easy.

segments.t: Have they not considered
how Allāh begins creation
and then repeats it?
Indeed that, for Allāh, is easy.

29:2.t: Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?

segments.t: Do the people think that they will be left to say,
"We believe"
and they will not be tried?

29:20.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Travel through the land and observe how He began creation. Then Allāh will produce the final creation [i.e., development]. Indeed Allāh, over all things, is competent."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Travel through the land
and observe how He began creation.
Then Allāh will produce the final creation [i.e., development].
Indeed Allāh, over all things, is competent."

29:21.t: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.

segments.t: He punishes whom He wills
and has mercy upon whom He wills,
and to Him you will be returned.

29:22.t: And you will not cause failure [to Allāh] upon the earth or in the heaven. And you have not other than Allāh any protector or any helper.

segments.t: And you will not cause failure [to Allāh]
upon the earth or in the heaven.
And you have not other than Allāh
any protector or any helper.

29:23.t: And the ones who disbelieve in the signs of Allāh and the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.

segments.t: And the ones who disbelieve in the signs of Allāh
and the meeting with Him -
those have despaired of My mercy,
and they will have a painful punishment.

29:24.t: And the answer of his [i.e., Abraham's] people was not but that they said, "Kill him or burn him," but Allāh saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

segments.t: And the answer of his [i.e., Abraham's] people was not but that they said,
"Kill him or burn him,"
but Allāh saved him from the fire.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

29:25.t: And [Abraham] said, "You have only taken, other than Allāh, idols as [a bond of] affection among you in worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will not have any helpers."

segments.t: And [Abraham] said,
"You have only taken, other than Allāh,
idols as [a bond of] affection among you in worldly life.
Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another,
and your refuge will be the Fire,
and you will not have any helpers."

29:26.t: And Lot believed him. [Abraham] said, "Indeed, I will emigrate to [the service of] my Lord. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

segments.t: And Lot believed him.
[Abraham] said,
"Indeed, I will emigrate to [the service of] my Lord.
Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

29:27.t: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.

segments.t: And We gave to him Isaac and Jacob
and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture.
And We gave him his reward in this world,
and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.

29:28.t: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Indeed, you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds.

segments.t: And [mention] Lot,
when he said to his people,
"Indeed, you commit such immorality
as no one has preceded you with
from among the worlds.

29:29.t: Indeed, you approach men and obstruct the road and commit in your meetings [every] evil." And the answer of his people was not but that they said, "Bring us the punishment of Allāh, if you should be of the truthful."

segments.t: Indeed, you approach men
and obstruct the road
and commit in your meetings [every] evil."
And the answer of his people was not but that they said,
"Bring us the punishment of Allāh,
if you should be of the truthful."

29:3.t: But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allāh will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.

segments.t: But We have certainly tried those before them,
and Allāh will surely make evident those who are truthful,
and He will surely make evident the liars.

29:30.t: He said, "My Lord, support me against the corrupting people."

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
support me against the corrupting people."

29:31.t: And when Our messengers [i.e., angels] came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that [i.e., Lot's] city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."

segments.t: And when Our messengers [i.e., angels] came to Abraham
with the good tidings, they said,
"Indeed, we will destroy the people of that [i.e., Lot's] city.
Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."

29:32.t: [Abraham] said, "Indeed, within it is Lot." They said, "We are more knowing of who is within it. We will surely save him and his family, except his wife. She is to be of those who remain behind."

segments.t: [Abraham] said,
"Indeed, within it is Lot."
They said,
"We are more knowing of who is within it.
We will surely save him and his family,
except his wife.
She is to be of those who remain behind."

29:33.t: And when Our messengers [i.e., angels] came to Lot, he was distressed for them and felt for them great discomfort. They said, "Fear not, nor grieve. Indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife; she is to be of those who remain behind.

segments.t: And when Our messengers [i.e., angels] came to Lot,
he was distressed for them
and felt for them great discomfort.
They said, "Fear not, nor grieve.
Indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife;
she is to be of those who remain behind.

29:34.t: Indeed, we will bring down on the people of this city punishment from the sky because they have been defiantly disobedient."

segments.t: Indeed, we will bring down on the people of this city
punishment from the sky
because they have been defiantly disobedient."

29:35.t: And We have certainly left of it a sign as clear evidence for a people who use reason.

segments.t: And We have certainly left of it a sign
as clear evidence for a people who use reason.

29:36.t: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shuʿayb, and he said, "O my people, worship Allāh and expect the Last Day and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

segments.t: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shuʿayb,
and he said, "O my people, worship Allāh
and expect the Last Day
and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

29:37.t: But they denied him, so the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

segments.t: But they denied him,
so the earthquake seized them,
and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

29:38.t: And [We destroyed] ʿAad and Thamūd, and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings. And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds and averted them from the path, and they were endowed with perception.

segments.t: And [We destroyed] ʿAad and Thamūd,
and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings.
And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds
and averted them from the path,
and they were endowed with perception.

29:39.t: And [We destroyed] Qārūn and Pharaoh and Hāmān. And Moses had already come to them with clear evidences, and they were arrogant in the land, but they were not outrunners [of Our punishment].

segments.t: And [We destroyed] Qārūn
and Pharaoh and Hāmān.
And Moses had already come to them with clear evidences,
and they were arrogant in the land,
but they were not outrunners [of Our punishment].

29:4.t: Or do those who do evil deeds think they can outrun [i.e., escape] Us? Evil is what they judge.

segments.t: Or do those who do evil deeds
think they can outrun [i.e., escape] Us?
Evil is what they judge.

29:40.t: So each We seized for his sin; and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them were those who were seized by the blast [from the sky], and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allāh would not have wronged them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.

segments.t: So each We seized for his sin;
and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones,
and among them were those who were seized by the blast [from the sky],
and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow,
and among them were those whom We drowned.
And Allāh would not have wronged them,
but it was they who were wronging themselves.

29:41.t: The example of those who take allies other than Allāh is like that of the spider who takes [i.e., constructs] a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.

segments.t: The example of those who take allies other than Allāh
is like that of the spider who takes [i.e., constructs] a home.
And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider,
if they only knew.

29:42.t: Indeed, Allāh knows whatever thing they call upon other than Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh knows whatever thing they call upon other than Him.
And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

29:43.t: And these examples We present to the people, but none will understand them except those of knowledge.

segments.t: And these examples We present to the people,
but none will understand them except those of knowledge.

29:44.t: Allāh created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

segments.t: Allāh created the heavens and the earth in truth.
Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

29:45.t: Recite, [O Muḥammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allāh is greater. And Allāh knows that which you do.

segments.t: Recite, [O Muḥammad],
what has been revealed to you of the Book
and establish prayer.
Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing,
and the remembrance of Allāh is greater.
And Allāh knows that which you do.

29:46.t: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, "We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one; and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

segments.t: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture
except in a way that is best,
except for those who commit injustice among them,
and say, "We believe in that which has been revealed to us
and revealed to you.
And our God and your God is one;
and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

29:47.t: And thus We have sent down to you the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]. And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture believe in it. And among these [people of Makkah] are those who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.

segments.t: And thus We have sent down to you the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān].
And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture believe in it.
And among these [people of Makkah] are those who believe in it.
And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.

29:48.t: And you did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Then [i.e., otherwise] the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.

segments.t: And you did not recite before it any scripture,
nor did you inscribe one with your right hand.
Then [i.e., otherwise] the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.

29:49.t: Rather, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is distinct verses [preserved] within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.

segments.t: Rather, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is distinct verses [preserved]
within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge.
And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.

29:5.t: Whoever should hope for the meeting with Allāh - indeed, the term [decreed by] Allāh is coming. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: Whoever should hope for the meeting with Allāh -
indeed, the term [decreed by] Allāh is coming.
And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

29:50.t: But they say, "Why are not signs sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "The signs are only with Allāh, and I am only a clear warner."

segments.t: But they say,
"Why are not signs sent down to him from his Lord?"
Say, "The signs are only with Allāh,
and I am only a clear warner."

29:51.t: And is it not sufficient for them that We revealed to you the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and reminder for a people who believe.

segments.t: And is it not sufficient for them
that We revealed to you the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
which is recited to them?
Indeed in that is a mercy and reminder
for a people who believe.

29:52.t: Say, "Sufficient is Allāh between me and you as Witness. He knows what is in the heavens and earth. And they who have believed in falsehood and disbelieved in Allāh - it is those who are the losers."

segments.t: Say, "Sufficient is Allāh between me and you as Witness.
He knows what is in the heavens and earth.
And they who have believed in falsehood and disbelieved in Allāh -
it is those who are the losers."

29:53.t: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And if not for [the decree of] a specified term, punishment would have reached them. But it will surely come to them suddenly while they perceive not.

segments.t: And they urge you to hasten the punishment.
And if not for [the decree of] a specified term,
punishment would have reached them.
But it will surely come to them suddenly
while they perceive not.

29:54.t: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers

segments.t: They urge you to hasten the punishment.
And indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers

29:55.t: On the Day the punishment will cover them from above them and from below their feet and it is said, "Taste [the result of] what you used to do."

segments.t: On the Day the punishment will cover them
from above them and from below their feet
and it is said,
"Taste [the result of] what you used to do."

29:56.t: O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.

segments.t: O My servants who have believed,
indeed My earth is spacious,
so worship only Me.

29:57.t: Every soul will taste death. Then to Us will you be returned.

segments.t: Every soul will taste death.
Then to Us will you be returned.

29:58.t: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will surely assign to them of Paradise [elevated] chambers beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers

segments.t: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds -
We will surely assign to them of Paradise [elevated] chambers
beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they abide eternally.
Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers

29:59.t: Who have been patient and upon their Lord rely.

segments.t: Who have been patient
and upon their Lord rely.

29:6.t: And whoever strives only strives for [the benefit of] himself. Indeed, Allāh is Free from need of the worlds.

segments.t: And whoever strives
only strives for [the benefit of] himself.
Indeed, Allāh is Free from need of the worlds.

29:60.t: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision. Allāh provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision.
Allāh provides for it and for you.
And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

29:61.t: If you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth and subjected the sun and the moon?" they would surely say, "Allāh." Then how are they deluded?

segments.t: If you asked them,
"Who created the heavens and earth
and subjected the sun and the moon?"
they would surely say,
"Allāh."
Then how are they deluded?

29:62.t: Allāh extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed Allāh is, of all things, Knowing.

segments.t: Allāh extends provision for whom He wills of His servants
and restricts for him.
Indeed Allāh is, of all things, Knowing.

29:63.t: And if you asked them, "Who sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?" they would surely say, "Allāh." Say, "Praise to Allāh"; but most of them do not reason.

segments.t: And if you asked them,
"Who sends down rain from the sky
and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?"
they would surely say, "Allāh."
Say, "Praise to Allāh";
but most of them do not reason.

29:64.t: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement. And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life, if only they knew.

segments.t: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement.
And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life,
if only they knew.

29:65.t: And when they board a ship, they supplicate Allāh, sincere to Him in religion [i.e., faith and hope]. But when He delivers them to the land, at once they associate others with Him

segments.t: And when they board a ship,
they supplicate Allāh,
sincere to Him in religion [i.e., faith and hope].
But when He delivers them to the land,
at once they associate others with Him

29:66.t: So that they will deny what We have granted them, and they will enjoy themselves. But they are going to know.

segments.t: So that they will deny what We have granted them,
and they will enjoy themselves.
But they are going to know.

29:67.t: Have they not seen that We made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary, while people are being taken away all around them? Then in falsehood do they believe, and in the favor of Allāh they disbelieve?

segments.t: Have they not seen that We made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary,
while people are being taken away all around them?
Then in falsehood do they believe,
and in the favor of Allāh they disbelieve?

29:68.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allāh or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allāh
or denies the truth when it has come to him?
Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?

29:69.t: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allāh is with the doers of good.

segments.t: And those who strive for Us -
We will surely guide them to Our ways.
And indeed, Allāh is with the doers of good.

29:7.t: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

segments.t: And those who believe and do righteous deeds -
We will surely remove from them their misdeeds
and will surely reward them
according to the best of what they used to do.

29:8.t: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to parents. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

segments.t: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to parents.
But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me
that of which you have no knowledge,
do not obey them.
To Me is your return,
and I will inform you about what you used to do.

29:9.t: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous [into Paradise].

segments.t: And those who believe and do righteous deeds -
We will surely admit them among the righteous [into Paradise].
Alif, Lām, Meem.

2:10.t: In their hearts is disease, so Allāh has increased their disease; and for them is a painful punishment because they [habitually] used to lie.

segments.t: In their hearts is disease,
so Allāh has increased their disease;
and for them is a painful punishment
because they [habitually] used to lie.

2:100.t: Is it not [true] that every time they took a covenant a party of them threw it away? But, [in fact], most of them do not believe.

segments.t: Is it not [true] that every time they took a covenant
a party of them threw it away?
But, [in fact], most of them do not believe.

2:101.t: And when a messenger from Allāh came to them confirming that which was with them, a party of those who had been given the Scripture threw the Scripture of Allāh [i.e., the Torah] behind their backs as if they did not know [what it contained].

segments.t: And when a messenger from Allāh came to them
confirming that which was with them,
a party of those who had been given the Scripture
threw the Scripture of Allāh [i.e., the Torah] behind their backs
as if they did not know [what it contained].

2:102.t: And they followed [instead] what the devils had recited during the reign of Solomon. It was not Solomon who disbelieved, but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Hārūt and Mārūt. But they [i.e., the two angels] do not teach anyone unless they say, "We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic]." And [yet] they learn from them that by which they cause separation between a man and his wife. But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allāh. And they [i.e., people] learn what harms them and does not benefit them. But they [i.e., the Children of Israel] certainly knew that whoever purchased it [i.e., magic] would not have in the Hereafter any share. And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew.

segments.t: And they followed [instead] what the devils had recited during the reign of Solomon.
It was not Solomon who disbelieved,
but the devils disbelieved, teaching people magic
and that which was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Hārūt and Mārūt.
But they [i.e., the two angels] do not teach anyone unless they say,
"We are a trial, so do not disbelieve [by practicing magic]."
And [yet] they learn from them that by which they cause separation between a man and his wife.
But they do not harm anyone through it except by permission of Allāh.
And they [i.e., people] learn what harms them and does not benefit them.
But they [i.e., the Children of Israel] certainly knew that whoever purchased it [i.e., magic]
would not have in the Hereafter any share.
And wretched is that for which they sold themselves, if they only knew.

2:103.t: And if they had believed and feared Allāh, then the reward from Allāh would have been [far] better, if they only knew.

segments.t: And if they had believed and feared Allāh,
then the reward from Allāh would have been [far] better,
if they only knew.

2:104.t: O you who have believed, say not [to Allāh's Messenger], "Rāʿinā" but say, "Unẓurnā" and listen. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
say not [to Allāh's Messenger], "Rāʿinā"
but say, "Unẓurnā" and listen.
And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

2:105.t: Neither those who disbelieve from the People of the Scripture [i.e., the Jews and Christians] nor the polytheists wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allāh selects for His mercy whom He wills, and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

segments.t: Neither those who disbelieve from the People of the Scripture [i.e., the Jews and Christians]
nor the polytheists wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord.
But Allāh selects for His mercy whom He wills,
and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

2:106.t: We do not abrogate a verse or cause it to be forgotten except that We bring forth [one] better than it or similar to it. Do you not know that Allāh is over all things competent?

segments.t: We do not abrogate a verse
or cause it to be forgotten
except that We bring forth [one] better than it or similar to it.
Do you not know that Allāh is over all things competent?

2:107.t: Do you not know that to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and [that] you have not besides Allāh any protector or any helper?

segments.t: Do you not know that to Allāh belongs
the dominion of the heavens and the earth
and [that] you have not besides Allāh
any protector or any helper?

2:108.t: Or do you intend to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

segments.t: Or do you intend to ask your Messenger
as Moses was asked before?
And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief
has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

2:109.t: Many of the People of the Scripture wish they could turn you back to disbelief after you have believed, out of envy from themselves [even] after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and overlook until Allāh delivers His command. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

segments.t: Many of the People of the Scripture wish they could turn you back to disbelief
after you have believed,
out of envy from themselves [even] after the truth has become clear to them.
So pardon and overlook until Allāh delivers His command.
Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

2:11.t: And when it is said to them, "Do not cause corruption on the earth," they say, "We are but reformers."

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Do not cause corruption on the earth,"
they say,
"We are but reformers."

2:110.t: And establish prayer and give zakāh, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allāh. Indeed Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.

segments.t: And establish prayer
and give zakāh,
and whatever good you put forward for yourselves
- you will find it with Allāh.
Indeed Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.

2:111.t: And they say, "None will enter Paradise except one who is a Jew or a Christian." That is [merely] their wishful thinking. Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: And they say,
"None will enter Paradise
except one who is a Jew or a Christian."
That is [merely] their wishful thinking.
Say, "Produce your proof,
if you should be truthful."

2:112.t: Yes, [on the contrary], whoever submits his face [i.e., self] in Islām to Allāh while being a doer of good will have his reward with his Lord. And no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.

segments.t: Yes, [on the contrary],
whoever submits his face [i.e., self] in Islām to Allāh
while being a doer of good
will have his reward with his Lord.
And no fear will there be concerning them,
nor will they grieve.

2:113.t: The Jews say, "The Christians have nothing [true] to stand on," and the Christians say, "The Jews have nothing to stand on," although they [both] recite the Scripture. Thus do those who know not [i.e., the polytheists] speak the same as their words. But Allāh will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

segments.t: The Jews say,
"The Christians have nothing [true] to stand on,"
and the Christians say,
"The Jews have nothing to stand on,"
although they [both] recite the Scripture.
Thus do those who know not [i.e., the polytheists]
speak the same as their words.
But Allāh will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection
concerning that over which they used to differ.

2:114.t: And who are more unjust than those who prevent the name of Allāh from being mentioned [i.e., praised] in His mosques and strive toward their destruction. It is not for them to enter them except in fear. For them in this world is disgrace, and they will have in the Hereafter a great punishment.

segments.t: And who are more unjust than those who prevent the name of Allāh
from being mentioned [i.e., praised] in His mosques
and strive toward their destruction.
It is not for them to enter them except in fear.
For them in this world is disgrace,
and they will have in the Hereafter a great punishment.

2:115.t: And to Allāh belongs the east and the west. So wherever you [might] turn, there is the Face of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs the east and the west.
So wherever you [might] turn,
there is the Face of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

2:116.t: They say, "Allāh has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. All are devoutly obedient to Him,

segments.t: They say,
"Allāh has taken a son."
Exalted is He!
Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth.
All are devoutly obedient to Him,

2:117.t: Originator of the heavens and the earth. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

segments.t: Originator of the heavens and the earth.
When He decrees a matter,
He only says to it, "Be,"
and it is.

2:118.t: Those who do not know say, "Why does Allāh not speak to us or there come to us a sign?" Thus spoke those before them like their words. Their hearts resemble each other. We have shown clearly the signs to a people who are certain [in faith].

segments.t: Those who do not know say,
"Why does Allāh not speak to us
or there come to us a sign?"
Thus spoke those before them like their words.
Their hearts resemble each other.
We have shown clearly the signs
to a people who are certain [in faith].

2:119.t: Indeed, We have sent you, [O Muḥammad], with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner, and you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire.

segments.t: Indeed, We have sent you, [O Muḥammad],
with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner,
and you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire.

2:12.t: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters, but they perceive [it] not.

segments.t: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters,
but they perceive [it] not.

2:120.t: And never will the Jews and the Christians approve of you until you follow their religion. Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allāh is the [only] guidance." If you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would have against Allāh no protector or helper.

segments.t: And never will the Jews and the Christians approve of you
until you follow their religion.
Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allāh is the [only] guidance."
If you were to follow their desires
after what has come to you of knowledge,
you would have against Allāh no protector or helper.

2:121.t: Those to whom We have given the Book recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it. And whoever disbelieves in it - it is they who are the losers.

segments.t: Those to whom We have given the Book
recite it with its true recital.
They [are the ones who] believe in it.
And whoever disbelieves in it -
it is they who are the losers.

2:122.t: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.

segments.t: O Children of Israel,
remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you
and that I preferred you over the worlds.

2:123.t: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, and no compensation will be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be aided.

segments.t: And fear a Day
when no soul will suffice for another soul at all,
and no compensation will be accepted from it,
nor will any intercession benefit it,
nor will they be aided.

2:124.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Abraham was tried by his Lord with words [i.e., commands] and he fulfilled them. [Allāh] said, "Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people." [Abraham] said, "And of my descendants?" [Allāh] said, "My covenant does not include the wrongdoers."

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when Abraham was tried by his Lord with words [i.e., commands]
and he fulfilled them.
[Allāh] said,
"Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people."
[Abraham] said,
"And of my descendants?"
[Allāh] said,
"My covenant does not include the wrongdoers."

2:125.t: And [mention] when We made the House [i.e., the Kaʿbah] a place of return for the people and [a place of] security. And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying], "Purify My House for those who perform ṭawāf and those who are staying [there] for worship and those who bow and prostrate [in prayer]."

segments.t: And [mention] when We made the House [i.e., the Kaʿbah]
a place of return for the people and [a place of] security.
And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer.
And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying],
"Purify My House for those who perform ṭawāf
and those who are staying [there] for worship
and those who bow and prostrate [in prayer]."

2:126.t: And [mention] when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allāh and the Last Day." [Allāh] said, "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination."

segments.t: And [mention] when Abraham said,
"My Lord, make this a secure city
and provide its people with fruits -
whoever of them believes in Allāh and the Last Day."
[Allāh] said,
"And whoever disbelieves -
I will grant him enjoyment for a little;
then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire,
and wretched is the destination."

2:127.t: And [mention] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], "Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: And [mention] when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House
and [with him] Ishmael, [saying],
"Our Lord, accept [this] from us.
Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing.

2:128.t: Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites [of worship] and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.

segments.t: Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You
and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You.
And show us our rites [of worship]
and accept our repentance.
Indeed, You are the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.

2:129.t: Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

segments.t: Our Lord, and send among them a messenger from themselves
who will recite to them Your verses
and teach them the Book and wisdom
and purify them.
Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

2:13.t: And when it is said to them, "Believe as the people have believed," they say, "Should we believe as the foolish have believed?" Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish, but they know [it] not.

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Believe as the people have believed,"
they say,
"Should we believe as the foolish have believed?"
Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish,
but they know [it] not.

2:130.t: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself. And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.

segments.t: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham
except one who makes a fool of himself.
And We had chosen him in this world,
and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.

2:131.t: When his Lord said to him, "Submit," he said, "I have submitted [in Islām] to the Lord of the worlds."

segments.t: When his Lord said to him,
"Submit,"
he said,
"I have submitted [in Islām]
to the Lord of the worlds."

2:132.t: And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same] and [so did] Jacob, [saying], "O my sons, indeed Allāh has chosen for you this religion, so do not die except while you are Muslims."

segments.t: And Abraham instructed his sons [to do the same]
and [so did] Jacob, [saying],
"O my sons, indeed Allāh has chosen for you this religion,
so do not die except while you are Muslims."

2:133.t: Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, "What will you worship after me?" They said, "We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac - one God. And we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

segments.t: Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob,
when he said to his sons,
"What will you worship after me?"
They said,
"We will worship your God
and the God of your fathers,
Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac -
one God.
And we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

2:134.t: That was a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.

segments.t: That was a nation which has passed on.
It will have [the consequence of] what it earned,
and you will have what you have earned.
And you will not be asked about what they used to do.

2:135.t: They say, "Be Jews or Christians [so] you will be guided." Say, "Rather, [we follow] the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not of the polytheists."

segments.t: They say,
"Be Jews or Christians [so] you will be guided."
Say, "Rather, [we follow] the religion of Abraham,
inclining toward truth,
and he was not of the polytheists."

2:136.t: Say, [O believers], "We have believed in Allāh and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants [al-Asbāṭ] and what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

segments.t: Say, [O believers], "We have believed in Allāh
and what has been revealed to us
and what has been revealed to Abraham
and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants [al-Asbāṭ]
and what was given to Moses and Jesus
and what was given to the prophets from their Lord.
We make no distinction between any of them,
and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."

2:137.t: So if they believe in the same as you believe in, then they have been [rightly] guided; but if they turn away, they are only in dissension, and Allāh will be sufficient for you against them. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: So if they believe in the same as you believe in,
then they have been [rightly] guided;
but if they turn away,
they are only in dissension,
and Allāh will be sufficient for you against them.
And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

2:138.t: [And say, "Ours is] the religion of Allāh. And who is better than Allāh in [ordaining] religion? And we are worshippers of Him."

segments.t: [And say, "Ours is] the religion of Allāh.
And who is better than Allāh in [ordaining] religion?
And we are worshippers of Him."

2:139.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Do you argue with us about Allāh while He is our Lord and your Lord? For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. And we are sincere [in deed and intention] to Him."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Do you argue with us about Allāh
while He is our Lord and your Lord?
For us are our deeds,
and for you are your deeds.
And we are sincere [in deed and intention] to Him."

2:14.t: And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We believe"; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, "Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers."

segments.t: And when they meet those who believe,
they say, "We believe";
but when they are alone with their evil ones,
they say, "Indeed, we are with you;
we were only mockers."

2:140.t: Or do you say that Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and the Descendants were Jews or Christians? Say, "Are you more knowing or is Allāh?" And who is more unjust than one who conceals a testimony he has from Allāh? And Allāh is not unaware of what you do.

segments.t: Or do you say that Abraham
and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob
and the Descendants were Jews or Christians?
Say, "Are you more knowing or is Allāh?"
And who is more unjust than one who conceals a testimony he has from Allāh?
And Allāh is not unaware of what you do.

2:141.t: That is a nation which has passed on. It will have [the consequence of] what it earned, and you will have what you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.

segments.t: That is a nation which has passed on.
It will have [the consequence of] what it earned,
and you will have what you have earned.
And you will not be asked about what they used to do.
