2:41.t: And believe in what I have sent down confirming that which is [already] with you, and be not the first to disbelieve in it. And do not exchange My signs for a small price, and fear [only] Me.

segments.t: And believe in what I have sent down
confirming that which is [already] with you,
and be not the first to disbelieve in it.
And do not exchange My signs for a small price,
and fear [only] Me.

2:42.t: And do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know [it].

segments.t: And do not mix the truth with falsehood
or conceal the truth while you know [it].

2:43.t: And establish prayer and give zakāh and bow with those who bow [in worship and obedience].

segments.t: And establish prayer
and give zakāh
and bow with those who bow [in worship and obedience].

2:44.t: Do you order righteousness of the people and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Then will you not reason?

segments.t: Do you order righteousness of the people
and forget yourselves
while you recite the Scripture?
Then will you not reason?

2:45.t: And seek help through patience and prayer; and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly submissive [to Allāh]

segments.t: And seek help through patience and prayer;
and indeed, it is difficult
except for the humbly submissive [to Allāh]

2:46.t: Who are certain that they will meet their Lord and that they will return to Him.

segments.t: Who are certain that they will meet their Lord
and that they will return to Him.

2:47.t: O Children of Israel, remember My favor that I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds [i.e., peoples].

segments.t: O Children of Israel,
remember My favor that I have bestowed upon you
and that I preferred you over the worlds [i.e., peoples].

2:48.t: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be aided.

segments.t: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all,
nor will intercession be accepted from it,
nor will compensation be taken from it,
nor will they be aided.

2:49.t: And [recall] when We saved you [i.e., your forefathers] from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with the worst torment, slaughtering your [newborn] sons and keeping your females alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

segments.t: And [recall] when We saved you [i.e., your forefathers]
from the people of Pharaoh,
who afflicted you with the worst torment,
slaughtering your [newborn] sons
and keeping your females alive.
And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

2:5.t: Those are upon [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

segments.t: Those are upon [right] guidance from their Lord,
and it is those who are the successful.

2:50.t: And [recall] when We parted the sea for you and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on.

segments.t: And [recall] when We parted the sea for you
and saved you
and drowned the people of Pharaoh
while you were looking on.

2:51.t: And [recall] when We made an appointment with Moses for forty nights. Then you took [for worship] the calf after him [i.e., his departure], while you were wrongdoers.

segments.t: And [recall] when We made an appointment with Moses
for forty nights.
Then you took [for worship] the calf after him [i.e., his departure],
while you were wrongdoers.

2:52.t: Then We forgave you after that so perhaps you would be grateful.

segments.t: Then We forgave you after that
so perhaps you would be grateful.

2:53.t: And [recall] when We gave Moses the Scripture and criterion that perhaps you would be guided.

segments.t: And [recall] when We gave Moses
the Scripture and criterion
that perhaps you would be guided.

2:54.t: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, indeed you have wronged yourselves by your taking of the calf [for worship]. So repent to your Creator and kill yourselves [i.e., the guilty among you]. That is best for [all of] you in the sight of your Creator." Then He accepted your repentance; indeed, He is the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.

segments.t: And [recall] when Moses said to his people,
"O my people,
indeed you have wronged yourselves by your taking of the calf [for worship].
So repent to your Creator and kill yourselves [i.e., the guilty among you].
That is best for [all of] you in the sight of your Creator."
Then He accepted your repentance;
indeed, He is the Accepting of Repentance, the Merciful.

2:55.t: And [recall] when you said, "O Moses, we will never believe you until we see Allāh outright"; so the thunderbolt took you while you were looking on.

segments.t: And [recall] when you said,
"O Moses, we will never believe you
until we see Allāh outright";
so the thunderbolt took you
while you were looking on.

2:56.t: Then We revived you after your death that perhaps you would be grateful.

segments.t: Then We revived you after your death
that perhaps you would be grateful.

2:57.t: And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not - but they were [only] wronging themselves.

segments.t: And We shaded you with clouds
and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying],
"Eat from the good things with which We have provided you."
And they wronged Us not -
but they were [only] wronging themselves.

2:58.t: And [recall] when We said, "Enter this city [i.e., Jerusalem] and eat from it wherever you will in [ease and] abundance, and enter the gate bowing humbly and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens [i.e., sins].' We will [then] forgive your sins for you, and We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."

segments.t: And [recall] when We said,
"Enter this city [i.e., Jerusalem]
and eat from it wherever you will in [ease and] abundance,
and enter the gate bowing humbly
and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens [i.e., sins].'
We will [then] forgive your sins for you,
and We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."

2:59.t: But those who wronged changed [those words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them, so We sent down upon those who wronged a punishment [i.e., plague] from the sky because they were defiantly disobeying.

segments.t: But those who wronged changed [those words] to a statement
other than that which had been said to them,
so We sent down upon those who wronged a punishment [i.e., plague] from the sky
because they were defiantly disobeying.

2:6.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve -
it is all the same for them
whether you warn them or do not warn them -
they will not believe.

2:60.t: And [recall] when Moses prayed for water for his people, so We said, "Strike with your staff the stone." And there gushed forth from it twelve springs, and every people [i.e., tribe] knew its watering place. "Eat and drink from the provision of Allāh, and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

segments.t: And [recall] when Moses prayed for water for his people,
so We said, "Strike with your staff the stone."
And there gushed forth from it twelve springs,
and every people [i.e., tribe] knew its watering place.
"Eat and drink from the provision of Allāh,
and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

2:61.t: And [recall] when you said, "O Moses, we can never endure one [kind of] food. So call upon your Lord to bring forth for us from the earth its green herbs and its cucumbers and its garlic and its lentils and its onions." [Moses] said, "Would you exchange what is better for what is less? Go into [any] settlement and indeed, you will have what you have asked." And they were covered with humiliation and poverty and returned with anger from Allāh [upon them]. That was because they [repeatedly] disbelieved in the signs of Allāh and killed the prophets without right. That was because they disobeyed and were [habitually] transgressing.

segments.t: And [recall] when you said,
"O Moses, we can never endure one [kind of] food.
So call upon your Lord to bring forth for us from the earth
its green herbs and its cucumbers and its garlic
and its lentils and its onions."
[Moses] said, "Would you exchange what is better for what is less?
Go into [any] settlement and indeed, you will have what you have asked."
And they were covered with humiliation and poverty
and returned with anger from Allāh [upon them].
That was because they [repeatedly] disbelieved in the signs of Allāh
and killed the prophets without right.
That was because they disobeyed and were [habitually] transgressing.

2:62.t: Indeed, those who believed and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabeans [before Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] - those [among them] who believed in Allāh and the Last Day and did righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.

segments.t: Indeed, those who believed
and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabeans [before Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] -
those [among them] who believed in Allāh and the Last Day
and did righteousness -
will have their reward with their Lord,
and no fear will there be concerning them,
nor will they grieve.

2:63.t: And [recall] when We took your covenant, [O Children of Israel, to abide by the Torah] and We raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that perhaps you may become righteous."

segments.t: And [recall] when We took your covenant,
[O Children of Israel, to abide by the Torah] and We raised over you the mount, [saying],
"Take what We have given you with determination
and remember what is in it that perhaps you may become righteous."

2:64.t: Then you turned away after that. And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy, you would have been among the losers.

segments.t: Then you turned away after that.
And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy,
you would have been among the losers.

2:65.t: And you had already known about those who transgressed among you concerning the sabbath, and We said to them, "Be apes, despised."

segments.t: And you had already known about those who transgressed among you
concerning the sabbath,
and We said to them,
"Be apes, despised."

2:66.t: And We made it a deterrent punishment for those who were present and those who succeeded [them] and a lesson for those who fear Allāh.

segments.t: And We made it a deterrent punishment
for those who were present
and those who succeeded [them]
and a lesson for those who fear Allāh.

2:67.t: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "Indeed, Allāh commands you to slaughter a cow." They said, "Do you take us in ridicule?" He said, "I seek refuge in Allāh from being among the ignorant."

segments.t: And [recall] when Moses said to his people,
"Indeed, Allāh commands you to slaughter a cow."
They said, "Do you take us in ridicule?"
He said, "I seek refuge in Allāh from being among the ignorant."

2:68.t: They said, "Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is." [Moses] said, "[Allāh] says, 'It is a cow which is neither old nor virgin, but median between that,' so do what you are commanded."

segments.t: They said,
"Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is."
[Moses] said,
"[Allāh] says,
'It is a cow which is neither old nor virgin,
but median between that,'
so do what you are commanded."

2:69.t: They said, "Call upon your Lord to show us what is her color." He said, "He says, 'It is a yellow cow, bright in color - pleasing to the observers.'"

segments.t: They said,
"Call upon your Lord to show us what is her color."
He said,
"He says, 'It is a yellow cow,
bright in color - pleasing to the observers.'"

2:7.t: Allāh has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.

segments.t: Allāh has set a seal upon their hearts
and upon their hearing,
and over their vision is a veil.
And for them is a great punishment.

2:70.t: They said, "Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is. Indeed, [all] cows look alike to us. And indeed we, if Allāh wills, will be guided."

segments.t: They said,
"Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what it is.
Indeed, [all] cows look alike to us.
And indeed we, if Allāh wills, will be guided."

2:71.t: He said, "He says, 'It is a cow neither trained to plow the earth nor to irrigate the field, one free from fault with no spot upon her.'" They said, "Now you have come with the truth." So they slaughtered her, but they could hardly do it.

segments.t: He said,
"He says, 'It is a cow neither trained to plow the earth
nor to irrigate the field,
one free from fault with no spot upon her.'"
They said,
"Now you have come with the truth."
So they slaughtered her,
but they could hardly do it.

2:72.t: And [recall] when you slew a man and disputed over it, but Allāh was to bring out that which you were concealing.

segments.t: And [recall] when you slew a man
and disputed over it,
but Allāh was to bring out
that which you were concealing.

2:73.t: So We said, "Strike him [i.e., the slain man] with part of it." Thus does Allāh bring the dead to life, and He shows you His signs that you might reason.

segments.t: So We said,
"Strike him [i.e., the slain man] with part of it."
Thus does Allāh bring the dead to life,
and He shows you His signs that you might reason.

2:74.t: Then your hearts became hardened after that, being like stones or even harder. For indeed, there are stones from which rivers burst forth, and there are some of them that split open and water comes out, and there are some of them that fall down for fear of Allāh. And Allāh is not unaware of what you do.

segments.t: Then your hearts became hardened after that,
being like stones or even harder.
For indeed, there are stones from which rivers burst forth,
and there are some of them that split open and water comes out,
and there are some of them that fall down for fear of Allāh.
And Allāh is not unaware of what you do.

2:75.t: Do you covet [the hope, O believers], that they would believe for you while a party of them used to hear the words of Allāh and then distort it [i.e., the Torah] after they had understood it while they were knowing?

segments.t: Do you covet [the hope, O believers],
that they would believe for you
while a party of them used to hear the words of Allāh
and then distort it [i.e., the Torah]
after they had understood it while they were knowing?

2:76.t: And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We have believed"; but when they are alone with one another, they say, "Do you talk to them about what Allāh has revealed to you so they can argue with you about it before your Lord?" Then will you not reason?

segments.t: And when they meet those who believe,
they say, "We have believed";
but when they are alone with one another,
they say, "Do you talk to them about what Allāh has revealed to you
so they can argue with you about it before your Lord?"
Then will you not reason?

2:77.t: But do they not know that Allāh knows what they conceal and what they declare?

segments.t: But do they not know
that Allāh knows what they conceal
and what they declare?

2:78.t: And among them are unlettered ones who do not know the Scripture except [indulgement in] wishful thinking, but they are only assuming.

segments.t: And among them are unlettered ones
who do not know the Scripture
except [indulgement in] wishful thinking,
but they are only assuming.

2:79.t: So woe to those who write the "scripture" with their own hands, then say, "This is from Allāh," in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn.

segments.t: So woe to those who write the "scripture" with their own hands,
then say, "This is from Allāh,"
in order to exchange it for a small price.
Woe to them for what their hands have written
and woe to them for what they earn.

2:8.t: And of the people are some who say, "We believe in Allāh and the Last Day," but they are not believers.

segments.t: And of the people are some who say,
"We believe in Allāh and the Last Day,"
but they are not believers.

2:80.t: And they say, "Never will the Fire touch us, except for [a few] numbered days." Say, "Have you taken a covenant with Allāh? For Allāh will never break His covenant. Or do you say about Allāh that which you do not know?"

segments.t: And they say,
"Never will the Fire touch us,
except for [a few] numbered days."
Say, "Have you taken a covenant with Allāh?
For Allāh will never break His covenant.
Or do you say about Allāh that which you do not know?"

2:81.t: Yes, [on the contrary], whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: Yes, [on the contrary],
whoever earns evil
and his sin has encompassed him -
those are the companions of the Fire;
they will abide therein eternally.

2:82.t: But they who believe and do righteous deeds - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: But they who believe and do righteous deeds -
those are the companions of Paradise;
they will abide therein eternally.

2:83.t: And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], "Do not worship except Allāh; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakāh." Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.

segments.t: And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel,
[enjoining upon them], "Do not worship except Allāh;
and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy.
And speak to people good [words]
and establish prayer and give zakāh."
Then you turned away, except a few of you,
and you were refusing.

2:84.t: And [recall] when We took your covenant, [saying], "Do not shed your [i.e., each other's] blood or evict one another from your homes." Then you acknowledged [this] while you were witnessing.

segments.t: And [recall] when We took your covenant, [saying],
"Do not shed your [i.e., each other's] blood
or evict one another from your homes."
Then you acknowledged [this] while you were witnessing.

2:85.t: Then, you are those [same ones who are] killing one another and evicting a party of your people from their homes, cooperating against them in sin and aggression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their eviction was forbidden to you. So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you except disgrace in worldly life; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back to the severest of punishment. And Allāh is not unaware of what you do.

segments.t: Then, you are those [same ones who are] killing one another
and evicting a party of your people from their homes,
cooperating against them in sin and aggression.
And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them,
although their eviction was forbidden to you.
So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part?
Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you
except disgrace in worldly life;
and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back
to the severest of punishment.
And Allāh is not unaware of what you do.

2:86.t: Those are the ones who have bought the life of this world [in exchange] for the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be aided.

segments.t: Those are the ones who have bought the life of this world [in exchange] for the Hereafter,
so the punishment will not be lightened for them,
nor will they be aided.

2:87.t: And We did certainly give Moses the Scripture [i.e., the Torah] and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit [i.e., the angel Gabriel]. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.

segments.t: And We did certainly give Moses the Scripture [i.e., the Torah]
and followed up after him with messengers.
And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs
and supported him with the Pure Spirit [i.e., the angel Gabriel].
But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel],
with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant?
And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.

2:88.t: And they said, "Our hearts are wrapped." But, [in fact], Allāh has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe.

segments.t: And they said,
"Our hearts are wrapped."
But, [in fact], Allāh has cursed them
for their disbelief,
so little is it that they believe.

2:89.t: And when there came to them a Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] from Allāh confirming that which was with them - although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but [then] when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allāh will be upon the disbelievers.

segments.t: And when there came to them a Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] from Allāh
confirming that which was with them -
although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved -
but [then] when there came to them that which they recognized,
they disbelieved in it;
so the curse of Allāh will be upon the disbelievers.

2:9.t: They [think to] deceive Allāh and those who believe, but they deceive not except themselves and perceive [it] not.

segments.t: They [think to] deceive Allāh and those who believe,
but they deceive not except themselves
and perceive [it] not.

2:90.t: How wretched is that for which they sold themselves - that they would disbelieve in what Allāh has revealed through [their] outrage that Allāh would send down His favor upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they returned having [earned] wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: How wretched is that for which they sold themselves -
that they would disbelieve in what Allāh has revealed
through [their] outrage that Allāh would send down His favor
upon whom He wills from among His servants.
So they returned having [earned] wrath upon wrath.
And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.

2:91.t: And when it is said to them, "Believe in what Allāh has revealed," they say, "We believe [only] in what was revealed to us." And they disbelieve in what came after it, while it is the truth confirming that which is with them. Say, "Then why did you kill the prophets of Allāh before, if you are [indeed] believers?"

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Believe in what Allāh has revealed,"
they say,
"We believe [only] in what was revealed to us."
And they disbelieve in what came after it,
while it is the truth confirming that which is with them.
Say, "Then why did you kill the prophets of Allāh before,
if you are [indeed] believers?"

2:92.t: And Moses had certainly brought you clear proofs. Then you took the calf [in worship] after that, while you were wrongdoers.

segments.t: And Moses had certainly brought you clear proofs.
Then you took the calf [in worship] after that,
while you were wrongdoers.

2:93.t: And [recall] when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and listen." They said [instead], "We hear and disobey." And their hearts absorbed [the worship of] the calf because of their disbelief. Say, "How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you, if you should be believers."

segments.t: And [recall] when We took your covenant
and raised over you the mount, [saying],
"Take what We have given you with determination and listen."
They said [instead], "We hear and disobey."
And their hearts absorbed [the worship of] the calf
because of their disbelief.
Say, "How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you,
if you should be believers."

2:94.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "If the home of the Hereafter with Allāh is for you alone and not the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"If the home of the Hereafter with Allāh
is for you alone and not the [other] people,
then wish for death, if you should be truthful."

2:95.t: But never will they wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allāh is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

segments.t: But never will they wish for it, ever,
because of what their hands have put forth.
And Allāh is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

2:96.t: And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life - [even] more than those who associate others with Allāh. One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years, but it would not remove him in the least from the [coming] punishment that he should be granted life. And Allāh is Seeing of what they do.

segments.t: And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life -
[even] more than those who associate others with Allāh.
One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years,
but it would not remove him in the least from the [coming] punishment
that he should be granted life.
And Allāh is Seeing of what they do.

2:97.t: Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is [none but] he who has brought it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down upon your heart, [O Muḥammad], by permission of Allāh, confirming that which was before it and as guidance and good tidings for the believers."

segments.t: Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel -
it is [none but] he who has brought it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down upon your heart,
[O Muḥammad], by permission of Allāh,
confirming that which was before it
and as guidance and good tidings for the believers."

2:98.t: Whoever is an enemy to Allāh and His angels and His messengers and Gabriel and Michael - then indeed, Allāh is an enemy to the disbelievers.

segments.t: Whoever is an enemy to Allāh
and His angels
and His messengers
and Gabriel
and Michael -
then indeed, Allāh is an enemy to the disbelievers.

2:99.t: And We have certainly revealed to you verses [which are] clear proofs, and no one would deny them except the defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: And We have certainly revealed to you verses [which are] clear proofs,
and no one would deny them except the defiantly disobedient.
Alif, Lām, Meem.

30:10.t: Then the end of those who did evil was the worst [consequence] because they denied the signs of Allāh and used to ridicule them.

segments.t: Then the end of those who did evil
was the worst [consequence]
because they denied the signs of Allāh
and used to ridicule them.

30:11.t: Allāh begins creation; then He will repeat it; then to Him you will be returned.

segments.t: Allāh begins creation;
then He will repeat it;
then to Him you will be returned.

30:12.t: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will be in despair.

segments.t: And the Day the Hour appears
the criminals will be in despair.

30:13.t: And there will not be for them among their [alleged] partners any intercessors, and they will [then] be disbelievers in their partners.

segments.t: And there will not be for them
among their [alleged] partners any intercessors,
and they will [then] be disbelievers in their partners.

30:14.t: And the Day the Hour appears - that Day they will become separated.

segments.t: And the Day the Hour appears -
that Day they will become separated.

30:15.t: And as for those who had believed and done righteous deeds, they will be in a garden [of Paradise], delighted.

segments.t: And as for those who had believed
and done righteous deeds,
they will be in a garden [of Paradise],
delighted.

30:16.t: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our verses and the meeting of the Hereafter, those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

segments.t: But as for those who disbelieved
and denied Our verses
and the meeting of the Hereafter,
those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

30:17.t: So exalted is Allāh when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.

segments.t: So exalted is Allāh
when you reach the evening
and when you reach the morning.

30:18.t: And to Him is [due all] praise throughout the heavens and the earth. And [exalted is He] at night and when you are at noon.

segments.t: And to Him is [due all] praise
throughout the heavens and the earth.
And [exalted is He] at night
and when you are at noon.

30:19.t: He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. And thus will you be brought out.

segments.t: He brings the living out of the dead
and brings the dead out of the living
and brings to life the earth after its lifelessness.
And thus will you be brought out.
The Byzantines
have been defeated

30:20.t: And of His signs is that He created you from dust; then, suddenly you were human beings dispersing [throughout the earth].

segments.t: And of His signs is that He created you from dust;
then, suddenly you were human beings dispersing [throughout the earth].

30:21.t: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

segments.t: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates
that you may find tranquility in them;
and He placed between you affection and mercy.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

30:22.t: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge.

segments.t: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth
and the diversity of your languages and your colors.
Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge.

30:23.t: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

segments.t: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day
and your seeking of His bounty.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

30:24.t: And of His signs is [that] He shows you the lightning [causing] fear and aspiration, and He sends down rain from the sky by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for a people who use reason.

segments.t: And of His signs is [that] He shows you the lightning [causing] fear and aspiration,
and He sends down rain from the sky
by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who use reason.

30:25.t: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth stand [i.e., remain] by His command. Then when He calls you with a [single] call from the earth, immediately you will come forth.

segments.t: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth stand [i.e., remain] by His command.
Then when He calls you with a [single] call from the earth,
immediately you will come forth.

30:26.t: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and earth. All are to Him devoutly obedient.

segments.t: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and earth.
All are to Him devoutly obedient.

30:27.t: And it is He who begins creation; then He repeats it, and that is [even] easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest description [i.e., attribute] in the heavens and earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: And it is He who begins creation;
then He repeats it,
and that is [even] easier for Him.
To Him belongs the highest description [i.e., attribute]
in the heavens and earth.
And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

30:28.t: He presents to you an example from yourselves. Do you have among those whom your right hands possess [i.e., slaves] any partners in what We have provided for you so that you are equal therein [and] would fear them as your fear of one another [within a partnership]? Thus do We detail the verses for a people who use reason.

segments.t: He presents to you an example from yourselves.
Do you have among those whom your right hands possess [i.e., slaves]
any partners in what We have provided for you
so that you are equal therein [and] would fear them
as your fear of one another [within a partnership]?
Thus do We detail the verses for a people who use reason.

30:29.t: But those who wrong follow their [own] desires without knowledge. Then who can guide one whom Allāh has sent astray? And for them there are no helpers.

segments.t: But those who wrong follow their [own] desires without knowledge.
Then who can guide one whom Allāh has sent astray?
And for them there are no helpers.

30:3.t: In the nearest land. But they, after their defeat, will overcome

segments.t: In the nearest land.
But they, after their defeat,
will overcome

30:30.t: So direct your face [i.e., self] toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the fiṭrah of Allāh upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of Allāh. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.

segments.t: So direct your face [i.e., self] toward the religion,
inclining to truth.
[Adhere to] the fiṭrah of Allāh
upon which He has created [all] people.
No change should there be in the creation of Allāh.
That is the correct religion,
but most of the people do not know.

30:31.t: [Adhere to it], turning in repentance to Him, and fear Him and establish prayer and do not be of those who associate others with Allāh

segments.t: [Adhere to it], turning in repentance to Him,
and fear Him and establish prayer
and do not be of those who associate others with Allāh

30:32.t: [Or] of those who have divided their religion and become sects, every faction rejoicing in what it has.

segments.t: [Or] of those who have divided their religion
and become sects,
every faction rejoicing in what it has.

30:33.t: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord,

segments.t: And when adversity touches the people,
they call upon their Lord,
turning in repentance to Him.
Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him,
at once a party of them associate others with their Lord,

30:34.t: So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

segments.t: So that they will deny what We have granted them.
Then enjoy yourselves,
for you are going to know.

30:35.t: Or have We sent down to them an authority [i.e., a proof or scripture], and it speaks of what they have been associating with Him?

segments.t: Or have We sent down to them an authority [i.e., a proof or scripture],
and it speaks of what they have been associating with Him?

30:36.t: And when We let the people taste mercy, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, immediately they despair.

segments.t: And when We let the people taste mercy,
they rejoice therein,
but if evil afflicts them
for what their hands have put forth,
immediately they despair.

30:37.t: Do they not see that Allāh extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

segments.t: Do they not see that Allāh extends provision for whom He wills
and restricts [it]?
Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

30:38.t: So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh, and it is they who will be the successful.

segments.t: So give the relative his right,
as well as the needy and the traveler.
That is best for those who desire the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh,
and it is they who will be the successful.

30:39.t: And whatever you give for interest [i.e., advantage] to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allāh. But what you give in zakāh, desiring the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh - those are the multipliers.

segments.t: And whatever you give for interest [i.e., advantage]
to increase within the wealth of people
will not increase with Allāh.
But what you give in zakāh,
desiring the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh -
those are the multipliers.

30:4.t: Within three to nine years. To Allāh belongs the command [i.e., decree] before and after. And that day the believers will rejoice

segments.t: Within three to nine years.
To Allāh belongs the command [i.e., decree] before and after.
And that day the believers will rejoice

30:40.t: Allāh is the one who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, and then will give you life. Are there any of your "partners" who does anything of that? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

segments.t: Allāh is the one who created you,
then provided for you,
then will cause you to die,
and then will give you life.
Are there any of your "partners" who does anything of that?
Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

30:41.t: Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He [i.e., Allāh] may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].

segments.t: Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea
by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned
so He [i.e., Allāh] may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done
that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].

30:42.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were associators [of others with Allāh].

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Travel through the land
and observe how was the end of those before.
Most of them were associators [of others with Allāh].

30:43.t: So direct your face [i.e., self] toward the correct religion before a Day comes from Allāh of which there is no repelling. That Day, they will be divided.

segments.t: So direct your face [i.e., self] toward the correct religion
before a Day comes from Allāh of which there is no repelling.
That Day, they will be divided.

30:44.t: Whoever disbelieves - upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are for themselves preparing,

segments.t: Whoever disbelieves -
upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief.
And whoever does righteousness -
they are for themselves preparing,

30:45.t: That He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

segments.t: That He may reward those who have believed
and done righteous deeds out of His bounty.
Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

30:46.t: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy [i.e., rain] and so the ships may sail at His command and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.

segments.t: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings
and to let you taste His mercy [i.e., rain]
and so the ships may sail at His command
and so you may seek of His bounty,
and perhaps you will be grateful.

30:47.t: And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear evidences; then We took retribution from those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.

segments.t: And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples,
and they came to them with clear evidences;
then We took retribution from those who committed crimes,
and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.

30:48.t: It is Allāh who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the rain emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice

segments.t: It is Allāh who sends the winds,
and they stir the clouds
and spread them in the sky however He wills,
and He makes them fragments
so you see the rain emerge from within them.
And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants,
immediately they rejoice

30:49.t: Although they were, before it was sent down upon them - before that, in despair.

segments.t: Although they were,
before it was sent down upon them -
before that, in despair.

30:5.t: In the victory of Allāh. He gives victory to whom He wills, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

segments.t: In the victory of Allāh.
He gives victory to whom He wills,
and He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

30:50.t: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allāh - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.

segments.t: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allāh -
how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness.
Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead,
and He is over all things competent.

30:51.t: But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disbelievers.

segments.t: But if We should send a [bad] wind
and they saw [their crops] turned yellow,
they would remain thereafter disbelievers.

30:52.t: So indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.

segments.t: So indeed, you will not make the dead hear,
nor will you make the deaf hear the call
when they turn their backs, retreating.

30:53.t: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [in submission to Allāh].

segments.t: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error.
You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses
so they are Muslims [in submission to Allāh].

30:54.t: Allāh is the one who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.

segments.t: Allāh is the one who created you from weakness,
then made after weakness strength,
then made after strength weakness and white hair.
He creates what He wills,
and He is the Knowing, the Competent.

30:55.t: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour. Thus they were deluded.

segments.t: And the Day the Hour appears
the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour.
Thus they were deluded.

30:56.t: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "You remained the extent of Allāh's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not used to know."

segments.t: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say,
"You remained the extent of Allāh's decree until the Day of Resurrection,
and this is the Day of Resurrection,
but you did not used to know."

30:57.t: So that Day, their excuse will not benefit those who wronged, nor will they be asked to appease [Allāh].

segments.t: So that Day,
their excuse will not benefit those who wronged,
nor will they be asked to appease [Allāh].

30:58.t: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur’ān from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muḥammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, "You [believers] are but falsifiers."

segments.t: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur’ān
from every [kind of] example.
But, [O Muḥammad], if you should bring them a sign,
the disbelievers will surely say,
"You [believers] are but falsifiers."

30:59.t: Thus does Allāh seal the hearts of those who do not know.

segments.t: Thus does Allāh seal
the hearts of those who do not know.

30:6.t: [It is] the promise of Allāh. Allāh does not fail in His promise, but most of the people do not know.

segments.t: [It is] the promise of Allāh.
Allāh does not fail in His promise,
but most of the people do not know.

30:60.t: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain [in faith].

segments.t: So be patient.
Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth.
And let them not disquiet you
who are not certain [in faith].

30:7.t: They know what is apparent of the worldly life, but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.

segments.t: They know what is apparent of the worldly life,
but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.

30:8.t: Do they not contemplate within themselves? Allāh has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, in the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.

segments.t: Do they not contemplate within themselves?
Allāh has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them
except in truth and for a specified term.
And indeed, many of the people, in the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.

30:9.t: Have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in power, and they plowed [or excavated] the earth and built it up more than they [i.e., the Makkans] have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear evidences. And Allāh would not ever have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.

segments.t: Have they not traveled through the earth
and observed how was the end of those before them?
They were greater than them in power,
and they plowed [or excavated] the earth
and built it up more than they [i.e., the Makkans] have built it up,
and their messengers came to them with clear evidences.
And Allāh would not ever have wronged them,
but they were wronging themselves.
Alif, Lām, Meem.

31:10.t: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.

segments.t: He created the heavens without pillars that you see
and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains,
lest it should shift with you,
and dispersed therein from every creature.
And We sent down rain from the sky
and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.

31:11.t: This is the creation of Allāh. So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

segments.t: This is the creation of Allāh.
So show Me what those other than Him have created.
Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

31:12.t: And We had certainly given Luqmān wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to Allāh." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [His favor] - then indeed, Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

segments.t: And We had certainly given Luqmān wisdom [and said],
"Be grateful to Allāh."
And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself.
And whoever denies [His favor] -
then indeed, Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

31:13.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Luqmān said to his son while he was instructing him, "O my son, do not associate [anything] with Allāh. Indeed, association [with Him] is great injustice."

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when Luqmān said to his son
while he was instructing him,
"O my son,
do not associate [anything] with Allāh.
Indeed, association [with Him] is great injustice."

31:14.t: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.

segments.t: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents.
His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness,
and his weaning is in two years.
Be grateful to Me and to your parents;
to Me is the [final] destination.

31:15.t: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

segments.t: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me
that of which you have no knowledge,
do not obey them
but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness
and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance].
Then to Me will be your return,
and I will inform you about what you used to do.

31:16.t: [And Luqmān said], "O my son, indeed if it [i.e., a wrong] should be the weight of a mustard seed and should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth, Allāh will bring it forth. Indeed, Allāh is Subtle and Aware.

segments.t: [And Luqmān said], "O my son,
indeed if it [i.e., a wrong] should be the weight of a mustard seed
and should be within a rock or [anywhere] in the heavens or in the earth,
Allāh will bring it forth.
Indeed, Allāh is Subtle and Aware.

31:17.t: O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] resolve.

segments.t: O my son,
establish prayer,
enjoin what is right,
forbid what is wrong,
and be patient over what befalls you.
Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] resolve.

31:18.t: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allāh does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.

segments.t: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people
and do not walk through the earth exultantly.
Indeed, Allāh does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.

31:19.t: And be moderate in your pace and lower your voice; indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds is the voice of donkeys."

segments.t: And be moderate in your pace
and lower your voice;
indeed, the most disagreeable of sounds
is the voice of donkeys."

31:2.t: These are verses of the wise Book,

segments.t: These are verses
of the wise Book,

31:20.t: Do you not see that Allāh has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allāh without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him].

segments.t: Do you not see that Allāh has made subject to you
whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth
and amply bestowed upon you His favors,
[both] apparent and unapparent?
But of the people is he who disputes about Allāh
without knowledge or guidance
or an enlightening Book [from Him].

31:21.t: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allāh has revealed," they say, "Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers." Even if Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the Blaze?

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Follow what Allāh has revealed,"
they say,
"Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers."
Even if Satan was inviting them
to the punishment of the Blaze?

31:22.t: And whoever submits his face [i.e., self] to Allāh while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allāh will be the outcome of [all] matters.

segments.t: And whoever submits his face [i.e., self] to Allāh
while he is a doer of good -
then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold.
And to Allāh will be the outcome of [all] matters.

31:23.t: And whoever has disbelieved - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.

segments.t: And whoever has disbelieved -
let not his disbelief grieve you.
To Us is their return,
and We will inform them of what they did.
Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.

31:24.t: We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive punishment.

segments.t: We grant them enjoyment for a little;
then We will force them to a massive punishment.

31:25.t: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and earth?" they would surely say, "Allāh." Say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allāh"; but most of them do not know.

segments.t: And if you asked them,
"Who created the heavens and earth?"
they would surely say, "Allāh."
Say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allāh";
but most of them do not know.

31:26.t: To Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

segments.t: To Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth.
Indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

31:27.t: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of Allāh would not be exhausted. Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Wise.

segments.t: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens
and the sea [was ink],
replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas,
the words of Allāh would not be exhausted.
Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Wise.

31:28.t: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul. Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.

segments.t: Your creation and your resurrection
will not be but as that of a single soul.
Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.

31:29.t: Do you not see [i.e., know] that Allāh causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that Allāh, of whatever you do, is Aware?

segments.t: Do you not see [i.e., know] that Allāh causes the night to enter the day
and causes the day to enter the night
and has subjected the sun and the moon,
each running [its course] for a specified term,
and that Allāh, of whatever you do, is Aware?

31:3.t: As guidance and mercy for the doers of good

segments.t: As guidance and mercy
for the doers of good

31:30.t: That is because Allāh is the True Reality, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allāh is the Most High, the Grand.

segments.t: That is because Allāh is the True Reality,
and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood,
and because Allāh is the Most High, the Grand.

31:31.t: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of Allāh that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

segments.t: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea
by the favor of Allāh
that He may show you of His signs?
Indeed in that are signs
for everyone patient and grateful.

31:32.t: And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate Allāh, sincere to Him in religion [i.e., faith]. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

segments.t: And when waves come over them like canopies,
they supplicate Allāh,
sincere to Him in religion [i.e., faith].
But when He delivers them to the land,
there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith].
And none rejects Our signs
except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

31:33.t: O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allāh by the Deceiver [i.e., Satan].

segments.t: O mankind,
fear your Lord
and fear a Day when no father will avail his son,
nor will a son avail his father at all.
Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth,
so let not the worldly life delude you
and be not deceived about Allāh by the Deceiver [i.e., Satan].

31:34.t: Indeed, Allāh [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Aware.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh [alone] has knowledge of the Hour
and sends down the rain
and knows what is in the wombs.
And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow,
and no soul perceives in what land it will die.
Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Aware.

31:4.t: Who establish prayer and give zakāh, and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].

segments.t: Who establish prayer
and give zakāh,
and they, of the Hereafter,
are certain [in faith].

31:5.t: Those are on [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

segments.t: Those are on [right] guidance from their Lord,
and it is those who are the successful.

31:6.t: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of Allāh without knowledge and who takes it [i.e., His way] in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech
to mislead [others] from the way of Allāh without knowledge
and who takes it [i.e., His way] in ridicule.
Those will have a humiliating punishment.

31:7.t: And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

segments.t: And when Our verses are recited to him,
he turns away arrogantly
as if he had not heard them,
as if there was in his ears deafness.
So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

31:8.t: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the Gardens of Pleasure,

segments.t: Indeed, those who believe
and do righteous deeds -
for them are the Gardens of Pleasure,

31:9.t: Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of Allāh [which is] truth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Wherein they abide eternally;
[it is] the promise of Allāh [which is] truth.
And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
Alif, Lām, Meem.

32:10.t: And they say, "When we are lost [i.e., disintegrated] within the earth, will we indeed be [recreated] in a new creation?" Rather, they are, in the meeting with their Lord, disbelievers.

segments.t: And they say,
"When we are lost [i.e., disintegrated] within the earth,
will we indeed be [recreated] in a new creation?"
Rather, they are, in the meeting with their Lord, disbelievers.

32:11.t: Say, "The angel of death who has been entrusted with you will take you. Then to your Lord you will be returned."

segments.t: Say, "The angel of death
who has been entrusted with you will take you.
Then to your Lord you will be returned."

32:12.t: If you could but see when the criminals are hanging their heads before their Lord, [saying], "Our Lord, we have seen and heard, so return us [to the world]; we will work righteousness. Indeed, we are [now] certain."

segments.t: If you could but see
when the criminals are hanging their heads before their Lord,
[saying], "Our Lord, we have seen and heard,
so return us [to the world];
we will work righteousness.
Indeed, we are [now] certain."

32:13.t: And if We had willed, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the word from Me will come into effect [that] "I will surely fill Hell with jinn and people all together.

segments.t: And if We had willed,
We could have given every soul its guidance,
but the word from Me will come into effect [that]
"I will surely fill Hell with jinn and people all together.

32:14.t: So taste [punishment] because you forgot the meeting of this, your Day; indeed, We have [accordingly] forgotten you. And taste the punishment of eternity for what you used to do."

segments.t: So taste [punishment]
because you forgot the meeting of this, your Day;
indeed, We have [accordingly] forgotten you.
And taste the punishment of eternity for what you used to do."

32:15.t: Only those believe in Our verses who, when they are reminded by them, fall down in prostration and exalt [Allāh] with praise of their Lord, and they are not arrogant.

segments.t: Only those believe in Our verses who, when they are reminded by them,
fall down in prostration and exalt [Allāh] with praise of their Lord,
and they are not arrogant.

32:16.t: Their sides part [i.e., they arise] from [their] beds; they supplicate their Lord in fear and aspiration, and from what We have provided them, they spend.

segments.t: Their sides part [i.e., they arise] from [their] beds;
they supplicate their Lord in fear and aspiration,
and from what We have provided them, they spend.

32:17.t: And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes [i.e., satisfaction] as reward for what they used to do.

segments.t: And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes
[i.e., satisfaction] as reward for what they used to do.

32:18.t: Then is one who was a believer like one who was defiantly disobedient? They are not equal.

segments.t: Then is one who was a believer
like one who was defiantly disobedient?
They are not equal.

32:19.t: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, for them will be the Gardens of Refuge as accommodation for what they used to do.

segments.t: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds,
for them will be the Gardens of Refuge
as accommodation for what they used to do.

32:2.t: [This is] the revelation of the Book about which there is no doubt from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: [This is] the revelation of the Book
about which there is no doubt
from the Lord of the worlds.

32:20.t: But as for those who defiantly disobeyed, their refuge is the Fire. Every time they wish to emerge from it, they will be returned to it while it is said to them, "Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny."

segments.t: But as for those who defiantly disobeyed,
their refuge is the Fire.
Every time they wish to emerge from it,
they will be returned to it
while it is said to them,
"Taste the punishment of the Fire
which you used to deny."

32:21.t: And We will surely let them taste the nearer punishment short of the greater punishment that perhaps they will return [i.e., repent].

segments.t: And We will surely let them taste the nearer punishment
short of the greater punishment
that perhaps they will return [i.e., repent].

32:22.t: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord; then he turns away from them? Indeed We, from the criminals, will take retribution.

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord;
then he turns away from them?
Indeed We, from the criminals, will take retribution.

32:23.t: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so do not be in doubt over his meeting. And We made it [i.e., the Torah] guidance for the Children of Israel.

segments.t: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture,
so do not be in doubt over his meeting.
And We made it [i.e., the Torah] guidance
for the Children of Israel.

32:24.t: And We made from among them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient and [when] they were certain of Our signs.

segments.t: And We made from among them leaders
guiding by Our command
when they were patient
and [when] they were certain of Our signs.

32:25.t: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them
on the Day of Resurrection
concerning that over which they used to differ.

32:26.t: Has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them, [as] they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs; then do they not hear?

segments.t: Has it not become clear to them
how many generations We destroyed before them,
[as] they walk among their dwellings?
Indeed in that are signs;
then do they not hear?

32:27.t: Have they not seen that We drive water [in clouds] to barren land and bring forth thereby crops from which their livestock eat and [they] themselves? Then do they not see?

segments.t: Have they not seen that We drive water [in clouds] to barren land
and bring forth thereby crops from which their livestock eat
and [they] themselves?
Then do they not see?

32:28.t: And they say, "When will be this conquest, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: And they say,
"When will be this conquest,
if you should be truthful?"

32:29.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "On the Day of Conquest the belief of those who had disbelieved will not benefit them, nor will they be reprieved."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"On the Day of Conquest
the belief of those who had disbelieved will not benefit them,
nor will they be reprieved."

32:3.t: Or do they say, "He invented it"? Rather, it is the truth from your Lord, [O Muḥammad], that you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you [so] perhaps they will be guided.

segments.t: Or do they say,
"He invented it"?
Rather, it is the truth from your Lord, [O Muḥammad],
that you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you
[so] perhaps they will be guided.

32:30.t: So turn away from them and wait. Indeed, they are waiting.

segments.t: So turn away from them and wait.
Indeed, they are waiting.

32:4.t: It is Allāh who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days; then He established Himself above the Throne. You have not besides Him any protector or any intercessor; so will you not be reminded?

segments.t: It is Allāh who created the heavens and the earth
and whatever is between them in six days;
then He established Himself above the Throne.
You have not besides Him any protector or any intercessor;
so will you not be reminded?

32:5.t: He arranges [each] matter from the heaven to the earth; then it will ascend to Him in a Day, the extent of which is a thousand years of those which you count.

segments.t: He arranges [each] matter
from the heaven to the earth;
then it will ascend to Him in a Day,
the extent of which is a thousand years
of those which you count.

32:6.t: That is the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

segments.t: That is the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed,
the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

32:7.t: Who perfected everything which He created and began the creation of man from clay.

segments.t: Who perfected everything which He created
and began the creation of man from clay.

32:8.t: Then He made his posterity out of the extract of a liquid disdained.

segments.t: Then He made his posterity
out of the extract of a liquid disdained.

32:9.t: Then He proportioned him and breathed into him from His [created] soul and made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful.

segments.t: Then He proportioned him
and breathed into him from His [created] soul
and made for you hearing
and vision
and hearts [i.e., intellect];
little are you grateful.

33:1.t: O Prophet, fear Allāh and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: O Prophet, fear Allāh
and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

33:10.t: [Remember] when they came at you from above you and from below you, and when eyes shifted [in fear], and hearts reached the throats, and you assumed about Allāh [various] assumptions.

segments.t: [Remember] when they came at you
from above you and from below you,
and when eyes shifted [in fear],
and hearts reached the throats,
and you assumed about Allāh [various] assumptions.

33:11.t: There the believers were tested and shaken with a severe shaking.

segments.t: There the believers were tested
and shaken with a severe shaking.

33:12.t: And [remember] when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease said, "Allāh and His Messenger did not promise us except delusion,"

segments.t: And [remember] when the hypocrites
and those in whose hearts is disease said,
"Allāh and His Messenger did not promise us except delusion,"

33:13.t: And when a faction of them said, "O people of Yathrib, there is no stability for you [here], so return [home]." And a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying, "Indeed, our houses are exposed [i.e., unprotected]," while they were not exposed. They did not intend except to flee.

segments.t: And when a faction of them said,
"O people of Yathrib,
there is no stability for you [here],
so return [home]."
And a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying,
"Indeed, our houses are exposed [i.e., unprotected],"
while they were not exposed.
They did not intend except to flee.

33:14.t: And if they had been entered upon from all its [surrounding] regions and fitnah [i.e., disbelief] had been demanded of them, they would have done it and not hesitated over it except briefly.

segments.t: And if they had been entered upon
from all its [surrounding] regions
and fitnah [i.e., disbelief] had been demanded of them,
they would have done it
and not hesitated over it except briefly.

33:15.t: And they had already promised Allāh before not to turn their backs [i.e., flee]. And ever is the promise to Allāh [that about which one will be] questioned.

segments.t: And they had already promised Allāh before
not to turn their backs [i.e., flee].
And ever is the promise to Allāh
[that about which one will be] questioned.

33:16.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Never will fleeing benefit you if you should flee from death or killing; and then [if you did], you would not be given enjoyment [of life] except for a little."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Never will fleeing benefit you
if you should flee from death or killing;
and then [if you did],
you would not be given enjoyment [of life]
except for a little."

33:17.t: Say, "Who is it that can protect you from Allāh if He intends for you an ill or intends for you a mercy?" And they will not find for themselves besides Allāh any protector or any helper.

segments.t: Say, "Who is it that can protect you from Allāh
if He intends for you an ill
or intends for you a mercy?"
And they will not find for themselves besides Allāh
any protector or any helper.

33:18.t: Already Allāh knows the hinderers among you and those [hypocrites] who say to their brothers, "Come to us," and do not go to battle, except for a few,

segments.t: Already Allāh knows the hinderers among you
and those [hypocrites] who say to their brothers,
"Come to us,"
and do not go to battle,
except for a few,

33:19.t: Indisposed toward you. And when fear comes, you see them looking at you, their eyes revolving like one being overcome by death. But when fear departs, they lash you with sharp tongues, indisposed toward [any] good. Those have not believed, so Allāh has rendered their deeds worthless, and ever is that, for Allāh, easy.

segments.t: Indisposed toward you.
And when fear comes,
you see them looking at you,
their eyes revolving like one being overcome by death.
But when fear departs,
they lash you with sharp tongues,
indisposed toward [any] good.
Those have not believed,
so Allāh has rendered their deeds worthless,
and ever is that, for Allāh, easy.

33:2.t: And follow that which is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

segments.t: And follow that which is revealed to you from your Lord.
Indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

33:20.t: They think the companies have not [yet] withdrawn. And if the companies should come [again], they would wish they were in the desert among the bedouins, inquiring [from afar] about your news. And if they should be among you, they would not fight except for a little.

segments.t: They think the companies have not [yet] withdrawn.
And if the companies should come [again],
they would wish they were in the desert among the bedouins,
inquiring [from afar] about your news.
And if they should be among you,
they would not fight except for a little.

33:21.t: There has certainly been for you in the Messenger of Allāh an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allāh and the Last Day and [who] remembers Allāh often.

segments.t: There has certainly been for you
in the Messenger of Allāh an excellent pattern
for anyone whose hope is in Allāh and the Last Day
and [who] remembers Allāh often.

33:22.t: And when the believers saw the companies, they said, "This is what Allāh and His Messenger had promised us, and Allāh and His Messenger spoke the truth." And it increased them only in faith and acceptance.

segments.t: And when the believers saw the companies,
they said, "This is what Allāh and His Messenger had promised us,
and Allāh and His Messenger spoke the truth."
And it increased them only in faith and acceptance.

33:23.t: Among the believers are men true to what they promised Allāh. Among them is he who has fulfilled his vow [to the death], and among them is he who awaits [his chance]. And they did not alter [the terms of their commitment] by any alteration -

segments.t: Among the believers are men true to what they promised Allāh.
Among them is he who has fulfilled his vow [to the death],
and among them is he who awaits [his chance].
And they did not alter [the terms of their commitment] by any alteration -

33:24.t: That Allāh may reward the truthful for their truth and punish the hypocrites if He wills or accept their repentance. Indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: That Allāh may reward the truthful for their truth
and punish the hypocrites if He wills
or accept their repentance.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

33:25.t: And Allāh repelled those who disbelieved, in their rage, not having obtained any good. And sufficient was Allāh for the believers in battle, and ever is Allāh Powerful and Exalted in Might.

segments.t: And Allāh repelled those who disbelieved,
in their rage,
not having obtained any good.
And sufficient was Allāh for the believers in battle,
and ever is Allāh Powerful and Exalted in Might.

33:26.t: And He brought down those who supported them among the People of the Scripture from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts [so that] a party [i.e., their men] you killed, and you took captive a party [i.e., the women and children].

segments.t: And He brought down those who supported them
among the People of the Scripture from their fortresses
and cast terror into their hearts [so that] a party [i.e., their men] you killed,
and you took captive a party [i.e., the women and children].

33:27.t: And He caused you to inherit their land and their homes and their properties and a land which you have not trodden. And ever is Allāh, over all things, competent.

segments.t: And He caused you to inherit their land
and their homes
and their properties
and a land which you have not trodden.
And ever is Allāh,
over all things, competent.

33:28.t: O Prophet, say to your wives, "If you should desire the worldly life and its adornment, then come, I will provide for you and give you a gracious release.

segments.t: O Prophet, say to your wives,
"If you should desire the worldly life and its adornment,
then come, I will provide for you
and give you a gracious release.

33:29.t: But if you should desire Allāh and His Messenger and the home of the Hereafter - then indeed, Allāh has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward."

segments.t: But if you should desire Allāh and His Messenger
and the home of the Hereafter -
then indeed, Allāh has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward."

33:3.t: And rely upon Allāh; and sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

segments.t: And rely upon Allāh;
and sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

33:30.t: O wives of the Prophet, whoever of you should commit a clear immorality - for her the punishment would be doubled two fold, and ever is that, for Allāh, easy.

segments.t: O wives of the Prophet,
whoever of you should commit a clear immorality -
for her the punishment would be doubled two fold,
and ever is that, for Allāh, easy.

33:31.t: And whoever of you devoutly obeys Allāh and His Messenger and does righteousness - We will give her her reward twice; and We have prepared for her a noble provision.

segments.t: And whoever of you devoutly obeys Allāh and His Messenger
and does righteousness -
We will give her her reward twice;
and We have prepared for her a noble provision.

33:32.t: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like anyone among women. If you fear Allāh, then do not be soft in speech [to men], lest he in whose heart is disease should covet, but speak with appropriate speech.

segments.t: O wives of the Prophet,
you are not like anyone among women.
If you fear Allāh,
then do not be soft in speech [to men],
lest he in whose heart is disease should covet,
but speak with appropriate speech.

33:33.t: And abide in your houses and do not display yourselves as [was] the display of the former times of ignorance. And establish prayer and give zakāh and obey Allāh and His Messenger. Allāh intends only to remove from you the impurity [of sin], O people of the [Prophet's] household, and to purify you with [extensive] purification.

segments.t: And abide in your houses
and do not display yourselves as [was] the display of the former times of ignorance.
And establish prayer and give zakāh
and obey Allāh and His Messenger.
Allāh intends only to remove from you the impurity [of sin],
O people of the [Prophet's] household,
and to purify you with [extensive] purification.

33:34.t: And remember what is recited in your houses of the verses of Allāh and wisdom. Indeed, Allāh is ever Subtle and Aware.

segments.t: And remember what is recited in your houses
of the verses of Allāh and wisdom.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Subtle and Aware.

33:35.t: Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so, and the men who remember Allāh often and the women who do so - for them Allāh has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.

segments.t: Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women,
the believing men and believing women,
the obedient men and obedient women,
the truthful men and truthful women,
the patient men and patient women,
the humble men and humble women,
the charitable men and charitable women,
the fasting men and fasting women,
the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so,
and the men who remember Allāh often and the women who do so -
for them Allāh has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.

33:36.t: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allāh and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error.

segments.t: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman,
when Allāh and His Messenger have decided a matter,
that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair.
And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger
has certainly strayed into clear error.
