segments.t: Gardens of perpetual residence,
whose doors will be opened to them.

38:51.t: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

segments.t: Reclining within them,
they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

38:52.t: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.

segments.t: And with them will be women
limiting [their] glances
and of equal age.

38:53.t: This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.

segments.t: This is what you, [the righteous],
are promised for the Day of Account.

38:54.t: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.

segments.t: Indeed, this is Our provision;
for it there is no depletion.

38:55.t: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -

segments.t: This [is so].
But indeed, for the transgressors
is an evil place of return -

38:56.t: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.

segments.t: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn,
and wretched is the resting place.

38:57.t: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.

segments.t: This - so let them taste it -
is scalding water and [foul] purulence.

38:58.t: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.

segments.t: And other [punishments] of its type
[in various] kinds.

38:59.t: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."

segments.t: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you.
No welcome for them.
Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."

38:6.t: And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.

segments.t: And the eminent among them went forth,
[saying], "Continue,
and be patient over [the defense of] your gods.
Indeed, this is a thing intended.

38:60.t: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."

segments.t: They will say,
"Nor you!
No welcome for you.
You, [our leaders], brought this upon us,
and wretched is the settlement."

38:61.t: They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."

segments.t: They will say,
"Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us -
increase for him double punishment in the Fire."

38:62.t: And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?

segments.t: And they will say,
"Why do we not see men
whom we used to count among the worst?

38:63.t: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"

segments.t: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule,
or has [our] vision turned away from them?"

38:64.t: Indeed, that is truth [i.e., reality] - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

segments.t: Indeed, that is truth [i.e., reality] -
the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

38:65.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allāh, the One, the Prevailing,

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"I am only a warner,
and there is not any deity except Allāh,
the One, the Prevailing,

38:66.t: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver."

segments.t: Lord of the heavens and the earth
and whatever is between them,
the Exalted in Might,
the Perpetual Forgiver."
Say, "It is great news
From which you turn away.

38:69.t: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

segments.t: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels]
when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

38:7.t: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is not but a fabrication.

segments.t: We have not heard of this
in the latest religion.
This is not but a fabrication.

38:70.t: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."

segments.t: It has not been revealed to me
except that I am a clear warner."

38:71.t: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.

segments.t: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels,
"Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.

38:72.t: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

segments.t: So when I have proportioned him
and breathed into him of My [created] soul,
then fall down to him in prostration."

38:73.t: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

segments.t: So the angels prostrated -
all of them entirely,

38:74.t: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

segments.t: Except Iblees;
he was arrogant
and became among the disbelievers.

38:75.t: [Allāh] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"O Iblees,
what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands?
Were you arrogant [then],
or were you [already] among the haughty?"

38:76.t: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

segments.t: He said,
"I am better than him.
You created me from fire
and created him from clay."

38:77.t: [Allāh] said, "Then get out of it [i.e., Paradise], for indeed, you are expelled.

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Then get out of it [i.e., Paradise],
for indeed, you are expelled.

38:78.t: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."

segments.t: And indeed, upon you is My curse
until the Day of Recompense."

38:79.t: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord,
then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

38:8.t: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

segments.t: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?"
Rather, they are in doubt about My message.
Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

38:80.t: [Allāh] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"So indeed, you are of those reprieved

38:81.t: Until the Day of the time well-known."

segments.t: Until the Day of the time well-known."

38:82.t: [Iblees] said, "By Your might, I will surely mislead them all

segments.t: [Iblees] said,
"By Your might,
I will surely mislead them all

38:83.t: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

segments.t: Except, among them,
Your chosen servants."

38:84.t: [Allāh] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"The truth [is My oath],
and the truth I say -

38:85.t: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."

segments.t: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you
and those of them that follow you all together."

38:86.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I do not ask you for it [i.e., the Qur’ān] any payment, and I am not of the pretentious.

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"I do not ask you for it [i.e., the Qur’ān] any payment,
and I am not of the pretentious.

38:87.t: It is but a reminder to the worlds.

segments.t: It is but a reminder
to the worlds.

38:88.t: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."

segments.t: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information
after a time."

38:9.t: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?

segments.t: Or do they have the depositories
of the mercy of your Lord,
the Exalted in Might,
the Bestower?

39:1.t: The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] is from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
is from Allāh,
the Exalted in Might,
the Wise.

39:10.t: Say, "O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of Allāh is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account [i.e., limit]."

segments.t: Say, "O My servants who have believed,
fear your Lord.
For those who do good in this world is good,
and the earth of Allāh is spacious.
Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account [i.e., limit]."

39:11.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allāh,
[being] sincere to Him in religion.

39:12.t: And I have been commanded to be the first [among you] of the Muslims."

segments.t: And I have been commanded
to be the first [among you] of the Muslims."

39:13.t: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

segments.t: Say, "Indeed I fear,
if I should disobey my Lord,
the punishment of a tremendous Day."

39:14.t: Say, "Allāh [alone] do I worship, sincere to Him in my religion,

segments.t: Say, "Allāh [alone] do I worship,
sincere to Him in my religion,

39:15.t: So worship what you will besides Him." Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."

segments.t: So worship what you will besides Him."
Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves
and their families on the Day of Resurrection.
Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."

39:16.t: They will have canopies [i.e., layers] of fire above them and below them, canopies. By that Allāh threatens [i.e., warns] His servants. O My servants, then fear Me.

segments.t: They will have canopies [i.e., layers] of fire above them
and below them, canopies.
By that Allāh threatens [i.e., warns] His servants.
O My servants, then fear Me.

39:17.t: But those who have avoided ṭāghūt, lest they worship it, and turned back to Allāh - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings to My servants

segments.t: But those who have avoided ṭāghūt,
lest they worship it,
and turned back to Allāh -
for them are good tidings.
So give good tidings to My servants

39:18.t: Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones Allāh has guided, and those are people of understanding.

segments.t: Who listen to speech
and follow the best of it.
Those are the ones Allāh has guided,
and those are people of understanding.

39:19.t: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?

segments.t: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]?
Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?

39:2.t: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book, [O Muḥammad], in truth. So worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

segments.t: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book, [O Muḥammad], in truth.
So worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

39:20.t: But those who have feared their Lord - for them are chambers, above them chambers built high, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of Allāh. Allāh does not fail in [His] promise.

segments.t: But those who have feared their Lord -
for them are chambers,
above them chambers built high,
beneath which rivers flow.
[This is] the promise of Allāh.
Allāh does not fail in [His] promise.

39:21.t: Do you not see that Allāh sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth; then He produces thereby crops of varying colors; then they dry and you see them turned yellow; then He makes them [scattered] debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.

segments.t: Do you not see that Allāh sends down rain from the sky
and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth;
then He produces thereby crops of varying colors;
then they dry and you see them turned yellow;
then He makes them [scattered] debris.
Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.

39:22.t: So is one whose breast Allāh has expanded to [accept] Islām and he is upon [i.e., guided by] a light from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects it]? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allāh. Those are in manifest error.

segments.t: So is one whose breast Allāh has expanded to [accept] Islām
and he is upon [i.e., guided by] a light from his Lord
[like one whose heart rejects it]?
Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened
against the remembrance of Allāh.
Those are in manifest error.

39:23.t: Allāh has sent down the best statement: a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance [i.e., mention] of Allāh. That is the guidance of Allāh by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom Allāh sends astray - for him there is no guide.

segments.t: Allāh has sent down the best statement:
a consistent Book wherein is reiteration.
The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord;
then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance [i.e., mention] of Allāh.
That is the guidance of Allāh by which He guides whom He wills.
And one whom Allāh sends astray -
for him there is no guide.

39:24.t: Then is he who will shield with his face the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Taste what you used to earn."

segments.t: Then is he who will shield with his face
the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]?
And it will be said to the wrongdoers,
"Taste what you used to earn."

39:25.t: Those before them denied, and punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive.

segments.t: Those before them denied,
and punishment came upon them
from where they did not perceive.

39:26.t: So Allāh made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

segments.t: So Allāh made them taste disgrace in worldly life.
But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater,
if they only knew.

39:27.t: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur’ān from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.

segments.t: And We have certainly presented for the people
in this Qur’ān from every [kind of] example -
that they might remember.

39:28.t: [It is] an Arabic Qur’ān, without any deviance that they might become righteous.

segments.t: [It is] an Arabic Qur’ān,
without any deviance
that they might become righteous.

39:29.t: Allāh presents an example: a man [i.e., slave] owned by quarreling partners and another belonging exclusively to one man - are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allāh! But most of them do not know.

segments.t: Allāh presents an example:
a man [i.e., slave] owned by quarreling partners
and another belonging exclusively to one man -
are they equal in comparison?
Praise be to Allāh!
But most of them do not know.

39:3.t: Unquestionably, for Allāh is the pure religion. And those who take protectors besides Him [say], "We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allāh in position." Indeed, Allāh will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allāh does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disbeliever.

segments.t: Unquestionably, for Allāh is the pure religion.
And those who take protectors besides Him [say],
"We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allāh in position."
Indeed, Allāh will judge between them concerning that over which they differ.
Indeed, Allāh does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disbeliever.

39:30.t: Indeed, you are to die, and indeed, they are to die.

segments.t: Indeed, you are to die,
and indeed, they are to die.

39:31.t: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.

segments.t: Then indeed you,
on the Day of Resurrection,
before your Lord,
will dispute.

39:32.t: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allāh and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?

segments.t: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allāh
and denies the truth when it has come to him?
Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?

39:33.t: And the one who has brought the truth [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] and [they who] believed in it - those are the righteous.

segments.t: And the one who has brought the truth [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)]
and [they who] believed in it -
those are the righteous.

39:34.t: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good -

segments.t: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord.
That is the reward of the doers of good -

39:35.t: That Allāh may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.

segments.t: That Allāh may remove from them the worst of what they did
and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.

39:36.t: Is not Allāh sufficient for His Servant [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)]? And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him. And whoever Allāh leaves astray - for him there is no guide.

segments.t: Is not Allāh sufficient for His Servant [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)]?
And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him.
And whoever Allāh leaves astray -
for him there is no guide.

39:37.t: And whoever Allāh guides - for him there is no misleader. Is not Allāh Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?

segments.t: And whoever Allāh guides -
for him there is no misleader.
Is not Allāh Exalted in Might
and Owner of Retribution?

39:38.t: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "Allāh." Say, "Then have you considered what you invoke besides Allāh? If Allāh intended me harm, are they removers of His harm; or if He intended me mercy, are they withholders of His mercy?" Say, "Sufficient for me is Allāh; upon Him [alone] rely the [wise] reliers."

segments.t: And if you asked them,
"Who created the heavens and the earth?"
they would surely say, "Allāh."
Say, "Then have you considered what you invoke besides Allāh?
If Allāh intended me harm,
are they removers of His harm;
or if He intended me mercy,
are they withholders of His mercy?"
Say, "Sufficient for me is Allāh;
upon Him [alone] rely the [wise] reliers."

39:39.t: Say, "O my people, work according to your position, [for] indeed, I am working; and you are going to know

segments.t: Say, "O my people,
work according to your position,
[for] indeed, I am working;
and you are going to know

39:4.t: If Allāh had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is Allāh, the One, the Prevailing.

segments.t: If Allāh had intended to take a son,
He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed.
Exalted is He;
He is Allāh, the One, the Prevailing.

39:40.t: To whom will come a torment disgracing him and on whom will descend an enduring punishment."

segments.t: To whom will come a torment disgracing him
and on whom will descend an enduring punishment."

39:41.t: Indeed, We sent down to you the Book for the people in truth. So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager [i.e., authority] over them.

segments.t: Indeed, We sent down to you the Book for the people in truth.
So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul;
and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment.
And you are not a manager [i.e., authority] over them.

39:42.t: Allāh takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

segments.t: Allāh takes the souls at the time of their death,
and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep.
Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death
and releases the others for a specified term.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

39:43.t: Or have they taken other than Allāh as intercessors? Say, "Even though they do not possess [power over] anything, nor do they reason?"

segments.t: Or have they taken other than Allāh as intercessors?
Say, "Even though they do not possess [power over] anything,
nor do they reason?"

39:44.t: Say, "To Allāh belongs [the right to allow] intercession entirely. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."

segments.t: Say, "To Allāh belongs [the right to allow] intercession entirely.
To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth.
Then to Him you will be returned."

39:45.t: And when Allāh is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.

segments.t: And when Allāh is mentioned alone,
the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter
shrink with aversion,
but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned,
immediately they rejoice.

39:46.t: Say, "O Allāh, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between your servants concerning that over which they used to differ."

segments.t: Say, "O Allāh,
Creator of the heavens and the earth,
Knower of the unseen and the witnessed,
You will judge between your servants
concerning that over which they used to differ."

39:47.t: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby from the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from Allāh that which they had not taken into account.

segments.t: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely
and the like of it with it,
they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby
from the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection.
And there will appear to them from Allāh
that which they had not taken into account.

39:48.t: And there will appear to them the evils they had earned, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

segments.t: And there will appear to them the evils they had earned,
and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

39:49.t: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.

segments.t: And when adversity touches man,
he calls upon Us;
then when We bestow on him a favor from Us,
he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge."
Rather, it is a trial,
but most of them do not know.

39:5.t: He created the heavens and earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

segments.t: He created the heavens and earth in truth.
He wraps the night over the day
and wraps the day over the night
and has subjected the sun and the moon,
each running [its course] for a specified term.
Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

39:50.t: Those before them had already said it, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

segments.t: Those before them had already said it,
but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

39:51.t: And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them. And those who have wronged of these [people] will be struck [i.e., afflicted] by the evil consequences of what they earned; and they will not cause failure.

segments.t: And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them.
And those who have wronged of these [people] will be struck [i.e., afflicted]
by the evil consequences of what they earned;
and they will not cause failure.

39:52.t: Do they not know that Allāh extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

segments.t: Do they not know that Allāh extends provision for whom He wills
and restricts [it]?
Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

39:53.t: Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

segments.t: Say, "O My servants
who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning],
do not despair of the mercy of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh forgives all sins.
Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

39:54.t: And return [in repentance] to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be helped.

segments.t: And return [in repentance] to your Lord
and submit to Him
before the punishment comes upon you;
then you will not be helped.

39:55.t: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord [i.e., the Qur’ān] before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive,

segments.t: And follow the best of what was revealed to you
from your Lord [i.e., the Qur’ān]
before the punishment comes upon you suddenly
while you do not perceive,

39:56.t: Lest a soul should say, "Oh, [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to Allāh and that I was among the mockers."

segments.t: Lest a soul should say,
"Oh, [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to Allāh
and that I was among the mockers."

39:57.t: Or [lest] it say, "If only Allāh had guided me, I would have been among the righteous."

segments.t: Or [lest] it say,
"If only Allāh had guided me,
I would have been among the righteous."

39:58.t: Or [lest] it say when it sees the punishment, "If only I had another turn so I could be among the doers of good."

segments.t: Or [lest] it say when it sees the punishment,
"If only I had another turn
so I could be among the doers of good."

39:59.t: But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.

segments.t: But yes,
there had come to you My verses,
but you denied them
and were arrogant,
and you were among the disbelievers.

39:6.t: He created you from one soul. Then He made from it its mate, and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses. That is Allāh, your Lord; to Him belongs dominion. There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?

segments.t: He created you from one soul.
Then He made from it its mate,
and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates.
He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation,
within three darknesses.
That is Allāh, your Lord; to Him belongs dominion.
There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?

39:60.t: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about Allāh [with] their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?

segments.t: And on the Day of Resurrection
you will see those who lied about Allāh
[with] their faces blackened.
Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?

39:61.t: And Allāh will save those who feared Him by their attainment; no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

segments.t: And Allāh will save those who feared Him
by their attainment;
no evil will touch them,
nor will they grieve.

39:62.t: Allāh is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.

segments.t: Allāh is the Creator of all things,
and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.

39:63.t: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And they who disbelieve in the verses of Allāh - it is those who are the losers.

segments.t: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth.
And they who disbelieve in the verses of Allāh -
it is those who are the losers.

39:64.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Is it other than Allāh that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Is it other than Allāh
that you order me to worship,
O ignorant ones?"

39:65.t: And it was already revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with Allāh, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers.

segments.t: And it was already revealed to you
and to those before you
that if you should associate [anything] with Allāh,
your work would surely become worthless,
and you would surely be among the losers.

39:66.t: Rather, worship [only] Allāh and be among the grateful.

segments.t: Rather, worship [only] Allāh
and be among the grateful.

39:67.t: They have not appraised Allāh with true appraisal, while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

segments.t: They have not appraised Allāh with true appraisal,
while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip on the Day of Resurrection,
and the heavens will be folded in His right hand.
Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

39:68.t: And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allāh wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.

segments.t: And the Horn will be blown,
and whoever is in the heavens
and whoever is on the earth will fall dead
except whom Allāh wills.
Then it will be blown again,
and at once they will be standing, looking on.

39:69.t: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord,
and the record [of deeds] will be placed,
and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought,
and it will be judged between them in truth,
and they will not be wronged.

39:7.t: If you disbelieve - indeed, Allāh is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves [i.e., likes] it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

segments.t: If you disbelieve -
indeed, Allāh is Free from need of you.
And He does not approve for His servants disbelief.
And if you are grateful,
He approves [i.e., likes] it for you;
and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another.
Then to your Lord is your return,
and He will inform you about what you used to do.
Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

39:70.t: And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing of what they do.

segments.t: And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did;
and He is most knowing of what they do.

39:71.t: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word [i.e., decree] of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers."

segments.t: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups
until, when they reach it, its gates are opened
and its keepers will say,
"Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves,
reciting to you the verses of your Lord
and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?"
They will say, "Yes, but the word [i.e., decree] of punishment
has come into effect upon the disbelievers."

39:72.t: [To them] it will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

segments.t: [To them] it will be said,
"Enter the gates of Hell
to abide eternally therein,
and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

39:73.t: But those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it while its gates have been opened and its keepers say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally therein," [they will enter].

segments.t: But those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups
until, when they reach it while its gates have been opened
and its keepers say, "Peace be upon you;
you have become pure;
so enter it to abide eternally therein," [they will enter].

39:74.t: And they will say, "Praise to Allāh, who has fulfilled for us His promise and made us inherit the earth [so] we may settle in Paradise wherever we will. And excellent is the reward of [righteous] workers."

segments.t: And they will say,
"Praise to Allāh,
who has fulfilled for us His promise
and made us inherit the earth [so] we may settle in Paradise wherever we will.
And excellent is the reward of [righteous] workers."

39:75.t: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [Allāh] with praise of their Lord. And it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said, "[All] praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds."

segments.t: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne,
exalting [Allāh] with praise of their Lord.
And it will be judged between them in truth,
and it will be said,
"[All] praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds."

39:8.t: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him [alone]; then when He bestows on him a favor from Himself, he forgets Him whom he called upon before, and he attributes to Allāh equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."

segments.t: And when adversity touches man,
he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him [alone];
then when He bestows on him a favor from Himself,
he forgets Him whom he called upon before,
and he attributes to Allāh equals to mislead [people] from His way.
Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little;
indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."

39:9.t: Is one who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing [in prayer], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, [like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.

segments.t: Is one who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night,
prostrating and standing [in prayer],
fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord,
[like one who does not]?
Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?"
Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.
Alif, Lām, Meem.

3:10.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allāh at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve -
never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allāh at all.
And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.

3:100.t: O you who have believed, if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back, after your belief, [to being] unbelievers.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture,
they would turn you back,
after your belief,
[to being] unbelievers.

3:101.t: And how could you disbelieve while to you are being recited the verses of Allāh and among you is His Messenger? And whoever holds firmly to Allāh has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.

segments.t: And how could you disbelieve
while to you are being recited the verses of Allāh
and among you is His Messenger?
And whoever holds firmly to Allāh
has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.

3:102.t: O you who have believed, fear Allāh as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].

segments.t: O you who have believed,
fear Allāh as He should be feared
and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].

3:103.t: And hold firmly to the rope of Allāh all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allāh upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.

segments.t: And hold firmly to the rope of Allāh all together
and do not become divided.
And remember the favor of Allāh upon you -
when you were enemies
and He brought your hearts together
and you became, by His favor, brothers.
And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire,
and He saved you from it.
Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses
that you may be guided.

3:104.t: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.

segments.t: And let there be [arising] from you a nation
inviting to [all that is] good,
enjoining what is right
and forbidding what is wrong,
and those will be the successful.

3:105.t: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a great punishment

segments.t: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed
after the clear proofs had come to them.
And those will have a great punishment

3:106.t: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said], "Did you disbelieve [i.e., reject faith] after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject."

segments.t: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black.
As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said],
"Did you disbelieve [i.e., reject faith] after your belief?
Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject."

3:107.t: But as for those whose faces turn white, [they will be] within the mercy of Allāh. They will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: But as for those whose faces turn white,
[they will be] within the mercy of Allāh.
They will abide therein eternally.

3:108.t: These are the verses of Allāh. We recite them to you, [O Muḥammad], in truth; and Allāh wants no injustice to the worlds [i.e., His creatures].

segments.t: These are the verses of Allāh.
We recite them to you, [O Muḥammad], in truth;
and Allāh wants no injustice to the worlds [i.e., His creatures].

3:109.t: To Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to Allāh will [all] matters be returned.

segments.t: To Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And to Allāh will [all] matters be returned.

3:11.t: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allāh seized them for their sins. And Allāh is severe in penalty.

segments.t: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh
and those before them.
They denied Our signs,
so Allāh seized them for their sins.
And Allāh is severe in penalty.

3:110.t: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allāh. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind.
You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allāh.
If only the People of the Scripture had believed,
it would have been better for them.
Among them are believers,
but most of them are defiantly disobedient.

3:111.t: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance. And if they fight you, they will show you their backs [i.e., retreat]; then they will not be aided.

segments.t: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance.
And if they fight you,
they will show you their backs [i.e., retreat];
then they will not be aided.

3:112.t: They have been put under humiliation [by Allāh] wherever they are overtaken, except for a rope [i.e., covenant] from Allāh and a rope [i.e., treaty] from the people [i.e., the Muslims]. And they have drawn upon themselves anger from Allāh and have been put under destitution. That is because they disbelieved in [i.e., rejected] the verses of Allāh and killed the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.

segments.t: They have been put under humiliation [by Allāh] wherever they are overtaken,
except for a rope [i.e., covenant] from Allāh
and a rope [i.e., treaty] from the people [i.e., the Muslims].
And they have drawn upon themselves anger from Allāh
and have been put under destitution.
That is because they disbelieved in [i.e., rejected] the verses of Allāh
and killed the prophets without right.
That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.

3:113.t: They are not [all] the same; among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience], reciting the verses of Allāh during periods of the night and prostrating [in prayer].

segments.t: They are not [all] the same;
among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience],
reciting the verses of Allāh during periods of the night
and prostrating [in prayer].

3:114.t: They believe in Allāh and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and hasten to good deeds. And those are among the righteous.

segments.t: They believe in Allāh and the Last Day,
and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong
and hasten to good deeds.
And those are among the righteous.

3:115.t: And whatever good they do - never will it be denied them. And Allāh is Knowing of the righteous.

segments.t: And whatever good they do -
never will it be denied them.
And Allāh is Knowing of the righteous.

3:116.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allāh at all, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve -
never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allāh at all,
and those are the companions of the Fire;
they will abide therein eternally.

3:117.t: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves [i.e., sinned] and destroys it. And Allāh has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.

segments.t: The example of what they spend in this worldly life
is like that of a wind containing frost
which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves [i.e., sinned]
and destroys it.
And Allāh has not wronged them,
but they wrong themselves.

3:118.t: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves [i.e., believers], for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you will use reason.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not take as intimates those other than yourselves [i.e., believers],
for they will not spare you [any] ruin.
They wish you would have hardship.
Hatred has already appeared from their mouths,
and what their breasts conceal is greater.
We have certainly made clear to you the signs,
if you will use reason.

3:119.t: Here you are loving them but they are not loving you, while you believe in the Scripture - all of it. And when they meet you, they say, "We believe." But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you in rage. Say, "Die in your rage. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts."

segments.t: Here you are loving them but they are not loving you,
while you believe in the Scripture - all of it.
And when they meet you, they say, "We believe."
But when they are alone,
they bite their fingertips at you in rage.
Say, "Die in your rage.
Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts."

3:12.t: Say to those who disbelieve, "You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place."

segments.t: Say to those who disbelieve,
"You will be overcome
and gathered together to Hell,
and wretched is the resting place."

3:120.t: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. And if you are patient and fear Allāh, their plot will not harm you at all. Indeed, Allāh is encompassing of what they do.

segments.t: If good touches you, it distresses them;
but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it.
And if you are patient and fear Allāh,
their plot will not harm you at all.
Indeed, Allāh is encompassing of what they do.

3:121.t: And [remember] when you, [O Muḥammad], left your family in the morning to post the believers at their stations for the battle [of Uḥud] - and Allāh is Hearing and Knowing -

segments.t: And [remember] when you, [O Muḥammad],
left your family in the morning
to post the believers at their stations
for the battle [of Uḥud] -
and Allāh is Hearing and Knowing -

3:122.t: When two parties among you were about to lose courage, but Allāh was their ally; and upon Allāh the believers should rely.

segments.t: When two parties among you were about to lose courage,
but Allāh was their ally;
and upon Allāh the believers should rely.

3:123.t: And already had Allāh given you victory at [the battle of] Badr while you were weak [i.e., few in number]. Then fear Allāh; perhaps you will be grateful.

segments.t: And already had Allāh given you victory
at [the battle of] Badr
while you were weak [i.e., few in number].
Then fear Allāh;
perhaps you will be grateful.

3:124.t: [Remember] when you said to the believers, "Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?

segments.t: [Remember] when you said to the believers,
"Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you
with three thousand angels sent down?

3:125.t: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of Allāh and they [i.e., the enemy] come upon you [attacking] in rage, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]."

segments.t: Yes, if you remain patient
and conscious of Allāh
and they [i.e., the enemy] come upon you [attacking] in rage,
your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels
having marks [of distinction]."

3:126.t: And Allāh made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not except from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise -

segments.t: And Allāh made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you
and to reassure your hearts thereby.
And victory is not except from Allāh,
the Exalted in Might, the Wise -

3:127.t: That He might cut down a section of the disbelievers or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed.

segments.t: That He might cut down a section of the disbelievers
or suppress them
so that they turn back disappointed.

3:128.t: Not for you, [O Muḥammad, but for Allāh], is the decision whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them, for indeed, they are wrongdoers.

segments.t: Not for you, [O Muḥammad, but for Allāh], is the decision
whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them,
for indeed, they are wrongdoers.

3:129.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
He forgives whom He wills
and punishes whom He wills.
And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

3:13.t: Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met [in combat at Badr] - one fighting in the cause of Allāh and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allāh supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.

segments.t: Already there has been for you a sign
in the two armies which met [in combat at Badr] -
one fighting in the cause of Allāh
and another of disbelievers.
They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number
by [their] eyesight.
But Allāh supports with His victory whom He wills.
Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.

3:130.t: O you who have believed, do not consume usury, doubled and multiplied, but fear Allāh that you may be successful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not consume usury,
doubled and multiplied,
but fear Allāh that you may be successful.

3:131.t: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disbelievers.

segments.t: And fear the Fire,
which has been prepared for the disbelievers.

3:132.t: And obey Allāh and the Messenger that you may obtain mercy.

segments.t: And obey Allāh and the Messenger
that you may obtain mercy.

3:133.t: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden [i.e., Paradise] as wide as the heavens and earth, prepared for the righteous

segments.t: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord
and a garden [i.e., Paradise]
as wide as the heavens and earth,
prepared for the righteous

3:134.t: Who spend [in the cause of Allāh] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people - and Allāh loves the doers of good;

segments.t: Who spend [in the cause of Allāh] during ease and hardship
and who restrain anger
and who pardon the people -
and Allāh loves the doers of good;

3:135.t: And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves [by transgression], remember Allāh and seek forgiveness for their sins - and who can forgive sins except Allāh? - and [who] do not persist in what they have done while they know.

segments.t: And those who, when they commit an immorality
or wrong themselves [by transgression],
remember Allāh and seek forgiveness for their sins
- and who can forgive sins except Allāh? -
and [who] do not persist in what they have done
while they know.

3:136.t: Those - their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens beneath which rivers flow [in Paradise], wherein they will abide eternally; and excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.

segments.t: Those - their reward is forgiveness from their Lord
and gardens beneath which rivers flow [in Paradise],
wherein they will abide eternally;
and excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.

3:137.t: Similar situations [as yours] have passed on before you, so proceed throughout the earth and observe how was the end of those who denied.

segments.t: Similar situations [as yours] have passed on before you,
so proceed throughout the earth
and observe how was the end of those who denied.

3:138.t: This [Qur’ān] is a clear statement to [all] the people and a guidance and instruction for those conscious of Allāh.

segments.t: This [Qur’ān] is a clear statement to [all] the people
and a guidance and instruction for those conscious of Allāh.

3:139.t: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are [true] believers.

segments.t: So do not weaken and do not grieve,
and you will be superior if you are [true] believers.

3:14.t: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allāh has with Him the best return [i.e., Paradise].

segments.t: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire -
of women and sons,
heaped-up sums of gold and silver,
fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land.
That is the enjoyment of worldly life,
but Allāh has with Him the best return [i.e., Paradise].

3:140.t: If a wound should touch you - there has already touched the [opposing] people a wound similar to it. And these days [of varying conditions] We alternate among the people so that Allāh may make evident those who believe and [may] take to Himself from among you martyrs - and Allāh does not like the wrongdoers -

segments.t: If a wound should touch you -
there has already touched the [opposing] people a wound similar to it.
And these days [of varying conditions] We alternate among the people
so that Allāh may make evident those who believe
and [may] take to Himself from among you martyrs -
and Allāh does not like the wrongdoers -

3:141.t: And that Allāh may purify the believers [through trials] and destroy the disbelievers.

segments.t: And that Allāh may purify the believers [through trials]
and destroy the disbelievers.

3:142.t: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while Allāh has not yet made evident those of you who fight in His cause and made evident those who are steadfast?

segments.t: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise
while Allāh has not yet made evident those of you who fight in His cause
and made evident those who are steadfast?

3:143.t: And you had certainly wished for death [i.e., martyrdom] before you encountered it, and you have [now] seen it [before you] while you were looking on.

segments.t: And you had certainly wished for death [i.e., martyrdom]
before you encountered it,
and you have [now] seen it [before you]
while you were looking on.

3:144.t: Muḥammad is not but a messenger. [Other] messengers have passed on before him. So if he was to die or be killed, would you turn back on your heels [to unbelief]? And he who turns back on his heels will never harm Allāh at all; but Allāh will reward the grateful.

segments.t: Muḥammad is not but a messenger.
[Other] messengers have passed on before him.
So if he was to die or be killed,
would you turn back on your heels [to unbelief]?
And he who turns back on his heels will never harm Allāh at all;
but Allāh will reward the grateful.

3:145.t: And it is not [possible] for one to die except by permission of Allāh at a decree determined. And whoever desires the reward of this world - We will give him thereof; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter - We will give him thereof. And We will reward the grateful.

segments.t: And it is not [possible] for one to die
except by permission of Allāh
at a decree determined.
And whoever desires the reward of this world -
We will give him thereof;
and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter -
We will give him thereof.
And We will reward the grateful.

3:146.t: And how many a prophet [fought in battle and] with him fought many religious scholars. But they never lost assurance due to what afflicted them in the cause of Allāh, nor did they weaken or submit. And Allāh loves the steadfast.

segments.t: And how many a prophet [fought in battle and] with him fought many religious scholars.
But they never lost assurance due to what afflicted them in the cause of Allāh,
nor did they weaken or submit.
And Allāh loves the steadfast.

3:147.t: And their words were not but that they said, "Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people."

segments.t: And their words were not but that they said,
"Our Lord, forgive us our sins
and the excess [committed] in our affairs
and plant firmly our feet
and give us victory over the disbelieving people."

3:148.t: So Allāh gave them the reward of this world and the good reward of the Hereafter. And Allāh loves the doers of good.

segments.t: So Allāh gave them the reward of this world
and the good reward of the Hereafter.
And Allāh loves the doers of good.

3:149.t: O you who have believed, if you obey those who disbelieve, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will [then] become losers.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
if you obey those who disbelieve,
they will turn you back on your heels,
and you will [then] become losers.

3:15.t: Say, "Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allāh will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allāh. And Allāh is Seeing [i.e., aware] of [His] servants -

segments.t: Say, "Shall I inform you of [something] better than that?
For those who fear Allāh will be gardens in the presence of their Lord
beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they abide eternally,
and purified spouses and approval from Allāh.
And Allāh is Seeing [i.e., aware] of [His] servants -

3:150.t: But Allāh is your protector, and He is the best of helpers.

segments.t: But Allāh is your protector,
and He is the best of helpers.

3:151.t: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve for what they have associated with Allāh of which He had not sent down [any] authority. And their refuge will be the Fire, and wretched is the residence of the wrongdoers.

segments.t: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieve
for what they have associated with Allāh
of which He had not sent down [any] authority.
And their refuge will be the Fire,
and wretched is the residence of the wrongdoers.

3:152.t: And Allāh had certainly fulfilled His promise to you when you were killing them [i.e., the enemy] by His permission until [the time] when you lost courage and fell to disputing about the order [given by the Prophet (ﷺ)] and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you love. Among you are some who desire this world, and among you are some who desire the Hereafter. Then He turned you back from them [defeated] that He might test you. And He has already forgiven you, and Allāh is the possessor of bounty for the believers.

segments.t: And Allāh had certainly fulfilled His promise to you
when you were killing them [i.e., the enemy] by His permission
until [the time] when you lost courage
and fell to disputing about the order [given by the Prophet (ﷺ)]
and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you love.
Among you are some who desire this world,
and among you are some who desire the Hereafter.
Then He turned you back from them [defeated] that He might test you.
And He has already forgiven you,
and Allāh is the possessor of bounty for the believers.

3:153.t: [Remember] when you [fled and] climbed [the mountain] without looking aside at anyone while the Messenger was calling you from behind. So Allāh repaid you with distress upon distress so you would not grieve for that which had escaped you [of victory and spoils of war] or [for] that which had befallen you [of injury and death]. And Allāh is [fully] Aware of what you do.

segments.t: [Remember] when you [fled and] climbed [the mountain]
without looking aside at anyone
while the Messenger was calling you from behind.
So Allāh repaid you with distress upon distress
so you would not grieve for that which had escaped you [of victory and spoils of war]
or [for] that which had befallen you [of injury and death].
And Allāh is [fully] Aware of what you do.

3:154.t: Then after distress, He sent down upon you security [in the form of] drowsiness, overcoming a faction of you, while another faction worried about themselves, thinking of Allāh other than the truth - the thought of ignorance, saying, "Is there anything for us [to have done] in this matter?" Say, "Indeed, the matter belongs completely to Allāh." They conceal within themselves what they will not reveal to you. They say, "If there was anything we could have done in the matter, we [i.e., some of us] would not have been killed right here." Say, "Even if you had been inside your houses, those decreed to be killed would have come out to their death beds." [It was] so that Allāh might test what is in your breasts and purify what is in your hearts. And Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.

segments.t: Then after distress,
He sent down upon you security [in the form of] drowsiness,
overcoming a faction of you,
while another faction worried about themselves,
thinking of Allāh other than the truth - the thought of ignorance,
saying, "Is there anything for us [to have done] in this matter?"
Say, "Indeed, the matter belongs completely to Allāh."

[It was] so that Allāh might test what is in your breasts

And Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.

3:155.t: Indeed, those of you who turned back on the day the two armies met [at Uḥud] - it was Satan who caused them to slip because of some [blame] they had earned. But Allāh has already forgiven them. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Forbearing.

segments.t: Indeed, those of you who turned back
on the day the two armies met [at Uḥud] -
it was Satan who caused them to slip
because of some [blame] they had earned.
But Allāh has already forgiven them.
Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Forbearing.

3:156.t: O you who have believed, do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brothers when they traveled through the land or went out to fight, "If they had been with us, they would not have died or have been killed," so Allāh makes that [misconception] a regret within their hearts. And it is Allāh who gives life and causes death, and Allāh is Seeing of what you do.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not be like those who disbelieved
and said about their brothers
when they traveled through the land
or went out to fight,
"If they had been with us,
they would not have died or have been killed,"
so Allāh makes that [misconception] a regret within their hearts.
And it is Allāh who gives life and causes death,
and Allāh is Seeing of what you do.

3:157.t: And if you are killed in the cause of Allāh or die - then forgiveness from Allāh and mercy are better than whatever they accumulate [in this world].

segments.t: And if you are killed in the cause of Allāh or die -
then forgiveness from Allāh and mercy are better
than whatever they accumulate [in this world].

3:158.t: And whether you die or are killed, unto Allāh you will be gathered.

segments.t: And whether you die or are killed,
unto Allāh you will be gathered.

3:159.t: So by mercy from Allāh, [O Muḥammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allāh. Indeed, Allāh loves those who rely [upon Him].

segments.t: So by mercy from Allāh, [O Muḥammad],
you were lenient with them.
And if you had been rude [in speech]
and harsh in heart,
they would have disbanded from about you.
So pardon them
and ask forgiveness for them
and consult them in the matter.
And when you have decided,
then rely upon Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh loves those who rely [upon Him].

3:16.t: Those who say, 'Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,' "

segments.t: Those who say,
'Our Lord, indeed we have believed,
so forgive us our sins
and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,' "

3:160.t: If Allāh should aid you, no one can overcome you; but if He should forsake you, who is there that can aid you after Him? And upon Allāh let the believers rely.

segments.t: If Allāh should aid you,
no one can overcome you;
but if He should forsake you,
who is there that can aid you after Him?
And upon Allāh let the believers rely.

3:161.t: It is not [attributable] to any prophet that he would act unfaithfully [in regard to war booty]. And whoever betrays, [taking unlawfully], will come with what he took on the Day of Resurrection. Then will every soul be [fully] compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: It is not [attributable] to any prophet
that he would act unfaithfully [in regard to war booty].
And whoever betrays, [taking unlawfully],
will come with what he took on the Day of Resurrection.
Then will every soul be [fully] compensated for what it earned,
and they will not be wronged.

3:162.t: So is one who pursues the pleasure of Allāh like one who brings upon himself the anger of Allāh and whose refuge is Hell? And wretched is the destination.

segments.t: So is one who pursues the pleasure of Allāh
like one who brings upon himself the anger of Allāh
and whose refuge is Hell?
And wretched is the destination.

3:163.t: They are [varying] degrees in the sight of Allāh, and Allāh is Seeing of whatever they do.

segments.t: They are [varying] degrees
in the sight of Allāh,
and Allāh is Seeing of whatever they do.

3:164.t: Certainly did Allāh confer [great] favor upon the believers when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] and wisdom, although they had been before in manifest error.

segments.t: Certainly did Allāh confer [great] favor upon the believers
when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves,
reciting to them His verses
and purifying them
and teaching them the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] and wisdom,
although they had been before in manifest error.

3:165.t: Why [is it that] when a [single] disaster struck you [on the day of Uḥud], although you had struck [the enemy in the battle of Badr] with one twice as great, you said, "From where is this?" Say, "It is from yourselves [i.e., due to your sin]." Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

segments.t: Why [is it that] when a [single] disaster struck you [on the day of Uḥud],
although you had struck [the enemy in the battle of Badr] with one twice as great,
you said, "From where is this?"
Say, "It is from yourselves [i.e., due to your sin]."
Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.

3:166.t: And what struck you on the day the two armies met [at Uḥud] was by permission of Allāh that He might make evident the [true] believers

segments.t: And what struck you on the day the two armies met [at Uḥud]
was by permission of Allāh
that He might make evident the [true] believers

3:167.t: And that He might make evident those who are hypocrites. For it was said to them, "Come, fight in the way of Allāh or [at least] defend." They said, "If we had known [there would be] battle, we would have followed you." They were nearer to disbelief that day than to faith, saying with their mouths what was not in their hearts. And Allāh is most knowing of what they conceal -

segments.t: And that He might make evident those who are hypocrites.
For it was said to them,
"Come, fight in the way of Allāh or [at least] defend."
They said,
"If we had known [there would be] battle,
we would have followed you."
They were nearer to disbelief that day than to faith,
saying with their mouths what was not in their hearts.
And Allāh is most knowing of what they conceal -

3:168.t: Those who said about their brothers while sitting [at home], "If they had obeyed us, they would not have been killed." Say, "Then prevent death from yourselves, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Those who said about their brothers while sitting [at home],
"If they had obeyed us,
they would not have been killed."
Say, "Then prevent death from yourselves,
if you should be truthful."

3:169.t: And never think of those who have been killed in the cause of Allāh as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, receiving provision,

segments.t: And never think of those who have been killed
in the cause of Allāh as dead.
Rather, they are alive with their Lord,
receiving provision,

3:17.t: The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allāh], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.

segments.t: The patient,
the true,
the obedient,
those who spend [in the way of Allāh],
and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.

3:170.t: Rejoicing in what Allāh has bestowed upon them of His bounty, and they receive good tidings about those [to be martyred] after them who have not yet joined them - that there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

segments.t: Rejoicing in what Allāh has bestowed upon them of His bounty,
and they receive good tidings about those [to be martyred] after them
who have not yet joined them -
that there will be no fear concerning them,
nor will they grieve.

3:171.t: They receive good tidings of favor from Allāh and bounty and [of the fact] that Allāh does not allow the reward of believers to be lost -

segments.t: They receive good tidings of favor from Allāh and bounty
and [of the fact] that Allāh does not allow the reward of believers to be lost -

3:172.t: Those [believers] who responded to Allāh and the Messenger after injury had struck them. For those who did good among them and feared Allāh is a great reward -

segments.t: Those [believers] who responded to Allāh and the Messenger
after injury had struck them.
For those who did good among them and feared Allāh
is a great reward -

3:173.t: Those to whom people [i.e., hypocrites] said, "Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them." But it [merely] increased them in faith, and they said, "Sufficient for us is Allāh, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs."

segments.t: Those to whom people [i.e., hypocrites] said,
"Indeed, the people have gathered against you,
so fear them."
But it [merely] increased them in faith,
and they said,
"Sufficient for us is Allāh,
and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs."

3:174.t: So they returned with favor from Allāh and bounty, no harm having touched them. And they pursued the pleasure of Allāh, and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

segments.t: So they returned with favor from Allāh and bounty,
no harm having touched them.
And they pursued the pleasure of Allāh,
and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

3:175.t: That is only Satan who frightens [you] of his supporters. So fear them not, but fear Me, if you are [indeed] believers.

segments.t: That is only Satan
who frightens [you] of his supporters.
So fear them not,
but fear Me,
if you are [indeed] believers.

3:176.t: And do not be grieved, [O Muḥammad], by those who hasten into disbelief. Indeed, they will never harm Allāh at all. Allāh intends that He should give them no share in the Hereafter, and for them is a great punishment.

segments.t: And do not be grieved, [O Muḥammad],
by those who hasten into disbelief.
Indeed, they will never harm Allāh at all.
Allāh intends that He should give them no share in the Hereafter,
and for them is a great punishment.

3:177.t: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief [in exchange] for faith - never will they harm Allāh at all, and for them is a painful punishment.

segments.t: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief [in exchange] for faith -
never will they harm Allāh at all,
and for them is a painful punishment.

3:178.t: And let not those who disbelieve ever think that [because] We extend their time [of enjoyment] it is better for them. We only extend it for them so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: And let not those who disbelieve ever think that [because] We extend their time [of enjoyment] it is better for them.
We only extend it for them so that they may increase in sin,
and for them is a humiliating punishment.

3:179.t: Allāh would not leave the believers in that [state] you are in [presently] until He separates the evil from the good. Nor would Allāh reveal to you the unseen. But [instead], Allāh chooses of His messengers whom He wills, so believe in Allāh and His messengers. And if you believe and fear Him, then for you is a great reward.

segments.t: Allāh would not leave the believers in that [state] you are in [presently]
until He separates the evil from the good.
Nor would Allāh reveal to you the unseen.
But [instead], Allāh chooses of His messengers whom He wills,
so believe in Allāh and His messengers.
And if you believe and fear Him,
then for you is a great reward.

3:18.t: Allāh witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Allāh witnesses that there is no deity except Him,
and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge -
[that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice.
There is no deity except Him,
the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

3:180.t: And let not those who [greedily] withhold what Allāh has given them of His bounty ever think that it is better for them. Rather, it is worse for them. Their necks will be encircled by what they withheld on the Day of Resurrection. And to Allāh belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh, of what you do, is [fully] Aware.

segments.t: And let not those who [greedily] withhold what Allāh has given them of His bounty
ever think that it is better for them.
Rather, it is worse for them.
Their necks will be encircled by what they withheld on the Day of Resurrection.
And to Allāh belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth.
And Allāh, of what you do, is [fully] Aware.

3:181.t: Allāh has certainly heard the statement of those [Jews] who said, "Indeed, Allāh is poor, while we are rich." We will record what they said and their killing of the prophets without right and will say, "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.

segments.t: Allāh has certainly heard the statement of those [Jews] who said,
"Indeed, Allāh is poor, while we are rich."
We will record what they said
and their killing of the prophets without right
and will say,
"Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.

3:182.t: That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allāh is not ever unjust to [His] servants."

segments.t: That is for what your hands have put forth
and because Allāh is not ever unjust to [His] servants."

3:183.t: [They are] those who said, "Indeed, Allāh has taken our promise not to believe any messenger until he brings us an offering which fire [from heaven] will consume." Say, "There have already come to you messengers before me with clear proofs and [even] that of which you speak. So why did you kill them, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: [They are] those who said,
"Indeed, Allāh has taken our promise
not to believe any messenger
until he brings us an offering
which fire [from heaven] will consume."
Say, "There have already come to you messengers before me
with clear proofs and [even] that of which you speak.
So why did you kill them,
if you should be truthful?"

3:184.t: Then if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] - so were messengers denied before you, who brought clear proofs and written ordinances and the enlightening Scripture.

segments.t: Then if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] -
so were messengers denied before you,
who brought clear proofs
and written ordinances
and the enlightening Scripture.

3:185.t: Every soul will taste death, and you will only be given your [full] compensation on the Day of Resurrection. So he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise has attained [his desire]. And what is the life of this world except the enjoyment of delusion.

segments.t: Every soul will taste death,
and you will only be given your [full] compensation on the Day of Resurrection.
So he who is drawn away from the Fire
and admitted to Paradise has attained [his desire].
And what is the life of this world
except the enjoyment of delusion.

3:186.t: You will surely be tested in your possessions and in yourselves. And you will surely hear from those who were given the Scripture before you and from those who associate others with Allāh much abuse. But if you are patient and fear Allāh - indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of resolve.

segments.t: You will surely be tested in your possessions and in yourselves.
And you will surely hear from those who were given the Scripture before you
and from those who associate others with Allāh much abuse.
But if you are patient and fear Allāh -
indeed, that is of the matters [worthy] of resolve.

3:187.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Allāh took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture, [saying], "You must make it clear [i.e., explain it] to the people and not conceal it." But they threw it away behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price. And wretched is that which they purchased.

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when Allāh took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture,
[saying], "You must make it clear [i.e., explain it] to the people
and not conceal it."
But they threw it away behind their backs
and exchanged it for a small price.
And wretched is that which they purchased.

3:188.t: And never think that those who rejoice in what they have perpetrated and like to be praised for what they did not do - never think them [to be] in safety from the punishment, and for them is a painful punishment.

segments.t: And never think that those who rejoice in what they have perpetrated
and like to be praised for what they did not do -
never think them [to be] in safety from the punishment,
and for them is a painful punishment.

3:189.t: And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and Allāh is over all things competent.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs the dominion
of the heavens and the earth,
and Allāh is over all things competent.

3:19.t: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allāh is Islām. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allāh, then indeed, Allāh is swift in [taking] account.

segments.t: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allāh is Islām.
And those who were given the Scripture did not differ
except after knowledge had come to them -
out of jealous animosity between themselves.
And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allāh,
then indeed, Allāh is swift in [taking] account.

3:190.t: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth and the alternation of the night and the day are signs for those of understanding -

segments.t: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth
and the alternation of the night and the day
are signs for those of understanding -

3:191.t: Who remember Allāh while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying], "Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

segments.t: Who remember Allāh while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides
and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying],
"Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly;
exalted are You [above such a thing];
then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

3:192.t: Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

segments.t: Our Lord,
indeed whoever You admit to the Fire -
You have disgraced him,
and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

3:193.t: Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die among the righteous.

segments.t: Our Lord,
indeed we have heard a caller [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] calling to faith,
[saying], 'Believe in your Lord,'
and we have believed.
Our Lord, so forgive us our sins
