and remove from us our misdeeds
and cause us to die among the righteous.

3:194.t: Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise."

segments.t: Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers
and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection.
Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise."

3:195.t: And their Lord responded to them, "Never will I allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another. So those who emigrated or were evicted from their homes or were harmed in My cause or fought or were killed - I will surely remove from them their misdeeds, and I will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow as reward from Allāh, and Allāh has with Him the best reward."

segments.t: And their Lord responded to them,
"Never will I allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you,
whether male or female;
you are of one another.
So those who emigrated or were evicted from their homes
or were harmed in My cause or fought or were killed -
I will surely remove from them their misdeeds,
and I will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow
as reward from Allāh,
and Allāh has with Him the best reward."

3:196.t: Be not deceived by the [uninhibited] movement of the disbelievers throughout the land.

segments.t: Be not deceived by the [uninhibited] movement
of the disbelievers throughout the land.

3:197.t: [It is but] a small enjoyment; then their [final] refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.

segments.t: [It is but] a small enjoyment;
then their [final] refuge is Hell,
and wretched is the resting place.

3:198.t: But those who feared their Lord will have gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein, as accommodation from Allāh. And that which is with Allāh is best for the righteous.

segments.t: But those who feared their Lord will have gardens
beneath which rivers flow,
abiding eternally therein,
as accommodation from Allāh.
And that which is with Allāh is best for the righteous.

3:199.t: And indeed, among the People of the Scripture are those who believe in Allāh and what was revealed to you and what was revealed to them, [being] humbly submissive to Allāh. They do not exchange the verses of Allāh for a small price. Those will have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.

segments.t: And indeed, among the People of the Scripture
are those who believe in Allāh
and what was revealed to you
and what was revealed to them,
[being] humbly submissive to Allāh.
They do not exchange the verses of Allāh for a small price.
Those will have their reward with their Lord.
Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.

3:2.t: Allāh - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Self-Sustaining.

segments.t: Allāh -
there is no deity except Him,
the Ever-Living,
the Self-Sustaining.

3:20.t: So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to Allāh [in Islām], and [so have] those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, "Have you submitted yourselves?" And if they submit [in Islām], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allāh is Seeing of [His] servants.

segments.t: So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to Allāh [in Islām],
and [so have] those who follow me."
And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned,
"Have you submitted yourselves?"
And if they submit [in Islām], they are rightly guided;
but if they turn away -
then upon you is only the [duty of] notification.
And Allāh is Seeing of [His] servants.

3:200.t: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allāh that you may be successful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
persevere and endure
and remain stationed
and fear Allāh
that you may be successful.

3:21.t: Those who disbelieve in the signs of Allāh and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice from among the people - give them tidings of a painful punishment.

segments.t: Those who disbelieve in the signs of Allāh
and kill the prophets without right
and kill those who order justice from among the people
- give them tidings of a painful punishment.

3:22.t: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there will be no helpers.

segments.t: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless
in this world and the Hereafter,
and for them there will be no helpers.

3:23.t: Do you not consider, [O Muḥammad], those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They are invited to the Scripture of Allāh that it should arbitrate between them; then a party of them turns away, and they are refusing.

segments.t: Do you not consider, [O Muḥammad], those who were given a portion of the Scripture?
They are invited to the Scripture of Allāh that it should arbitrate between them;
then a party of them turns away, and they are refusing.

3:24.t: That is because they say, "Never will the Fire touch us except for [a few] numbered days," and [because] they were deluded in their religion by what they were inventing.

segments.t: That is because they say,
"Never will the Fire touch us
except for [a few] numbered days,"
and [because] they were deluded in their religion
by what they were inventing.

3:25.t: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no doubt? And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned, and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day
about which there is no doubt?
And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned,
and they will not be wronged.

3:26.t: Say, "O Allāh, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.

segments.t: Say, "O Allāh, Owner of Sovereignty,
You give sovereignty to whom You will
and You take sovereignty away from whom You will.
You honor whom You will
and You humble whom You will.
In Your hand is [all] good.
Indeed, You are over all things competent.

3:27.t: You cause the night to enter the day, and You cause the day to enter the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living. And You give provision to whom You will without account [i.e., limit or measure]."

segments.t: You cause the night to enter the day,
and You cause the day to enter the night;
and You bring the living out of the dead,
and You bring the dead out of the living.
And You give provision to whom You will without account [i.e., limit or measure]."

3:28.t: Let not believers take disbelievers as allies [i.e., supporters or protectors] rather than believers. And whoever [of you] does that has nothing [i.e., no association] with Allāh, except when taking precaution against them in prudence. And Allāh warns you of Himself, and to Allāh is the [final] destination.

segments.t: Let not believers take disbelievers as allies [i.e., supporters or protectors]
rather than believers.
And whoever [of you] does that has nothing [i.e., no association] with Allāh,
except when taking precaution against them in prudence.
And Allāh warns you of Himself,
and to Allāh is the [final] destination.

3:29.t: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allāh knows it. And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And Allāh is over all things competent.

segments.t: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it,
Allāh knows it.
And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth.
And Allāh is over all things competent.

3:3.t: He has sent down upon you, [O Muḥammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel

segments.t: He has sent down upon you, [O Muḥammad],
the Book in truth,
confirming what was before it.
And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel

3:30.t: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And Allāh warns you of Himself, and Allāh is Kind to [His] servants."

segments.t: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it]
and what it has done of evil,
it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance.
And Allāh warns you of Himself,
and Allāh is Kind to [His] servants."

3:31.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "If you should love Allāh, then follow me, [so] Allāh will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"If you should love Allāh,
then follow me, [so] Allāh will love you
and forgive you your sins.
And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful."

3:32.t: Say, "Obey Allāh and the Messenger. But if you turn away - then indeed, Allāh does not like the disbelievers."

segments.t: Say, "Obey Allāh and the Messenger.
But if you turn away -
then indeed, Allāh does not like the disbelievers."

3:33.t: Indeed, Allāh chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of ʿImrān over the worlds -

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh chose Adam and Noah
and the family of Abraham
and the family of ʿImrān over the worlds -

3:34.t: Descendants, some of them from others. And Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

segments.t: Descendants, some of them from others.
And Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

3:35.t: [Mention, O Muḥammad], when the wife of ʿImrān said, "My Lord, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb, consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing."

segments.t: [Mention, O Muḥammad], when the wife of ʿImrān said,
"My Lord, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb,
consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me.
Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing."

3:36.t: But when she delivered her, she said, "My Lord, I have delivered a female." And Allāh was most knowing of what she delivered, and the male is not like the female. "And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allāh]."

segments.t: But when she delivered her, she said,
"My Lord, I have delivered a female."
And Allāh was most knowing of what she delivered,
and the male is not like the female.
"And I have named her Mary,
and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants
from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allāh]."

3:37.t: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provision. He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?" She said, "It is from Allāh. Indeed, Allāh provides for whom He wills without account."

segments.t: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance
and caused her to grow in a good manner
and put her in the care of Zechariah.
Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber,
he found with her provision.
He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?"
She said, "It is from Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh provides for whom He wills without account."

3:38.t: At that, Zechariah called upon his Lord, saying, "My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication."

segments.t: At that, Zechariah called upon his Lord, saying,
"My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring.
Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication."

3:39.t: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, "Indeed, Allāh gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allāh and [who will be] honorable, abstaining [from women], and a prophet from among the righteous."

segments.t: So the angels called him
while he was standing in prayer in the chamber,
"Indeed, Allāh gives you good tidings of John,
confirming a word from Allāh
and [who will be] honorable,
abstaining [from women],
and a prophet from among the righteous."

3:4.t: Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Criterion [i.e., the Qur’ān]. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allāh will have a severe punishment, and Allāh is Exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.

segments.t: Before, as guidance for the people.
And He revealed the Criterion [i.e., the Qur’ān].
Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allāh will have a severe punishment,
and Allāh is Exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.

3:40.t: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when I have reached old age and my wife is barren?" He [the angel] said, "Such is Allāh; He does what He wills."

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord, how will I have a boy
when I have reached old age
and my wife is barren?"
He [the angel] said,
"Such is Allāh;
He does what He wills."

3:41.t: He said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture. And remember your Lord much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."

segments.t: He said,
"My Lord, make for me a sign."
He said,
"Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people
for three days except by gesture.
And remember your Lord much
and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."

3:42.t: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allāh has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.

segments.t: And [mention] when the angels said,
"O Mary,
indeed Allāh has chosen you and purified you
and chosen you above the women of the worlds.

3:43.t: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer]."

segments.t: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord
and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer]."

3:44.t: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muḥammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.

segments.t: That is from the news of the unseen
which We reveal to you, [O Muḥammad].
And you were not with them
when they cast their pens
as to which of them should be responsible for Mary.
Nor were you with them when they disputed.

3:45.t: [And mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allāh gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allāh].

segments.t: [And mention] when the angels said,
"O Mary, indeed Allāh gives you good tidings of a word from Him,
whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary -
distinguished in this world and the Hereafter
and among those brought near [to Allāh].

3:46.t: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous."

segments.t: He will speak to the people in the cradle
and in maturity
and will be of the righteous."

3:47.t: She said, "My Lord, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] said, "Such is Allāh; He creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.

segments.t: She said,
"My Lord, how will I have a child
when no man has touched me?"
[The angel] said,
"Such is Allāh;
He creates what He wills.
When He decrees a matter,
He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.

3:48.t: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel

segments.t: And He will teach him writing and wisdom
and the Torah and the Gospel

3:49.t: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel, [who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of Allāh. And I cure the blind [from birth] and the leper, and I give life to the dead - by permission of Allāh. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.

segments.t: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel,
[who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord
in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird,
then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of Allāh.
And I cure the blind [from birth] and the leper,
and I give life to the dead - by permission of Allāh.
And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses.
Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.

3:5.t: Indeed, from Allāh nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.

segments.t: Indeed, from Allāh nothing is hidden
in the earth nor in the heaven.

3:50.t: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allāh and obey me.

segments.t: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah
and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you.
And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord,
so fear Allāh and obey me.

3:51.t: Indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is the straight path.'"

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh is my Lord and your Lord,
so worship Him.
That is the straight path.'"

3:52.t: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them, he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] Allāh?" The disciples said, "We are supporters for Allāh. We have believed in Allāh and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].

segments.t: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them,
he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] Allāh?"
The disciples said, "We are supporters for Allāh.
We have believed in Allāh and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].

3:53.t: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger [i.e., Jesus], so register us among the witnesses [to truth]."

segments.t: Our Lord,
we have believed in what You revealed
and have followed the messenger [i.e., Jesus],
so register us among the witnesses [to truth]."

3:54.t: And they [i.e., the disbelievers] planned, but Allāh planned. And Allāh is the best of planners.

segments.t: And they [i.e., the disbelievers] planned,
but Allāh planned.
And Allāh is the best of planners.

3:55.t: [Mention] when Allāh said, "O Jesus, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify [i.e., free] you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you [in submission to Allāh alone] superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.

segments.t: [Mention] when Allāh said,
"O Jesus,
indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself
and purify [i.e., free] you from those who disbelieve
and make those who follow you [in submission to Allāh alone]
superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection.
Then to Me is your return,
and I will judge between you
concerning that in which you used to differ.

3:56.t: And as for those who disbelieved, I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers."

segments.t: And as for those who disbelieved,
I will punish them with a severe punishment
in this world and the Hereafter,
and they will have no helpers."

3:57.t: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards, and Allāh does not like the wrongdoers.

segments.t: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds,
He will give them in full their rewards,
and Allāh does not like the wrongdoers.

3:58.t: This is what We recite to you, [O Muḥammad], of [Our] verses and the precise [and wise] message [i.e., the Qur’ān].

segments.t: This is what We recite to you,
[O Muḥammad], of [Our] verses
and the precise [and wise] message [i.e., the Qur’ān].

3:59.t: Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allāh is like that of Adam. He created him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.

segments.t: Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allāh
is like that of Adam.
He created him from dust;
then He said to him, "Be," and he was.

3:6.t: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: It is He who forms you in the wombs
however He wills.
There is no deity except Him,
the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

3:60.t: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.

segments.t: The truth is from your Lord,
so do not be among the doubters.

3:61.t: Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allāh upon the liars [among us]."

segments.t: Then whoever argues with you about it
after [this] knowledge has come to you -
say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons,
our women and your women,
ourselves and yourselves,
then supplicate earnestly [together]
and invoke the curse of Allāh upon the liars [among us]."

3:62.t: Indeed, this is the true narration. And there is no deity except Allāh. And indeed, Allāh is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Indeed, this is the true narration.
And there is no deity except Allāh.
And indeed, Allāh is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

3:63.t: But if they turn away, then indeed - Allāh is Knowing of the corrupters.

segments.t: But if they turn away,
then indeed - Allāh is Knowing of the corrupters.

3:64.t: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allāh and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allāh." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."

segments.t: Say, "O People of the Scripture,
come to a word that is equitable between us and you -
that we will not worship except Allāh
and not associate anything with Him
and not take one another as lords instead of Allāh."
But if they turn away,
then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."

3:65.t: O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?

segments.t: O People of the Scripture,
why do you argue about Abraham
while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him?
Then will you not reason?

3:66.t: Here you are - those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge, but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allāh knows, while you know not.

segments.t: Here you are -
those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge,
but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge?
And Allāh knows,
while you know not.

3:67.t: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was one inclining toward truth, a Muslim [submitting to Allāh]. And he was not of the polytheists.

segments.t: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian,
but he was one inclining toward truth, a Muslim [submitting to Allāh].
And he was not of the polytheists.

3:68.t: Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to Allāh] and this prophet [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] and those who believe [in his message]. And Allāh is the Ally of the believers.

segments.t: Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people
are those who followed him [in submission to Allāh]
and this prophet [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)]
and those who believe [in his message].
And Allāh is the Ally of the believers.

3:69.t: A faction of the People of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.

segments.t: A faction of the People of the Scripture
wish they could mislead you.
But they do not mislead except themselves,
and they perceive [it] not.

3:7.t: It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allāh. But those firm in knowledge say, "We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord." And no one will be reminded except those of understanding,

segments.t: It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Book;
in it are verses [that are] precise -
they are the foundation of the Book -
and others unspecific.
As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth],
they will follow that of it which is unspecific,
seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them].
And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allāh.
But those firm in knowledge say, "We believe in it.
All [of it] is from our Lord."
And no one will be reminded except those of understanding,

3:70.t: O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allāh while you witness [to their truth]?

segments.t: O People of the Scripture,
why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allāh
while you witness [to their truth]?

3:71.t: O People of the Scripture, why do you mix [i.e., confuse] the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know [it]?

segments.t: O People of the Scripture,
why do you mix [i.e., confuse] the truth with falsehood
and conceal the truth while you know [it]?

3:72.t: And a faction of the People of the Scripture say [to each other], "Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end that perhaps they will return [i.e., abandon their religion],

segments.t: And a faction of the People of the Scripture say [to each other],
"Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day
and reject it at its end
that perhaps they will return [i.e., abandon their religion],

3:73.t: And do not trust except those who follow your religion." Say, "Indeed, the [true] guidance is the guidance of Allāh. [Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?" Say, "Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of Allāh - He grants it to whom He wills. And Allāh is all-Encompassing and Wise."

segments.t: And do not trust except those who follow your religion."
Say, "Indeed, the [true] guidance is the guidance of Allāh.
[Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given
or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?"
Say, "Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of Allāh -
He grants it to whom He wills.
And Allāh is all-Encompassing and Wise."

3:74.t: He selects for His mercy whom He wills. And Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

segments.t: He selects for His mercy whom He wills.
And Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

3:75.t: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth], he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a [single] coin, he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it]. That is because they say, "There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned." And they speak untruth about Allāh while they know [it].

segments.t: And among the People of the Scripture is he who,
if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth],
he will return it to you.
And among them is he who,
if you entrust him with a [single] coin,
he will not return it to you
unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it].
That is because they say,
"There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned."
And they speak untruth about Allāh while they know [it].

3:76.t: But yes, whoever fulfills his commitment and fears Allāh - then indeed, Allāh loves those who fear Him.

segments.t: But yes,
whoever fulfills his commitment
and fears Allāh -
then indeed, Allāh loves those who fear Him.

3:77.t: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allāh and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and Allāh will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful punishment.

segments.t: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allāh
and their [own] oaths for a small price
will have no share in the Hereafter,
and Allāh will not speak to them
or look at them on the Day of Resurrection,
nor will He purify them;
and they will have a painful punishment.

3:78.t: And indeed, there is among them a party who alter the Scripture with their tongues so you may think it is from the Scripture, but it is not from the Scripture. And they say, "This is from Allāh," but it is not from Allāh. And they speak untruth about Allāh while they know.

segments.t: And indeed, there is among them a party
who alter the Scripture with their tongues
so you may think it is from the Scripture,
but it is not from the Scripture.
And they say, "This is from Allāh,"
but it is not from Allāh.
And they speak untruth about Allāh while they know.

3:79.t: It is not for a human [prophet] that Allāh should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people, "Be servants to me rather than Allāh," but [instead, he would say], "Be pious scholars of the Lord because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied."

segments.t: It is not for a human [prophet] that Allāh should give him the Scripture
and authority and prophethood
and then he would say to the people,
"Be servants to me rather than Allāh,"
but [instead, he would say],
"Be pious scholars of the Lord
because of what you have taught of the Scripture
and because of what you have studied."

3:8.t: [Who say], "Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.

segments.t: [Who say], "Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate
after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy.
Indeed, You are the Bestower.

3:80.t: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords. Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?

segments.t: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords.
Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?

3:81.t: And [recall, O People of the Scripture], when Allāh took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], "Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him." [Allāh] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?" They said, "We have acknowledged it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."

segments.t: And [recall, O People of the Scripture],
when Allāh took the covenant of the prophets, [saying],
"Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom
and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you,
you [must] believe in him and support him."
[Allāh] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?"
They said, "We have acknowledged it."
He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."

3:82.t: And whoever turned away after that - they were the defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: And whoever turned away after that -
they were the defiantly disobedient.

3:83.t: So is it other than the religion of Allāh they desire, while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth, willingly or by compulsion, and to Him they will be returned?

segments.t: So is it other than the religion of Allāh they desire,
while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth,
willingly or by compulsion,
and to Him they will be returned?

3:84.t: Say, "We have believed in Allāh and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants [al-Asbāṭ], and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."

segments.t: Say, "We have believed in Allāh
and in what was revealed to us
and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob,
and the Descendants [al-Asbāṭ],
and in what was given to Moses and Jesus
and to the prophets from their Lord.
We make no distinction between any of them,
and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."

3:85.t: And whoever desires other than Islām as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.

segments.t: And whoever desires other than Islām as religion -
never will it be accepted from him,
and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.

3:86.t: How shall Allāh guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear signs had come to them? And Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

segments.t: How shall Allāh guide a people who disbelieved after their belief
and had witnessed that the Messenger is true
and clear signs had come to them?
And Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

3:87.t: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of Allāh and the angels and the people, all together,

segments.t: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of Allāh
and the angels and the people, all together,

3:88.t: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved,

segments.t: Abiding eternally therein.
The punishment will not be lightened for them,
nor will they be reprieved,

3:89.t: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Except for those who repent after that
and correct themselves.
For indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

3:9.t: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allāh does not fail in His promise."

segments.t: Our Lord,
surely You will gather the people for a Day
about which there is no doubt.
Indeed, Allāh does not fail in His promise."

3:90.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve [i.e., reject the message] after their belief and then increase in disbelief - never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted, and they are the ones astray.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve [i.e., reject the message] after their belief
and then increase in disbelief -
never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted,
and they are the ones astray.

3:91.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it. For those there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers -
never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them
if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it.
For those there will be a painful punishment,
and they will have no helpers.

3:92.t: Never will you attain the good [reward] until you spend [in the way of Allāh] from that which you love. And whatever you spend - indeed, Allāh is Knowing of it.

segments.t: Never will you attain the good [reward]
until you spend [in the way of Allāh]
from that which you love.
And whatever you spend -
indeed, Allāh is Knowing of it.

3:93.t: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel [i.e., Jacob] had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, [O Muḥammad], "So bring the Torah and recite it, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel
except what Israel [i.e., Jacob] had made unlawful to himself
before the Torah was revealed.
Say, [O Muḥammad],
"So bring the Torah and recite it,
if you should be truthful."

3:94.t: And whoever invents about Allāh untruth after that - then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.

segments.t: And whoever invents about Allāh untruth after that -
then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.

3:95.t: Say, "Allāh has told the truth. So follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of the polytheists."

segments.t: Say, "Allāh has told the truth.
So follow the religion of Abraham,
inclining toward truth;
and he was not of the polytheists."

3:96.t: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Bakkah [i.e., Makkah] - blessed and a guidance for the worlds.

segments.t: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind
was that at Bakkah [i.e., Makkah] -
blessed and a guidance for the worlds.

3:97.t: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it [i.e., the Ḥaram] shall be safe. And [due] to Allāh from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disbelieves [i.e., refuses] - then indeed, Allāh is free from need of the worlds.

segments.t: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham.
And whoever enters it [i.e., the Ḥaram] shall be safe.
And [due] to Allāh from the people is a pilgrimage to the House -
for whoever is able to find thereto a way.
But whoever disbelieves [i.e., refuses] -
then indeed, Allāh is free from need of the worlds.

3:98.t: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allāh while Allāh is Witness over what you do?"

segments.t: Say, "O People of the Scripture,
why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allāh
while Allāh is Witness over what you do?"

3:99.t: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you avert from the way of Allāh those who believe, seeking to make it [seem] deviant, while you are witnesses [to the truth]? And Allāh is not unaware of what you do."

segments.t: Say, "O People of the Scripture,
why do you avert from the way of Allāh those who believe,
seeking to make it [seem] deviant,
while you are witnesses [to the truth]?
And Allāh is not unaware of what you do."
Ḥā, Meem.

40:10.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve will be addressed, "The hatred of Allāh for you was [even] greater than your hatred of yourselves [this Day in Hell] when you were invited to faith, but you disbelieved [i.e., refused]."

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve will be addressed,
"The hatred of Allāh for you was [even] greater
than your hatred of yourselves [this Day in Hell]
when you were invited to faith,
but you disbelieved [i.e., refused]."

40:11.t: They will say, "Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have confessed our sins. So is there to an exit any way?"

segments.t: They will say,
"Our Lord,
You made us lifeless twice
and gave us life twice,
and we have confessed our sins.
So is there to an exit any way?"

40:12.t: [They will be told], "That is because, when Allāh was called upon alone, you disbelieved; but if others were associated with Him, you believed. So the judgement is with Allāh, the Most High, the Grand."

segments.t: [They will be told], "That is because, when Allāh was called upon alone, you disbelieved;
but if others were associated with Him, you believed.
So the judgement is with Allāh, the Most High, the Grand."

40:13.t: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you from the sky, provision. But none will remember except he who turns back [in repentance].

segments.t: It is He who shows you His signs
and sends down to you from the sky, provision.
But none will remember
except he who turns back [in repentance].

40:14.t: So invoke Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, although the disbelievers dislike it.

segments.t: So invoke Allāh,
[being] sincere to Him in religion,
although the disbelievers dislike it.

40:15.t: [He is] the Exalted above [all] degrees, Owner of the Throne; He places the inspiration of His command [i.e., revelation] upon whom He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Meeting.

segments.t: [He is] the Exalted above [all] degrees,
Owner of the Throne;
He places the inspiration of His command [i.e., revelation]
upon whom He wills of His servants
to warn of the Day of Meeting.

40:16.t: The Day they come forth nothing concerning them will be concealed from Allāh. To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day? To Allāh, the One, the Prevailing.

segments.t: The Day they come forth
nothing concerning them will be concealed from Allāh.
To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day?
To Allāh, the One, the Prevailing.

40:17.t: This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today! Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.

segments.t: This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned.
No injustice today!
Indeed, Allāh is swift in account.

40:18.t: And warn them, [O Muḥammad], of the Approaching Day, when hearts are at the throats, filled [with distress]. For the wrongdoers there will be no devoted friend and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.

segments.t: And warn them, [O Muḥammad], of the Approaching Day,
when hearts are at the throats, filled [with distress].
For the wrongdoers there will be no devoted friend
and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.

40:19.t: He knows that which deceives the eyes and what the breasts conceal.

segments.t: He knows that which deceives the eyes
and what the breasts conceal.

40:2.t: The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] is from Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing,

segments.t: The revelation of the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
is from Allāh,
the Exalted in Might,
the Knowing,

40:20.t: And Allāh judges with truth, while those they invoke besides Him judge not with anything. Indeed, Allāh - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

segments.t: And Allāh judges with truth,
while those they invoke besides Him judge not with anything.
Indeed, Allāh -
He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

40:21.t: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those who were before them? They were greater than them in strength and in impression on the land, but Allāh seized them for their sins. And they had not from Allāh any protector.

segments.t: Have they not traveled through the land
and observed how was the end of those who were before them?
They were greater than them in strength
and in impression on the land,
but Allāh seized them for their sins.
And they had not from Allāh any protector.

40:22.t: That was because their messengers were coming to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so Allāh seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in punishment.

segments.t: That was because their messengers
were coming to them with clear proofs,
but they disbelieved,
so Allāh seized them.
Indeed, He is Powerful
and severe in punishment.

40:23.t: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

segments.t: And We did certainly send Moses
with Our signs and a clear authority

40:24.t: To Pharaoh, Hāmān and Qārūn, but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."

segments.t: To Pharaoh,
Hāmān and Qārūn,
but they said,
"[He is] a magician and a liar."

40:25.t: And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and keep their women alive." But the plan of the disbelievers is not except in error.

segments.t: And when he brought them the truth from Us,
they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him
and keep their women alive."
But the plan of the disbelievers is not except in error.

40:26.t: And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption in the land."

segments.t: And Pharaoh said,
"Let me kill Moses
and let him call upon his Lord.
Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion
or that he will cause corruption in the land."

40:27.t: But Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."

segments.t: But Moses said,
"Indeed, I have sought refuge
in my Lord and your Lord
from every arrogant one
who does not believe in the Day of Account."

40:28.t: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is Allāh' while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, Allāh does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.

segments.t: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh
who concealed his faith said,
"Do you kill a man [merely] because he says,
'My Lord is Allāh'
while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord?
And if he should be lying,
then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie;
but if he should be truthful,
there will strike you some of what he promises you.
Indeed, Allāh does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.

40:29.t: O my people, sovereignty is yours today, [your being] dominant in the land. But who would protect us from the punishment of Allāh if it came to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."

segments.t: O my people,
sovereignty is yours today,
[your being] dominant in the land.
But who would protect us from the punishment of Allāh
if it came to us?" Pharaoh said,
"I do not show you except what I see,
and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."

40:3.t: The forgiver of sin, acceptor of repentance, severe in punishment, owner of abundance. There is no deity except Him; to Him is the destination.

segments.t: The forgiver of sin,
acceptor of repentance,
severe in punishment,
owner of abundance.
There is no deity except Him;
to Him is the destination.

40:30.t: And he who believed said, "O my people, indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies -

segments.t: And he who believed said,
"O my people,
indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies -

40:31.t: Like the custom of the people of Noah and of ʿAad and Thamūd and those after them. And Allāh wants no injustice for [His] servants.

segments.t: Like the custom of the people of Noah
and of ʿAad and Thamūd
and those after them.
And Allāh wants no injustice for [His] servants.

40:32.t: And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling -

segments.t: And O my people,
indeed I fear for you
the Day of Calling -

40:33.t: The Day you will turn your backs fleeing; there is not for you from Allāh any protector. And whoever Allāh sends astray - there is not for him any guide.

segments.t: The Day you will turn your backs fleeing;
there is not for you from Allāh any protector.
And whoever Allāh sends astray -
there is not for him any guide.

40:34.t: And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs, but you remained in doubt of that which he brought to you, until when he died, you said, 'Never will Allāh send a messenger after him.' Thus does Allāh leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic."

segments.t: And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs,
but you remained in doubt of that which he brought to you,
until when he died, you said,
'Never will Allāh send a messenger after him.'
Thus does Allāh leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic."

40:35.t: Those who dispute concerning the signs of Allāh without an authority having come to them - great is hatred [of them] in the sight of Allāh and in the sight of those who have believed. Thus does Allāh seal over every heart [belonging to] an arrogant tyrant.

segments.t: Those who dispute concerning the signs of Allāh
without an authority having come to them -
great is hatred [of them] in the sight of Allāh
and in the sight of those who have believed.
Thus does Allāh seal over every heart [belonging to] an arrogant tyrant.

40:36.t: And Pharaoh said, "O Hāmān, construct for me a tower that I might reach the ways -

segments.t: And Pharaoh said,
"O Hāmān,
construct for me a tower
that I might reach the ways -

40:37.t: The ways into the heavens - so that I may look at the deity of Moses; but indeed, I think he is a liar." And thus was made attractive to Pharaoh the evil of his deed, and he was averted from the [right] way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin.

segments.t: The ways into the heavens -
so that I may look at the deity of Moses;
but indeed, I think he is a liar."
And thus was made attractive to Pharaoh the evil of his deed,
and he was averted from the [right] way.
And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin.

40:38.t: And he who believed said, "O my people, follow me; I will guide you to the way of right conduct.

segments.t: And he who believed said,
"O my people, follow me;
I will guide you to the way of right conduct.

40:39.t: O my people, this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of [permanent] settlement.

segments.t: O my people,
this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment,
and indeed, the Hereafter -
that is the home of [permanent] settlement.

40:4.t: No one disputes concerning the signs of Allāh except those who disbelieve, so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.

segments.t: No one disputes concerning the signs of Allāh
except those who disbelieve,
so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.

40:40.t: Whoever does an evil deed will not be recompensed except by the like thereof; but whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - those will enter Paradise, being given provision therein without account.

segments.t: Whoever does an evil deed
will not be recompensed except by the like thereof;
but whoever does righteousness,
whether male or female,
while he is a believer -
those will enter Paradise,
being given provision therein without account.

40:41.t: And O my people, how is it that I invite you to salvation while you invite me to the Fire?

segments.t: And O my people,
how is it that I invite you to salvation
while you invite me to the Fire?

40:42.t: You invite me to disbelieve in Allāh and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, and I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

segments.t: You invite me to disbelieve in Allāh
and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge,
and I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

40:43.t: Assuredly, that to which you invite me has no [response to a] supplication in this world or in the Hereafter; and indeed, our return is to Allāh, and indeed, the transgressors will be companions of the Fire.

segments.t: Assuredly, that to which you invite me
has no [response to a] supplication
in this world or in the Hereafter;
and indeed, our return is to Allāh,
and indeed, the transgressors will be companions of the Fire.

40:44.t: And you will remember what I [now] say to you, and I entrust my affair to Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Seeing of [His] servants."

segments.t: And you will remember what I [now] say to you,
and I entrust my affair to Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is Seeing of [His] servants."

40:45.t: So Allāh protected him from the evils they plotted, and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst of punishment -

segments.t: So Allāh protected him from the evils they plotted,
and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst of punishment -

40:46.t: The Fire; they are exposed to it morning and evening. And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said], "Make the people of Pharaoh enter the severest punishment."

segments.t: The Fire;
they are exposed to it morning and evening.
And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said],
"Make the people of Pharaoh enter the severest punishment."

40:47.t: And [mention] when they will argue within the Fire, and the weak will say to those who had been arrogant, "Indeed, we were [only] your followers, so will you relieve us of a share of the Fire?"

segments.t: And [mention] when they will argue within the Fire,
and the weak will say to those who had been arrogant,
"Indeed, we were [only] your followers,
so will you relieve us of a share of the Fire?"

40:48.t: Those who had been arrogant will say, "Indeed, all [of us] are in it. Indeed, Allāh has judged between the servants."

segments.t: Those who had been arrogant will say,
"Indeed, all [of us] are in it.
Indeed, Allāh has judged between the servants."

40:49.t: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Supplicate your Lord to lighten for us a day from the punishment."

segments.t: And those in the Fire will say
to the keepers of Hell,
"Supplicate your Lord to lighten for us
a day from the punishment."

40:5.t: The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

segments.t: The people of Noah denied before them
and the [disbelieving] factions after them,
and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him,
and they disputed by [using] falsehood
to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth.
So I seized them,
and how [terrible] was My penalty.

40:50.t: They will say, "Did there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes." They will reply, "Then supplicate [yourselves], but the supplication of the disbelievers is not except in error [i.e., futility]."

segments.t: They will say,
"Did there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs?"
They will say,
"Yes."
They will reply,
"Then supplicate [yourselves],
but the supplication of the disbelievers is not except in error [i.e., futility]."

40:51.t: Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand -

segments.t: Indeed, We will support Our messengers
and those who believe
during the life of this world
and on the Day when the witnesses will stand -

40:52.t: The Day their excuse will not benefit the wrongdoers, and they will have the curse, and they will have the worst home [i.e., Hell].

segments.t: The Day their excuse will not benefit the wrongdoers,
and they will have the curse,
and they will have the worst home [i.e., Hell].

40:53.t: And We had certainly given Moses guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture

segments.t: And We had certainly given Moses guidance,
and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture

40:54.t: As guidance and a reminder for those of understanding.

segments.t: As guidance
and a reminder
for those of understanding.

40:55.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad]. Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth. And ask forgiveness for your sin and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning.

segments.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad].
Indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth.
And ask forgiveness for your sin
and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord
in the evening and the morning.

40:56.t: Indeed, those who dispute concerning the signs of Allāh without [any] evidence having come to them - there is not within their breasts except pride, [the extent of] which they cannot reach. So seek refuge in Allāh. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.

segments.t: Indeed, those who dispute concerning the signs of Allāh
without [any] evidence having come to them -
there is not within their breasts except pride,
[the extent of] which they cannot reach.
So seek refuge in Allāh.
Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.

40:57.t: The creation of the heavens and earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people do not know.

segments.t: The creation of the heavens and earth
is greater than the creation of mankind,
but most of the people do not know.

40:58.t: And not equal are the blind and the seeing, nor are those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little do you remember.

segments.t: And not equal are the blind and the seeing,
nor are those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer.
Little do you remember.

40:59.t: Indeed, the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - but most of the people do not believe.

segments.t: Indeed, the Hour is coming -
no doubt about it -
but most of the people do not believe.

40:6.t: And thus has the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord come into effect upon those who disbelieved that they are companions of the Fire.

segments.t: And thus has the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord come into effect
upon those who disbelieved
that they are companions of the Fire.

40:60.t: And your Lord says, "Call upon Me; I will respond to you." Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell [rendered] contemptible.

segments.t: And your Lord says,
"Call upon Me;
I will respond to you."
Indeed, those who disdain My worship
will enter Hell [rendered] contemptible.

40:61.t: It is Allāh who made for you the night that you may rest therein and the day giving sight. Indeed, Allāh is the possessor of bounty for the people, but most of them are not grateful.

segments.t: It is Allāh who made for you the night
that you may rest therein
and the day giving sight.
Indeed, Allāh is the possessor of bounty for the people,
but most of them are not grateful.

40:62.t: That is Allāh, your Lord, Creator of all things; there is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?

segments.t: That is Allāh, your Lord,
Creator of all things;
there is no deity except Him,
so how are you deluded?

40:63.t: Thus were those [before you] deluded who were rejecting the signs of Allāh.

segments.t: Thus were those [before you] deluded
who were rejecting the signs of Allāh.

40:64.t: It is Allāh who made for you the earth a place of settlement and the sky a structure [i.e., ceiling] and formed you and perfected your forms and provided you with good things. That is Allāh, your Lord; then blessed is Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: It is Allāh who made for you the earth a place of settlement
and the sky a structure [i.e., ceiling]
and formed you and perfected your forms
and provided you with good things.
That is Allāh, your Lord;
then blessed is Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

40:65.t: He is the Ever-Living; there is no deity except Him, so call upon Him, [being] sincere to Him in religion. [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: He is the Ever-Living;
there is no deity except Him,
so call upon Him,
[being] sincere to Him in religion.
[All] praise is [due] to Allāh,
Lord of the worlds.

40:66.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allāh once the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allāh
once the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord,
and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

40:67.t: It is He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot; then He brings you out as a child; then [He develops you] that you reach your [time of] maturity, then [further] that you become elders. And among you is he who is taken in death before [that], so that you reach a specified term; and perhaps you will use reason.

segments.t: It is He who created you from dust,
then from a sperm-drop,
then from a clinging clot;
then He brings you out as a child;
then [He develops you] that you reach your [time of] maturity,
then [further] that you become elders.
And among you is he who is taken in death before [that],
so that you reach a specified term;
and perhaps you will use reason.

40:68.t: He it is who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a matter, He but says to it, "Be," and it is.

segments.t: He it is who gives life and causes death;
and when He decrees a matter,
He but says to it, "Be,"
and it is.

40:69.t: Do you not consider those who dispute concerning the signs of Allāh - how are they averted?

segments.t: Do you not consider those
who dispute concerning the signs of Allāh -
how are they averted?

40:7.t: Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [Allāh] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.

segments.t: Those [angels] who carry the Throne
and those around it exalt [Allāh] with praise of their Lord
and believe in Him
and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying],
"Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge,
so forgive those who have repented
and followed Your way
and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.

40:70.t: Those who deny the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] and that with which We sent Our messengers - they are going to know,

segments.t: Those who deny the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
and that with which We sent Our messengers -
they are going to know,

40:71.t: When the shackles are around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged

segments.t: When the shackles are around their necks
and the chains;
they will be dragged

40:72.t: In boiling water; then in the Fire they will be filled [with flame].

segments.t: In boiling water;
then in the Fire they will be filled [with flame].

40:73.t: Then it will be said to them, "Where is that which you used to associate [with Him in worship]

segments.t: Then it will be said to them,
"Where is that which you used to associate [with Him in worship]

40:74.t: Other than Allāh?" They will say, "They have departed from us; rather, we did not used to invoke previously anything." Thus does Allāh put astray the disbelievers.

segments.t: Other than Allāh?"
They will say,
"They have departed from us;
rather, we did not used to invoke previously anything."
Thus does Allāh put astray the disbelievers.

40:75.t: [The angels will say], "That was because you used to exult upon the earth without right and you used to behave insolently.

segments.t: [The angels will say], "That was because you used to exult upon the earth without right
and you used to behave insolently.

40:76.t: Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

segments.t: Enter the gates of Hell
to abide eternally therein,
and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

40:77.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad]; indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth. And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We take you in death, it is to Us they will be returned.

segments.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad];
indeed, the promise of Allāh is truth.
And whether We show you some of what We have promised them
or We take you in death,
it is to Us they will be returned.

40:78.t: And We have already sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of Allāh. So when the command of Allāh comes, it will be concluded [i.e., judged] in truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].

segments.t: And We have already sent messengers before you.
Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you,
and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you.
And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse]
except by permission of Allāh.
So when the command of Allāh comes,
it will be concluded [i.e., judged] in truth,
and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].

40:79.t: It is Allāh who made for you the grazing animals upon which you ride, and some of them you eat.

segments.t: It is Allāh who made for you the grazing animals
upon which you ride,
and some of them you eat.

40:8.t: Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their forefathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence
which You have promised them
and whoever was righteous among their forefathers,
their spouses and their offspring.
Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

40:80.t: And for you therein are [other] benefits and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts; and upon them and upon ships you are carried.

segments.t: And for you therein are [other] benefits
and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts;
and upon them and upon ships you are carried.

40:81.t: And He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of Allāh do you deny?

segments.t: And He shows you His signs.
So which of the signs of Allāh do you deny?

40:82.t: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than themselves and greater in strength and in impression on the land, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

segments.t: Have they not traveled through the land
and observed how was the end of those before them?
They were more numerous than themselves
and greater in strength and in impression on the land,
but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

40:83.t: And when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they [merely] rejoiced in what they had of knowledge, but they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

segments.t: And when their messengers came to them with clear proofs,
they [merely] rejoiced in what they had of knowledge,
but they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

40:84.t: And when they saw Our punishment, they said, "We believe in Allāh alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him."

segments.t: And when they saw Our punishment,
they said, "We believe in Allāh alone
and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him."

40:85.t: But never did their faith benefit them once they saw Our punishment. [It is] the established way of Allāh which has preceded among His servants. And the disbelievers thereupon lost [all].

segments.t: But never did their faith benefit them
once they saw Our punishment.
[It is] the established way of Allāh
which has preceded among His servants.
And the disbelievers thereupon lost [all].

40:9.t: And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment."

segments.t: And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds].
And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day -
You will have given him mercy.
And that is the great attainment."
Ḥā, Meem.

41:10.t: And He placed on it [i.e., the earth] firmly set mountains over its surface, and He blessed it and determined therein its [creatures'] sustenance in four days without distinction - for [the information of] those who ask.

segments.t: And He placed on it [i.e., the earth] firmly set mountains over its surface,
and He blessed it and determined therein its [creatures'] sustenance in four days without distinction -
for [the information of] those who ask.

41:11.t: Then He directed Himself to the heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come [into being], willingly or by compulsion." They said, "We have come willingly."

segments.t: Then He directed Himself to the heaven
while it was smoke
and said to it and to the earth,
"Come [into being], willingly or by compulsion."
They said, "We have come willingly."

41:12.t: And He completed them as seven heavens within two days and inspired [i.e., made known] in each heaven its command. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars, for beauty] and as protection. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

segments.t: And He completed them as seven heavens within two days
and inspired [i.e., made known] in each heaven its command.
And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars, for beauty]
and as protection.
That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

41:13.t: But if they turn away, then say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] ʿAad and Thamūd.

segments.t: But if they turn away,
then say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt
like the thunderbolt [that struck] ʿAad and Thamūd.

41:14.t: [That occurred] when the messengers had come to them before them and after them, [saying], "Worship not except Allāh." They said, "If our Lord had willed, He would have sent down the angels, so indeed we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers."

segments.t: [That occurred] when the messengers had come to them
before them and after them, [saying],
"Worship not except Allāh."
They said, "If our Lord had willed,
He would have sent down the angels,
so indeed we, in that with which you have been sent,
are disbelievers."

41:15.t: As for ʿAad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, "Who is greater than us in strength?" Did they not consider that Allāh who created them was greater than them in strength? But they were rejecting Our signs.

segments.t: As for ʿAad,
they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said,
"Who is greater than us in strength?"
Did they not consider that Allāh who created them
was greater than them in strength?
But they were rejecting Our signs.

41:16.t: So We sent upon them a screaming wind during days of misfortune to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life; but the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgracing, and they will not be helped.

segments.t: So We sent upon them a screaming wind
during days of misfortune
to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life;
but the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgracing,
and they will not be helped.

41:17.t: And as for Thamūd, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance, so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them for what they used to earn.

segments.t: And as for Thamūd,
We guided them,
but they preferred blindness over guidance,
so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them
for what they used to earn.

41:18.t: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allāh.

segments.t: And We saved those who believed
and used to fear Allāh.

41:19.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], the Day when the enemies of Allāh will be gathered to the Fire while they are [driven], assembled in rows,

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], the Day when the enemies of Allāh
will be gathered to the Fire
while they are [driven], assembled in rows,

41:2.t: [This is] a revelation from the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful -

segments.t: [This is] a revelation
from the Entirely Merciful,
the Especially Merciful -

41:20.t: Until, when they reach it, their hearing and their eyes and their skins will testify against them of what they used to do.

segments.t: Until, when they reach it,
their hearing and their eyes and their skins will testify against them
of what they used to do.

41:21.t: And they will say to their skins, "Why have you testified against us?" They will say, "We were made to speak by Allāh, who has made everything speak; and He created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.

segments.t: And they will say to their skins,
"Why have you testified against us?"
They will say,
"We were made to speak by Allāh,
who has made everything speak;
and He created you the first time,
and to Him you are returned.

41:22.t: And you were not covering [i.e., protecting] yourselves, lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you assumed that Allāh does not know much of what you do.

segments.t: And you were not covering [i.e., protecting] yourselves,
lest your hearing testify against you
or your sight
or your skins,
but you assumed that Allāh does not know much of what you do.

41:23.t: And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers."

segments.t: And that was your assumption
which you assumed about your Lord.
It has brought you to ruin,
and you have become among the losers."

41:24.t: So [even] if they are patient, the Fire is a residence for them; and if they ask to appease [Allāh], they will not be of those who are allowed to appease.

segments.t: So [even] if they are patient,
the Fire is a residence for them;
and if they ask to appease [Allāh],
they will not be of those who are allowed to appease.

41:25.t: And We appointed for them companions who made attractive to them what was before them and what was behind them [of sin], and the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon them among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.

segments.t: And We appointed for them companions
who made attractive to them what was before them
and what was behind them [of sin],
and the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon them
among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men.
Indeed, they [all] were losers.

41:26.t: And those who disbelieve say, "Do not listen to this Qur’ān and speak noisily during [the recitation of] it that perhaps you will overcome."

segments.t: And those who disbelieve say,
"Do not listen to this Qur’ān
and speak noisily during [the recitation of] it
that perhaps you will overcome."

41:27.t: But We will surely cause those who disbelieve to taste a severe punishment, and We will surely recompense them for the worst of what they had been doing.

segments.t: But We will surely cause those who disbelieve
to taste a severe punishment,
and We will surely recompense them
for the worst of what they had been doing.

41:28.t: That is the recompense of the enemies of Allāh - the Fire. For them therein is the home of eternity as recompense for what they, of Our verses, were rejecting.

segments.t: That is the recompense of the enemies of Allāh - the Fire.
For them therein is the home of eternity
as recompense for what they, of Our verses, were rejecting.

41:29.t: And those who disbelieved will [then] say, "Our Lord, show us those who misled us of the jinn and men [so] we may put them under our feet that they will be among the lowest."

segments.t: And those who disbelieved will [then] say,
"Our Lord, show us those who misled us of the jinn and men
[so] we may put them under our feet
that they will be among the lowest."

41:3.t: A Book whose verses have been detailed, an Arabic Qur’ān for a people who know,

segments.t: A Book whose verses have been detailed,
an Arabic Qur’ān for a people who know,

41:30.t: Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is Allāh" and then remained on a right course - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], "Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have said,
"Our Lord is Allāh"
and then remained on a right course -
the angels will descend upon them, [saying],
"Do not fear and do not grieve
but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.

41:31.t: We [angels] were your allies in worldly life and [are so] in the Hereafter. And you will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you request [or wish]

segments.t: We [angels] were your allies in worldly life
and [are so] in the Hereafter.
And you will have therein whatever your souls desire,
and you will have therein whatever you request [or wish]

41:32.t: As accommodation from a [Lord who is] Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: As accommodation from a [Lord who is] Forgiving and Merciful."

41:33.t: And who is better in speech than one who invites to Allāh and does righteousness and says, "Indeed, I am of the Muslims."

segments.t: And who is better in speech than one who invites to Allāh
and does righteousness
and says, "Indeed, I am of the Muslims."

41:34.t: And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon, the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.

segments.t: And not equal are the good deed and the bad.
Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better;
and thereupon, the one whom between you and him is enmity
[will become] as though he was a devoted friend.

41:35.t: But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].

segments.t: But none is granted it except those who are patient,
and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].

41:36.t: And if there comes to you from Satan an evil suggestion, then seek refuge in Allāh. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: And if there comes to you from Satan an evil suggestion,
then seek refuge in Allāh.
Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

41:37.t: And of His signs are the night and day and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon, but prostrate to Allāh, who created them, if it should be Him that you worship.

segments.t: And of His signs are the night and day
and the sun and moon.
Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon,
but prostrate to Allāh, who created them,
if it should be Him that you worship.

41:38.t: But if they are arrogant - then those who are near your Lord [i.e., the angels] exalt Him by night and by day, and they do not become weary.

segments.t: But if they are arrogant -
then those who are near your Lord [i.e., the angels]
exalt Him by night and by day,
and they do not become weary.

41:39.t: And of His signs is that you see the earth stilled, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and grows. Indeed, He who has given it life is the Giver of Life to the dead. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

segments.t: And of His signs is that you see the earth stilled,
but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and grows.
Indeed, He who has given it life is the Giver of Life to the dead.
Indeed, He is over all things competent.

41:4.t: As a giver of good tidings and a warner; but most of them turn away, so they do not hear.

segments.t: As a giver of good tidings and a warner;
but most of them turn away,
so they do not hear.

41:40.t: Indeed, those who inject deviation into Our verses are not concealed from Us. So, is he who is cast into the Fire better or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

segments.t: Indeed, those who inject deviation into Our verses
are not concealed from Us.
So, is he who is cast into the Fire better
or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection?
Do whatever you will;
indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

41:41.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the message [i.e., the Qur’ān] after it has come to them... And indeed, it is a mighty Book.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the message [i.e., the Qur’ān]
after it has come to them...
And indeed, it is a mighty Book.
