46:31.t: O our people, respond to the Caller [i.e., Messenger] of Allāh and believe in him; He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive for you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.

segments.t: O our people,
respond to the Caller [i.e., Messenger] of Allāh
and believe in him;
He [i.e., Allāh] will forgive for you your sins
and protect you from a painful punishment.

46:32.t: But he who does not respond to the Caller of Allāh will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error."

segments.t: But he who does not respond to the Caller of Allāh
will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth,
and he will not have besides Him any protectors.
Those are in manifest error."

46:33.t: Do they not see that Allāh, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

segments.t: Do they not see that Allāh,
who created the heavens and earth
and did not fail in their creation,
is able to give life to the dead?
Yes.
Indeed, He is over all things competent.

46:34.t: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment for what you used to deny."

segments.t: And the Day those who disbelieved
are exposed to the Fire [it will be said],
"Is this not the truth?"
They will say, "Yes, by our Lord."
He will say, "Then taste the punishment
for what you used to deny."

46:35.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them. It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

segments.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad],
as were those of determination among the messengers
and do not be impatient for them.
It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised -
as though they had not remained [in the world]
except an hour of a day.
[This is] notification.
And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

46:4.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Have you considered that which you invoke besides Allāh? Show me what they have created of the earth; or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens? Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this or a [remaining] trace of knowledge, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Have you considered that which you invoke besides Allāh?
Show me what they have created of the earth;
or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens?
Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this
or a [remaining] trace of knowledge,
if you should be truthful."

46:5.t: And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allāh those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection [i.e., never], and they, of their invocation, are unaware.

segments.t: And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allāh
those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection [i.e., never],
and they, of their invocation, are unaware.

46:6.t: And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.

segments.t: And when the people are gathered [that Day],
they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them,
and they will be deniers of their worship.

46:7.t: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic."

segments.t: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences,
those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them,
"This is obvious magic."

46:8.t: Or do they say, "He has invented it"? Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from Allāh at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved. Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

segments.t: Or do they say,
"He has invented it"?
Say, "If I have invented it,
you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from Allāh at all.
He is most knowing of that in which you are involved.
Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you,
and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

46:9.t: Say, "I am not something new among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."

segments.t: Say, "I am not something new among the messengers,
nor do I know what will be done with me or with you.
I only follow that which is revealed to me,
and I am not but a clear warner."

47:1.t: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allāh - He will waste their deeds.

segments.t: Those who disbelieve
and avert [people] from the way of Allāh -
He will waste their deeds.

47:10.t: Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? Allāh destroyed [everything] over them, and for the disbelievers is something comparable.

segments.t: Have they not traveled through the land
and seen how was the end of those before them?
Allāh destroyed [everything] over them,
and for the disbelievers is something comparable.

47:11.t: That is because Allāh is the protector of those who have believed and because the disbelievers have no protector.

segments.t: That is because Allāh is the protector of those who have believed
and because the disbelievers have no protector.

47:12.t: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds
to gardens beneath which rivers flow,
but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat,
and the Fire will be a residence for them.

47:13.t: And how many a city was stronger than your city [i.e., Makkah] which drove you out? We destroyed them; and there was no helper for them.

segments.t: And how many a city was stronger than your city [i.e., Makkah]
which drove you out?
We destroyed them;
and there was no helper for them.

47:14.t: So is he who is on clear evidence from his Lord like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive and they follow their [own] desires?

segments.t: So is he who is on clear evidence from his Lord
like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive
and they follow their [own] desires?

47:15.t: Is the description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, wherein are rivers of water unaltered, rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey, in which they will have from all [kinds of] fruits and forgiveness from their Lord... [Are its inhabitants] like those who abide eternally in the Fire and are given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines?

segments.t: Is the description of Paradise,
which the righteous are promised,
wherein are rivers of water unaltered,
rivers of milk the taste of which never changes,
rivers of wine delicious to those who drink,
and rivers of purified honey,
in which they will have from all [kinds of] fruits
and forgiveness from their Lord...
[Are its inhabitants] like those who abide eternally in the Fire
and are given to drink scalding water
that will sever their intestines?

47:16.t: And among them, [O Muḥammad], are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge, "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones of whom Allāh has sealed over their hearts and who have followed their [own] desires.

segments.t: And among them, [O Muḥammad], are those who listen to you,
until when they depart from you,
they say to those who were given knowledge,
"What has he said just now?"
Those are the ones of whom Allāh has sealed over their hearts
and who have followed their [own] desires.

47:17.t: And those who are guided - He increases them in guidance and gives them their righteousness.

segments.t: And those who are guided -
He increases them in guidance
and gives them their righteousness.

47:18.t: Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then how [i.e., what good] to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?

segments.t: Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly?
But already there have come [some of] its indications.
Then how [i.e., what good] to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?

47:19.t: So know, [O Muḥammad], that there is no deity except Allāh and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allāh knows of your movement and your resting place.

segments.t: So know, [O Muḥammad],
that there is no deity except Allāh
and ask forgiveness for your sin
and for the believing men and believing women.
And Allāh knows of your movement and your resting place.

47:2.t: And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Muḥammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.

segments.t: And those who believe and do righteous deeds
and believe in what has been sent down upon Muḥammad
- and it is the truth from their Lord -
He will remove from them their misdeeds
and amend their condition.

47:20.t: Those who believe say, "Why has a sūrah not been sent down?" But when a precise sūrah is revealed and battle is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them [would have been]

segments.t: Those who believe say,
"Why has a sūrah not been sent down?"
But when a precise sūrah is revealed
and battle is mentioned therein,
you see those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy]
looking at you with a look of one overcome by death.
And more appropriate for them [would have been]

47:21.t: Obedience and good words. And when the matter [of fighting] was determined, if they had been true to Allāh, it would have been better for them.

segments.t: Obedience and good words.
And when the matter [of fighting] was determined,
if they had been true to Allāh,
it would have been better for them.

47:22.t: So would you perhaps, if you turned away, cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship?

segments.t: So would you perhaps,
if you turned away,
cause corruption on earth
and sever your [ties of] relationship?

47:23.t: Those [who do so] are the ones that Allāh has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.

segments.t: Those [who do so] are the ones that Allāh has cursed,
so He deafened them and blinded their vision.

47:24.t: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur’ān, or are there locks upon [their] hearts?

segments.t: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur’ān,
or are there locks upon [their] hearts?

47:25.t: Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.

segments.t: Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief]
after guidance had become clear to them -
Satan enticed them
and prolonged hope for them.

47:26.t: That is because they said to those who disliked what Allāh sent down, "We will obey you in part of the matter." And Allāh knows what they conceal.

segments.t: That is because they said to those who disliked what Allāh sent down,
"We will obey you in part of the matter."
And Allāh knows what they conceal.

47:27.t: Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?

segments.t: Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death,
striking their faces and their backs?

47:28.t: That is because they followed what angered Allāh and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

segments.t: That is because they followed what angered Allāh
and disliked [what earns] His pleasure,
so He rendered worthless their deeds.

47:29.t: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allāh would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?

segments.t: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think
that Allāh would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?

47:3.t: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allāh present to the people their comparisons.

segments.t: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood,
and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord.
Thus does Allāh present to the people their comparisons.

47:30.t: And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And Allāh knows your deeds.

segments.t: And if We willed,
We could show them to you,
and you would know them by their mark;
but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech.
And Allāh knows your deeds.

47:31.t: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allāh] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.

segments.t: And We will surely test you
until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allāh]
and the patient,
and We will test your affairs.

47:32.t: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allāh and opposed the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them - never will they harm Allāh at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieved
and averted [people] from the path of Allāh
and opposed the Messenger
after guidance had become clear to them -
never will they harm Allāh at all,
and He will render worthless their deeds.

47:33.t: O you who have believed, obey Allāh and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
obey Allāh and obey the Messenger
and do not invalidate your deeds.

47:34.t: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allāh and then died while they were disbelievers - never will Allāh forgive them.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieved
and averted [people] from the path of Allāh
and then died while they were disbelievers -
never will Allāh forgive them.

47:35.t: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and Allāh is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.

segments.t: So do not weaken and call for peace
while you are superior;
and Allāh is with you
and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.

47:36.t: [This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion. And if you believe and fear Allāh, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.

segments.t: [This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion.
And if you believe and fear Allāh,
He will give you your rewards
and not ask you for your properties.

47:37.t: If He should ask you for them and press you, you would withhold, and He would expose your hatred [i.e., unwillingness].

segments.t: If He should ask you for them and press you,
you would withhold,
and He would expose your hatred [i.e., unwillingness].

47:38.t: Here you are - those invited to spend in the cause of Allāh - but among you are those who withhold [out of greed]. And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself; and Allāh is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away [i.e., refuse], He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.

segments.t: Here you are -
those invited to spend in the cause of Allāh -
but among you are those who withhold [out of greed].
And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself;
and Allāh is the Free of need,
while you are the needy.
And if you turn away [i.e., refuse],
He will replace you with another people;
then they will not be the likes of you.

47:4.t: So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure [their] bonds, and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That [is the command]. And if Allāh had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allāh - never will He waste their deeds.

segments.t: So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle],
strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them,
then secure [their] bonds,
and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them]
until the war lays down its burdens.
That [is the command].
And if Allāh had willed,
He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself],
but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others.
And those who are killed in the cause of Allāh -
never will He waste their deeds.

47:5.t: He will guide them and amend their condition

segments.t: He will guide them
and amend their condition

47:6.t: And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.

segments.t: And admit them to Paradise,
which He has made known to them.

47:7.t: O you who have believed, if you support Allāh, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
if you support Allāh,
He will support you
and plant firmly your feet.

47:8.t: But those who disbelieve - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.

segments.t: But those who disbelieve -
for them is misery,
and He will waste their deeds.

47:9.t: That is because they disliked what Allāh revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

segments.t: That is because they disliked what Allāh revealed,
so He rendered worthless their deeds.

48:1.t: Indeed, We have given you, [O Muḥammad], a clear conquest

segments.t: Indeed, We have given you, [O Muḥammad],
a clear conquest

48:10.t: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muḥammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allāh. The hand of Allāh is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allāh - He will give him a great reward.

segments.t: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you,
[O Muḥammad] -
they are actually pledging allegiance to Allāh.
The hand of Allāh is over their hands.
So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself.
And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allāh -
He will give him a great reward.

48:11.t: Those who remained behind of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts. Say, "Then who could prevent Allāh at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is Allāh, of what you do, Aware.

segments.t: Those who remained behind of the bedouins will say to you,
"Our properties and our families occupied us,
so ask forgiveness for us."
They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts.
Say, "Then who could prevent Allāh at all
if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit?
Rather, ever is Allāh, of what you do, Aware.

48:12.t: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."

segments.t: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers
would never return to their families, ever,
and that was made pleasing in your hearts.
And you assumed an assumption of evil
and became a people ruined."

48:13.t: And whoever has not believed in Allāh and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.

segments.t: And whoever has not believed in Allāh and His Messenger -
then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.

48:14.t: And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth.
He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills.
And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

48:15.t: Those who remained behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of Allāh. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did Allāh say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.

segments.t: Those who remained behind will say
when you set out toward the war booty to take it,
"Let us follow you."
They wish to change the words of Allāh.
Say, "Never will you follow us.
Thus did Allāh say before."
So they will say, "Rather, you envy us."
But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.

48:16.t: Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit. So if you obey, Allāh will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

segments.t: Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins,
"You will be called to [face] a people of great military might;
you may fight them, or they will submit.
So if you obey, Allāh will give you a good reward;
but if you turn away as you turned away before,
He will punish you with a painful punishment."

48:17.t: There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.

segments.t: There is not upon the blind any guilt
or upon the lame any guilt
or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind].
And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger -
He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow;
but whoever turns away -
He will punish him with a painful punishment.

48:18.t: Certainly was Allāh pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muḥammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest

segments.t: Certainly was Allāh pleased with the believers
when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muḥammad], under the tree,
and He knew what was in their hearts,
so He sent down tranquility upon them
and rewarded them with an imminent conquest

48:19.t: And much war booty which they will take. And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

segments.t: And much war booty which they will take.
And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

48:2.t: That Allāh may forgive for you what preceded of your sin [i.e., errors] and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path

segments.t: That Allāh may forgive for you what preceded of your sin [i.e., errors]
and what will follow
and complete His favor upon you
and guide you to a straight path

48:20.t: Allāh has promised you much booty that you will take [in the future] and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.

segments.t: Allāh has promised you much booty
that you will take [in the future]
and has hastened for you this [victory]
and withheld the hands of people from you -
that it may be a sign for the believers
and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.

48:21.t: And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which Allāh has already encompassed. And ever is Allāh, over all things, competent.

segments.t: And [He promises] other [victories]
that you were [so far] unable to [realize]
which Allāh has already encompassed.
And ever is Allāh,
over all things, competent.

48:22.t: And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.

segments.t: And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you,
they would have turned their backs [in flight].
Then they would not find a protector or a helper.

48:23.t: [This is] the established way of Allāh which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of Allāh any change.

segments.t: [This is] the established way of Allāh
which has occurred before.
And never will you find in the way of Allāh any change.

48:24.t: And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is Allāh, of what you do, Seeing.

segments.t: And it is He who withheld their hands from you
and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah
after He caused you to overcome them.
And ever is Allāh, of what you do, Seeing.

48:25.t: They are the ones who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Ḥarām while the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample [i.e., kill] them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that Allāh might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment

segments.t: They are the ones who disbelieved
and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Ḥarām
while the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice.
And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know
- that you might trample [i.e., kill] them
and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge
- [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah].
[This was so] that Allāh might admit to His mercy whom He willed.
If they had been apart [from them],
We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment

48:26.t: When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But Allāh sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is Allāh, of all things, Knowing.

segments.t: When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism -
the chauvinism of the time of ignorance.
But Allāh sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger
and upon the believers
and imposed upon them the word of righteousness,
and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it.
And ever is Allāh, of all things, Knowing.

48:27.t: Certainly has Allāh showed to His Messenger the vision [i.e., dream] in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Ḥarām, if Allāh wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened, not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].

segments.t: Certainly has Allāh showed to His Messenger the vision [i.e., dream] in truth.
You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Ḥarām,
if Allāh wills, in safety,
with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened,
not fearing [anyone].
He knew what you did not know
and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].

48:28.t: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

segments.t: It is He who sent His Messenger
with guidance and the religion of truth
to manifest it over all religion.
And sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

48:29.t: Muḥammad is the Messenger of Allāh; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from Allāh and [His] pleasure. Their sign is in their faces from the effect of prostration [i.e., prayer]. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that He [i.e., Allāh] may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allāh has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.

segments.t: Muḥammad is the Messenger of Allāh;
and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers,
merciful among themselves.
You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer],
seeking bounty from Allāh and [His] pleasure.
Their sign is in their faces from the effect of prostration [i.e., prayer].
That is their description in the Torah.
And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots
and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks,
delighting the sowers -
so that He [i.e., Allāh] may enrage by them the disbelievers.
Allāh has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them
forgiveness and a great reward.

48:3.t: And [that] Allāh may aid you with a mighty victory.

segments.t: And [that] Allāh may aid you
with a mighty victory.

48:4.t: It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allāh belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allāh Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: It is He who sent down tranquility
into the hearts of the believers
that they would increase in faith
along with their [present] faith.
And to Allāh belong the soldiers
of the heavens and the earth,
and ever is Allāh Knowing and Wise.

48:5.t: [And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of Allāh, a great attainment –

segments.t: [And] that He may admit the believing men
and the believing women to gardens
beneath which rivers flow
to abide therein eternally
and remove from them their misdeeds -
and ever is that, in the sight of Allāh,
a great attainment –

48:6.t: And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about Allāh an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature; and Allāh has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.

segments.t: And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men
and hypocrite women,
and the polytheist men
and polytheist women -
those who assume about Allāh an assumption of evil nature.
Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature;
and Allāh has become angry with them
and has cursed them
and prepared for them Hell,
and evil it is as a destination.

48:7.t: And to Allāh belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

segments.t: And to Allāh belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth.
And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

48:8.t: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner

segments.t: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness
and a bringer of good tidings
and a warner

48:9.t: That you [people] may believe in Allāh and His Messenger and honor him and respect him [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] and exalt Him [i.e., Allāh] morning and afternoon.

segments.t: That you [people] may believe in Allāh and His Messenger
and honor him and respect him [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)]
and exalt Him [i.e., Allāh] morning and afternoon.

49:1.t: O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before Allāh and His Messenger but fear Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not put [yourselves] before Allāh and His Messenger
but fear Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Knowing.

49:10.t: The believers are but brothers, so make settlement between your brothers. And fear Allāh that you may receive mercy.

segments.t: The believers are but brothers,
so make settlement between your brothers.
And fear Allāh that you may receive mercy.

49:11.t: O you who have believed, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name [i.e., mention] of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
let not a people ridicule [another] people;
perhaps they may be better than them;
nor let women ridicule [other] women;
perhaps they may be better than them.
And do not insult one another
and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames.
Wretched is the name [i.e., mention] of disobedience after [one's] faith.
And whoever does not repent -
then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

49:12.t: O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear Allāh; indeed, Allāh is Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
avoid much [negative] assumption.
Indeed, some assumption is sin.
And do not spy or backbite each other.
Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead?
You would detest it.
And fear Allāh;
indeed, Allāh is Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

49:13.t: O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allāh is the most righteous of you. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Aware.

segments.t: O mankind,
indeed We have created you from male and female
and made you peoples and tribes
that you may know one another.
Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allāh
is the most righteous of you.
Indeed, Allāh is Knowing and Aware.

49:14.t: The bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not [yet] believed; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allāh and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds of anything. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: The bedouins say,
"We have believed."
Say, "You have not [yet] believed;
but say [instead], 'We have submitted,'
for faith has not yet entered your hearts.
And if you obey Allāh and His Messenger,
He will not deprive you from your deeds of anything.
Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful."

49:15.t: The believers are only the ones who have believed in Allāh and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of Allāh. It is those who are the truthful.

segments.t: The believers are only the ones who have believed in Allāh and His Messenger
and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives
in the cause of Allāh.
It is those who are the truthful.

49:16.t: Say, "Would you acquaint Allāh with your religion while Allāh knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and Allāh is Knowing of all things?"

segments.t: Say, "Would you acquaint Allāh with your religion
while Allāh knows whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth,
and Allāh is Knowing of all things?"

49:17.t: They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Islām. Say, "Do not consider your Islām a favor to me. Rather, Allāh has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Islām.
Say, "Do not consider your Islām a favor to me.
Rather, Allāh has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith,
if you should be truthful."

49:18.t: Indeed, Allāh knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh is Seeing of what you do.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth.
And Allāh is Seeing of what you do.

49:2.t: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet
or be loud to him in speech
like the loudness of some of you to others,
lest your deeds become worthless
while you perceive not.

49:3.t: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allāh - they are the ones whose hearts Allāh has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and great reward.

segments.t: Indeed, those who lower their voices
before the Messenger of Allāh -
they are the ones whose hearts Allāh has tested for righteousness.
For them is forgiveness and great reward.

49:4.t: Indeed, those who call you, [O Muḥammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.

segments.t: Indeed, those who call you, [O Muḥammad],
from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.

49:5.t: And if they had been patient until you [could] come out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And if they had been patient
until you [could] come out to them,
it would have been better for them.
But Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

49:6.t: O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
if there comes to you a disobedient one with information,
investigate,
lest you harm a people out of ignorance
and become, over what you have done, regretful.

49:7.t: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allāh. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be in difficulty, but Allāh has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.

segments.t: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allāh.
If he were to obey you in much of the matter,
you would be in difficulty,
but Allāh has endeared to you the faith
and has made it pleasing in your hearts
and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience.
Those are the [rightly] guided.

49:8.t: [It is] as bounty from Allāh and favor. And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: [It is] as bounty from Allāh and favor.
And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

49:9.t: And if two factions among the believers should fight, then make settlement between the two. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of Allāh. And if it returns, then make settlement between them in justice and act justly. Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.

segments.t: And if two factions among the believers should fight,
then make settlement between the two.
But if one of them oppresses the other,
then fight against the one that oppresses
until it returns to the ordinance of Allāh.
And if it returns,
then make settlement between them in justice
and act justly.
Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.

4:1.t: O mankind, fear your Lord, who created you from one soul and created from it its mate and dispersed from both of them many men and women. And fear Allāh, through whom you ask one another, and the wombs. Indeed Allāh is ever, over you, an Observer.

segments.t: O mankind,
fear your Lord,
who created you from one soul
and created from it its mate
and dispersed from both of them many men and women.
And fear Allāh,
through whom you ask one another,
and the wombs.
Indeed Allāh is ever, over you, an Observer.

4:10.t: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming into their bellies fire. And they will be burned in a Blaze [i.e., Hellfire].

segments.t: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly
are only consuming into their bellies fire.
And they will be burned in a Blaze [i.e., Hellfire].

4:100.t: And whoever emigrates for the cause of Allāh will find on the earth many [alternative] locations and abundance. And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allāh and His Messenger and then death overtakes him - his reward has already become incumbent upon Allāh. And Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And whoever emigrates for the cause of Allāh
will find on the earth many [alternative] locations and abundance.
And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allāh and His Messenger
and then death overtakes him -
his reward has already become incumbent upon Allāh.
And Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

4:101.t: And when you travel throughout the land, there is no blame upon you for shortening the prayer, [especially] if you fear that those who disbelieve may disrupt [or attack] you. Indeed, the disbelievers are ever to you a clear enemy.

segments.t: And when you travel throughout the land,
there is no blame upon you for shortening the prayer,
[especially] if you fear that those who disbelieve may disrupt [or attack] you.
Indeed, the disbelievers are ever to you a clear enemy.

4:102.t: And when you [i.e., the commander of an army] are among them and lead them in prayer, let a group of them stand [in prayer] with you and let them carry their arms. And when they have prostrated, let them be [in position] behind you and have the other group come forward which has not [yet] prayed and let them pray with you, taking precaution and carrying their arms. Those who disbelieve wish that you would neglect your weapons and your baggage so they could come down upon you in one [single] attack. But there is no blame upon you, if you are troubled by rain or are ill, for putting down your arms, but take precaution. Indeed, Allāh has prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: And when you [i.e., the commander of an army] are among them
and lead them in prayer,
let a group of them stand [in prayer] with you
and let them carry their arms.
And when they have prostrated,
let them be [in position] behind you
and have the other group come forward which has not [yet] prayed
and let them pray with you,
taking precaution and carrying their arms.
Those who disbelieve wish that you would neglect your weapons
and your baggage
so they could come down upon you in one [single] attack.
But there is no blame upon you,
if you are troubled by rain or are ill,
for putting down your arms,
but take precaution.
Indeed, Allāh has prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.

4:103.t: And when you have completed the prayer, remember Allāh standing, sitting, or [lying] on your sides. But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] prayer. Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.

segments.t: And when you have completed the prayer,
remember Allāh standing, sitting, or [lying] on your sides.
But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] prayer.
Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.

4:104.t: And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy. If you should be suffering - so are they suffering as you are suffering, but you expect from Allāh that which they expect not. And Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And do not weaken in pursuit of the enemy.
If you should be suffering -
so are they suffering as you are suffering,
but you expect from Allāh that which they expect not.
And Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

4:105.t: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], the Book in truth so you may judge between the people by that which Allāh has shown you. And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.

segments.t: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad],
the Book in truth
so you may judge between the people
by that which Allāh has shown you.
And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.

4:106.t: And seek forgiveness of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And seek forgiveness of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

4:107.t: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. Indeed, Allāh loves not one who is a habitually sinful deceiver.

segments.t: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves.
Indeed, Allāh loves not one who is a habitually sinful deceiver.

4:108.t: They conceal [their evil intentions and deeds] from the people, but they cannot conceal [them] from Allāh, and He is with them [in His knowledge] when they spend the night in such as He does not accept of speech. And ever is Allāh, of what they do, encompassing.

segments.t: They conceal [their evil intentions and deeds] from the people,
but they cannot conceal [them] from Allāh,
and He is with them [in His knowledge]
when they spend the night in such as He does not accept of speech.
And ever is Allāh, of what they do, encompassing.

4:109.t: Here you are - those who argue on their behalf in [this] worldly life - but who will argue with Allāh for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who will [then] be their representative?

segments.t: Here you are -
those who argue on their behalf in [this] worldly life -
but who will argue with Allāh for them on the Day of Resurrection,
or who will [then] be their representative?

4:11.t: Allāh instructs you concerning your children [i.e., their portions of inheritance]: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [and/or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit. [These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: Allāh instructs you concerning your children [i.e., their portions of inheritance]:
for the male, what is equal to the share of two females.
But if there are [only] daughters, two or more,
for them is two thirds of one's estate.
And if there is only one, for her is half.
And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate
if he left children.
But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him,
then for his mother is one third.
And if he had brothers [and/or sisters], for his mother is a sixth,
after any bequest he [may have] made or debt.
Your parents or your children -
you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit.
[These shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

4:110.t: And whoever does a wrong or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness of Allāh will find Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And whoever does a wrong
or wrongs himself
but then seeks forgiveness of Allāh
will find Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

4:111.t: And whoever earns [i.e., commits] a sin only earns it against himself. And Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And whoever earns [i.e., commits] a sin
only earns it against himself.
And Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

4:112.t: But whoever earns an offense or a sin and then blames it on an innocent [person] has taken upon himself a slander and manifest sin.

segments.t: But whoever earns an offense or a sin
and then blames it on an innocent [person]
has taken upon himself a slander and manifest sin.

4:113.t: And if it was not for the favor of Allāh upon you, [O Muḥammad], and His mercy, a group of them would have determined to mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they will not harm you at all. And Allāh has revealed to you the Book and wisdom and has taught you that which you did not know. And ever has the favor of Allāh upon you been great.

segments.t: And if it was not for the favor of Allāh upon you, [O Muḥammad],
and His mercy, a group of them would have determined to mislead you.
But they do not mislead except themselves,
and they will not harm you at all.
And Allāh has revealed to you the Book and wisdom
and has taught you that which you did not know.
And ever has the favor of Allāh upon you been great.

4:114.t: No good is there in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity or that which is right or conciliation between people. And whoever does that seeking means to the approval of Allāh - then We are going to give him a great reward.

segments.t: No good is there in much of their private conversation,
except for those who enjoin charity
or that which is right
or conciliation between people.
And whoever does that seeking means to the approval of Allāh -
then We are going to give him a great reward.

4:115.t: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers - We will give him what he has taken and drive him into Hell, and evil it is as a destination.

segments.t: And whoever opposes the Messenger
after guidance has become clear to him
and follows other than the way of the believers -
We will give him what he has taken
and drive him into Hell,
and evil it is as a destination.

4:116.t: Indeed, Allāh does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allāh has certainly gone far astray.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh does not forgive association with Him,
but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills.
And he who associates others with Allāh has certainly gone far astray.

4:117.t: They call upon instead of Him none but female [deities], and they [actually] call upon none but a rebellious Satan,

segments.t: They call upon instead of Him none but female [deities],
and they [actually] call upon none but a rebellious Satan,

4:118.t: Whom Allāh has cursed. For he had said, "I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion.

segments.t: Whom Allāh has cursed.
For he had said,
"I will surely take from among Your servants a specific portion.

4:119.t: And I will mislead them, and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires, and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them so they will change the creation of Allāh." And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of Allāh has certainly sustained a clear loss.

segments.t: And I will mislead them,
and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires,
and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle,
and I will command them so they will change the creation of Allāh."
And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of Allāh
has certainly sustained a clear loss.

4:12.t: And for you is half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for them [i.e., the wives] is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is an eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allāh, and Allāh is Knowing and Forbearing.

segments.t: And for you is half of what your wives leave
if they have no child.
But if they have a child,
for you is one fourth of what they leave,
after any bequest they [may have] made or debt.
And for them [i.e., the wives] is one fourth
if you leave no child.
But if you leave a child,
then for them is an eighth of what you leave,
after any bequest you [may have] made or debt.
And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants
but has a brother or a sister,
then for each one of them is a sixth.
But if they are more than two,
they share a third,
after any bequest which was made or debt,
as long as there is no detriment [caused].
[This is] an ordinance from Allāh,
and Allāh is Knowing and Forbearing.

4:120.t: He [i.e., Satan] promises them and arouses desire in them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

segments.t: He [i.e., Satan] promises them
and arouses desire in them.
But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

4:121.t: The refuge of those will be Hell, and they will not find from it an escape.

segments.t: The refuge of those will be Hell,
and they will not find from it an escape.

4:122.t: But the ones who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. [It is] the promise of Allāh, [which is] truth, and who is more truthful than Allāh in statement.

segments.t: But the ones who believe and do righteous deeds -
We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they will abide forever.
[It is] the promise of Allāh, [which is] truth,
and who is more truthful than Allāh in statement.

4:123.t: It [i.e., Paradise] is not [obtained] by your wishful thinking nor by that of the People of the Scripture. Whoever does a wrong will be recompensed for it, and he will not find besides Allāh a protector or a helper.

segments.t: It [i.e., Paradise] is not [obtained] by your wishful thinking
nor by that of the People of the Scripture.
Whoever does a wrong will be recompensed for it,
and he will not find besides Allāh a protector or a helper.

4:124.t: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged, [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.

segments.t: And whoever does righteous deeds,
whether male or female,
while being a believer -
those will enter Paradise
and will not be wronged,
[even as much as] the speck on a date seed.

4:125.t: And who is better in religion than one who submits himself to Allāh while being a doer of good and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth? And Allāh took Abraham as an intimate friend.

segments.t: And who is better in religion than one who submits himself to Allāh
while being a doer of good
and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth?
And Allāh took Abraham as an intimate friend.

4:126.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allāh, of all things, encompassing.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And ever is Allāh,
of all things, encompassing.

4:127.t: And they request from you, [O Muḥammad], a [legal] ruling concerning women. Say, "Allāh gives you a ruling about them and [about] what has been recited to you in the Book concerning the orphan girls to whom you do not give what is decreed for them - and [yet] you desire to marry them - and concerning the oppressed among children and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice." And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing of it.

segments.t: And they request from you, [O Muḥammad],
a [legal] ruling concerning women.
Say, "Allāh gives you a ruling about them
and [about] what has been recited to you in the Book
concerning the orphan girls to whom you do not give what is decreed for them
- and [yet] you desire to marry them -
and concerning the oppressed among children
and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice."
And whatever you do of good -
indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing of it.

4:128.t: And if a woman fears from her husband contempt or evasion, there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between them - and settlement is best. And present in [human] souls is stinginess. But if you do good and fear Allāh - then indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

segments.t: And if a woman fears from her husband contempt or evasion,
there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between them -
and settlement is best.
And present in [human] souls is stinginess.
But if you do good and fear Allāh -
then indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

4:129.t: And you will never be able to be equal [in feeling] between wives, even if you should strive [to do so]. So do not incline completely [toward one] and leave another hanging. And if you amend [your affairs] and fear Allāh - then indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And you will never be able to be equal [in feeling] between wives,
even if you should strive [to do so].
So do not incline completely [toward one]
and leave another hanging.
And if you amend [your affairs] and fear Allāh -
then indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

4:13.t: These are the limits [set by] Allāh, and whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.

segments.t: These are the limits [set by] Allāh,
and whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger
will be admitted by Him to gardens [in Paradise] under which rivers flow,
abiding eternally therein;
and that is the great attainment.

4:130.t: But if they separate [by divorce], Allāh will enrich each [of them] from His abundance. And ever is Allāh Encompassing and Wise.

segments.t: But if they separate [by divorce],
Allāh will enrich each [of them] from His abundance.
And ever is Allāh Encompassing and Wise.

4:131.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you and yourselves to fear Allāh. But if you disbelieve - then to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allāh Free of need and Praiseworthy.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you and yourselves
to fear Allāh.
But if you disbelieve -
then to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And ever is Allāh Free of need and Praiseworthy.

4:132.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

segments.t: And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

4:133.t: If He wills, He can do away with you, O people, and bring others [in your place]. And ever is Allāh competent to do that.

segments.t: If He wills,
He can do away with you, O people,
and bring others [in your place].
And ever is Allāh competent to do that.

4:134.t: Whoever desires the reward of this world - then with Allāh is the reward of this world and the Hereafter. And ever is Allāh Hearing and Seeing.

segments.t: Whoever desires the reward of this world -
then with Allāh is the reward of this world and the Hereafter.
And ever is Allāh Hearing and Seeing.

4:135.t: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm in justice, witnesses for Allāh, even if it be against yourselves or parents and relatives. Whether one is rich or poor, Allāh is more worthy of both. So follow not [personal] inclination, lest you not be just. And if you distort [your testimony] or refuse [to give it], then indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
be persistently standing firm in justice,
witnesses for Allāh,
even if it be against yourselves or parents and relatives.
Whether one is rich or poor,
Allāh is more worthy of both.
So follow not [personal] inclination,
lest you not be just.
And if you distort [your testimony] or refuse [to give it],
then indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

4:136.t: O you who have believed, believe in Allāh and His Messenger and the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger and the Scripture which He sent down before. And whoever disbelieves in Allāh, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly gone far astray.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
believe in Allāh and His Messenger
and the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger
and the Scripture which He sent down before.
And whoever disbelieves in Allāh,
His angels, His books, His messengers,
and the Last Day
has certainly gone far astray.

4:137.t: Indeed, those who have believed then disbelieved, then believed then disbelieved, and then increased in disbelief - never will Allāh forgive them, nor will He guide them to a way.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have believed then disbelieved,
then believed then disbelieved,
and then increased in disbelief -
never will Allāh forgive them,
nor will He guide them to a way.

4:138.t: Give tidings to the hypocrites that there is for them a painful punishment -

segments.t: Give tidings to the hypocrites
that there is for them a painful punishment -

4:139.t: Those who take disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do they seek with them honor [through power]? But indeed, honor belongs to Allāh entirely.

segments.t: Those who take disbelievers as allies
instead of the believers.
Do they seek with them honor [through power]?
But indeed, honor belongs to Allāh entirely.

4:14.t: And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein, and he will have a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger
and transgresses His limits -
He will put him into the Fire to abide eternally therein,
and he will have a humiliating punishment.

4:140.t: And it has already come down to you in the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] that when you hear the verses of Allāh [recited], they are denied [by them] and ridiculed; so do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation. Indeed, you would then be like them. Indeed, Allāh will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together -

segments.t: And it has already come down to you in the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
that when you hear the verses of Allāh [recited],
they are denied [by them] and ridiculed;
so do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation.
Indeed, you would then be like them.
Indeed, Allāh will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together -

4:141.t: Those who wait [and watch] you. Then if you gain a victory from Allāh, they say, "Were we not with you?" But if the disbelievers have a success, they say [to them], "Did we not gain the advantage over you, but we protected you from the believers?" Allāh will judge between [all of] you on the Day of Resurrection, and never will Allāh give the disbelievers over the believers a way [to overcome them].

segments.t: Those who wait [and watch] you.
Then if you gain a victory from Allāh,
they say, "Were we not with you?"
But if the disbelievers have a success,
they say [to them], "Did we not gain the advantage over you,
but we protected you from the believers?"
Allāh will judge between [all of] you on the Day of Resurrection,
and never will Allāh give the disbelievers over the believers a way [to overcome them].

4:142.t: Indeed, the hypocrites [think to] deceive Allāh, but He is deceiving them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing [themselves to] the people and not remembering Allāh except a little,

segments.t: Indeed, the hypocrites [think to] deceive Allāh,
but He is deceiving them.
And when they stand for prayer,
they stand lazily,
showing [themselves to] the people
and not remembering Allāh except a little,

4:143.t: Wavering between them, [belonging] neither to these [i.e., the believers] nor to those [i.e., the disbelievers]. And whoever Allāh sends astray - never will you find for him a way.

segments.t: Wavering between them,
[belonging] neither to these [i.e., the believers]
nor to those [i.e., the disbelievers].
And whoever Allāh sends astray -
never will you find for him a way.

4:144.t: O you who have believed, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do you wish to give Allāh against yourselves a clear case?

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not take the disbelievers as allies
instead of the believers.
Do you wish to give Allāh against yourselves a clear case?

4:145.t: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper -

segments.t: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire -
and never will you find for them a helper -

4:146.t: Except for those who repent, correct themselves, hold fast to Allāh, and are sincere in their religion for Allāh, for those will be with the believers. And Allāh is going to give the believers a great reward.

segments.t: Except for those who repent,
correct themselves,
hold fast to Allāh,
and are sincere in their religion for Allāh,
for those will be with the believers.
And Allāh is going to give the believers a great reward.

4:147.t: What would Allāh do with [i.e., gain from] your punishment if you are grateful and believe? And ever is Allāh Appreciative and Knowing.

segments.t: What would Allāh do with [i.e., gain from] your punishment
if you are grateful and believe?
And ever is Allāh Appreciative and Knowing.

4:148.t: Allāh does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allāh Hearing and Knowing.

segments.t: Allāh does not like the public mention of evil
except by one who has been wronged.
And ever is Allāh Hearing and Knowing.

4:149.t: If [instead] you show [some] good or conceal it or pardon an offense - indeed, Allāh is ever Pardoning and Competent.

segments.t: If [instead] you show [some] good
or conceal it
or pardon an offense -
indeed, Allāh is ever Pardoning and Competent.

4:15.t: Those who commit immorality [i.e., unlawful sexual intercourse] of your women - bring against them four [witnesses] from among you. And if they testify, confine them [i.e., the guilty women] to houses until death takes them or Allāh ordains for them [another] way.

segments.t: Those who commit immorality [i.e., unlawful sexual intercourse] of your women -
bring against them four [witnesses] from among you.
And if they testify,
confine them [i.e., the guilty women] to houses until death takes them
or Allāh ordains for them [another] way.

4:150.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allāh and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allāh and His messengers and say, "We believe in some and disbelieve in others," and wish to adopt a way in between -

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allāh and His messengers
and wish to discriminate between Allāh and His messengers
and say, "We believe in some and disbelieve in others,"
and wish to adopt a way in between -

4:151.t: Those are the disbelievers, truly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.

segments.t: Those are the disbelievers, truly.
And We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.

4:152.t: But they who believe in Allāh and His messengers and do not discriminate between any of them - to those He is going to give their rewards. And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: But they who believe in Allāh and His messengers
and do not discriminate between any of them -
to those He is going to give their rewards.
And ever is Allāh Forgiving and Merciful.

4:153.t: The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said, "Show us Allāh outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf [for worship] after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority.

segments.t: The People of the Scripture ask you
to bring down to them a book from the heaven.
But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said,
"Show us Allāh outright,"
so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing.
Then they took the calf [for worship]
after clear evidences had come to them,
and We pardoned that.
And We gave Moses a clear authority.

4:154.t: And We raised over them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, "Enter the gate bowing humbly"; and We said to them, "Do not transgress on the sabbath"; and We took from them a solemn covenant.

segments.t: And We raised over them the mount
for [refusal of] their covenant;
and We said to them,
"Enter the gate bowing humbly";
and We said to them,
"Do not transgress on the sabbath";
and We took from them a solemn covenant.

4:155.t: And [We cursed them] for their breaking of the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of Allāh and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, "Our hearts are wrapped" [i.e., sealed against reception]. Rather, Allāh has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.

segments.t: And [We cursed them] for their breaking of the covenant
and their disbelief in the signs of Allāh
and their killing of the prophets without right
and their saying, "Our hearts are wrapped" [i.e., sealed against reception].
Rather, Allāh has sealed them because of their disbelief,
so they believe not, except for a few.

4:156.t: And [We cursed them] for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander

segments.t: And [We cursed them] for their disbelief
and their saying against Mary a great slander

4:157.t: And [for] their saying, "Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus the son of Mary, the messenger of Allāh." And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but [another] was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. And they did not kill him, for certain.

segments.t: And [for] their saying,
"Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus the son of Mary,
the messenger of Allāh."
And they did not kill him,
nor did they crucify him;
but [another] was made to resemble him to them.
And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it.
They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption.
And they did not kill him, for certain.

4:158.t: Rather, Allāh raised him to Himself. And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

segments.t: Rather, Allāh raised him to Himself.
And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

4:159.t: And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in him [i.e., Jesus] before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness.

segments.t: And there is none from the People of the Scripture
but that he will surely believe in him [i.e., Jesus]
before his death.
And on the Day of Resurrection
he will be against them a witness.

4:16.t: And the two who commit it [i.e., unlawful sexual intercourse] among you - punish [i.e., dishonor] them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, Allāh is ever Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

segments.t: And the two who commit it [i.e., unlawful sexual intercourse] among you -
punish [i.e., dishonor] them both.
But if they repent and correct themselves,
leave them alone.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

4:160.t: For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We made unlawful for them [certain] good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of Allāh many [people],

segments.t: For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews,
We made unlawful for them [certain] good foods
which had been lawful to them,
and for their averting from the way of Allāh many [people],

4:161.t: And [for] their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.

segments.t: And [for] their taking of usury
while they had been forbidden from it,
and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly.
And We have prepared for the disbelievers among them
a painful punishment.

4:162.t: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer [especially] and the givers of zakāh and the believers in Allāh and the Last Day - those We will give a great reward.

segments.t: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers
believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muḥammad],
and what was revealed before you.
And the establishers of prayer [especially]
and the givers of zakāh
and the believers in Allāh and the Last Day -
those We will give a great reward.

4:163.t: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon; and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

segments.t: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad],
as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him.
And We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon;
and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

4:164.t: And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allāh spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.

segments.t: And [We sent] messengers
about whom We have related [their stories] to you before
and messengers about whom We have not related to you.
And Allāh spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.

4:165.t: [We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allāh after the messengers. And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

segments.t: [We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners
so that mankind will have no argument against Allāh after the messengers.
And ever is Allāh Exalted in Might and Wise.

4:166.t: But Allāh bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

segments.t: But Allāh bears witness to that which He has revealed to you.
He has sent it down with His knowledge,
and the angels bear witness [as well].
And sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

4:167.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allāh have certainly gone far astray.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve
and avert [people] from the way of Allāh
have certainly gone far astray.

4:168.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will Allāh forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path,

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] -
never will Allāh forgive them,
nor will He guide them to a path,

4:169.t: Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that, for Allāh, is [always] easy.

segments.t: Except the path of Hell;
they will abide therein forever.
And that, for Allāh, is [always] easy.

4:17.t: The repentance accepted by Allāh is only for those who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness] and then repent soon [after]. It is those to whom Allāh will turn in forgiveness, and Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: The repentance accepted by Allāh is only for those
who do wrong in ignorance [or carelessness]
and then repent soon [after].
It is those to whom Allāh will turn in forgiveness,
and Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

4:170.t: O mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe; it is better for you. But if you disbelieve - then indeed, to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is Allāh Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: O mankind,
the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord,
so believe; it is better for you.
But if you disbelieve -
then indeed, to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth.
And ever is Allāh Knowing and Wise.

4:171.t: O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allāh except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allāh and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul [created at a command] from Him. So believe in Allāh and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allāh is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

segments.t: O People of the Scripture,
do not commit excess in your religion
or say about Allāh except the truth.
The Messiah, Jesus the son of Mary,
was but a messenger of Allāh
and His word which He directed to Mary
and a soul [created at a command] from Him.
So believe in Allāh and His messengers.
And do not say, "Three";
desist - it is better for you.
Indeed, Allāh is but one God.
Exalted is He above having a son.
To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth.
And sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

4:172.t: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allāh, nor would the angels near [to Him]. And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant - He will gather them to Himself all together.

segments.t: Never would the Messiah disdain to be a servant of Allāh,
nor would the angels near [to Him].
And whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant -
He will gather them to Himself all together.

4:173.t: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who disdained and were arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allāh any protector or helper.

segments.t: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds,
He will give them in full their rewards
and grant them extra from His bounty.
But as for those who disdained and were arrogant,
He will punish them with a painful punishment,
and they will not find for themselves besides Allāh any protector or helper.

4:174.t: O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.

segments.t: O mankind,
there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord,
and We have sent down to you a clear light.

4:175.t: So those who believe in Allāh and hold fast to Him - He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path.

segments.t: So those who believe in Allāh
and hold fast to Him -
He will admit them to mercy from Himself
and bounty
and guide them to Himself on a straight path.

4:176.t: They request from you a [legal] ruling. Say, "Allāh gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]." If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child.
