But if there are two sisters [or more], they will have two thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females. Allāh makes clear to you [His law], lest you go astray. And Allāh is Knowing of all things.

segments.t: They request from you a [legal] ruling.
Say, "Allāh gives you a ruling
concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]."
If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister,
she will have half of what he left.
And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child.
But if there are two sisters [or more],
they will have two thirds of what he left.
If there are both brothers and sisters,
the male will have the share of two females.
Allāh makes clear to you [His law],
lest you go astray.
And Allāh is Knowing of all things.

4:18.t: But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "Indeed, I have repented now," or of those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment.

segments.t: But repentance is not [accepted] of those who [continue to] do evil deeds
up until, when death comes to one of them, he says,
"Indeed, I have repented now,"
or of those who die while they are disbelievers.
For them We have prepared a painful punishment.

4:19.t: O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality [i.e., adultery]. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allāh makes therein much good.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion.
And do not make difficulties for them
in order to take [back] part of what you gave them
unless they commit a clear immorality [i.e., adultery].
And live with them in kindness.
For if you dislike them -
perhaps you dislike a thing
and Allāh makes therein much good.

4:2.t: And give to the orphans their properties and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs]. And do not consume their properties into your own. Indeed, that is ever a great sin.

segments.t: And give to the orphans their properties
and do not substitute the defective [of your own] for the good [of theirs].
And do not consume their properties into your own.
Indeed, that is ever a great sin.

4:20.t: But if you want to replace one wife with another and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts], do not take [back] from it anything. Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?

segments.t: But if you want to replace one wife with another
and you have given one of them a great amount [in gifts],
do not take [back] from it anything.
Would you take it in injustice and manifest sin?

4:21.t: And how could you take it while you have gone in unto each other and they have taken from you a solemn covenant?

segments.t: And how could you take it
while you have gone in unto each other
and they have taken from you a solemn covenant?

4:22.t: And do not marry those [women] whom your fathers married, except what has already occurred. Indeed, it was an immorality and hateful [to Allāh] and was evil as a way.

segments.t: And do not marry those [women] whom your fathers married,
except what has already occurred.
Indeed, it was an immorality and hateful [to Allāh]
and was evil as a way.

4:23.t: Prohibited to you [for marriage] are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your father's sisters, your mother's sisters, your brother's daughters, your sister's daughters, your [milk] mothers who nursed you, your sisters through nursing, your wives' mothers, and your step-daughters under your guardianship [born] of your wives unto whom you have gone in. But if you have not gone in unto them, there is no sin upon you. And [also prohibited are] the wives of your sons who are from your [own] loins, and that you take [in marriage] two sisters simultaneously, except for what has already occurred. Indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Prohibited to you [for marriage] are your mothers,
your daughters,
your sisters,
your father's sisters,
your mother's sisters,
your brother's daughters,
your sister's daughters,
your [milk] mothers who nursed you,
your sisters through nursing,
your wives' mothers,
and your step-daughters under your guardianship [born] of your wives
unto whom you have gone in.
But if you have not gone in unto them,
there is no sin upon you.
And [also prohibited are] the wives of your sons who are from your [own] loins,
and that you take [in marriage] two sisters simultaneously,
except for what has already occurred.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

4:24.t: And [also prohibited to you are all] married women except those your right hands possess. [This is] the decree of Allāh upon you. And lawful to you are [all others] beyond these, [provided] that you seek them [in marriage] with [gifts from] your property, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse. So for whatever you enjoy [of marriage] from them, give them their due compensation as an obligation. And there is no blame upon you for what you mutually agree to beyond the obligation. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And [also prohibited to you are all] married women
except those your right hands possess.
[This is] the decree of Allāh upon you.
And lawful to you are [all others] beyond these,
[provided] that you seek them [in marriage] with [gifts from] your property,
desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse.
So for whatever you enjoy [of marriage] from them,
give them their due compensation as an obligation.
And there is no blame upon you for what you mutually agree to beyond the obligation.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

4:25.t: And whoever among you cannot [find] the means to marry free, believing women, then [he may marry] from those whom your right hands possess of believing slave girls. And Allāh is most knowing about your faith. You [believers] are of one another. So marry them with the permission of their people and give them their due compensation [i.e., mahr] according to what is acceptable. [They should be] chaste, neither [of] those who commit unlawful intercourse randomly nor those who take [secret] lovers. But once they are sheltered in marriage, if they should commit adultery, then for them is half the punishment for free [unmarried] women. This [allowance] is for him among you who fears affliction [i.e., sin], but to be patient is better for you. And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And whoever among you cannot [find] the means to marry free, believing women,
then [he may marry] from those whom your right hands possess of believing slave girls.
And Allāh is most knowing about your faith.
You [believers] are of one another.
So marry them with the permission of their people
and give them their due compensation [i.e., mahr] according to what is acceptable.
[They should be] chaste,
neither [of] those who commit unlawful intercourse randomly
nor those who take [secret] lovers.
But once they are sheltered in marriage, if they should commit adultery,
then for them is half the punishment for free [unmarried] women.
This [allowance] is for him among you who fears affliction [i.e., sin],
but to be patient is better for you.
And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

4:26.t: Allāh wants to make clear to you [the lawful from the unlawful] and guide you to the [good] practices of those before you and to accept your repentance. And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: Allāh wants to make clear to you [the lawful from the unlawful]
and guide you to the [good] practices of those before you
and to accept your repentance.
And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

4:27.t: Allāh wants to accept your repentance, but those who follow [their] passions want you to digress [into] a great deviation.

segments.t: Allāh wants to accept your repentance,
but those who follow [their] passions
want you to digress [into] a great deviation.

4:28.t: And Allāh wants to lighten for you [your difficulties]; and mankind was created weak.

segments.t: And Allāh wants to lighten for you [your difficulties];
and mankind was created weak.

4:29.t: O you who have believed, do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allāh is to you ever Merciful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not consume one another's wealth unjustly
but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent.
And do not kill yourselves [or one another].
Indeed, Allāh is to you ever Merciful.

4:3.t: And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hands possess [i.e., slaves]. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].

segments.t: And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls,
then marry those that please you of [other] women,
two or three or four.
But if you fear that you will not be just,
then [marry only] one or those your right hands possess [i.e., slaves].
That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].

4:30.t: And whoever does that in aggression and injustice - then We will drive him into a Fire. And that, for Allāh, is [always] easy.

segments.t: And whoever does that
in aggression and injustice -
then We will drive him into a Fire.
And that, for Allāh, is [always] easy.

4:31.t: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden, We will remove from you your lesser sins and admit you to a noble entrance [into Paradise].

segments.t: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden,
We will remove from you your lesser sins
and admit you to a noble entrance [into Paradise].

4:32.t: And do not wish for that by which Allāh has made some of you exceed others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask Allāh of His bounty. Indeed Allāh is ever, of all things, Knowing.

segments.t: And do not wish for that by which Allāh has made some of you exceed others.
For men is a share of what they have earned,
and for women is a share of what they have earned.
And ask Allāh of His bounty.
Indeed Allāh is ever, of all things, Knowing.

4:33.t: And for all, We have made heirs to what is left by parents and relatives. And to those whom your oaths have bound [to you] - give them their share. Indeed Allāh is ever, over all things, a Witness.

segments.t: And for all,
We have made heirs to what is left by parents and relatives.
And to those whom your oaths have bound [to you] -
give them their share.
Indeed Allāh is ever, over all things, a Witness.

4:34.t: Men are in charge of women by [right of] what Allāh has given one over the other and what they spend [for maintenance] from their wealth. So righteous women are devoutly obedient, guarding in [the husband's] absence what Allāh would have them guard. But those [wives] from whom you fear arrogance - [first] advise them; [then if they persist], forsake them in bed; and [finally], strike them [lightly]. But if they obey you [once more], seek no means against them. Indeed, Allāh is ever Exalted and Grand.

segments.t: Men are in charge of women
by [right of] what Allāh has given one over the other
and what they spend [for maintenance] from their wealth.
So righteous women are devoutly obedient,
guarding in [the husband's] absence
what Allāh would have them guard.
But those [wives] from whom you fear arrogance -
[first] advise them;
[then if they persist], forsake them in bed;
and [finally], strike them [lightly].
But if they obey you [once more],
seek no means against them.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Exalted and Grand.

4:35.t: And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, Allāh will cause it between them. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Aware.

segments.t: And if you fear dissension between the two,
send an arbitrator from his people
and an arbitrator from her people.
If they both desire reconciliation,
Allāh will cause it between them.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Aware.

4:36.t: Worship Allāh and associate nothing with Him, and to parents do good, and to relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor, the neighbor farther away, the companion at your side, the traveler, and those whom your right hands possess. Indeed, Allāh does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful,

segments.t: Worship Allāh and associate nothing with Him,
and to parents do good,
and to relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor,
the neighbor farther away, the companion at your side, the traveler,
and those whom your right hands possess.
Indeed, Allāh does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful,

4:37.t: Who are stingy and enjoin upon [other] people stinginess and conceal what Allāh has given them of His bounty - and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment -

segments.t: Who are stingy
and enjoin upon [other] people stinginess
and conceal what Allāh has given them of His bounty -
and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment -

4:38.t: And [also] those who spend of their wealth to be seen by the people and believe not in Allāh nor in the Last Day. And he to whom Satan is a companion - then evil is he as a companion.

segments.t: And [also] those who spend of their wealth
to be seen by the people
and believe not in Allāh
nor in the Last Day.
And he to whom Satan is a companion -
then evil is he as a companion.

4:39.t: And what [harm would come] upon them if they believed in Allāh and the Last Day and spent out of what Allāh provided for them? And Allāh is ever, about them, Knowing.

segments.t: And what [harm would come] upon them
if they believed in Allāh and the Last Day
and spent out of what Allāh provided for them?
And Allāh is ever, about them, Knowing.

4:4.t: And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously. But if they give up willingly to you anything of it, then take it in satisfaction and ease.

segments.t: And give the women [upon marriage] their [bridal] gifts graciously.
But if they give up willingly to you anything of it,
then take it in satisfaction and ease.

4:40.t: Indeed, Allāh does not do injustice, [even] as much as an atom's weight; while if there is a good deed, He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh does not do injustice,
[even] as much as an atom's weight;
while if there is a good deed,
He multiplies it and gives from Himself a great reward.

4:41.t: So how [will it be] when We bring from every nation a witness and We bring you, [O Muḥammad], against these [people] as a witness?

segments.t: So how [will it be] when We bring from every nation a witness
and We bring you, [O Muḥammad], against these [people] as a witness?

4:42.t: That Day, those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger will wish they could be covered by the earth. And they will not conceal from Allāh a [single] statement.

segments.t: That Day,
those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger
will wish they could be covered by the earth.
And they will not conceal from Allāh a [single] statement.

4:43.t: O you who have believed, do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated until you know what you are saying or in a state of janābah, except those passing through [a place of prayer], until you have washed [your whole body]. And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women [i.e., had sexual intercourse] and find no water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, Allāh is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated
until you know what you are saying
or in a state of janābah,
except those passing through [a place of prayer],
until you have washed [your whole body].
And if you are ill or on a journey
or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself
or you have contacted women [i.e., had sexual intercourse]
and find no water,
then seek clean earth
and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it].
Indeed, Allāh is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.

4:44.t: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, purchasing error [in exchange for it] and wishing you would lose the way?

segments.t: Have you not seen those
who were given a portion of the Scripture,
purchasing error [in exchange for it]
and wishing you would lose the way?

4:45.t: And Allāh is most knowing of your enemies; and sufficient is Allāh as an ally, and sufficient is Allāh as a helper.

segments.t: And Allāh is most knowing of your enemies;
and sufficient is Allāh as an ally,
and sufficient is Allāh as a helper.

4:46.t: Among the Jews are those who distort words from their [proper] places [i.e., usages] and say, "We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard" and "Rāʿinā," twisting their tongues and defaming the religion. And if they had said [instead], "We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand]," it would have been better for them and more suitable. But Allāh has cursed them for their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.

segments.t: Among the Jews are those who distort words
from their [proper] places [i.e., usages] and say,
"We hear and disobey" and "Hear but be not heard"
and "Rāʿinā," twisting their tongues
and defaming the religion.
And if they had said [instead],
"We hear and obey" and "Wait for us [to understand],"
it would have been better for them and more suitable.
But Allāh has cursed them for their disbelief,
so they believe not, except for a few.

4:47.t: O you who were given the Scripture, believe in what We have sent down [to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)], confirming that which is with you, before We obliterate faces and turn them toward their backs or curse them as We cursed the sabbath-breakers. And ever is the matter [i.e., decree] of Allāh accomplished.

segments.t: O you who were given the Scripture,
believe in what We have sent down [to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)],
confirming that which is with you,
before We obliterate faces
and turn them toward their backs
or curse them as We cursed the sabbath-breakers.
And ever is the matter [i.e., decree] of Allāh accomplished.

4:48.t: Indeed, Allāh does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allāh has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh does not forgive association with Him,
but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills.
And he who associates others with Allāh
has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.

4:49.t: Have you not seen those who claim themselves to be pure? Rather, Allāh purifies whom He wills, and injustice is not done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].

segments.t: Have you not seen those who claim themselves to be pure?
Rather, Allāh purifies whom He wills,
and injustice is not done to them,
[even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed].

4:5.t: And do not give the weak-minded your property, which Allāh has made a means of sustenance for you, but provide for them with it and clothe them and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.

segments.t: And do not give the weak-minded your property,
which Allāh has made a means of sustenance for you,
but provide for them with it
and clothe them
and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.

4:50.t: Look how they invent about Allāh untruth, and sufficient is that as a manifest sin.

segments.t: Look how they invent about Allāh untruth,
and sufficient is that as a manifest sin.

4:51.t: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, who believe in jibt [superstition] and ṭāghūt [false objects of worship] and say about the disbelievers, "These are better guided than the believers as to the way"?

segments.t: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture,
who believe in jibt [superstition] and ṭāghūt [false objects of worship]
and say about the disbelievers,
"These are better guided than the believers as to the way"?

4:52.t: Those are the ones whom Allāh has cursed; and he whom Allāh curses - never will you find for him a helper.

segments.t: Those are the ones whom Allāh has cursed;
and he whom Allāh curses -
never will you find for him a helper.

4:53.t: Or have they a share of dominion? Then [if that were so], they would not give the people [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.

segments.t: Or have they a share of dominion?
Then [if that were so],
they would not give the people [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.

4:54.t: Or do they envy people for what Allāh has given them of His bounty? But We had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

segments.t: Or do they envy people
for what Allāh has given them of His bounty?
But We had already given the family of Abraham
the Scripture and wisdom
and conferred upon them a great kingdom.

4:55.t: And some among them believed in it, and some among them were averse to it. And sufficient is Hell as a blaze.

segments.t: And some among them believed in it,
and some among them were averse to it.
And sufficient is Hell as a blaze.

4:56.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses - We will drive them into a fire. Every time their skins are roasted through, We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment. Indeed, Allāh is ever Exalted in Might and Wise.

segments.t: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses -
We will drive them into a fire.
Every time their skins are roasted through,
We will replace them with other skins
so they may taste the punishment.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Exalted in Might and Wise.

4:57.t: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide forever. For them therein are purified spouses, and We will admit them to deepening shade.

segments.t: But those who believe and do righteous deeds -
We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they abide forever.
For them therein are purified spouses,
and We will admit them to deepening shade.

4:58.t: Indeed, Allāh commands you to render trusts to whom they are due and when you judge between people to judge with justice. Excellent is that which Allāh instructs you. Indeed, Allāh is ever Hearing and Seeing.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh commands you to render trusts to whom they are due
and when you judge between people to judge with justice.
Excellent is that which Allāh instructs you.
Indeed, Allāh is ever Hearing and Seeing.

4:59.t: O you who have believed, obey Allāh and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allāh and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allāh and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
obey Allāh and obey the Messenger
and those in authority among you.
And if you disagree over anything,
refer it to Allāh and the Messenger,
if you should believe in Allāh and the Last Day.
That is the best [way] and best in result.

4:6.t: And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] that they will grow up. And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient should refrain [from taking a fee]; and whoever is poor - let him take according to what is acceptable. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allāh as Accountant.

segments.t: And test the orphans [in their abilities]
until they reach marriageable age.
Then if you perceive in them sound judgement,
release their property to them.
And do not consume it excessively and quickly,
[anticipating] that they will grow up.
And whoever, [when acting as guardian], is self-sufficient
should refrain [from taking a fee];
and whoever is poor -
let him take according to what is acceptable.
Then when you release their property to them,
bring witnesses upon them.
And sufficient is Allāh as Accountant.

4:60.t: Have you not seen those who claim to have believed in what was revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to ṭāghūt, while they were commanded to reject it; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.

segments.t: Have you not seen those who claim to have believed
in what was revealed to you, [O Muḥammad],
and what was revealed before you?
They wish to refer legislation to ṭāghūt,
while they were commanded to reject it;
and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.

4:61.t: And when it is said to them, "Come to what Allāh has revealed and to the Messenger," you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Come to what Allāh has revealed
and to the Messenger,"
you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.

4:62.t: So how [will it be] when disaster strikes them because of what their hands have put forth and then they come to you swearing by Allāh, "We intended nothing but good conduct and accommodation."

segments.t: So how [will it be] when disaster strikes them
because of what their hands have put forth
and then they come to you swearing by Allāh,
"We intended nothing but good conduct and accommodation."

4:63.t: Those are the ones of whom Allāh knows what is in their hearts, so turn away from them but admonish them and speak to them a far-reaching [i.e., effective] word.

segments.t: Those are the ones of whom Allāh knows what is in their hearts,
so turn away from them but admonish them
and speak to them a far-reaching [i.e., effective] word.

4:64.t: And We did not send any messenger except to be obeyed by permission of Allāh. And if, when they wronged themselves, they had come to you, [O Muḥammad], and asked forgiveness of Allāh and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them, they would have found Allāh Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

segments.t: And We did not send any messenger
except to be obeyed by permission of Allāh.
And if, when they wronged themselves,
they had come to you, [O Muḥammad],
and asked forgiveness of Allāh
and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them,
they would have found Allāh Accepting of Repentance and Merciful.

4:65.t: But no, by your Lord, they will not [truly] believe until they make you, [O Muḥammad], judge concerning that over which they dispute among themselves and then find within themselves no discomfort from what you have judged and submit in [full, willing] submission.

segments.t: But no, by your Lord,
they will not [truly] believe
until they make you, [O Muḥammad], judge
concerning that over which they dispute among themselves
and then find within themselves no discomfort
from what you have judged
and submit in [full, willing] submission.

4:66.t: And if We had decreed upon them, "Kill yourselves" or "Leave your homes," they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But if they had done what they were instructed, it would have been better for them and a firmer position [for them in faith].

segments.t: And if We had decreed upon them,
"Kill yourselves" or "Leave your homes,"
they would not have done it,
except for a few of them.
But if they had done what they were instructed,
it would have been better for them
and a firmer position [for them in faith].

4:67.t: And then We would have given them from Us a great reward.

segments.t: And then We would have given them
from Us a great reward.

4:68.t: And We would have guided them to a straight path.

segments.t: And We would have guided them
to a straight path.

4:69.t: And whoever obeys Allāh and the Messenger - those will be with the ones upon whom Allāh has bestowed favor of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth, the martyrs and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions.

segments.t: And whoever obeys Allāh and the Messenger -
those will be with the ones upon whom Allāh has bestowed favor
of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth,
the martyrs and the righteous.
And excellent are those as companions.

4:7.t: For men is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, be it little or much - an obligatory share.

segments.t: For men is a share
of what the parents and close relatives leave,
and for women is a share
of what the parents and close relatives leave,
be it little or much -
an obligatory share.

4:70.t: That is the bounty from Allāh, and sufficient is Allāh as Knower.

segments.t: That is the bounty from Allāh,
and sufficient is Allāh as Knower.

4:71.t: O you who have believed, take your precaution and [either] go forth in companies or go forth all together.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
take your precaution
and [either] go forth in companies
or go forth all together.

4:72.t: And indeed, there is among you he who lingers behind; and if disaster strikes you, he says, "Allāh has favored me in that I was not present with them."

segments.t: And indeed, there is among you he who lingers behind;
and if disaster strikes you,
he says, "Allāh has favored me
in that I was not present with them."

4:73.t: But if bounty comes to you from Allāh, he will surely say, as if [i.e., showing that] there had never been between you and him any affection, "Oh, I wish I had been with them so I could have attained a great attainment."

segments.t: But if bounty comes to you from Allāh,
he will surely say,
as if [i.e., showing that] there had never been between you and him any affection,
"Oh, I wish I had been with them
so I could have attained a great attainment."

4:74.t: So let those fight in the cause of Allāh who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter. And he who fights in the cause of Allāh and is killed or achieves victory - We will bestow upon him a great reward.

segments.t: So let those fight in the cause of Allāh
who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter.
And he who fights in the cause of Allāh
and is killed or achieves victory -
We will bestow upon him a great reward.

4:75.t: And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of Allāh and [for] the oppressed among men, women and children who say, "Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper"?

segments.t: And what is [the matter] with you
that you fight not in the cause of Allāh
and [for] the oppressed among men, women and children
who say, "Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people
and appoint for us from Yourself a protector
and appoint for us from Yourself a helper"?

4:76.t: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allāh, and those who disbelieve fight in the cause of ṭāghūt. So fight against the allies of Satan. Indeed, the plot of Satan has ever been weak.

segments.t: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allāh,
and those who disbelieve fight in the cause of ṭāghūt.
So fight against the allies of Satan.
Indeed, the plot of Satan has ever been weak.

4:77.t: Have you not seen those who were told, "Restrain your hands [from fighting] and establish prayer and give zakāh"? But then when battle was ordained for them, at once a party of them feared men as they fear Allāh or with [even] greater fear. They said, "Our Lord, why have You decreed upon us fighting? If only You had postponed [it for] us for a short time." Say, "The enjoyment of this world is little, and the Hereafter is better for he who fears Allāh. And injustice will not be done to you, [even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed]."

segments.t: Have you not seen those who were told,
"Restrain your hands [from fighting]
and establish prayer and give zakāh"?
But then when battle was ordained for them,
at once a party of them feared men as they fear Allāh
or with [even] greater fear.
They said, "Our Lord, why have You decreed upon us fighting?
If only You had postponed [it for] us for a short time."
Say, "The enjoyment of this world is little,
and the Hereafter is better for he who fears Allāh.
And injustice will not be done to you,
[even] as much as a thread [inside a date seed]."

4:78.t: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, even if you should be within towers of lofty construction. But if good comes to them, they say, "This is from Allāh"; and if evil befalls them, they say, "This is from you." Say, "All [things] are from Allāh." So what is [the matter] with those people that they can hardly understand any statement?

segments.t: Wherever you may be,
death will overtake you,
even if you should be within towers of lofty construction.
But if good comes to them,
they say, "This is from Allāh";
and if evil befalls them,
they say, "This is from you."
Say, "All [things] are from Allāh."
So what is [the matter] with those people
that they can hardly understand any statement?

4:79.t: What comes to you of good is from Allāh, but what comes to you of evil, [O man], is from yourself. And We have sent you, [O Muḥammad], to the people as a messenger, and sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

segments.t: What comes to you of good is from Allāh,
but what comes to you of evil, [O man], is from yourself.
And We have sent you, [O Muḥammad], to the people as a messenger,
and sufficient is Allāh as Witness.

4:8.t: And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present at the [time of] division, then provide for them [something] out of it [i.e., the estate] and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.

segments.t: And when [other] relatives and orphans and the needy are present
at the [time of] division,
then provide for them [something] out of it [i.e., the estate]
and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.

4:80.t: He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allāh; but those who turn away - We have not sent you over them as a guardian.

segments.t: He who obeys the Messenger has obeyed Allāh;
but those who turn away -
We have not sent you over them as a guardian.

4:81.t: And they say, "[We pledge] obedience." But when they leave you, a group of them spend the night determining to do other than what you say. But Allāh records what they plan by night. So leave them alone and rely upon Allāh. And sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

segments.t: And they say,
"[We pledge] obedience."
But when they leave you,
a group of them spend the night determining to do other than what you say.
But Allāh records what they plan by night.
So leave them alone and rely upon Allāh.
And sufficient is Allāh as Disposer of affairs.

4:82.t: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur’ān? If it had been from [any] other than Allāh, they would have found within it much contradiction.

segments.t: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur’ān?
If it had been from [any] other than Allāh,
they would have found within it much contradiction.

4:83.t: And when there comes to them something [i.e., information] about [public] security or fear, they spread it around. But if they had referred it back to the Messenger or to those of authority among them, then the ones who [can] draw correct conclusions from it would have known about it. And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy, you would have followed Satan, except for a few.

segments.t: And when there comes to them something [i.e., information]
about [public] security or fear,
they spread it around.
But if they had referred it back to the Messenger
or to those of authority among them,
then the ones who [can] draw correct conclusions from it
would have known about it.
And if not for the favor of Allāh upon you and His mercy,
you would have followed Satan, except for a few.

4:84.t: So fight, [O Muḥammad], in the cause of Allāh; you are not held responsible except for yourself. And encourage the believers [to join you] that perhaps Allāh will restrain the [military] might of those who disbelieve. And Allāh is greater in might and stronger in [exemplary] punishment.

segments.t: So fight, [O Muḥammad], in the cause of Allāh;
you are not held responsible except for yourself.
And encourage the believers [to join you]
that perhaps Allāh will restrain the [military] might of those who disbelieve.
And Allāh is greater in might and stronger in [exemplary] punishment.

4:85.t: Whoever intercedes for a good cause will have a share [i.e., reward] therefrom; and whoever intercedes for an evil cause will have a portion [i.e., burden] therefrom. And ever is Allāh, over all things, a Keeper.

segments.t: Whoever intercedes for a good cause
will have a share [i.e., reward] therefrom;
and whoever intercedes for an evil cause
will have a portion [i.e., burden] therefrom.
And ever is Allāh, over all things, a Keeper.

4:86.t: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet [in return] with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner]. Indeed Allāh is ever, over all things, an Accountant.

segments.t: And when you are greeted with a greeting,
greet [in return] with one better than it
or [at least] return it [in a like manner].
Indeed Allāh is ever, over all things, an Accountant.

4:87.t: Allāh - there is no deity except Him. He will surely assemble you for [account on] the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. And who is more truthful than Allāh in statement.

segments.t: Allāh -
there is no deity except Him.
He will surely assemble you for [account on] the Day of Resurrection,
about which there is no doubt.
And who is more truthful than Allāh in statement.

4:88.t: What is [the matter] with you [that you are] two groups concerning the hypocrites, while Allāh has made them fall back [into error and disbelief] for what they earned. Do you wish to guide those whom Allāh has sent astray? And he whom Allāh sends astray - never will you find for him a way [of guidance].

segments.t: What is [the matter] with you
[that you are] two groups concerning the hypocrites,
while Allāh has made them fall back [into error and disbelief]
for what they earned.
Do you wish to guide those whom Allāh has sent astray?
And he whom Allāh sends astray -
never will you find for him a way [of guidance].

4:89.t: They wish you would disbelieve as they disbelieved so you would be alike. So do not take from among them allies until they emigrate for the cause of Allāh. But if they turn away [i.e., refuse], then seize them and kill them [for their betrayal] wherever you find them and take not from among them any ally or helper,

segments.t: They wish you would disbelieve as they disbelieved
so you would be alike.
So do not take from among them allies
until they emigrate for the cause of Allāh.
But if they turn away [i.e., refuse],
then seize them and kill them [for their betrayal]
wherever you find them
and take not from among them any ally or helper,

4:9.t: And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice] as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind and feared for them. So let them fear Allāh and speak words of appropriate justice.

segments.t: And let those [executors and guardians] fear [injustice]
as if they [themselves] had left weak offspring behind
and feared for them.
So let them fear Allāh
and speak words of appropriate justice.

4:90.t: Except for those who take refuge with a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty or those who come to you, their hearts strained at [the prospect of] fighting you or fighting their own people. And if Allāh had willed, He could have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. So if they remove themselves from you and do not fight you and offer you peace, then Allāh has not made for you a cause [for fighting] against them.

segments.t: Except for those who take refuge with a people
between yourselves and whom is a treaty
or those who come to you,
their hearts strained at [the prospect of] fighting you
or fighting their own people.
And if Allāh had willed,
He could have given them power over you,
and they would have fought you.
So if they remove themselves from you
and do not fight you
and offer you peace,
then Allāh has not made for you a cause [for fighting] against them.

4:91.t: You will find others who wish to obtain security from you and [to] obtain security from their people. Every time they are returned to [the influence of] disbelief, they fall back into it. So if they do not withdraw from you or offer you peace or restrain their hands, then seize them and kill them wherever you overtake them. And those - We have made for you against them a clear authorization.

segments.t: You will find others who wish to obtain security from you
and [to] obtain security from their people.
Every time they are returned to [the influence of] disbelief,
they fall back into it.
So if they do not withdraw from you
or offer you peace
or restrain their hands,
then seize them and kill them wherever you overtake them.
And those -
We have made for you against them a clear authorization.

4:92.t: And never is it for a believer to kill a believer except by mistake. And whoever kills a believer by mistake - then the freeing of a believing slave and a compensation payment [diyah] presented to his [i.e., the deceased's] family [is required], unless they give [up their right as] charity. But if he [i.e., the deceased] was from a people at war with you and he was a believer - then [only] the freeing of a believing slave; and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty - then a compensation payment presented to his family and the freeing of a believing slave. And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one] - then [instead], a fast for two months consecutively, [seeking] acceptance of repentance from Allāh. And Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: And never is it for a believer to kill a believer except by mistake.
And whoever kills a believer by mistake -
then the freeing of a believing slave and a compensation payment [diyah]
presented to his [i.e., the deceased's] family [is required],
unless they give [up their right as] charity.
But if he [i.e., the deceased] was from a people at war with you
and he was a believer -
then [only] the freeing of a believing slave;
and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty -
then a compensation payment presented to his family
and the freeing of a believing slave.
And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one] -
then [instead], a fast for two months consecutively,
[seeking] acceptance of repentance from Allāh.
And Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.

4:93.t: But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allāh has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment.

segments.t: But whoever kills a believer intentionally -
his recompense is Hell,
wherein he will abide eternally,
and Allāh has become angry with him
and has cursed him
and has prepared for him a great punishment.

4:94.t: O you who have believed, when you go forth [to fight] in the cause of Allāh, investigate; and do not say to one who gives you [a greeting of] peace, "You are not a believer," aspiring for the goods of worldly life; for with Allāh are many acquisitions. You [yourselves] were like that before; then Allāh conferred His favor [i.e., guidance] upon you, so investigate. Indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
when you go forth [to fight] in the cause of Allāh, investigate;
and do not say to one who gives you [a greeting of] peace,
"You are not a believer,"
aspiring for the goods of worldly life;
for with Allāh are many acquisitions.
You [yourselves] were like that before;
then Allāh conferred His favor [i.e., guidance] upon you,
so investigate.
Indeed Allāh is ever, of what you do, Aware.

4:95.t: Not equal are those believers remaining [at home] - other than the disabled - and the mujāhideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of Allāh with their wealth and their lives. Allāh has preferred the mujāhideen through their wealth and their lives over those who remain [behind], by degrees. And to all [i.e., both] Allāh has promised the best [reward]. But Allāh has preferred the mujāhideen over those who remain [behind] with a great reward -

segments.t: Not equal are those believers remaining [at home] -
other than the disabled -
and the mujāhideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of Allāh
with their wealth and their lives.
Allāh has preferred the mujāhideen through their wealth and their lives
over those who remain [behind], by degrees.
And to all [i.e., both] Allāh has promised the best [reward].
But Allāh has preferred the mujāhideen over those who remain [behind]
with a great reward -

4:96.t: Degrees [of high position] from Him and forgiveness and mercy. And Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Degrees [of high position] from Him
and forgiveness and mercy.
And Allāh is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

4:97.t: Indeed, those whom the angels take [in death] while wronging themselves - [the angels] will say, "In what [condition] were you?" They will say, "We were oppressed in the land." They [the angels] will say, "Was not the earth of Allāh spacious [enough] for you to emigrate therein?" For those, their refuge is Hell - and evil it is as a destination.

segments.t: Indeed, those whom the angels take [in death]
while wronging themselves -
[the angels] will say,
"In what [condition] were you?"
They will say,
"We were oppressed in the land."
They [the angels] will say,
"Was not the earth of Allāh spacious [enough]
for you to emigrate therein?"
For those, their refuge is Hell -
and evil it is as a destination.

4:98.t: Except for the oppressed among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan nor are they directed to a way -

segments.t: Except for the oppressed
among men, women and children
who cannot devise a plan
nor are they directed to a way -

4:99.t: For those it is expected that Allāh will pardon them, and Allāh is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.

segments.t: For those it is expected that Allāh will pardon them,
and Allāh is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
Qāf.
By the honored Qur’ān...

50:10.t: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

segments.t: And lofty palm trees
having fruit arranged in layers -

50:11.t: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the emergence [i.e., resurrection].

segments.t: As provision for the servants,
and We have given life thereby to a dead land.
Thus is the emergence [i.e., resurrection].

50:12.t: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamūd

segments.t: The people of Noah denied before them,
and the companions of the well and Thamūd

50:13.t: And ʿAad and Pharaoh and the brothers [i.e., people] of Lot

segments.t: And ʿAad and Pharaoh
and the brothers [i.e., people] of Lot

50:14.t: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubbaʿ. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.

segments.t: And the companions of the thicket
and the people of Tubbaʿ.
All denied the messengers,
so My threat was justly fulfilled.

50:15.t: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.

segments.t: Did We fail in the first creation?
But they are in confusion over a new creation.

50:16.t: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein.

segments.t: And We have already created man
and know what his soul whispers to him,
and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein.

50:17.t: When the two receivers [i.e., recording angels] receive, seated on the right and on the left.

segments.t: When the two receivers [i.e., recording angels] receive,
seated on the right and on the left.

50:18.t: He [i.e., man] utters no word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

segments.t: He [i.e., man] utters no word
except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

50:19.t: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.

segments.t: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth;
that is what you were trying to avoid.

50:2.t: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.

segments.t: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves,
and the disbelievers say,
"This is an amazing thing.

50:20.t: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

segments.t: And the Horn will be blown.
That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

50:21.t: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.

segments.t: And every soul will come,
with it a driver and a witness.

50:22.t: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."

segments.t: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this,
and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."

50:23.t: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."

segments.t: And his companion, [the angel], will say,
"This [record] is what is with me, prepared."

50:24.t: [Allāh will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

segments.t: [Allāh will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

50:25.t: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,

segments.t: Preventer of good,
aggressor,
and doubter,

50:26.t: Who made [as equal] with Allāh another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."

segments.t: Who made [as equal] with Allāh another deity;
then throw him into the severe punishment."

50:27.t: His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."

segments.t: His [devil] companion will say,
"Our Lord,
I did not make him transgress,
but he [himself] was in extreme error."

50:28.t: [Allāh] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the threat [i.e., warning].

segments.t: [Allāh] will say,
"Do not dispute before Me,
while I had already presented to you the threat [i.e., warning].

50:29.t: The word [i.e., decree] will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."

segments.t: The word [i.e., decree] will not be changed with Me,
and never will I be unjust to the servants."

50:3.t: When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant [i.e., unlikely] return."

segments.t: When we have died
and have become dust,
[we will return to life]?
That is a distant [i.e., unlikely] return."

50:30.t: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"

segments.t: On the Day We will say to Hell,
"Have you been filled?"
and it will say,
"Are there some more,"

50:31.t: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,

segments.t: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,
not far,

50:32.t: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allāh] and keeper [of His covenant].

segments.t: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised -
for every returner [to Allāh] and keeper [of His covenant].

50:33.t: Who feared the Most Merciful in the unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

segments.t: Who feared the Most Merciful in the unseen
and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

50:34.t: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."

segments.t: Enter it in peace.
This is the Day of Eternity."

50:35.t: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.

segments.t: They will have whatever they wish therein,
and with Us is more.

50:36.t: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?

segments.t: And how many a generation before them did We destroy
who were greater than them in [striking] power
and had explored throughout the lands.
Is there any place of escape?

50:37.t: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].

segments.t: Indeed in that is a reminder
for whoever has a heart
or who listens while he is present [in mind].

50:38.t: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.

segments.t: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth
and what is between them in six days,
and there touched Us no weariness.

50:39.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad], over what they say and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

segments.t: So be patient, [O Muḥammad],
over what they say
and exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord
before the rising of the sun
and before its setting,

50:4.t: We know what the earth diminishes [i.e., consumes] of them, and with Us is a retaining record.

segments.t: We know what the earth diminishes [i.e., consumes] of them,
and with Us is a retaining record.

50:40.t: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration [i.e., prayer].

segments.t: And [in part] of the night exalt Him
and after prostration [i.e., prayer].

50:41.t: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -

segments.t: And listen on the Day
when the Caller will call out
from a place that is near -

50:42.t: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

segments.t: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth.
That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

50:43.t: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination

segments.t: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death,
and to Us is the destination

50:44.t: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.

segments.t: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly;
that is a gathering easy for Us.

50:45.t: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur’ān whoever fears My threat.

segments.t: We are most knowing of what they say,
and you are not over them a tyrant.
But remind by the Qur’ān
whoever fears My threat.

50:5.t: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.

segments.t: But they denied the truth
when it came to them,
so they are in a confused condition.

50:6.t: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?

segments.t: Have they not looked at the heaven above them -
how We structured it and adorned it
and [how] it has no rifts?

50:7.t: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

segments.t: And the earth -
We spread it out
and cast therein firmly set mountains
and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

50:8.t: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allāh].

segments.t: Giving insight and a reminder
for every servant who turns [to Allāh].

50:9.t: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest

segments.t: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky
and made grow thereby gardens
and grain from the harvest
By the [winds] scattering [dust],
dispersing [it]
Destroyed are the misinformers

51:11.t: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

segments.t: Who are within a flood [of confusion]
and heedless.

51:12.t: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

segments.t: They ask,
"When is the Day of Recompense?"

51:13.t: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

segments.t: [It is] the Day they will be tormented
over the Fire

51:14.t: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

segments.t: [And will be told], "Taste your torment.
This is that for which you were impatient."

51:15.t: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

segments.t: Indeed, the righteous will be
among gardens and springs,

51:16.t: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

segments.t: Accepting what their Lord has given them.
Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

51:17.t: They used to sleep but little of the night,

segments.t: They used to sleep
but little of the night,

51:18.t: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

segments.t: And in the hours before dawn
they would ask forgiveness,

51:19.t: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

segments.t: And from their properties was [given] the right
of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

51:2.t: And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

segments.t: And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

51:20.t: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

segments.t: And on the earth are signs
for the certain [in faith]

51:21.t: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

segments.t: And in yourselves.
Then will you not see?

51:22.t: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

segments.t: And in the heaven is your provision
and whatever you are promised.

51:23.t: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

segments.t: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth,
indeed, it is truth -
just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

51:24.t: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -

segments.t: Has there reached you the story
of the honored guests of Abraham? -

51:25.t: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace; [you are] a people unknown."

segments.t: When they entered upon him and said,
"[We greet you with] peace."
He answered,
"[And upon you] peace;
[you are] a people unknown."

51:26.t: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf.

segments.t: Then he went to his family
and came with a fat [roasted] calf.

51:27.t: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

segments.t: And placed it near them;
he said,
"Will you not eat?"

51:28.t: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

segments.t: And he felt from them apprehension.
They said, "Fear not,"
and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

51:29.t: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

segments.t: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm]
and struck her face and said,
"[I am] a barren old woman!"

51:3.t: And the ships sailing with ease

segments.t: And the ships sailing with ease

51:30.t: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

segments.t: They said,
"Thus has said your Lord;
indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

51:31.t: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

segments.t: [Abraham] said,
"Then what is your business [here],
O messengers?"

51:32.t: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals

segments.t: They said,
"Indeed, we have been sent
to a people of criminals

51:33.t: To send down upon them stones of clay,

segments.t: To send down upon them
stones of clay,

51:34.t: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."

segments.t: Marked in the presence of your Lord
for the transgressors."

51:35.t: So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities] of the believers.

segments.t: So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities]
of the believers.

51:36.t: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.

segments.t: And We found not within them
other than a [single] house of Muslims.

51:37.t: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

segments.t: And We left therein a sign
for those who fear the painful punishment.

51:38.t: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

segments.t: And in Moses [was a sign],
when We sent him to Pharaoh
with clear authority.

51:39.t: But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."

segments.t: But he turned away with his supporters and said,
"A magician or a madman."
And the [angels] apportioning [each] matter,

51:40.t: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

segments.t: So We took him and his soldiers
and cast them into the sea,
and he was blameworthy.

51:41.t: And in ʿAad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.

segments.t: And in ʿAad [was a sign],
when We sent against them the barren wind.

51:42.t: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

segments.t: It left nothing of what it came upon
but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

51:43.t: And in Thamūd, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."

segments.t: And in Thamūd,
when it was said to them,
"Enjoy yourselves for a time."

51:44.t: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

segments.t: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord,
so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

51:45.t: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

segments.t: And they were unable to arise,
nor could they defend themselves.

51:46.t: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before;
indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

51:47.t: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.

segments.t: And the heaven We constructed with strength,
and indeed, We are [its] expander.

51:48.t: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

segments.t: And the earth We have spread out,
and excellent is the preparer.

51:49.t: And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts]; perhaps you will remember.

segments.t: And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts];
perhaps you will remember.

51:5.t: Indeed, what you are promised is true.

segments.t: Indeed, what you are promised is true.

51:50.t: So flee to Allāh. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

segments.t: So flee to Allāh.
Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

51:51.t: And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

segments.t: And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity.
Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

51:52.t: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

segments.t: Similarly,
there came not to those before them any messenger
except that they said,
"A magician or a madman."

51:53.t: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.

segments.t: Did they suggest it to them?
Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.

51:54.t: So leave them, [O Muḥammad], for you are not to be blamed.

segments.t: So leave them, [O Muḥammad],
for you are not to be blamed.

51:55.t: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

segments.t: And remind,
for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

51:56.t: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

segments.t: And I did not create the jinn and mankind
except to worship Me.

51:57.t: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

segments.t: I do not want from them any provision,
nor do I want them to feed Me.

51:58.t: Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.

segments.t: Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider,
the firm possessor of strength.

51:59.t: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors], so let them not impatiently urge Me.

segments.t: And indeed, for those who have wronged
is a portion [of punishment]
like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors],
so let them not impatiently urge Me.

51:6.t: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.

segments.t: And indeed,
the recompense is to occur.

51:60.t: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.

segments.t: And woe to those who have disbelieved
from their Day which they are promised.
By the heaven containing pathways,

51:8.t: Indeed, you are in differing speech.

segments.t: Indeed, you are in differing speech.

51:9.t: Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is he who is deluded.

segments.t: Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān]
is he who is deluded.
By the mount

52:10.t: And the mountains will pass on, departing -

segments.t: And the mountains will pass on,
departing -

52:11.t: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,

segments.t: Then woe, that Day,
to the deniers,

52:12.t: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.

segments.t: Who are in [empty] discourse
amusing themselves.

52:13.t: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],

segments.t: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell
with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],

52:14.t: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.

segments.t: "This is the Fire
which you used to deny.

52:15.t: Then is this magic, or do you not see?

segments.t: Then is this magic,
or do you not see?

52:16.t: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."

segments.t: [Enter to] burn therein;
then be patient or impatient -
it is all the same for you.
You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."

52:17.t: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,

segments.t: Indeed, the righteous will be
in gardens and pleasure,

52:18.t: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.

segments.t: Enjoying what their Lord has given them,
and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.

52:19.t: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."

segments.t: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction
for what you used to do."
And [by] a Book inscribed

52:20.t: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

segments.t: They will be reclining on thrones lined up,
and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

52:21.t: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every person, for what he earned, is retained.

segments.t: And those who believed
and whose descendants followed them in faith -
We will join with them their descendants,
and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds.
Every person, for what he earned, is retained.

52:22.t: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.

segments.t: And We will provide them with fruit
and meat from whatever they desire.

52:23.t: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.

segments.t: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine]
wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.

52:24.t: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.

segments.t: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them,
as if they were pearls well-protected.

52:25.t: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

segments.t: And they will approach one another,
inquiring of each other.

52:26.t: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allāh].

segments.t: They will say,
"Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allāh].

52:27.t: So Allāh conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

segments.t: So Allāh conferred favor upon us
and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

52:28.t: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

segments.t: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before.
Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

52:29.t: So remind, [O Muḥammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

segments.t: So remind, [O Muḥammad],
for you are not, by the favor of your Lord,
a soothsayer or a madman.
In parchment spread open

52:30.t: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time"?

segments.t: Or do they say [of you],
"A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time"?

52:31.t: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."

segments.t: Say, "Wait,
for indeed I am, with you,
among the waiters."

52:32.t: Or do their minds command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?

segments.t: Or do their minds command them to [say] this,
or are they a transgressing people?

52:33.t: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.

segments.t: Or do they say,
"He has made it up"?
Rather, they do not believe.

52:34.t: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.

segments.t: Then let them produce a statement like it,
if they should be truthful.

52:35.t: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

segments.t: Or were they created by nothing,
or were they the creators [of themselves]?

52:36.t: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.

segments.t: Or did they create the heavens and the earth?
Rather, they are not certain.

52:37.t: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?

segments.t: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord?
Or are they the controllers [of them]?

52:38.t: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority [i.e., proof].

segments.t: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven]
upon which they listen?
Then let their listener produce a clear authority [i.e., proof].

52:39.t: Or has He daughters while you have sons?

segments.t: Or has He daughters
while you have sons?
And [by] the frequented House

52:40.t: Or do you, [O Muḥammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

segments.t: Or do you, [O Muḥammad],
ask of them a payment,
so they are by debt burdened down?

52:41.t: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

segments.t: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen,
so they write [it] down?

52:42.t: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.

segments.t: Or do they intend a plan?
But those who disbelieve -
they are the object of a plan.

52:43.t: Or have they a deity other than Allāh? Exalted is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.

segments.t: Or have they a deity other than Allāh?
Exalted is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.

52:44.t: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."

segments.t: And if they were to see a fragment
from the sky falling,
they would say,
"[It is merely] clouds heaped up."

52:45.t: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -

segments.t: So leave them
until they meet their Day
in which they will be struck insensible -

52:46.t: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.

segments.t: The Day their plan will not avail them at all,
nor will they be helped.

52:47.t: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment before that, but most of them do not know.

segments.t: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment before that,
but most of them do not know.

52:48.t: And be patient, [O Muḥammad], for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes [i.e., sight]. And exalt [Allāh] with praise of your Lord when you arise

segments.t: And be patient, [O Muḥammad],
for the decision of your Lord,
for indeed, you are in Our eyes [i.e., sight].

And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.

57:20.t: Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from Allāh and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.

57:21.t: Race [i.e., compete] toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allāh and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allāh which He gives to whom He wills, and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allāh may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allāh. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

57:28.t: O you who have believed, fear Allāh and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

57:29.t: [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of Allāh and that [all] bounty is in the hand of Allāh; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.
