5:86.t: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - they are the companions of Hellfire.

segments.t: But those who disbelieved
and denied Our signs -
they are the companions of Hellfire.

5:87.t: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allāh has made lawful to you and do not transgress. Indeed, Allāh does not like transgressors.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not prohibit the good things
which Allāh has made lawful to you
and do not transgress.
Indeed, Allāh does not like transgressors.

5:88.t: And eat of what Allāh has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And fear Allāh, in whom you are believers.

segments.t: And eat of what Allāh has provided for you [which is] lawful and good.
And fear Allāh,
in whom you are believers.

5:89.t: Allāh will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths, but He will impose blame upon you for [breaking] what you intended of oaths. So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people from the average of that which you feed your [own] families or clothing them or the freeing of a slave. But whoever cannot find [or afford it] - then a fast of three days [is required]. That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn. But guard your oaths. Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses [i.e., revealed law] that you may be grateful.

segments.t: Allāh will not impose blame upon you for what is meaningless in your oaths,
but He will impose blame upon you for [breaking] what you intended of oaths.
So its expiation is the feeding of ten needy people
from the average of that which you feed your [own] families
or clothing them or the freeing of a slave.
But whoever cannot find [or afford it] -
then a fast of three days [is required].
That is the expiation for oaths when you have sworn.
But guard your oaths.
Thus does Allāh make clear to you His verses [i.e., revealed law]
that you may be grateful.

5:9.t: Allāh has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds [that] for them there is forgiveness and great reward.

segments.t: Allāh has promised those who believe
and do righteous deeds
[that] for them there is forgiveness
and great reward.

5:90.t: O you who have believed, indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allāh], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be successful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
indeed, intoxicants, gambling,
[sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allāh],
and divining arrows are but defilement
from the work of Satan,
so avoid it that you may be successful.

5:91.t: Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred through intoxicants and gambling and to avert you from the remembrance of Allāh and from prayer. So will you not desist?

segments.t: Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred
through intoxicants and gambling
and to avert you from the remembrance of Allāh
and from prayer.
So will you not desist?

5:92.t: And obey Allāh and obey the Messenger and beware. And if you turn away - then know that upon Our Messenger is only [the responsibility for] clear notification.

segments.t: And obey Allāh
and obey the Messenger
and beware.
And if you turn away -
then know that upon Our Messenger is only [the responsibility for] clear notification.

5:93.t: There is not upon those who believe and do righteousness [any] blame concerning what they have eaten [in the past] if they [now] fear Allāh and believe and do righteous deeds, and then fear Allāh and believe, and then fear Allāh and do good; and Allāh loves the doers of good.

segments.t: There is not upon those who believe and do righteousness [any] blame
concerning what they have eaten [in the past]
if they [now] fear Allāh and believe and do righteous deeds,
and then fear Allāh and believe,
and then fear Allāh and do good;
and Allāh loves the doers of good.

5:94.t: O you who have believed, Allāh will surely test you through something of the game that your hands and spears [can] reach, that Allāh may make evident those who fear Him unseen. And whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful punishment.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
Allāh will surely test you through something of the game
that your hands and spears [can] reach,
that Allāh may make evident those who fear Him unseen.
And whoever transgresses after that -
for him is a painful punishment.

5:95.t: O you who have believed, do not kill game while you are in the state of iḥrām. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed, as judged by two just men among you as an offering [to Allāh] delivered to the Kaʿbah, or an expiation: the feeding of needy people or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his matter [i.e., deed]. Allāh has pardoned what is past; but whoever returns [to violation], then Allāh will take retribution from him. And Allāh is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not kill game while you are in the state of iḥrām.
And whoever of you kills it intentionally -
the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed,
as judged by two just men among you
as an offering [to Allāh] delivered to the Kaʿbah,
or an expiation: the feeding of needy people
or the equivalent of that in fasting,
that he may taste the consequence of his matter [i.e., deed].
Allāh has pardoned what is past;
but whoever returns [to violation],
then Allāh will take retribution from him.
And Allāh is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

5:96.t: Lawful to you is game from the sea and its food as provision for you and the travelers, but forbidden to you is game from the land as long as you are in the state of iḥrām. And fear Allāh to whom you will be gathered.

segments.t: Lawful to you is game from the sea
and its food as provision for you and the travelers,
but forbidden to you is game from the land
as long as you are in the state of iḥrām.
And fear Allāh to whom you will be gathered.

5:97.t: Allāh has made the Kaʿbah, the Sacred House, standing for the people and [has sanctified] the sacred months and the sacrificial animals and the garlands [by which they are identified]. That is so you may know that Allāh knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth and that Allāh is Knowing of all things.

segments.t: Allāh has made the Kaʿbah, the Sacred House,
standing for the people
and [has sanctified] the sacred months
and the sacrificial animals
and the garlands [by which they are identified].
That is so you may know that Allāh knows
what is in the heavens
and what is in the earth
and that Allāh is Knowing of all things.

5:98.t: Know that Allāh is severe in penalty and that Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Know that Allāh is severe in penalty
and that Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

5:99.t: Not upon the Messenger is [responsibility] except [for] notification. And Allāh knows whatever you reveal and whatever you conceal.

segments.t: Not upon the Messenger is [responsibility] except [for] notification.
And Allāh knows whatever you reveal
and whatever you conceal.

60:1.t: O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in Allāh, your Lord. If you have come out for jihād [i.e., fighting or striving] in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [take them not as friends]. You confide to them affection [i.e., instruction], but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies,
extending to them affection
while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth,
having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only]
because you believe in Allāh, your Lord.
If you have come out for jihād [i.e., fighting or striving] in My cause
and seeking means to My approval,
[take them not as friends].
You confide to them affection [i.e., instruction],
but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared.
And whoever does it among you
has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

60:10.t: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine [i.e., test] them. Allāh is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give them [i.e., the disbelievers] what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation [i.e., mahr]. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them [i.e., the disbelievers] ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of Allāh; He judges between you. And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
when the believing women come to you as emigrants,
examine [i.e., test] them.
Allāh is most knowing as to their faith.
And if you know them to be believers,
then do not return them to the disbelievers;
they are not lawful [wives] for them,
nor are they lawful [husbands] for them.
But give them [i.e., the disbelievers] what they have spent.
And there is no blame upon you if you marry them
when you have given them their due compensation [i.e., mahr].
And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women,
but ask for what you have spent
and let them [i.e., the disbelievers] ask for what they have spent.
That is the judgement of Allāh;
He judges between you.
And Allāh is Knowing and Wise.

60:11.t: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and you subsequently obtain [something], then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allāh, in whom you are believers.

segments.t: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers
and you subsequently obtain [something],
then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent.
And fear Allāh, in whom you are believers.

60:12.t: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allāh, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs, nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: O Prophet,
when the believing women come to you
pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allāh,
nor will they steal,
nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse,
nor will they kill their children,
nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented
between their arms and legs,
nor will they disobey you in what is right -
then accept their pledge
and ask forgiveness for them of Allāh.
Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

60:13.t: O you who have believed, do not make allies of a people with whom Allāh has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the companions [i.e., inhabitants] of the graves.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
do not make allies of a people with whom Allāh has become angry.
They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter
just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the companions [i.e., inhabitants] of the graves.

60:2.t: If they gain dominance over you, they would be [i.e., behave] to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.

segments.t: If they gain dominance over you,
they would be [i.e., behave] to you as enemies
and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil,
and they wish you would disbelieve.

60:3.t: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.

segments.t: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you;
the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you.
And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.

60:4.t: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allāh. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allāh alone" - except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allāh. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

segments.t: There has already been for you an excellent pattern
in Abraham and those with him,
when they said to their people,
"Indeed, we are disassociated from you
and from whatever you worship other than Allāh.
We have denied you,
and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever
until you believe in Allāh alone"
- except for the saying of Abraham to his father,
"I will surely ask forgiveness for you,
but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allāh.
Our Lord, upon You we have relied,
and to You we have returned,
and to You is the destination.

60:5.t: Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

segments.t: Our Lord,
make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers
and forgive us, our Lord.
Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

60:6.t: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allāh and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

segments.t: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern
for anyone whose hope is in Allāh and the Last Day.
And whoever turns away -
then indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

60:7.t: Perhaps Allāh will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And Allāh is competent, and Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: Perhaps Allāh will put,
between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection.
And Allāh is competent,
and Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

60:8.t: Allāh does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.

segments.t: Allāh does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion
and do not expel you from your homes -
from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them.
Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.

60:9.t: Allāh only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

segments.t: Allāh only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion
and expel you from your homes
and aid in your expulsion -
[forbids] that you make allies of them.
And whoever makes allies of them,
then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

61:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allāh, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth exalts Allāh,
and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

61:10.t: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?

segments.t: O you who have believed,
shall I guide you to a transaction
that will save you from a painful punishment?

61:11.t: [It is that] you believe in Allāh and His Messenger and strive in the cause of Allāh with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you only knew.

segments.t: [It is that] you believe in Allāh and His Messenger
and strive in the cause of Allāh with your wealth and your lives.
That is best for you, if you only knew.

61:12.t: He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.

segments.t: He will forgive for you your sins
and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow
and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence.
That is the great attainment.

61:13.t: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from Allāh and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers.

segments.t: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love -
victory from Allāh and an imminent conquest;
and give good tidings to the believers.

61:14.t: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allāh, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for Allāh?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of Allāh." And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
be supporters of Allāh,
as when Jesus, the son of Mary,
said to the disciples,
"Who are my supporters for Allāh?"
The disciples said,
"We are supporters of Allāh."
And a faction of the Children of Israel believed
and a faction disbelieved.
So We supported those who believed against their enemy,
and they became dominant.

61:2.t: O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?

segments.t: O you who have believed,
why do you say what you do not do?

61:3.t: Greatly hateful in the sight of Allāh is that you say what you do not do.

segments.t: Greatly hateful in the sight of Allāh
is that you say what you do not do.

61:4.t: Indeed, Allāh loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh loves those who fight in His cause in a row
as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.

61:5.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allāh to you?" And when they deviated, Allāh caused their hearts to deviate. And Allāh does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when Moses said to his people,
"O my people, why do you harm me
while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allāh to you?"
And when they deviated,
Allāh caused their hearts to deviate.
And Allāh does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

61:6.t: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O Children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allāh to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Aḥmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."

segments.t: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said,
"O Children of Israel,
indeed I am the messenger of Allāh to you
confirming what came before me of the Torah
and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me,
whose name is Aḥmad."
But when he came to them with clear evidences,
they said,
"This is obvious magic."

61:7.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh untruth while he is being invited to Islām. And Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh untruth
while he is being invited to Islām.
And Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

61:8.t: They want to extinguish the light of Allāh with their mouths, but Allāh will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.

segments.t: They want to extinguish the light of Allāh with their mouths,
but Allāh will perfect His light,
although the disbelievers dislike it.

61:9.t: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allāh dislike it.

segments.t: It is He who sent His Messenger
with guidance and the religion of truth
to manifest it over all religion,
although those who associate others with Allāh dislike it.

62:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allāh, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth
is exalting Allāh,
the Sovereign,
the Pure,
the Exalted in Might,
the Wise.

62:10.t: And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of Allāh, and remember Allāh often that you may succeed.

segments.t: And when the prayer has been concluded,
disperse within the land
and seek from the bounty of Allāh,
and remember Allāh often that you may succeed.

62:11.t: But [on one occasion] when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Muḥammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with Allāh is better than diversion and than a transaction, and Allāh is the best of providers."

segments.t: But [on one occasion] when they saw a transaction or a diversion,
[O Muḥammad], they rushed to it
and left you standing.
Say, "What is with Allāh is better than diversion
and than a transaction,
and Allāh is the best of providers."

62:2.t: It is He who has sent among the unlettered [Arabs] a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] and wisdom [i.e., the sunnah] - although they were before in clear error -

segments.t: It is He who has sent among the unlettered [Arabs] a Messenger from themselves
reciting to them His verses and purifying them
and teaching them the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] and wisdom [i.e., the sunnah] -
although they were before in clear error -

62:3.t: And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: And [to] others of them
who have not yet joined them.
And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

62:4.t: That is the bounty of Allāh, which He gives to whom He wills, and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

segments.t: That is the bounty of Allāh,
which He gives to whom He wills,
and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.

62:5.t: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allāh. And Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

segments.t: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah
and then did not take it on
is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books].
Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allāh.
And Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.

62:6.t: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allāh, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: Say, "O you who are Jews,
if you claim that you are allies of Allāh,
excluding the [other] people,
then wish for death,
if you should be truthful."

62:7.t: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allāh is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

segments.t: But they will not wish for it, ever,
because of what their hands have put forth.
And Allāh is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

62:8.t: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."

segments.t: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee -
indeed, it will meet you.
Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed,
and He will inform you about what you used to do."

62:9.t: O you who have believed, when [the adhān] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumuʿah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allāh and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
when [the adhān] is called for the prayer
on the day of Jumuʿah [Friday],
then proceed to the remembrance of Allāh
and leave trade.
That is better for you,
if you only knew.

63:1.t: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muḥammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allāh." And Allāh knows that you are His Messenger, and Allāh testifies that the hypocrites are liars.

segments.t: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muḥammad],
they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allāh."
And Allāh knows that you are His Messenger,
and Allāh testifies that the hypocrites are liars.

63:10.t: And spend [in the way of Allāh] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be of the righteous."

segments.t: And spend [in the way of Allāh] from what We have provided you
before death approaches one of you and he says,
"My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term
so I would give charity and be of the righteous."

63:11.t: But never will Allāh delay a soul when its time has come. And Allāh is Aware of what you do.

segments.t: But never will Allāh delay a soul
when its time has come.
And Allāh is Aware of what you do.

63:2.t: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allāh. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

segments.t: They have taken their oaths as a cover,
so they averted [people] from the way of Allāh.
Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

63:3.t: That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.

segments.t: That is because they believed,
and then they disbelieved;
so their hearts were sealed over,
and they do not understand.

63:4.t: And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allāh destroy them; how are they deluded?

segments.t: And when you see them,
their forms please you,
and if they speak,
you listen to their speech.
[They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up -
they think that every shout is against them.
They are the enemy,
so beware of them.
May Allāh destroy them;
how are they deluded?

63:5.t: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allāh will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.

segments.t: And when it is said to them,
"Come, the Messenger of Allāh will ask forgiveness for you,"
they turn their heads aside
and you see them evading while they are arrogant.

63:6.t: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will Allāh forgive them. Indeed, Allāh does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

segments.t: It is all the same for them
whether you ask forgiveness for them
or do not ask forgiveness for them;
never will Allāh forgive them.
Indeed, Allāh does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

63:7.t: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allāh until they disband." And to Allāh belong the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.

segments.t: They are the ones who say,
"Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allāh
until they disband."
And to Allāh belong the depositories of the heavens and the earth,
but the hypocrites do not understand.

63:8.t: They say, "If we return to al-Madīnah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to Allāh belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

segments.t: They say,
"If we return to al-Madīnah,
the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble."
And to Allāh belongs [all] honor,
and to His Messenger,
and to the believers,
but the hypocrites do not know.

63:9.t: O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of Allāh. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
let not your wealth and your children
divert you from the remembrance of Allāh.
And whoever does that -
then those are the losers.

64:1.t: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allāh. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.

segments.t: Whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth
is exalting Allāh.
To Him belongs dominion,
and to Him belongs [all] praise,
and He is over all things competent.

64:10.t: But the ones who disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein; and wretched is the destination.

segments.t: But the ones who disbelieved
and denied Our verses -
those are the companions of the Fire,
abiding eternally therein;
and wretched is the destination.

64:11.t: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allāh. And whoever believes in Allāh - He will guide his heart. And Allāh is Knowing of all things.

segments.t: No disaster strikes except by permission of Allāh.
And whoever believes in Allāh -
He will guide his heart.
And Allāh is Knowing of all things.

64:12.t: And obey Allāh and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.

segments.t: And obey Allāh
and obey the Messenger;
but if you turn away -
then upon Our Messenger is only [the duty of] clear notification.

64:13.t: Allāh - there is no deity except Him. And upon Allāh let the believers rely.

segments.t: Allāh -
there is no deity except Him.
And upon Allāh let the believers rely.

64:14.t: O you who have believed, indeed, among your spouses and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
indeed, among your spouses and your children
are enemies to you,
so beware of them.
But if you pardon and overlook and forgive -
then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

64:15.t: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allāh has with Him a great reward.

segments.t: Your wealth and your children are but a trial,
and Allāh has with Him a great reward.

64:16.t: So fear Allāh as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend [in the way of Allāh]; it is better for your selves. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.

segments.t: So fear Allāh as much as you are able
and listen and obey
and spend [in the way of Allāh];
it is better for your selves.
And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul -
it is those who will be the successful.

64:17.t: If you loan Allāh a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allāh is [most] Appreciative and Forbearing,

segments.t: If you loan Allāh a goodly loan,
He will multiply it for you and forgive you.
And Allāh is [most] Appreciative and Forbearing,

64:18.t: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

segments.t: Knower of the unseen and the witnessed,
the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

64:2.t: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.

segments.t: It is He who created you,
and among you is the disbeliever,
and among you is the believer.
And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.

64:3.t: He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.

segments.t: He created the heavens and earth in truth
and formed you and perfected your forms;
and to Him is the [final] destination.

64:4.t: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.

segments.t: He knows what is within the heavens and earth
and knows what you conceal and what you declare.
And Allāh is Knowing of that within the breasts.

64:5.t: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

segments.t: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before?
So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair,
and they will have a painful punishment.

64:6.t: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allāh dispensed [with them]; and Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

segments.t: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences,
but they said,
"Shall human beings guide us?"
and disbelieved and turned away.
And Allāh dispensed [with them];
and Allāh is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

64:7.t: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allāh, is easy."

segments.t: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected.
Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected;
then you will surely be informed of what you did.
And that, for Allāh, is easy."

64:8.t: So believe in Allāh and His Messenger and the light [i.e., the Qur’ān] which We have sent down. And Allāh is Aware of what you do.

segments.t: So believe in Allāh and His Messenger
and the light [i.e., the Qur’ān] which We have sent down.
And Allāh is Aware of what you do.

64:9.t: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation. And whoever believes in Allāh and does righteousness - He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever. That is the great attainment.

segments.t: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly -
that is the Day of Deprivation.
And whoever believes in Allāh and does righteousness -
He will remove from him his misdeeds
and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they will abide forever.
That is the great attainment.

65:1.t: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allāh, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period] unless they are committing a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] Allāh. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allāh has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps Allāh will bring about after that a [different] matter.

segments.t: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women,
divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period
and keep count of the waiting period,
and fear Allāh, your Lord.
Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses,
nor should they [themselves] leave [during that period]
unless they are committing a clear immorality.
And those are the limits [set by] Allāh.
And whoever transgresses the limits of Allāh has certainly wronged himself.
You know not; perhaps Allāh will bring about after that a [different] matter.

65:10.t: Allāh has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear Allāh, O you of understanding who have believed. Allāh has sent down to you a message [i.e., the Qur’ān].

segments.t: Allāh has prepared for them a severe punishment;
so fear Allāh,
O you of understanding who have believed.
Allāh has sent down to you a message [i.e., the Qur’ān].

65:11.t: [He sent] a Messenger [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] reciting to you the distinct verses of Allāh that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allāh and does righteousness - He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein forever. Allāh will have perfected for him a provision.

segments.t: [He sent] a Messenger [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)]
reciting to you the distinct verses of Allāh
that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds
from darknesses into the light.
And whoever believes in Allāh and does righteousness -
He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow
to abide therein forever.
Allāh will have perfected for him a provision.

65:12.t: It is Allāh who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them. [His] command descends among them so you may know that Allāh is over all things competent and that Allāh has encompassed all things in knowledge.

segments.t: It is Allāh who has created seven heavens
and of the earth, the like of them.
[His] command descends among them
so you may know that Allāh is over all things competent
and that Allāh has encompassed all things in knowledge.

65:2.t: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to acceptable terms or part with them according to acceptable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allāh. That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allāh and the Last Day. And whoever fears Allāh - He will make for him a way out

segments.t: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term,
either retain them according to acceptable terms
or part with them according to acceptable terms.
And bring to witness two just men from among you
and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allāh.
That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allāh and the Last Day.
And whoever fears Allāh -
He will make for him a way out

65:3.t: And will provide for him from where he does not expect. And whoever relies upon Allāh - then He is sufficient for him. Indeed, Allāh will accomplish His purpose. Allāh has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.

segments.t: And will provide for him from where he does not expect.
And whoever relies upon Allāh - then He is sufficient for him.
Indeed, Allāh will accomplish His purpose.
Allāh has already set for everything a [decreed] extent.

65:4.t: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allāh - He will make for him of his matter ease.

segments.t: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women -
if you doubt, then their period is three months,
and [also for] those who have not menstruated.
And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth.
And whoever fears Allāh -
He will make for him of his matter ease.

65:5.t: That is the command of Allāh, which He has sent down to you; and whoever fears Allāh - He will remove for him his misdeeds and make great for him his reward.

segments.t: That is the command of Allāh,
which He has sent down to you;
and whoever fears Allāh -
He will remove for him his misdeeds
and make great for him his reward.

65:6.t: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you are in discord, then there may breastfeed for him [i.e., the father] another woman.

segments.t: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell out of your means
and do not harm them in order to oppress them.
And if they should be pregnant,
then spend on them until they give birth.
And if they breastfeed for you,
then give them their payment
and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way;
but if you are in discord,
then there may breastfeed for him [i.e., the father] another woman.

65:7.t: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allāh has given him. Allāh does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allāh will bring about, after hardship, ease [i.e., relief].

segments.t: Let a man of wealth spend from his wealth,
and he whose provision is restricted -
let him spend from what Allāh has given him.
Allāh does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it.
Allāh will bring about, after hardship, ease [i.e., relief].

65:8.t: And how many a city was insolent toward the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We took it to severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.

segments.t: And how many a city was insolent
toward the command of its Lord and His messengers,
so We took it to severe account
and punished it with a terrible punishment.

65:9.t: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair [i.e., rebellion], and the outcome of its affair was loss.

segments.t: And it tasted the bad consequence of its affair [i.e., rebellion],
and the outcome of its affair was loss.

66:1.t: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allāh has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: O Prophet,
why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allāh has made lawful for you,
seeking the approval of your wives?
And Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.

66:10.t: Allāh presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so they [i.e., those prophets] did not avail them from Allāh at all, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."

segments.t: Allāh presents an example of those who disbelieved:
the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot.
They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them,
so they [i.e., those prophets] did not avail them from Allāh at all,
and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who enter."

66:11.t: And Allāh presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: And Allāh presents an example of those who believed:
the wife of Pharaoh, when she said,
"My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise
and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds
and save me from the wrongdoing people."

66:12.t: And [the example of] Mary, the daughter of ʿImrān, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel], and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.

segments.t: And [the example of] Mary,
the daughter of ʿImrān,
who guarded her chastity,
so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel [i.e., Gabriel],
and she believed in the words of her Lord
and His scriptures
and was of the devoutly obedient.

66:2.t: Allāh has already ordained for you [Muslims] the dissolution of your oaths. And Allāh is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.

segments.t: Allāh has already ordained for you [Muslims]
the dissolution of your oaths.
And Allāh is your protector,
and He is the Knowing, the Wise.

66:3.t: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allāh showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Aware."

segments.t: And [remember] when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement;
and when she informed [another] of it
and Allāh showed it to him,
he made known part of it and ignored a part.
And when he informed her about it,
she said, "Who told you this?"
He said, "I was informed by the Knowing, the Aware."

66:4.t: If you two [wives] repent to Allāh, [it is best], for your hearts have deviated. But if you cooperate against him - then indeed Allāh is his protector, and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.

segments.t: If you two [wives] repent to Allāh, [it is best],
for your hearts have deviated.
But if you cooperate against him -
then indeed Allāh is his protector,
and Gabriel and the righteous of the believers
and the angels, moreover, are [his] assistants.

66:5.t: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all], would substitute for him wives better than you - submitting [to Allāh], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones] previously married and virgins.

segments.t: Perhaps his Lord, if he divorced you [all],
would substitute for him wives better than you -
submitting [to Allāh],
believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling -
[ones] previously married and virgins.

66:6.t: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allāh in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.

segments.t: O you who have believed,
protect yourselves and your families
from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones,
over which are [appointed] angels,
harsh and severe;
they do not disobey Allāh
in what He commands them
but do what they are commanded.

66:7.t: O you who have disbelieved, make no excuses that Day. You will only be recompensed for what you used to do.

segments.t: O you who have disbelieved,
make no excuses that Day.
You will only be recompensed
for what you used to do.

66:8.t: O you who have believed, repent to Allāh with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allāh will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them and on their right; they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent."

segments.t: O you who have believed,
repent to Allāh with sincere repentance.
Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds
and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow
[on] the Day when Allāh will not disgrace the Prophet
and those who believed with him.
Their light will proceed before them and on their right;
they will say, "Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us.
Indeed, You are over all things competent."

66:9.t: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. And their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.

segments.t: O Prophet,
strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites
and be harsh upon them.
And their refuge is Hell,
and wretched is the destination.

67:1.t: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion, and He is over all things competent -

segments.t: Blessed is He in whose hand is dominion,
and He is over all things competent -

67:10.t: And they will say, "If only we had been listening or reasoning, we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."

segments.t: And they will say,
"If only we had been listening or reasoning,
we would not be among the companions of the Blaze."

67:11.t: And they will admit their sin, so [it is] alienation for the companions of the Blaze.

segments.t: And they will admit their sin,
so [it is] alienation
for the companions of the Blaze.

67:12.t: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen will have forgiveness and great reward.

segments.t: Indeed, those who fear their Lord unseen
will have forgiveness and great reward.

67:13.t: And conceal your speech or publicize it; indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

segments.t: And conceal your speech or publicize it;
indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

67:14.t: Does He who created not know, while He is the Subtle, the Aware?

segments.t: Does He who created not know,
while He is the Subtle, the Aware?

67:15.t: It is He who made the earth tame for you - so walk among its slopes and eat of His provision - and to Him is the resurrection.

segments.t: It is He who made the earth tame for you -
so walk among its slopes
and eat of His provision -
and to Him is the resurrection.

67:16.t: Do you feel secure that He who is above would not cause the earth to swallow you and suddenly it would sway?

segments.t: Do you feel secure that He who is above
would not cause the earth to swallow you
and suddenly it would sway?

67:17.t: Or do you feel secure that He who is above would not send against you a storm of stones? Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.

segments.t: Or do you feel secure that He who is above
would not send against you a storm of stones?
Then you would know how [severe] was My warning.

67:18.t: And already had those before them denied, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

segments.t: And already had those before them denied,
and how [terrible] was My reproach.

67:19.t: Do they not see the birds above them with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in? None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful. Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.

segments.t: Do they not see the birds above them
with wings outspread and [sometimes] folded in?
None holds them [aloft] except the Most Merciful.
Indeed He is, of all things, Seeing.

67:2.t: [He] who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving -

segments.t: [He] who created death and life
to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed -
and He is the Exalted in Might,
the Forgiving -

67:20.t: Or who is it that could be an army for you to aid you other than the Most Merciful? The disbelievers are not but in delusion.

segments.t: Or who is it that could be an army for you
to aid you other than the Most Merciful?
The disbelievers are not but in delusion.

67:21.t: Or who is it that could provide for you if He withheld His provision? But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.

segments.t: Or who is it that could provide for you
if He withheld His provision?
But they have persisted in insolence and aversion.

67:22.t: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided or one who walks erect on a straight path?

segments.t: Then is one who walks fallen on his face better guided
or one who walks erect on a straight path?

67:23.t: Say, "It is He who has produced you and made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect]; little are you grateful."

segments.t: Say, "It is He who has produced you
and made for you hearing and vision and hearts [i.e., intellect];
little are you grateful."

67:24.t: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered."

segments.t: Say, "It is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth,
and to Him you will be gathered."

67:25.t: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: And they say,
"When is this promise,
if you should be truthful?"

67:26.t: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allāh, and I am only a clear warner."

segments.t: Say, "The knowledge is only with Allāh,
and I am only a clear warner."

67:27.t: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed, and it will be said, "This is that for which you used to call."

segments.t: But when they see it approaching,
the faces of those who disbelieve will be distressed,
and it will be said,
"This is that for which you used to call."

67:28.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Have you considered: whether Allāh should cause my death and those with me or have mercy upon us, who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Have you considered:
whether Allāh should cause my death and those with me
or have mercy upon us,
who can protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?"

67:29.t: Say, "He is the Most Merciful; we have believed in Him, and upon Him we have relied. And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."

segments.t: Say, "He is the Most Merciful;
we have believed in Him,
and upon Him we have relied.
And you will [come to] know who it is that is in clear error."

67:3.t: [And] who created seven heavens in layers. You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency. So return [your] vision [to the sky]; do you see any breaks?

segments.t: [And] who created seven heavens in layers.
You do not see in the creation of the Most Merciful any inconsistency.
So return [your] vision [to the sky];
do you see any breaks?

67:30.t: Say, "Have you considered: if your water was to become sunken [into the earth], then who could bring you flowing water?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if your water was to become sunken [into the earth],
then who could bring you flowing water?"

67:4.t: Then return [your] vision twice again. [Your] vision will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.

segments.t: Then return [your] vision twice again.
[Your] vision will return to you humbled
while it is fatigued.

67:5.t: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars] and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.

segments.t: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with lamps [i.e., stars]
and have made [from] them what is thrown at the devils
and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.

67:6.t: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.

segments.t: And for those who disbelieved in their Lord
is the punishment of Hell,
and wretched is the destination.

67:7.t: When they are thrown into it, they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling while it boils up.

segments.t: When they are thrown into it,
they hear from it a [dreadful] inhaling
while it boils up.

67:8.t: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"

segments.t: It almost bursts with rage.
Every time a company is thrown into it,
its keepers ask them,
"Did there not come to you a warner?"

67:9.t: They will say, "Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allāh has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'"

segments.t: They will say,
"Yes, a warner had come to us,
but we denied and said,
'Allāh has not sent down anything.
You are not but in great error.'"

68:1.t: Nūn. By the pen and what they inscribe,

segments.t: Nūn.
By the pen and what they inscribe,

68:10.t: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer

segments.t: And do not obey
every worthless habitual swearer

68:11.t: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -

segments.t: [And] scorner,
going about with malicious gossip -

68:12.t: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,

segments.t: A preventer of good,
transgressing and sinful,

68:13.t: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.

segments.t: Cruel, moreover,
and an illegitimate pretender.

68:14.t: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

segments.t: Because he is a possessor
of wealth and children,

68:15.t: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."

segments.t: When Our verses are recited to him,
he says, "Legends of the former peoples."

68:16.t: We will brand him upon the snout.

segments.t: We will brand him
upon the snout.

68:17.t: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning

segments.t: Indeed, We have tried them
as We tried the companions of the garden,
when they swore to cut its fruit
in the [early] morning
Without making exception.

68:19.t: So there came upon it [i.e., the garden] an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.

segments.t: So there came upon it [i.e., the garden] an affliction
from your Lord
while they were asleep.

68:2.t: You are not, [O Muḥammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.

segments.t: You are not, [O Muḥammad],
by the favor of your Lord,
a madman.

68:20.t: And it became as though reaped.

segments.t: And it became
as though reaped.

68:21.t: And they called one another at morning,

segments.t: And they called one another
at morning,

68:22.t: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."

segments.t: [Saying], "Go early to your crop
if you would cut the fruit."

68:23.t: So they set out, while lowering their voices,

segments.t: So they set out,
while lowering their voices,

68:24.t: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."

segments.t: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."

68:25.t: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.

segments.t: And they went early in determination,
[assuming themselves] able.

68:26.t: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;

segments.t: But when they saw it,
they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
Rather, we have been deprived."

68:28.t: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allāh]?'"

segments.t: The most moderate of them said,
"Did I not say to you,
'Why do you not exalt [Allāh]?'"

68:29.t: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

segments.t: They said,
"Exalted is our Lord!
Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

68:3.t: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.

segments.t: And indeed, for you
is a reward uninterrupted.

68:30.t: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.

segments.t: Then they approached one another,
blaming each other.

68:31.t: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.

segments.t: They said,
"O woe to us;
indeed we were transgressors.

68:32.t: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."

segments.t: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it.
Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."

68:33.t: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

segments.t: Such is the punishment [of this world].
And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater,
if they only knew.

68:34.t: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.

segments.t: Indeed, for the righteous
with their Lord
are the Gardens of Pleasure.

68:35.t: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?

segments.t: Then will We treat the Muslims
like the criminals?

68:36.t: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?

segments.t: What is [the matter] with you?
How do you judge?

68:37.t: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn

segments.t: Or do you have a scripture
in which you learn

68:38.t: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

segments.t: That indeed for you
is whatever you choose?

68:39.t: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?

segments.t: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us,
extending until the Day of Resurrection,
that indeed for you is whatever you judge?

68:4.t: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.

segments.t: And indeed,
you are of a great moral character.

68:40.t: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

segments.t: Ask them which of them,
for that [claim],
is responsible.

68:41.t: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.

segments.t: Or do they have partners?
Then let them bring their partners,
if they should be truthful.

68:42.t: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but they [i.e., the disbelievers] will not be able,

segments.t: The Day the shin will be uncovered
and they are invited to prostration
but they [i.e., the disbelievers] will not be able,

68:43.t: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.

segments.t: Their eyes humbled,
humiliation will cover them.
And they used to be invited to prostration
while they were sound.

68:44.t: So leave Me, [O Muḥammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement [i.e., the Qur’ān]. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.

segments.t: So leave Me, [O Muḥammad],
with [the matter of] whoever denies this statement [i.e., the Qur’ān].
We will progressively lead them [to punishment]
from where they do not know.

68:45.t: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.

segments.t: And I will give them time.
Indeed, My plan is firm.

68:46.t: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

segments.t: Or do you ask of them a payment,
so they are by debt burdened down?

68:47.t: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

segments.t: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen,
so they write [it] down?

68:48.t: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muḥammad], and be not like the companion of the fish [i.e., Jonah] when he called out while he was distressed.

segments.t: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muḥammad],
and be not like the companion of the fish [i.e., Jonah]
when he called out while he was distressed.

68:49.t: If not that a favor [i.e., mercy] from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.

segments.t: If not that a favor [i.e., mercy] from his Lord overtook him,
he would have been thrown onto the naked shore
while he was censured.

68:5.t: So you will see and they will see

segments.t: So you will see
and they will see

68:50.t: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

segments.t: And his Lord chose him
and made him of the righteous.

68:51.t: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes [i.e., looks] when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."

segments.t: And indeed, those who disbelieve
would almost make you slip with their eyes [i.e., looks]
when they hear the message,
and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."

68:52.t: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.

segments.t: But it is not except a reminder
to the worlds.

68:6.t: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

segments.t: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

68:7.t: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way,
and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

68:8.t: Then do not obey the deniers.

segments.t: Then do not obey the deniers.

68:9.t: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].

segments.t: They wish that you would soften [in your position],
so they would soften [toward you].
The Inevitable Reality -

69:10.t: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

segments.t: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord,
so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

69:11.t: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried you [i.e., your ancestors] in the sailing ship

segments.t: Indeed, when the water overflowed,
We carried you [i.e., your ancestors]
in the sailing ship

69:12.t: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

segments.t: That We might make it for you a reminder
and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

69:13.t: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast

segments.t: Then when the Horn is blown
with one blast

69:14.t: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -

segments.t: And the earth and the mountains
are lifted and leveled with one blow [i.e., stroke] -

69:15.t: Then on that Day, the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,

segments.t: Then on that Day,
the Occurrence [i.e., Resurrection] will occur,

69:16.t: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.

segments.t: And the heaven will split [open],
for that Day it is infirm.

69:17.t: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].

segments.t: And the angels are at its edges.
And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them,
that Day, eight [of them].

69:18.t: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.

segments.t: That Day,
you will be exhibited [for judgement];
not hidden among you is anything concealed.

69:19.t: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, read my record!

segments.t: So as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
he will say,
"Here, read my record!
What is the Inevitable Reality?

69:20.t: Indeed, I was certain that I would be meeting my account."

segments.t: Indeed, I was certain
that I would be meeting my account."

69:21.t: So he will be in a pleasant life -

segments.t: So he will be in a pleasant life -
In an elevated garden,

69:23.t: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

segments.t: Its [fruit] to be picked
hanging near.

69:24.t: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you put forth in the days past."

segments.t: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction
for what you put forth in the days past."

69:25.t: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "Oh, I wish I had not been given my record

segments.t: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand,
he will say,
"Oh, I wish I had not been given my record

69:26.t: And had not known what is my account.

segments.t: And had not known
what is my account.

69:27.t: I wish it [i.e., my death] had been the decisive one.

segments.t: I wish it [i.e., my death]
had been the decisive one.

69:28.t: My wealth has not availed me.

segments.t: My wealth has not availed me.

69:29.t: Gone from me is my authority."

segments.t: Gone from me
is my authority."

69:3.t: And what can make you know what is the Inevitable Reality?

segments.t: And what can make you know
what is the Inevitable Reality?

69:30.t: [Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.

segments.t: [Allāh will say], "Seize him and shackle him.
Then into Hellfire drive him.

69:32.t: Then into a chain whose length is seventy cubits insert him."

segments.t: Then into a chain
whose length is seventy cubits
insert him."

69:33.t: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great,

segments.t: Indeed, he did not used to believe
in Allāh, the Most Great,

69:34.t: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.

segments.t: Nor did he encourage
the feeding of the poor.

69:35.t: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend

segments.t: So there is not for him here this Day
any devoted friend

69:36.t: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;

segments.t: Nor any food
except from the discharge of wounds;

69:37.t: None will eat it except the sinners.

segments.t: None will eat it
except the sinners.

69:38.t: So I swear by what you see

segments.t: So I swear by what you see

69:39.t: And what you do not see

segments.t: And what you do not see

69:4.t: Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].

segments.t: Thamūd and ʿAad denied the Striking Calamity [i.e., the Resurrection].

69:40.t: [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word of a noble Messenger.

segments.t: [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the word
of a noble Messenger.

69:41.t: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.

segments.t: And it is not the word of a poet;
little do you believe.

69:42.t: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.

segments.t: Nor the word of a soothsayer;
little do you remember.

69:43.t: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: [It is] a revelation
from the Lord of the worlds.

69:44.t: And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up about Us some [false] sayings,

segments.t: And if he [i.e., Muḥammad] had made up
about Us some [false] sayings,

69:45.t: We would have seized him by the right hand;

segments.t: We would have seized him
by the right hand;

69:46.t: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

segments.t: Then We would have cut
from him the aorta.

69:47.t: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.

segments.t: And there is no one of you
who could prevent [Us] from him.

69:48.t: And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder for the righteous.

segments.t: And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder
for the righteous.

69:49.t: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.

segments.t: And indeed,
We know that among you are deniers.

69:5.t: So as for Thamūd, they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

segments.t: So as for Thamūd,
they were destroyed by the overpowering [blast].

69:50.t: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.

segments.t: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret
upon the disbelievers.

69:51.t: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.

segments.t: And indeed,
it is the truth of certainty.

69:52.t: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

segments.t: So exalt the name of your Lord,
the Most Great.

69:6.t: And as for ʿAad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind

segments.t: And as for ʿAad,
they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind

69:7.t: Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

segments.t: Which He [i.e., Allāh] imposed upon them
for seven nights and eight days in succession,
so you would see the people therein fallen
as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

69:8.t: Then do you see of them any remains?

segments.t: Then do you see of them
any remains?

69:9.t: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.

segments.t: And there came Pharaoh
and those before him
and the overturned cities with sin.

6:1.t: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darkness and the light. Then those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord.

segments.t: [All] praise is [due] to Allāh,
who created the heavens and the earth
and made the darkness and the light.
Then those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord.

6:10.t: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by that which they used to ridicule.

segments.t: And already were messengers ridiculed before you,
but those who mocked them were enveloped by that which they used to ridicule.

6:100.t: But they have attributed to Allāh partners - the jinn, while He has created them - and have fabricated for Him sons and daughters without knowledge. Exalted is He and high above what they describe.

segments.t: But they have attributed to Allāh partners - the jinn,
while He has created them -
and have fabricated for Him sons and daughters without knowledge.
Exalted is He and high above what they describe.

6:101.t: [He is] Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He does not have a companion [i.e., wife] and He created all things? And He is, of all things, Knowing.

segments.t: [He is] Originator of the heavens and the earth.
How could He have a son
when He does not have a companion [i.e., wife]
and He created all things?
And He is, of all things, Knowing.

6:102.t: That is Allāh, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things.

segments.t: That is Allāh, your Lord;
there is no deity except Him,
the Creator of all things,
so worship Him.
And He is Disposer of all things.

6:103.t: Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Aware.

segments.t: Vision perceives Him not,
but He perceives [all] vision;
and He is the Subtle, the Aware.

6:104.t: There has come to you enlightenment from your Lord. So whoever will see does so for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever is blind [does harm] against it. And [say], "I am not a guardian over you."

segments.t: There has come to you enlightenment from your Lord.
So whoever will see does so for [the benefit of] his soul,
and whoever is blind [does harm] against it.
And [say], "I am not a guardian over you."

6:105.t: And thus do We diversify the verses so they [i.e., the disbelievers] will say, "You have studied," and so We may make it [i.e., the Qur’ān] clear for a people who know.

segments.t: And thus do We diversify the verses
so they [i.e., the disbelievers] will say,
"You have studied,"
and so We may make it [i.e., the Qur’ān] clear
for a people who know.

6:106.t: Follow, [O Muḥammad], what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with Allāh.

segments.t: Follow, [O Muḥammad],
what has been revealed to you from your Lord -
there is no deity except Him -
and turn away from those who associate others with Allāh.

6:107.t: But if Allāh had willed, they would not have associated. And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, nor are you a manager over them.

segments.t: But if Allāh had willed,
they would not have associated.
And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian,
nor are you a manager over them.

6:108.t: And do not insult those they invoke other than Allāh, lest they insult Allāh in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.

segments.t: And do not insult those they invoke other than Allāh,
lest they insult Allāh in enmity without knowledge.
Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds.
Then to their Lord is their return,
and He will inform them about what they used to do.

6:109.t: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths that if a sign came to them, they would surely believe in it. Say, "The signs are only with [i.e., from] Allāh." And what will make you perceive that even if it [i.e., a sign] came, they would not believe.

segments.t: And they swear by Allāh their strongest oaths
that if a sign came to them,
they would surely believe in it.
Say, "The signs are only with [i.e., from] Allāh."
And what will make you perceive that even if it [i.e., a sign] came,
they would not believe.

6:11.t: Say, "Travel through the land; then observe how was the end of the deniers."

segments.t: Say, "Travel through the land;
then observe how was the end of the deniers."

6:110.t: And We will turn away their hearts and their eyes just as they refused to believe in it [i.e., the revelation] the first time. And We will leave them in their transgression, wandering blindly.

segments.t: And We will turn away their hearts and their eyes
just as they refused to believe in it [i.e., the revelation] the first time.
And We will leave them in their transgression,
wandering blindly.

6:111.t: And even if We had sent down to them the angels [with the message] and the dead spoke to them [of it] and We gathered together every [created] thing in front of them, they would not believe unless Allāh should will. But most of them, [of that], are ignorant.

segments.t: And even if We had sent down to them the angels [with the message]
and the dead spoke to them [of it]
and We gathered together every [created] thing in front of them,
they would not believe unless Allāh should will.
But most of them, [of that], are ignorant.

6:112.t: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.

segments.t: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy -
devils from mankind and jinn,
inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion.
But if your Lord had willed,
they would not have done it,
so leave them and that which they invent.

6:113.t: And [it is] so the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter will incline toward it [i.e., deceptive speech] and that they will be satisfied with it and that they will commit that which they are committing.

segments.t: And [it is] so the hearts of those
who disbelieve in the Hereafter
will incline toward it [i.e., deceptive speech]
and that they will be satisfied with it
and that they will commit that which they are committing.

6:114.t: [Say], "Then is it other than Allāh I should seek as judge while it is He who has revealed to you the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] explained in detail?" And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture know that it is sent down from your Lord in truth, so never be among the doubters.

segments.t: [Say], "Then is it other than Allāh
I should seek as judge
while it is He who has revealed to you the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
explained in detail?"
And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture
know that it is sent down from your Lord in truth,
so never be among the doubters.

6:115.t: And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice. None can alter His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled
in truth and in justice.
None can alter His words,
and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

6:116.t: And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allāh. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but misjudging.

segments.t: And if you obey most of those upon the earth,
they will mislead you from the way of Allāh.
They follow not except assumption,
and they are not but misjudging.

6:117.t: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way,
and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

6:118.t: So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of Allāh has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses [i.e., revealed law].

segments.t: So eat of that [meat]
upon which the name of Allāh has been mentioned,
if you are believers in His verses [i.e., revealed law].

6:119.t: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allāh has been mentioned while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled. And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.

segments.t: And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allāh has been mentioned
while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you,
excepting that to which you are compelled.
And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge.
Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
