6:12.t: Say, "To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth?" Say, "To Allāh." He has decreed upon Himself mercy. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not believe.

segments.t: Say, "To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth?"
Say, "To Allāh."
He has decreed upon Himself mercy.
He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection,
about which there is no doubt.
Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not believe.

6:120.t: And leave [i.e., desist from] what is apparent of sin and what is concealed thereof. Indeed, those who earn [blame for] sin will be recompensed for that which they used to commit.

segments.t: And leave [i.e., desist from] what is apparent of sin
and what is concealed thereof.
Indeed, those who earn [blame for] sin
will be recompensed for that which they used to commit.

6:121.t: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allāh has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you. And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].

segments.t: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allāh has not been mentioned,
for indeed, it is grave disobedience.
And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you.
And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].

6:122.t: And is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus it has been made pleasing to the disbelievers that which they were doing.

segments.t: And is one who was dead
and We gave him life
and made for him light
by which to walk among the people
like one who is in darkness,
never to emerge therefrom?
Thus it has been made pleasing to the disbelievers
that which they were doing.

6:123.t: And thus We have placed within every city the greatest of its criminals to conspire therein. But they conspire not except against themselves, and they perceive [it] not.

segments.t: And thus We have placed within every city
the greatest of its criminals to conspire therein.
But they conspire not except against themselves,
and they perceive [it] not.

6:124.t: And when a sign comes to them, they say, "Never will we believe until we are given like that which was given to the messengers of Allāh." Allāh is most knowing of where [i.e., with whom] He places His message. There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before Allāh and severe punishment for what they used to conspire.

segments.t: And when a sign comes to them,
they say, "Never will we believe
until we are given like that which was given
to the messengers of Allāh."
Allāh is most knowing of where [i.e., with whom] He places His message.
There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before Allāh
and severe punishment for what they used to conspire.

6:125.t: So whoever Allāh wants to guide - He expands his breast to [contain] Islām; and whoever He wants to send astray - He makes his breast tight and constricted as though he were climbing into the sky. Thus does Allāh place defilement upon those who do not believe.

segments.t: So whoever Allāh wants to guide -
He expands his breast to [contain] Islām;
and whoever He wants to send astray -
He makes his breast tight and constricted
as though he were climbing into the sky.
Thus does Allāh place defilement upon those who do not believe.

6:126.t: And this is the path of your Lord, [leading] straight. We have detailed the verses for a people who remember.

segments.t: And this is the path of your Lord, [leading] straight.
We have detailed the verses
for a people who remember.

6:127.t: For them will be the Home of Peace [i.e., Paradise] with their Lord. And He will be their protecting friend because of what they used to do.

segments.t: For them will be the Home of Peace [i.e., Paradise] with their Lord.
And He will be their protecting friend
because of what they used to do.

6:128.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], the Day when He will gather them together [and say], "O company of jinn, you have [misled] many of mankind." And their allies among mankind will say, "Our Lord, some of us made use of others, and we have [now] reached our term which You appointed for us." He will say, "The Fire is your residence, wherein you will abide eternally, except for what Allāh wills. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing."

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], the Day when He will gather them together [and say],
"O company of jinn, you have [misled] many of mankind."
And their allies among mankind will say,
"Our Lord, some of us made use of others,
and we have [now] reached our term which You appointed for us."
He will say, "The Fire is your residence,
wherein you will abide eternally,
except for what Allāh wills.
Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing."

6:129.t: And thus will We make some of the wrongdoers allies of others for what they used to earn.

segments.t: And thus will We make some of the wrongdoers
allies of others
for what they used to earn.

6:13.t: And to Him belongs that which reposes by night and by day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

segments.t: And to Him belongs that which reposes by night and by day,
and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

6:130.t: "O company of jinn and mankind, did there not come to you messengers from among you, relating to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "We bear witness against ourselves"; and the worldly life had deluded them, and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

segments.t: "O company of jinn and mankind,
did there not come to you messengers from among you,
relating to you My verses
and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?"
They will say, "We bear witness against ourselves";
and the worldly life had deluded them,
and they will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

6:131.t: That is because your Lord would not destroy the cities for wrongdoing while their people were unaware.

segments.t: That is because your Lord would not destroy the cities for wrongdoing
while their people were unaware.

6:132.t: And for all are degrees [i.e., positions resulting] from what they have done. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do.

segments.t: And for all are degrees [i.e., positions resulting]
from what they have done.
And your Lord is not unaware of what they do.

6:133.t: And your Lord is the Free of need, the possessor of mercy. If He wills, He can do away with you and give succession after you to whomever He wills, just as He produced you from the descendants of another people.

segments.t: And your Lord is the Free of need,
the possessor of mercy.
If He wills,
He can do away with you
and give succession after you to whomever He wills,
just as He produced you
from the descendants of another people.

6:134.t: Indeed, what you are promised is coming, and you will not cause failure [to Allāh].

segments.t: Indeed, what you are promised is coming,
and you will not cause failure [to Allāh].

6:135.t: Say, "O my people, work according to your position; [for] indeed, I am working. And you are going to know who will have succession in the home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed."

segments.t: Say, "O my people,
work according to your position;
[for] indeed, I am working.
And you are going to know
who will have succession in the home.
Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed."

6:136.t: And they [i.e., the polytheists] assign to Allāh from that which He created of crops and livestock a share and say, "This is for Allāh," by their claim, "and this is for our 'partners' [associated with Him]." But what is for their "partners" does not reach Allāh, while what is for Allāh - this reaches their "partners." Evil is that which they rule.

segments.t: And they [i.e., the polytheists] assign to Allāh
from that which He created of crops and livestock a share
and say, "This is for Allāh,"
by their claim,
"and this is for our 'partners' [associated with Him]."
But what is for their "partners" does not reach Allāh,
while what is for Allāh -
this reaches their "partners."
Evil is that which they rule.

6:137.t: And likewise, to many of the polytheists their partners have made [to seem] pleasing the killing of their children in order to bring about their destruction and to cover them with confusion in their religion. And if Allāh had willed, they would not have done so. So leave them and that which they invent.

segments.t: And likewise,
to many of the polytheists their partners have made [to seem] pleasing
the killing of their children
in order to bring about their destruction
and to cover them with confusion in their religion.
And if Allāh had willed,
they would not have done so.
So leave them and that which they invent.

6:138.t: And they say, "These animals and crops are forbidden; no one may eat from them except whom we will," by their claim. And there are those [camels] whose backs are forbidden [by them] and those upon which the name of Allāh is not mentioned - [all of this] an invention of untruth about Him. He will punish them for what they were inventing.

segments.t: And they say,
"These animals and crops are forbidden;
no one may eat from them except whom we will,"
by their claim.
And there are those [camels] whose backs are forbidden [by them]
and those upon which the name of Allāh is not mentioned
- [all of this] an invention of untruth about Him.
He will punish them for what they were inventing.

6:139.t: And they say, "What is in the bellies of these animals is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our females. But if it is [born] dead, then all of them have shares therein." He will punish them for their description. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

segments.t: And they say,
"What is in the bellies of these animals
is exclusively for our males
and forbidden to our females.
But if it is [born] dead,
then all of them have shares therein."
He will punish them for their description.
Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

6:14.t: Say, "Is it other than Allāh I should take as a protector, Creator of the heavens and earth, while it is He who feeds and is not fed?" Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to Allāh] and [was commanded], 'Do not ever be of the polytheists.'"

segments.t: Say, "Is it other than Allāh I should take as a protector,
Creator of the heavens and earth,
while it is He who feeds and is not fed?"
Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to Allāh]
and [was commanded], 'Do not ever be of the polytheists.'"

6:140.t: They will have lost who killed their children in foolishness without knowledge and prohibited what Allāh had provided for them, inventing untruth about Allāh. They have gone astray and were not [rightly] guided.

segments.t: They will have lost who killed their children in foolishness without knowledge
and prohibited what Allāh had provided for them,
inventing untruth about Allāh.
They have gone astray and were not [rightly] guided.

6:141.t: And He it is who causes gardens to grow, [both] trellised and untrellised, and palm trees and crops of different [kinds of] food and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of [each of] its fruit when it yields and give its due [zakāh] on the day of its harvest. And be not excessive. Indeed, He does not like those who commit excess.

segments.t: And He it is who causes gardens to grow,
[both] trellised and untrellised,
and palm trees and crops of different [kinds of] food
and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar.
Eat of [each of] its fruit when it yields
and give its due [zakāh] on the day of its harvest.
And be not excessive.
Indeed, He does not like those who commit excess.

6:142.t: And of the grazing livestock are carriers [of burdens] and those [too] small. Eat of what Allāh has provided for you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

segments.t: And of the grazing livestock are carriers [of burdens]
and those [too] small.
Eat of what Allāh has provided for you
and do not follow the footsteps of Satan.
Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

6:143.t: [They are] eight mates - of the sheep, two and of the goats, two. Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Inform me with knowledge, if you should be truthful."

segments.t: [They are] eight mates -
of the sheep, two
and of the goats, two.
Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden
or the two females
or that which the wombs of the two females contain?
Inform me with knowledge,
if you should be truthful."

6:144.t: And of the camels, two and of the cattle, two. Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females or that which the wombs of the two females contain? Or were you witnesses when Allāh charged you with this? Then who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allāh to mislead the people by [something] other than knowledge? Indeed, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: And of the camels, two and of the cattle, two.
Say, "Is it the two males He has forbidden
or the two females
or that which the wombs of the two females contain?
Or were you witnesses when Allāh charged you with this?
Then who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allāh
to mislead the people by [something] other than knowledge?
Indeed, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people."

6:145.t: Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or it be [that slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than Allāh. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it
unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure -
or it be [that slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than Allāh.
But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit],
then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."

6:146.t: And to those who are Jews We prohibited every animal of uncloven hoof; and of the cattle and the sheep We prohibited to them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or the entrails or what is joined with bone. [By] that We repaid them for their transgression. And indeed, We are truthful.

segments.t: And to those who are Jews
We prohibited every animal of uncloven hoof;
and of the cattle and the sheep
We prohibited to them their fat,
except what adheres to their backs
or the entrails
or what is joined with bone.
[By] that We repaid them for their transgression.
And indeed, We are truthful.

6:147.t: So if they deny you, [O Muḥammad], say, "Your Lord is the possessor of vast mercy; but His punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals."

segments.t: So if they deny you, [O Muḥammad],
say, "Your Lord is the possessor of vast mercy;
but His punishment cannot be repelled
from the people who are criminals."

6:148.t: Those who associated [others] with Allāh will say, "If Allāh had willed, we would not have associated [anything] and neither would our fathers, nor would we have prohibited anything." Likewise did those before deny until they tasted Our punishment. Say, "Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but misjudging."

segments.t: Those who associated [others] with Allāh will say,
"If Allāh had willed,
we would not have associated [anything]
and neither would our fathers,
nor would we have prohibited anything."
Likewise did those before deny
until they tasted Our punishment.
Say, "Do you have any knowledge
that you can produce for us?
You follow not except assumption,
and you are not but misjudging."

6:149.t: Say, "With Allāh is the far-reaching [i.e., conclusive] argument. If He had willed, He would have guided you all."

segments.t: Say, "With Allāh is the far-reaching [i.e., conclusive] argument.
If He had willed,
He would have guided you all."

6:15.t: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

segments.t: Say,
"Indeed I fear,
if I should disobey my Lord,
the punishment of a tremendous Day."

6:150.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "Bring forward your witnesses who will testify that Allāh has prohibited this." And if they testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our verses and those who do not believe in the Hereafter, while they equate [others] with their Lord.

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"Bring forward your witnesses
who will testify that Allāh has prohibited this."
And if they testify,
do not testify with them.
And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our verses
and those who do not believe in the Hereafter,
while they equate [others] with their Lord.

6:151.t: Say, "Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allāh has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason."

segments.t: Say, "Come,
I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you.
[He commands] that you not associate anything with Him,
and to parents, good treatment,
and do not kill your children out of poverty;
We will provide for you and them.
And do not approach immoralities -
what is apparent of them and what is concealed.
And do not kill the soul which Allāh has forbidden [to be killed]
except by [legal] right.
This has He instructed you that you may use reason."

6:152.t: And do not approach the orphan's property except in a way that is best [i.e., intending improvement] until he reaches maturity. And give full measure and weight in justice. We do not charge any soul except [with that within] its capacity. And when you speak [i.e., testify], be just, even if [it concerns] a near relative. And the covenant of Allāh fulfill. This has He instructed you that you may remember.

segments.t: And do not approach the orphan's property
except in a way that is best [i.e., intending improvement]
until he reaches maturity.
And give full measure and weight in justice.
We do not charge any soul except [with that within] its capacity.
And when you speak [i.e., testify], be just,
even if [it concerns] a near relative.
And the covenant of Allāh fulfill.
This has He instructed you that you may remember.

6:153.t: And, [moreover], this is My path, which is straight, so follow it; and do not follow [other] ways, for you will be separated from His way. This has He instructed you that you may become righteous.

segments.t: And, [moreover], this is My path,
which is straight, so follow it;
and do not follow [other] ways,
for you will be separated from His way.
This has He instructed you that you may become righteous.

6:154.t: Then We gave Moses the Scripture, making complete [Our favor] upon the one who did good [i.e., Moses] and as a detailed explanation of all things and as guidance and mercy that perhaps in the meeting with their Lord they would believe.

segments.t: Then We gave Moses the Scripture,
making complete [Our favor] upon the one who did good [i.e., Moses]
and as a detailed explanation of all things
and as guidance and mercy
that perhaps in the meeting with their Lord they would believe.

6:155.t: And this [Qur’ān] is a Book We have revealed [which is] blessed, so follow it and fear Allāh that you may receive mercy.

segments.t: And this [Qur’ān] is a Book We have revealed [which is] blessed,
so follow it and fear Allāh
that you may receive mercy.

6:156.t: [We revealed it] lest you say, "The Scripture was only sent down to two groups before us, but we were of their study unaware,"

segments.t: [We revealed it] lest you say,
"The Scripture was only sent down to two groups before us,
but we were of their study unaware,"

6:157.t: Or lest you say, "If only the Scripture had been revealed to us, we would have been better guided than they." So there has [now] come to you a clear evidence from your Lord and a guidance and mercy. Then who is more unjust than one who denies the verses of Allāh and turns away from them? We will recompense those who turn away from Our verses with the worst of punishment for their having turned away.

segments.t: Or lest you say,
"If only the Scripture had been revealed to us,
we would have been better guided than they."
So there has [now] come to you a clear evidence from your Lord
and a guidance and mercy.
Then who is more unjust than one who denies the verses of Allāh
and turns away from them?
We will recompense those who turn away from Our verses
with the worst of punishment for their having turned away.

6:158.t: Do they [then] wait for anything except that the angels should come to them or your Lord should come or that there come some of the signs of your Lord? The Day that some of the signs of your Lord will come no soul will benefit from its faith as long as it had not believed before or had earned through its faith some good. Say, "Wait. Indeed, we [also] are waiting."

segments.t: Do they [then] wait for anything except that the angels should come to them
or your Lord should come
or that there come some of the signs of your Lord?
The Day that some of the signs of your Lord will come
no soul will benefit from its faith
as long as it had not believed before
or had earned through its faith some good.
Say, "Wait.
Indeed, we [also] are waiting."

6:159.t: Indeed, those who have divided their religion and become sects - you, [O Muḥammad], are not [associated] with them in anything. Their affair is only [left] to Allāh; then He will inform them about what they used to do.

segments.t: Indeed, those who have divided their religion
and become sects -
you, [O Muḥammad], are not [associated] with them in anything.
Their affair is only [left] to Allāh;
then He will inform them about what they used to do.

6:16.t: He from whom it is averted that Day - [Allāh] has granted him mercy. And that is the clear attainment.

segments.t: He from whom it is averted that Day -
[Allāh] has granted him mercy.
And that is the clear attainment.

6:160.t: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit], and whoever comes with an evil deed will not be recompensed except the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.

segments.t: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed
will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit],
and whoever comes with an evil deed
will not be recompensed except the like thereof;
and they will not be wronged.

6:161.t: Say, "Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct religion - the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth. And he was not among those who associated others with Allāh."

segments.t: Say, "Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path -
a correct religion -
the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth.
And he was not among those who associated others with Allāh."

6:162.t: Say, "Indeed, my prayer, my rites of sacrifice, my living and my dying are for Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: Say, "Indeed, my prayer,
my rites of sacrifice,
my living and my dying are for Allāh,
Lord of the worlds.

6:163.t: No partner has He. And this I have been commanded, and I am the first [among you] of the Muslims."

segments.t: No partner has He.
And this I have been commanded,
and I am the first [among you] of the Muslims."

6:164.t: Say, "Is it other than Allāh I should desire as a lord while He is the Lord of all things? And every soul earns not [blame] except against itself, and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ."

segments.t: Say, "Is it other than Allāh I should desire as a lord
while He is the Lord of all things?
And every soul earns not [blame] except against itself,
and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another.
Then to your Lord is your return,
and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ."

6:165.t: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank] that He may try you through what He has given you. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth
and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank]
that He may try you through what He has given you.
Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty;
but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

6:17.t: And if Allāh should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.

segments.t: And if Allāh should touch you with adversity,
there is no remover of it except Him.
And if He touches you with good -
then He is over all things competent.

6:18.t: And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He is the Wise, the Aware.

segments.t: And He is the subjugator over His servants.
And He is the Wise, the Aware.

6:19.t: Say, "What thing is greatest in testimony?" Say, "Allāh is witness between me and you. And this Qur’ān was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you [truly] testify that with Allāh there are other deities?" Say, "I will not testify [with you]." Say, "Indeed, He is but one God, and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him]."

segments.t: Say, "What thing is greatest in testimony?"
Say, "Allāh is witness between me and you.
And this Qur’ān was revealed to me
that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches.
Do you [truly] testify that with Allāh there are other deities?"
Say, "I will not testify [with you]."
Say, "Indeed, He is but one God,
and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him]."

6:2.t: It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term and a specified time [known] to Him; then [still] you are in dispute.

segments.t: It is He who created you from clay
and then decreed a term
and a specified time [known] to Him;
then [still] you are in dispute.

6:20.t: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize it as they recognize their [own] sons. Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter] do not believe.

segments.t: Those to whom We have given the Scripture
recognize it as they recognize their [own] sons.
Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter]
do not believe.

6:21.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh a lie or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh a lie
or denies His verses?
Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.

6:22.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], the Day We will gather them all together; then We will say to those who associated others with Allāh, "Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim [with Him]?"

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
the Day We will gather them all together;
then We will say to those who associated others with Allāh,
"Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim [with Him]?"

6:23.t: Then there will be no [excuse upon] examination except they will say, "By Allāh, our Lord, we were not those who associated."

segments.t: Then there will be no [excuse upon] examination
except they will say,
"By Allāh, our Lord,
we were not those who associated."

6:24.t: See how they will lie about themselves. And lost from them will be what they used to invent.

segments.t: See how they will lie about themselves.
And lost from them will be what they used to invent.

6:25.t: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. Even when they come to you arguing with you, those who disbelieve say, "This is not but legends of the former peoples."

segments.t: And among them are those who listen to you,
but We have placed over their hearts coverings,
lest they understand it,
and in their ears deafness.
And if they should see every sign,
they will not believe in it.
Even when they come to you arguing with you,
those who disbelieve say,
"This is not but legends of the former peoples."

6:26.t: And they prevent [others] from him and are [themselves] remote from him. And they do not destroy except themselves, but they perceive [it] not.

segments.t: And they prevent [others] from him
and are [themselves] remote from him.
And they do not destroy except themselves,
but they perceive [it] not.

6:27.t: If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers."

segments.t: If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire
and will say,
"Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth]
and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers."

6:28.t: But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them. And even if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden; and indeed, they are liars.

segments.t: But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them.
And even if they were returned,
they would return to that which they were forbidden;
and indeed, they are liars.

6:29.t: And they say, "There is none but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected."

segments.t: And they say,
"There is none but our worldly life,
and we will not be resurrected."

6:3.t: And He is Allāh, [the only deity] in the heavens and the earth. He knows your secret and what you make public, and He knows that which you earn.

segments.t: And He is Allāh,
[the only deity] in the heavens and the earth.
He knows your secret and what you make public,
and He knows that which you earn.

6:30.t: If you could but see when they will be made to stand before their Lord. He will say, "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will [then] say, "So taste the punishment for what you used to deny."

segments.t: If you could but see
when they will be made to stand before their Lord.
He will say,
"Is this not the truth?"
They will say,
"Yes, by our Lord."
He will [then] say,
"So taste the punishment
for what you used to deny."

6:31.t: Those will have lost who deny the meeting with Allāh, until when the Hour [of resurrection] comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say, "Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it [i.e., the Hour]," while they bear their burdens [i.e., sins] on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

segments.t: Those will have lost who deny the meeting with Allāh,
until when the Hour [of resurrection] comes upon them unexpectedly,
they will say, "Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it [i.e., the Hour],"
while they bear their burdens [i.e., sins] on their backs.
Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

6:32.t: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allāh, so will you not reason?

segments.t: And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion;
but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allāh,
so will you not reason?

6:33.t: We know that you, [O Muḥammad], are saddened by what they say. And indeed, they do not call you untruthful, but it is the verses of Allāh that the wrongdoers reject.

segments.t: We know that you, [O Muḥammad],
are saddened by what they say.
And indeed, they do not call you untruthful,
but it is the verses of Allāh that the wrongdoers reject.

6:34.t: And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over the denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words [i.e., decrees] of Allāh. And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.

segments.t: And certainly were messengers denied before you,
but they were patient over the denial,
and they were harmed until Our victory came to them.
And none can alter the words [i.e., decrees] of Allāh.
And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.

6:35.t: And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign, [then do so]. But if Allāh had willed, He would have united them upon guidance. So never be of the ignorant.

segments.t: And if their evasion is difficult for you,
then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth
or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign,
[then do so].
But if Allāh had willed,
He would have united them upon guidance.
So never be of the ignorant.

6:36.t: Only those who hear will respond. But the dead - Allāh will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.

segments.t: Only those who hear will respond.
But the dead -
Allāh will resurrect them;
then to Him they will be returned.

6:37.t: And they say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, Allāh is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."

segments.t: And they say,
"Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?"
Say, "Indeed, Allāh is Able to send down a sign,
but most of them do not know."

6:38.t: And there is no creature on [or within] the earth or bird that flies with its wings except [that they are] communities like you. We have not neglected in the Register a thing. Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.

segments.t: And there is no creature on [or within] the earth
or bird that flies with its wings
except [that they are] communities like you.
We have not neglected in the Register a thing.
Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.

6:39.t: But those who deny Our verses are deaf and dumb within darknesses. Whomever Allāh wills - He sends astray; and whomever He wills - He puts him on a straight path.

segments.t: But those who deny Our verses
are deaf and dumb within darknesses.
Whomever Allāh wills -
He sends astray;
and whomever He wills -
He puts him on a straight path.

6:4.t: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away therefrom.

segments.t: And no sign comes to them
from the signs of their Lord
except that they turn away therefrom.

6:40.t: Say, "Have you considered: if there came to you the punishment of Allāh or there came to you the Hour - is it other than Allāh you would invoke, if you should be truthful?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if there came to you the punishment of Allāh
or there came to you the Hour -
is it other than Allāh you would invoke,
if you should be truthful?"

6:41.t: No, it is Him [alone] you would invoke, and He would remove that for which you invoked Him if He willed, and you would forget what you associate [with Him].

segments.t: No, it is Him [alone] you would invoke,
and He would remove that for which you invoked Him if He willed,
and you would forget what you associate [with Him].

6:42.t: And We have already sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muḥammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].

segments.t: And We have already sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muḥammad];
then We seized them with poverty and hardship
that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].

6:43.t: Then why, when Our punishment came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.

segments.t: Then why, when Our punishment came to them,
did they not humble themselves?
But their hearts became hardened,
and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.

6:44.t: So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were [then] in despair.

segments.t: So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded,
We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until,
when they rejoiced in that which they were given,
We seized them suddenly,
and they were [then] in despair.

6:45.t: So the people that committed wrong were eliminated. And praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: So the people that committed wrong were eliminated.
And praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

6:46.t: Say, "Have you considered: if Allāh should take away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your hearts, which deity other than Allāh could bring them [back] to you?" Look how We diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if Allāh should take away your hearing and your sight
and set a seal upon your hearts,
which deity other than Allāh could bring them [back] to you?"
Look how We diversify the verses;
then they [still] turn away.

6:47.t: Say, "Have you considered: if the punishment of Allāh should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?"

segments.t: Say, "Have you considered:
if the punishment of Allāh should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly,
will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?"

6:48.t: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. So whoever believes and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

segments.t: And We send not the messengers
except as bringers of good tidings and warners.
So whoever believes and reforms -
there will be no fear concerning them,
nor will they grieve.

6:49.t: But those who deny Our verses - the punishment will touch them for their defiant disobedience.

segments.t: But those who deny Our verses -
the punishment will touch them
for their defiant disobedience.

6:5.t: For they had denied the truth when it came to them, but there is going to reach them the news of what they used to ridicule.

segments.t: For they had denied the truth
when it came to them,
but there is going to reach them
the news of what they used to ridicule.

6:50.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allāh or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me." Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Then will you not give thought?"

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad],
"I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allāh
or that I know the unseen,
nor do I tell you that I am an angel.
I only follow what is revealed to me."
Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing?
Then will you not give thought?"

6:51.t: And warn by it [i.e., the Qur’ān] those who fear that they will be gathered before their Lord - for them besides Him will be no protector and no intercessor - that they might become righteous.

segments.t: And warn by it [i.e., the Qur’ān] those who fear that they will be gathered before their Lord -
for them besides Him will be no protector and no intercessor -
that they might become righteous.

6:52.t: And do not send away those who call upon their Lord morning and afternoon, seeking His face [i.e., favor]. Not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account. So were you to send them away, you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.

segments.t: And do not send away those who call upon their Lord
morning and afternoon,
seeking His face [i.e., favor].
Not upon you is anything of their account
and not upon them is anything of your account.
So were you to send them away,
you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.

6:53.t: And thus We have tried some of them through others that they [i.e., the disbelievers] might say, "Is it these whom Allāh has favored among us?" Is not Allāh most knowing of those who are grateful?

segments.t: And thus We have tried some of them through others
that they [i.e., the disbelievers] might say,
"Is it these whom Allāh has favored among us?"
Is not Allāh most knowing of those who are grateful?

6:54.t: And when those come to you who believe in Our verses, say, "Peace be upon you. Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy: that any of you who does wrong out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."

segments.t: And when those come to you who believe in Our verses,
say, "Peace be upon you.
Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy:
that any of you who does wrong out of ignorance
and then repents after that and corrects himself -
indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."

6:55.t: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.

segments.t: And thus do We detail the verses,
and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.

6:56.t: Say, "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides Allāh." Say, "I will not follow your desires, for I would then have gone astray, and I would not be of the [rightly] guided."

segments.t: Say, "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides Allāh."
Say, "I will not follow your desires,
for I would then have gone astray,
and I would not be of the [rightly] guided."

6:57.t: Say, "Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have denied it. I do not have that for which you are impatient. The decision is only for Allāh. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders."

segments.t: Say, "Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my Lord,
and you have denied it.
I do not have that for which you are impatient.
The decision is only for Allāh.
He relates the truth,
and He is the best of deciders."

6:58.t: Say, "If I had that for which you are impatient, the matter would have been decided between me and you, but Allāh is most knowing of the wrongdoers."

segments.t: Say, "If I had that for which you are impatient,
the matter would have been decided between me and you,
but Allāh is most knowing of the wrongdoers."

6:59.t: And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record.

segments.t: And with Him are the keys of the unseen;
none knows them except Him.
And He knows what is on the land and in the sea.
Not a leaf falls but that He knows it.
And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth
and no moist or dry [thing]
but that it is [written] in a clear record.

6:6.t: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them which We had established upon the earth as We have not established you? And We sent [rain from] the sky upon them in showers and made rivers flow beneath them; then We destroyed them for their sins and brought forth after them a generation of others.

segments.t: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them
which We had established upon the earth as We have not established you?
And We sent [rain from] the sky upon them in showers
and made rivers flow beneath them;
then We destroyed them for their sins
and brought forth after them a generation of others.

6:60.t: And it is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein [i.e., by day] that a specified term may be fulfilled. Then to Him will be your return; then He will inform you about what you used to do.

segments.t: And it is He who takes your souls by night
and knows what you have committed by day.
Then He revives you therein [i.e., by day]
that a specified term may be fulfilled.
Then to Him will be your return;
then He will inform you about what you used to do.

6:61.t: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers [i.e., angels of death] take him, and they do not fail [in their duties].

segments.t: And He is the subjugator over His servants,
and He sends over you guardian-angels
until, when death comes to one of you,
Our messengers [i.e., angels of death] take him,
and they do not fail [in their duties].

6:62.t: Then they [i.e., His servants] are returned to Allāh, their true Lord. Unquestionably, His is the judgement, and He is the swiftest of accountants.

segments.t: Then they [i.e., His servants] are returned to Allāh,
their true Lord.
Unquestionably, His is the judgement,
and He is the swiftest of accountants.

6:63.t: Say, "Who rescues you from the darknesses of the land and sea [when] you call upon Him imploring [aloud] and privately, 'If He should save us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the thankful.'"

segments.t: Say, "Who rescues you
from the darknesses of the land and sea
[when] you call upon Him
imploring [aloud] and privately,
'If He should save us from this [crisis],
we will surely be among the thankful.'"

6:64.t: Say, "It is Allāh who saves you from it and from every distress; then you [still] associate others with Him."

segments.t: Say, "It is Allāh who saves you from it
and from every distress;
then you [still] associate others with Him."

6:65.t: Say, "He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another." Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.

segments.t: Say, "He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction
from above you or from beneath your feet
or to confuse you [so you become] sects
and make you taste the violence of one another."
Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.

6:66.t: But your people have denied it while it is the truth. Say, "I am not over you a manager [i.e., authority]."

segments.t: But your people have denied it
while it is the truth.
Say, "I am not over you a manager [i.e., authority]."

6:67.t: For every news [i.e., happening] is a finality; and you are going to know.

segments.t: For every news [i.e., happening] is a finality;
and you are going to know.

6:68.t: And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.

segments.t: And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse
concerning Our verses,
then turn away from them
until they enter into another conversation.
And if Satan should cause you to forget,
then do not remain after the reminder
with the wrongdoing people.

6:69.t: And those who fear Allāh are not held accountable for them [i.e., the disbelievers] at all, but [only for] a reminder - that perhaps they will fear Him.

segments.t: And those who fear Allāh
are not held accountable for them [i.e., the disbelievers] at all,
but [only for] a reminder -
that perhaps they will fear Him.

6:7.t: And even if We had sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], a written scripture on a page and they touched it with their hands, the disbelievers would say, "This is not but obvious magic."

segments.t: And even if We had sent down to you, [O Muḥammad],
a written scripture on a page
and they touched it with their hands,
the disbelievers would say,
"This is not but obvious magic."

6:70.t: And leave those who take their religion as amusement and diversion and whom the worldly life has deluded. But remind with it [i.e., the Qur’ān], lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have other than Allāh no protector and no intercessor. And if it should offer every compensation, it would not be taken from it [i.e., that soul]. Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.

segments.t: And leave those who take their religion as amusement and diversion
and whom the worldly life has deluded.
But remind with it [i.e., the Qur’ān],
lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned;
it will have other than Allāh no protector and no intercessor.
And if it should offer every compensation,
it would not be taken from it [i.e., that soul].
Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned.
For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment
because they used to disbelieve.

6:71.t: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of Allāh that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be turned back on our heels after Allāh has guided us? [We would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to guidance, [calling], 'Come to us.'" Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allāh is the [only] guidance; and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of Allāh
that which neither benefits us nor harms us
and be turned back on our heels
after Allāh has guided us?
[We would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander]
upon the earth confused,
[while] he has companions inviting him to guidance,
[calling], 'Come to us.'"
Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allāh is the [only] guidance;
and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.

6:72.t: And to establish prayer and fear Him." And it is He to whom you will be gathered.

segments.t: And to establish prayer and fear Him."
And it is He to whom you will be gathered.

6:73.t: And it is He who created the heavens and earth in truth. And the day [i.e., whenever] He says, "Be," and it is, His word is the truth. And His is the dominion [on] the Day the Horn is blown. [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; and He is the Wise, the Aware.

segments.t: And it is He who created the heavens and earth in truth.
And the day [i.e., whenever] He says, "Be," and it is,
His word is the truth.
And His is the dominion [on] the Day the Horn is blown.
[He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed;
and He is the Wise, the Aware.

6:74.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when Abraham said to his father Āzar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when Abraham said to his father Āzar,
"Do you take idols as deities?
Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."

6:75.t: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith].

segments.t: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth
that he would be among the certain [in faith].

6:76.t: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I like not those that set [i.e., disappear]."

segments.t: So when the night covered him [with darkness],
he saw a star.
He said,
"This is my lord."
But when it set,
he said,
"I like not those that set [i.e., disappear]."

6:77.t: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray."

segments.t: And when he saw the moon rising,
he said, "This is my lord."
But when it set,
he said, "Unless my Lord guides me,
I will surely be among the people gone astray."

6:78.t: And when he saw the sun rising, he said, "This is my lord; this is greater." But when it set, he said, "O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allāh.

segments.t: And when he saw the sun rising,
he said, "This is my lord;
this is greater."
But when it set,
he said, "O my people,
indeed I am free from what you associate with Allāh.

6:79.t: Indeed, I have turned my face [i.e., self] toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allāh."

segments.t: Indeed, I have turned my face [i.e., self]
toward He who created the heavens and the earth,
inclining toward truth,
and I am not of those who associate others with Allāh."

6:8.t: And they say, "Why was there not sent down to him an angel?" But if We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided; then they would not be reprieved.

segments.t: And they say,
"Why was there not sent down to him an angel?"
But if We had sent down an angel,
the matter would have been decided;
then they would not be reprieved.

6:80.t: And his people argued with him. He said, "Do you argue with me concerning Allāh while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed] unless my Lord should will something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge; then will you not remember?

segments.t: And his people argued with him.
He said, "Do you argue with me concerning Allāh
while He has guided me?
And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed]
unless my Lord should will something.
My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge;
then will you not remember?

6:81.t: And how should I fear what you associate while you do not fear that you have associated with Allāh that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?"

segments.t: And how should I fear what you associate
while you do not fear that you have associated with Allāh
that for which He has not sent down to you any authority?
So which of the two parties has more right to security,
if you should know?"

6:82.t: They who believe and do not mix their belief with injustice - those will have security, and they are [rightly] guided.

segments.t: They who believe
and do not mix their belief with injustice -
those will have security,
and they are [rightly] guided.

6:83.t: And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.

segments.t: And that was Our [conclusive] argument
which We gave Abraham against his people.
We raise by degrees whom We will.
Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.

6:84.t: And We gave to him [i.e., Abraham] Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.

segments.t: And We gave to him [i.e., Abraham] Isaac and Jacob -
all [of them] We guided.
And Noah, We guided before;
and among his descendants,
David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron.
Thus do We reward the doers of good.

6:85.t: And Zechariah and John and Jesus and Elias - and all were of the righteous.

segments.t: And Zechariah and John and Jesus and Elias -
and all were of the righteous.

6:86.t: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot - and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.

segments.t: And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot -
and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.

6:87.t: And [some] among their fathers and their descendants and their brothers - and We chose them and We guided them to a straight path.

segments.t: And [some] among their fathers
and their descendants
and their brothers -
and We chose them
and We guided them to a straight path.

6:88.t: That is the guidance of Allāh by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with Allāh, then worthless for them would be whatever they were doing.

segments.t: That is the guidance of Allāh
by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants.
But if they had associated others with Allāh,
then worthless for them would be whatever they were doing.

6:89.t: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture and authority and prophethood. But if they [i.e., the disbelievers] deny it, then We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disbelievers.

segments.t: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture
and authority and prophethood.
But if they [i.e., the disbelievers] deny it,
then We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disbelievers.

6:9.t: And if We had made him [i.e., the messenger] an angel, We would have made him [appear as] a man, and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves [i.e., confusion and doubt].

segments.t: And if We had made him [i.e., the messenger] an angel,
We would have made him [appear as] a man,
and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves [i.e., confusion and doubt].

6:90.t: Those are the ones whom Allāh has guided, so from their guidance take an example. Say, "I ask of you for it [i.e., this message] no payment. It is not but a reminder for the worlds."

segments.t: Those are the ones whom Allāh has guided,
so from their guidance take an example.
Say, "I ask of you for it [i.e., this message] no payment.
It is not but a reminder for the worlds."

6:91.t: And they did not appraise Allāh with true appraisal when they said, "Allāh did not reveal to a human being anything." Say, "Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought as light and guidance to the people? You [Jews] make it into pages, disclosing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers." Say, "Allāh [revealed it]." Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.

segments.t: And they did not appraise Allāh with true appraisal
when they said, "Allāh did not reveal to a human being anything."
Say, "Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought
as light and guidance to the people?
You [Jews] make it into pages,
disclosing [some of] it and concealing much.
And you were taught that which you knew not -
neither you nor your fathers."
Say, "Allāh [revealed it]."
Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.

6:92.t: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed and confirming what was before it, that you may warn the Mother of Cities [i.e., Makkah] and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are maintaining their prayers.

segments.t: And this is a Book which We have sent down,
blessed and confirming what was before it,
that you may warn the Mother of Cities [i.e., Makkah]
and those around it.
Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it,
and they are maintaining their prayers.

6:93.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allāh or says, "It has been inspired to me," while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, "I will reveal [something] like what Allāh revealed." And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels extend their hands, [saying], "Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against Allāh other than the truth and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant."

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allāh
or says, "It has been inspired to me,"
while nothing has been inspired to him,
and one who says, "I will reveal [something] like what Allāh revealed."
And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death
while the angels extend their hands, [saying], "Discharge your souls!
Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation
for what you used to say against Allāh other than the truth
and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant."

6:94.t: [It will be said to them], "And you have certainly come to Us alone [i.e., individually] as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you. And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed that they were among you associates [of Allāh]. It has [all] been severed between you, and lost from you is what you used to claim."

segments.t: [It will be said to them], "And you have certainly come to Us alone [i.e., individually]
as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you.
And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed that they were among you associates [of Allāh].
It has [all] been severed between you, and lost from you is what you used to claim."

6:95.t: Indeed, Allāh is the cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is Allāh; so how are you deluded?

segments.t: Indeed, Allāh is the cleaver of grain and date seeds.
He brings the living out of the dead
and brings the dead out of the living.
That is Allāh;
so how are you deluded?

6:96.t: [He is] the cleaver of daybreak and has made the night for rest and the sun and moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

segments.t: [He is] the cleaver of daybreak
and has made the night for rest
and the sun and moon for calculation.
That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

6:97.t: And it is He who placed for you the stars that you may be guided by them through the darknesses of the land and sea. We have detailed the signs for a people who know.

segments.t: And it is He who placed for you the stars
that you may be guided by them
through the darknesses of the land and sea.
We have detailed the signs for a people who know.

6:98.t: And it is He who produced you from one soul and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage. We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.

segments.t: And it is He who produced you from one soul
and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage.
We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.

6:99.t: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We produce from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And [We produce] gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

segments.t: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky,
and We produce thereby the growth of all things.
We produce from it greenery
from which We produce grains arranged in layers.
And from the palm trees -
of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low.
And [We produce] gardens of grapevines
and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied.
Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields
and [at] its ripening.
Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

70:1.t: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen

segments.t: A supplicant asked
for a punishment bound to happen

70:10.t: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

segments.t: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

70:11.t: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children

segments.t: They will be shown each other.
The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed
from the punishment of that Day by his children

70:12.t: And his wife and his brother

segments.t: And his wife
and his brother

70:13.t: And his nearest kindred who shelter him

segments.t: And his nearest kindred
who shelter him

70:14.t: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.

segments.t: And whoever is on earth entirely [so]
then it could save him.

70:15.t: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],

segments.t: No!
Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],
A remover of exteriors.

70:17.t: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]

segments.t: It invites he who turned his back [on truth]
and went away [from obedience]
And collected [wealth]
and hoarded.
Indeed, mankind was created anxious:

70:2.t: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.

segments.t: To the disbelievers;
of it there is no preventer.
When evil touches him,
impatient,

70:21.t: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],

segments.t: And when good touches him,
withholding [of it],
Except the observers of prayer -

70:23.t: Those who are constant in their prayer

segments.t: Those who are constant
in their prayer

70:24.t: And those within whose wealth is a known right

segments.t: And those within whose wealth
is a known right

70:25.t: For the petitioner and the deprived -

segments.t: For the petitioner
and the deprived -

70:26.t: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

segments.t: And those who believe
in the Day of Recompense

70:27.t: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -

segments.t: And those who are fearful
of the punishment of their Lord -

70:28.t: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -

segments.t: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord
is not that from which one is safe -

70:29.t: And those who guard their private parts

segments.t: And those who guard their private parts

70:3.t: [It is] from Allāh, owner of the ways of ascent.

segments.t: [It is] from Allāh,
owner of the ways of ascent.

70:30.t: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -

segments.t: Except from their wives
or those their right hands possess,
for indeed, they are not to be blamed -

70:31.t: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -

segments.t: But whoever seeks beyond that,
then they are the transgressors -

70:32.t: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive

7:10.t: And We have certainly established you upon the earth and made for you therein ways of livelihood. Little are you grateful.

7:100.t: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth after its [previous] people that if We willed, We could afflict them for their sins? But We seal over their hearts so they do not hear.

segments.t: Has it not become clear to those who inherited the earth

But We seal over their hearts
so they do not hear.

7:101.t: Those cities - We relate to you, [O Muḥammad], some of their news. And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus does Allāh seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.

segments.t: Those cities -

some of their news.
And certainly did their messengers come to them with clear proofs,
but they were not to believe in that which they had denied before.
Thus does Allāh seal over the hearts of the disbelievers.

7:102.t: And We did not find for most of them any covenant; but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: And We did not find for most of them any covenant;
but indeed, We found most of them defiantly disobedient.

7:103.t: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were unjust toward them. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

segments.t: Then We sent after them Moses with Our signs
to Pharaoh and his establishment,
but they were unjust toward them.
So see how was the end of the corrupters.

7:104.t: And Moses said, "O Pharaoh, I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds

segments.t: And Moses said,
"O Pharaoh,
I am a messenger
from the Lord of the worlds

7:105.t: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allāh except the truth. I have come to you with clear evidence from your Lord, so send with me the Children of Israel."

segments.t: [Who is] obligated not to say about Allāh except the truth.

if you should be of the truthful."

7:107.t: So he [i.e., Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent, manifest.

segments.t: So he [i.e., Moses] threw his staff,

7:108.t: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white [with radiance] for the observers.

segments.t: And he drew out his hand;
thereupon it was white [with radiance]

7:109.t: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh, "Indeed, this is a learned magician

segments.t: Said the eminent among the people of Pharaoh,
"Indeed, this is a learned magician

7:11.t: And We have certainly created you, [O mankind], and given you [human] form. Then We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam"; so they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was not of those who prostrated.

segments.t: And We have certainly created you, [O mankind],
and given you [human] form.

"Prostrate to Adam";
so they prostrated, except for Iblees.
He was not of those who prostrated.

7:110.t: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic], so what do you instruct?"

segments.t: Who wants to expel you from your land [through magic],
so what do you instruct?"

7:111.t: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

segments.t: They said,
"Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother
and send among the cities gatherers

7:112.t: Who will bring you every learned magician."

segments.t: Who will bring you
every learned magician."

7:113.t: And the magicians came to Pharaoh. They said, "Indeed for us is a reward if we are the predominant."

segments.t: And the magicians came to Pharaoh.
They said,
"Indeed for us is a reward
if we are the predominant."

7:114.t: He said, "Yes, and, [moreover], you will be among those made near [to me]."

segments.t: He said,
"Yes, and, [moreover],
you will be among those made near [to me]."

7:115.t: They said, "O Moses, either you throw [your staff], or we will be the ones to throw [first]."

segments.t: They said,
"O Moses,
either you throw [your staff],
or we will be the ones to throw [first]."

7:116.t: He said, "Throw," and when they threw, they bewitched the eyes of the people and struck terror into them, and they presented a great [feat of] magic.

segments.t: He said, "Throw,"
and when they threw,
they bewitched the eyes of the people
and struck terror into them,
and they presented a great [feat of] magic.

7:117.t: And We inspired to Moses, "Throw your staff," and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.

segments.t: And We inspired to Moses,
"Throw your staff,"
and at once it devoured what they were falsifying.

7:118.t: So the truth was established, and abolished was what they were doing.

segments.t: So the truth was established,
and abolished was what they were doing.

7:119.t: And they [i.e., Pharaoh and his people] were overcome right there and became debased.

segments.t: And they [i.e., Pharaoh and his people] were overcome right there
and became debased.

7:12.t: [Allāh] said, "What prevented you from prostrating when I commanded you?" [Satan] said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay [i.e., earth]."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,

[Satan] said,
"I am better than him.
You created me from fire
and created him from clay [i.e., earth]."

7:120.t: And the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allāh].

segments.t: And the magicians fell down
in prostration [to Allāh].

7:121.t: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

segments.t: They said,
"We have believed
in the Lord of the worlds,

7:122.t: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

segments.t: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

7:123.t: Said Pharaoh, "You believed in him before I gave you permission. Indeed, this is a conspiracy which you conspired in the city to expel therefrom its people. But you are going to know.

segments.t: Said Pharaoh,
"You believed in him before I gave you permission.
Indeed, this is a conspiracy
which you conspired in the city
to expel therefrom its people.
But you are going to know.

7:124.t: I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides; then I will surely crucify you all."

segments.t: I will surely cut off your hands
and your feet on opposite sides;
then I will surely crucify you all."

7:125.t: They said, "Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

segments.t: They said,
"Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

7:126.t: And you do not resent us except because we believed in the signs of our Lord when they came to us. Our Lord, pour upon us patience and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."

segments.t: And you do not resent us
except because we believed in the signs of our Lord
when they came to us.
Our Lord, pour upon us patience
and let us die as Muslims [in submission to You]."

7:127.t: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said, "Will you leave Moses and his people to cause corruption in the land and abandon you and your gods?" [Pharaoh] said, "We will kill their sons and keep their women alive; and indeed, we are subjugators over them."

segments.t: And the eminent among the people of Pharaoh said,

and abandon you and your gods?"
[Pharaoh] said,
"We will kill their sons and keep their women alive;
and indeed, we are subjugators over them."

7:128.t: Said Moses to his people, "Seek help through Allāh and be patient. Indeed, the earth belongs to Allāh. He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."

segments.t: Said Moses to his people,
"Seek help through Allāh and be patient.
Indeed, the earth belongs to Allāh.
He causes to inherit it whom He wills of His servants.
And the [best] outcome is for the righteous."

7:129.t: They said, "We have been harmed before you came to us and after you have come to us." He said, "Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy and grant you succession in the land and see how you will do."

segments.t: They said,
"We have been harmed before you came to us
and after you have come to us."
He said,
"Perhaps your Lord will destroy your enemy
and grant you succession in the land
and see how you will do."

7:13.t: [Allāh] said, "Descend from it [i.e., Paradise], for it is not for you to be arrogant therein. So get out; indeed, you are of the debased."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Descend from it [i.e., Paradise],
for it is not for you to be arrogant therein.
So get out;
indeed, you are of the debased."

7:130.t: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits that perhaps they would be reminded.

segments.t: And We certainly seized the people of Pharaoh
with years of famine and a deficiency in fruits
that perhaps they would be reminded.

7:131.t: But when good [i.e., provision] came to them, they said, "This is ours [by right]." And if a bad [condition] struck them, they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him. Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allāh, but most of them do not know.

segments.t: But when good [i.e., provision] came to them,
they said, "This is ours [by right]."
And if a bad [condition] struck them,
they saw an evil omen in Moses and those with him.
Unquestionably, their fortune is with Allāh,
but most of them do not know.

7:132.t: And they said, "No matter what sign you bring us with which to bewitch us, we will not be believers in you."

segments.t: And they said,
"No matter what sign you bring us
with which to bewitch us,
we will not be believers in you."

7:133.t: So We sent upon them the flood and locusts and lice and frogs and blood as distinct signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.

segments.t: So We sent upon them the flood
and locusts and lice and frogs and blood
as distinct signs,
but they were arrogant
and were a criminal people.

7:134.t: And when the punishment descended upon them, they said, "O Moses, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. If you [can] remove the punishment from us, we will surely believe you, and we will send with you the Children of Israel."

segments.t: And when the punishment descended upon them,
they said, "O Moses,
invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you.
If you [can] remove the punishment from us,
we will surely believe you,
and we will send with you the Children of Israel."

7:135.t: But when We removed the punishment from them until a term which they were to reach, then at once they broke their word.

segments.t: But when We removed the punishment from them
until a term which they were to reach,
then at once they broke their word.

7:136.t: So We took retribution from them, and We drowned them in the sea because they denied Our signs and were heedless of them.

segments.t: So We took retribution from them,
and We drowned them in the sea
because they denied Our signs
and were heedless of them.

7:137.t: And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word [i.e., decree] of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building.
