And the good word [i.e., decree] of your Lord was fulfilled
for the Children of Israel
because of what they had patiently endured.
And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing
and what they had been building.

7:138.t: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea; then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs. They [the Children of Israel] said, "O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods." He said, "Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.

segments.t: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea;
then they came upon a people intent in devotion to [some] idols of theirs.
They [the Children of Israel] said,
"O Moses, make for us a god just as they have gods."
He said,
"Indeed, you are a people behaving ignorantly.

7:139.t: Indeed, those [worshippers] - destroyed is that in which they are [engaged], and worthless is whatever they were doing."

segments.t: Indeed, those [worshippers] -
destroyed is that in which they are [engaged],
and worthless is whatever they were doing."

7:14.t: [Satan] said, "Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

segments.t: [Satan] said,
"Reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

7:140.t: He said, "Is it other than Allāh I should desire for you as a god while He has preferred you over the worlds?"

segments.t: He said,
"Is it other than Allāh I should desire for you as a god
while He has preferred you over the worlds?"

7:141.t: And [recall, O Children of Israel], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, [who were] afflicting you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

segments.t: And [recall, O Children of Israel],
when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh,
[who were] afflicting you with the worst torment -
killing your sons
and keeping your women alive.
And in that was a great trial from your Lord.

7:142.t: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."

segments.t: And We made an appointment with Moses for thirty nights
and perfected them by [the addition of] ten;
so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights.
And Moses said to his brother Aaron,
"Take my place among my people,
do right [by them],
and do not follow the way of the corrupters."

7:143.t: And when Moses arrived at Our appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said, "My Lord, show me [Yourself] that I may look at You." [Allāh] said, "You will not see Me, but look at the mountain; if it should remain in place, then you will see Me." But when his Lord appeared to the mountain, He rendered it level, and Moses fell unconscious. And when he awoke, he said, "Exalted are You! I have repented to You, and I am the first [among my people] of the believers."

that I may look at You."
[Allāh] said, "You will not see Me,

7:144.t: [Allāh] said, "O Moses, I have chosen you over the people with My messages and My words [to you]. So take what I have given you and be among the grateful."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"O Moses,
I have chosen you over the people
with My messages and My words [to you].
So take what I have given you
and be among the grateful."

7:145.t: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things - instruction and explanation for all things, [saying], "Take them with determination and order your people to take the best of it. I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."

segments.t: And We wrote for him on the tablets [something] of all things -
instruction and explanation for all things, [saying],
"Take them with determination
and order your people to take the best of it.
I will show you the home of the defiantly disobedient."

7:146.t: I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant upon the earth without right; and if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. And if they see the way of consciousness, they will not adopt it as a way; but if they see the way of error, they will adopt it as a way. That is because they have denied Our signs and they were heedless of them.

segments.t: I will turn away from My signs
those who are arrogant upon the earth without right;

they will not believe in it.
And if they see the way of consciousness,
they will not adopt it as a way;
but if they see the way of error,
they will adopt it as a way.
That is because they have denied Our signs
and they were heedless of them.

7:147.t: Those who denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter - their deeds have become worthless. Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?

segments.t: Those who denied Our signs
and the meeting of the Hereafter -
their deeds have become worthless.
Are they recompensed except for what they used to do?

7:148.t: And the people of Moses made, after [his departure], from their ornaments a calf - an image having a lowing sound. Did they not see that it could neither speak to them nor guide them to a way? They took it [for worship], and they were wrongdoers.

They took it [for worship],
and they were wrongdoers.

7:149.t: And when regret overcame them and they saw that they had gone astray, they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us and forgive us, we will surely be among the losers."

segments.t: And when regret overcame them
and they saw that they had gone astray,
they said, "If our Lord does not have mercy upon us
and forgive us,
we will surely be among the losers."

7:15.t: [Allāh] said, "Indeed, you are of those reprieved."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Indeed, you are of those reprieved."

7:150.t: And when Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved, he said, "How wretched is that by which you have replaced me after [my departure]. Were you impatient over the matter of your Lord?" And he threw down the tablets and seized his brother by [the hair of] his head, pulling him toward him. [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, indeed the people overpowered me and were about to kill me, so let not the enemies rejoice over me and do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

7:151.t: [Moses] said, "My Lord, forgive me and my brother and admit us into Your mercy, for You are the most merciful of the merciful."

segments.t: [Moses] said,
"My Lord, forgive me and my brother

for You are the most merciful of the merciful."

7:152.t: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship] will obtain anger from their Lord and humiliation in the life of this world, and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].

segments.t: Indeed, those who took the calf [for worship]

and thus do We recompense the inventors [of falsehood].

7:153.t: But those who committed misdeeds and then repented after them and believed - indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: But those who committed misdeeds
and then repented after them and believed -
indeed your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

7:154.t: And when the anger subsided in Moses, he took up the tablets; and in their inscription was guidance and mercy for those who are fearful of their Lord.

segments.t: And when the anger subsided in Moses,
he took up the tablets;
and in their inscription was guidance and mercy
for those who are fearful of their Lord.

7:155.t: And Moses chose from his people seventy men for Our appointment. And when the earthquake seized them, he said, "My Lord, if You had willed, You could have destroyed them before and me [as well]. Would You destroy us for what the foolish among us have done? This is not but Your trial by which You send astray whom You will and guide whom You will. You are our Protector, so forgive us and have mercy upon us; and You are the best of forgivers.

7:156.t: And decree for us in this world [that which is] good and [also] in the Hereafter; indeed, we have turned back to You." [Allāh] said, "My punishment - I afflict with it whom I will, but My mercy encompasses all things." So I will decree it [especially] for those who fear Me and give zakāh and those who believe in Our verses-

7:157.t: Those who follow the Messenger, the unlettered prophet, whom they find written [i.e., described] in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel, who enjoins upon them what is right and prohibits them from what is wrong and makes lawful for them what is good and forbids them from what is evil and relieves them of their burden and the shackles which were upon them. So they who have believed in him, honored him, supported him and followed the light which was sent down with him - it is those who will be the successful.

the unlettered prophet,
whom they find written [i.e., described]
in what they have of the Torah and the Gospel,
who enjoins upon them what is right
and prohibits them from what is wrong
and makes lawful for them what is good
and forbids them from what is evil
and relieves them of their burden
and the shackles which were upon them.
So they who have believed in him,
honored him,
supported him

7:158.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "O mankind, indeed I am the Messenger of Allāh to you all, [from Him] to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death." So believe in Allāh and His Messenger, the unlettered prophet, who believes in Allāh and His words, and follow him that you may be guided.

7:159.t: And among the people of Moses is a community which guides by truth and by it establishes justice.

7:16.t: [Satan] said, "Because You have put me in error, I will surely sit in wait for them [i.e., mankind] on Your straight path.

7:160.t: And We divided them into twelve descendant tribes [as distinct] nations. And We inspired to Moses when his people implored him for water, "Strike with your staff the stone," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs. Every people [i.e., tribe] knew its watering place. And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails, [saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you." And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.

Every people [i.e., tribe] knew its watering place.
And We shaded them with clouds and sent down upon them manna and quails,
[saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you."
And they wronged Us not, but they were [only] wronging themselves.

7:161.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad], when it was said to them, "Dwell in this city [i.e., Jerusalem] and eat from it wherever you will and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens [i.e., sins],' and enter the gate bowing humbly; We will [then] forgive you your sins. We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."

segments.t: And [mention, O Muḥammad],
when it was said to them,
"Dwell in this city [i.e., Jerusalem]
and eat from it wherever you will
and say, 'Relieve us of our burdens [i.e., sins],'
and enter the gate bowing humbly;
We will [then] forgive you your sins.
We will increase the doers of good [in goodness and reward]."

7:162.t: But those who wronged among them changed [the words] to a statement other than that which had been said to them. So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky for the wrong that they were doing.

segments.t: But those who wronged among them changed [the words]
to a statement other than that which had been said to them.
So We sent upon them a punishment from the sky
for the wrong that they were doing.

7:163.t: And ask them about the town that was by the sea - when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath - when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day, and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them. Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.

segments.t: And ask them about the town that was by the sea -
when they transgressed in [the matter of] the sabbath -
when their fish came to them openly on their sabbath day,
and the day they had no sabbath they did not come to them.
Thus did We give them trial because they were defiantly disobedient.

7:164.t: And when a community among them said, "Why do you advise [or warn] a people whom Allāh is [about] to destroy or to punish with a severe punishment?" they [the advisors] said, "To be absolved before your Lord and perhaps they may fear Him."

segments.t: And when a community among them said,
"Why do you advise [or warn] a people
whom Allāh is [about] to destroy
or to punish with a severe punishment?"
they [the advisors] said,
"To be absolved before your Lord
and perhaps they may fear Him."

7:165.t: And when they [i.e., those advised] forgot that by which they had been reminded, We saved those who had forbidden evil and seized those who wronged, with a wretched punishment, because they were defiantly disobeying.

segments.t: And when they [i.e., those advised] forgot that by which they had been reminded,
We saved those who had forbidden evil
and seized those who wronged,
with a wretched punishment,
because they were defiantly disobeying.

7:166.t: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden, We said to them, "Be apes, despised."

segments.t: So when they were insolent about that which they had been forbidden,
We said to them,
"Be apes, despised."

7:167.t: And [mention] when your Lord declared that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection those who would afflict them with the worst torment. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

segments.t: And [mention] when your Lord declared
that He would surely [continue to] send upon them until the Day of Resurrection
those who would afflict them with the worst torment.
Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty;
but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.

7:168.t: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations. Of them some were righteous, and of them some were otherwise. And We tested them with good [times] and bad that perhaps they would return [to obedience].

segments.t: And We divided them throughout the earth into nations.
Of them some were righteous,
and of them some were otherwise.
And We tested them with good [times] and bad
that perhaps they would return [to obedience].

7:169.t: And there followed them successors who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life and saying, "It will be forgiven for us." And if an offer like it comes to them, they will [again] take it. Was not the covenant of the Scripture [i.e., the Torah] taken from them that they would not say about Allāh except the truth, and they studied what was in it? And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allāh, so will you not use reason?

segments.t: And there followed them successors
who inherited the Scripture [while] taking the commodities of this lower life
and saying, "It will be forgiven for us."
And if an offer like it comes to them,
they will [again] take it.
Was not the covenant of the Scripture [i.e., the Torah] taken from them
that they would not say about Allāh except the truth,
and they studied what was in it?
And the home of the Hereafter is better for those who fear Allāh,
so will you not use reason?

7:17.t: Then I will come to them from before them and from behind them and on their right and on their left, and You will not find most of them grateful [to You]."

segments.t: Then I will come to them from before them
and from behind them
and on their right
and on their left,
and You will not find most of them grateful [to You]."

7:170.t: But those who hold fast to the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān] and establish prayer - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.

segments.t: But those who hold fast to the Book [i.e., the Qur’ān]
and establish prayer -
indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of the reformers.

7:171.t: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud and they were certain that it would fall upon them, [and Allāh said], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that you might fear Allāh."

segments.t: And [mention] when We raised the mountain above them as if it was a dark cloud
and they were certain that it would fall upon them,
[and Allāh said], "Take what We have given you with determination
and remember what is in it that you might fear Allāh."

7:172.t: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam - from their loins - their descendants and made them testify of themselves, [saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?" They said, "Yes, we have testified." [This] - lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection, "Indeed, we were of this unaware."

segments.t: And [mention] when your Lord took from the children of Adam -
from their loins -
their descendants and made them testify of themselves,
[saying to them], "Am I not your Lord?"
They said, "Yes, we have testified."
[This] - lest you should say on the Day of Resurrection,
"Indeed, we were of this unaware."

7:173.t: Or [lest] you say, "It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allāh before, and we were but descendants after them. Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"

segments.t: Or [lest] you say,
"It was only that our fathers associated [others in worship] with Allāh before,
and we were but descendants after them.
Then would You destroy us for what the falsifiers have done?"

7:174.t: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses, and perhaps they will return.

segments.t: And thus do We [explain in] detail the verses,
and perhaps they will return.

7:175.t: And recite to them, [O Muḥammad], the news of him to whom We gave [knowledge of] Our signs, but he detached himself from them; so Satan pursued him, and he became of the deviators.

segments.t: And recite to them, [O Muḥammad],
the news of him to whom We gave [knowledge of] Our signs,
but he detached himself from them;
so Satan pursued him,
and he became of the deviators.

7:176.t: And if We had willed, We could have elevated him thereby, but he adhered [instead] to the earth and followed his own desire. So his example is like that of the dog: if you chase him, he pants, or if you leave him, he [still] pants. That is the example of the people who denied Our signs. So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.

segments.t: And if We had willed,
We could have elevated him thereby,
but he adhered [instead] to the earth
and followed his own desire.
So his example is like that of the dog:
if you chase him, he pants,
or if you leave him, he [still] pants.
That is the example of the people who denied Our signs.
So relate the stories that perhaps they will give thought.

7:177.t: How evil an example [is that of] the people who denied Our signs and used to wrong themselves.

segments.t: How evil an example [is that of] the people
who denied Our signs
and used to wrong themselves.

7:178.t: Whoever Allāh guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - it is those who are the losers.

segments.t: Whoever Allāh guides -
he is the [rightly] guided;
and whoever He sends astray -
it is those who are the losers.

7:179.t: And We have certainly created for Hell many of the jinn and mankind. They have hearts with which they do not understand, they have eyes with which they do not see, and they have ears with which they do not hear. Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray. It is they who are the heedless.

segments.t: And We have certainly created for Hell
many of the jinn and mankind.
They have hearts with which they do not understand,
they have eyes with which they do not see,
and they have ears with which they do not hear.
Those are like livestock; rather, they are more astray.
It is they who are the heedless.

7:18.t: [Allāh] said, "Depart from it [i.e., Paradise], reproached and expelled. Whoever follows you among them - I will surely fill Hell with you, all together."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Depart from it [i.e., Paradise],
reproached and expelled.
Whoever follows you among them -
I will surely fill Hell with you, all together."

7:180.t: And to Allāh belong the best names, so invoke Him by them. And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names. They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.

segments.t: And to Allāh belong the best names,
so invoke Him by them.
And leave [the company of] those who practice deviation concerning His names.
They will be recompensed for what they have been doing.

7:181.t: And among those We created is a community which guides by truth and thereby establishes justice.

segments.t: And among those We created is a community
which guides by truth
and thereby establishes justice.

7:182.t: But those who deny Our signs - We will progressively lead them [to destruction] from where they do not know.

segments.t: But those who deny Our signs -
We will progressively lead them [to destruction]
from where they do not know.

7:183.t: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.

segments.t: And I will give them time.
Indeed, My plan is firm.

7:184.t: Then do they not give thought? There is in their companion [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] no madness. He is not but a clear warner.

segments.t: Then do they not give thought?
There is in their companion [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] no madness.
He is not but a clear warner.

7:185.t: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth and everything that Allāh has created and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near? So in what statement [i.e., message] hereafter will they believe?

segments.t: Do they not look into the realm of the heavens and the earth
and everything that Allāh has created
and [think] that perhaps their appointed time has come near?
So in what statement [i.e., message] hereafter will they believe?

7:186.t: Whoever Allāh sends astray - there is no guide for him. And He leaves them in their transgression, wandering blindly.

segments.t: Whoever Allāh sends astray -
there is no guide for him.
And He leaves them in their transgression,
wandering blindly.

7:187.t: They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival? Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord. None will reveal its time except Him. It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth. It will not come upon you except unexpectedly." They ask you as if you are familiar with it. Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allāh, but most of the people do not know."

segments.t: They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour:
when is its arrival?
Say, "Its knowledge is only with my Lord.
None will reveal its time except Him.
It lays heavily upon the heavens and the earth.
It will not come upon you except unexpectedly."
They ask you as if you are familiar with it.
Say, "Its knowledge is only with Allāh,
but most of the people do not know."

7:188.t: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm, except what Allāh has willed. And if I knew the unseen, I could have acquired much wealth, and no harm would have touched me. I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."

segments.t: Say, "I hold not for myself [the power of] benefit or harm,
except what Allāh has willed.
And if I knew the unseen,
I could have acquired much wealth,
and no harm would have touched me.
I am not except a warner and a bringer of good tidings to a people who believe."

7:189.t: It is He who created you from one soul and created from it its mate that he might dwell in security with her. And when he [i.e., man] covers her, she carries a light burden [i.e., a pregnancy] and continues therein. And when it becomes heavy, they both invoke Allāh, their Lord, "If You should give us a good [child], we will surely be among the grateful."

segments.t: It is He who created you from one soul
and created from it its mate
that he might dwell in security with her.
And when he [i.e., man] covers her,
she carries a light burden [i.e., a pregnancy]
and continues therein.
And when it becomes heavy,
they both invoke Allāh, their Lord,
"If You should give us a good [child],
we will surely be among the grateful."

7:19.t: And "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat from wherever you will but do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."

segments.t: And "O Adam,
dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise
and eat from wherever you will
but do not approach this tree,
lest you be among the wrongdoers."

7:190.t: But when He gives them a good [child], they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them. Exalted is Allāh above what they associate with Him.

segments.t: But when He gives them a good [child],
they ascribe partners to Him concerning that which He has given them.
Exalted is Allāh above what they associate with Him.

7:191.t: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing and they are [themselves] created?

segments.t: Do they associate with Him those who create nothing
and they are [themselves] created?

7:192.t: And they [i.e., the false deities] are unable to [give] them help, nor can they help themselves.

segments.t: And they [i.e., the false deities] are unable to [give] them help,
nor can they help themselves.

7:193.t: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance, they will not follow you. It is all the same for you whether you invite them or you are silent.

segments.t: And if you [believers] invite them to guidance,
they will not follow you.
It is all the same for you
whether you invite them or you are silent.

7:194.t: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allāh are servants [i.e., creations] like you. So call upon them and let them respond to you, if you should be truthful.

segments.t: Indeed, those you [polytheists] call upon besides Allāh
are servants [i.e., creations] like you.
So call upon them
and let them respond to you,
if you should be truthful.

7:195.t: Do they have feet by which they walk? Or do they have hands by which they strike? Or do they have eyes by which they see? Or do they have ears by which they hear? Say, [O Muḥammad], "Call your 'partners' and then conspire against me and give me no respite.

segments.t: Do they have feet by which they walk?
Or do they have hands by which they strike?
Or do they have eyes by which they see?
Or do they have ears by which they hear?
Say, [O Muḥammad], "Call your 'partners'
and then conspire against me
and give me no respite.

7:196.t: Indeed, my protector is Allāh, who has sent down the Book; and He is an ally to the righteous.

segments.t: Indeed, my protector is Allāh,
who has sent down the Book;
and He is an ally to the righteous.

7:197.t: And those you call upon besides Him are unable to help you, nor can they help themselves."

segments.t: And those you call upon besides Him
are unable to help you,
nor can they help themselves."

7:198.t: And if you invite them to guidance, they do not hear; and you see them looking at you while they do not see.

segments.t: And if you invite them to guidance,
they do not hear;
and you see them looking at you
while they do not see.

7:199.t: Take what is given freely, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant.

segments.t: Take what is given freely,
enjoin what is good,
and turn away from the ignorant.

7:2.t: [This is] a Book revealed to you, [O Muḥammad] - so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom - that you may warn thereby and as a reminder to the believers.

segments.t: [This is] a Book revealed to you,
[O Muḥammad] -
so let there not be in your breast distress therefrom -
that you may warn thereby
and as a reminder to the believers.

7:20.t: But Satan whispered to them to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them of their private parts. He said, "Your Lord did not forbid you this tree except that you become angels or become of the immortal."

segments.t: But Satan whispered to them
to make apparent to them that which was concealed from them
of their private parts.
He said, "Your Lord did not forbid you this tree
except that you become angels
or become of the immortal."

7:200.t: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allāh. Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.

segments.t: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan,
then seek refuge in Allāh.
Indeed, He is Hearing and Knowing.

7:201.t: Indeed, those who fear Allāh - when an impulse touches them from Satan, they remember [Him] and at once they have insight.

segments.t: Indeed, those who fear Allāh -
when an impulse touches them from Satan,
they remember [Him]
and at once they have insight.

7:202.t: But their brothers - they [i.e., the devils] increase them in error; then they do not stop short.

segments.t: But their brothers -
they [i.e., the devils] increase them in error;
then they do not stop short.

7:203.t: And when you, [O Muḥammad], do not bring them a sign [i.e., miracle], they say, "Why have you not contrived it?" Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord. This [Qur’ān] is enlightenment from your Lord and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."

segments.t: And when you, [O Muḥammad],
do not bring them a sign [i.e., miracle],
they say, "Why have you not contrived it?"
Say, "I only follow what is revealed to me from my Lord.
This [Qur’ān] is enlightenment from your Lord
and guidance and mercy for a people who believe."

7:204.t: So when the Qur’ān is recited, then listen to it and pay attention that you may receive mercy.

segments.t: So when the Qur’ān is recited,
then listen to it and pay attention
that you may receive mercy.

7:205.t: And remember your Lord within yourself in humility and in fear without being apparent in speech - in the mornings and the evenings. And do not be among the heedless.

segments.t: And remember your Lord within yourself
in humility and in fear
without being apparent in speech -
in the mornings and the evenings.
And do not be among the heedless.

7:206.t: Indeed, those who are near your Lord [i.e., the angels] are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, and they exalt Him, and to Him they prostrate.

segments.t: Indeed, those who are near your Lord [i.e., the angels]
are not prevented by arrogance from His worship,
and they exalt Him,
and to Him they prostrate.

7:21.t: And he swore [by Allāh] to them, "Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors."

segments.t: And he swore [by Allāh] to them,
"Indeed, I am to you from among the sincere advisors."

7:22.t: So he made them fall, through deception. And when they tasted of the tree, their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And their Lord called to them, "Did I not forbid you from that tree and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?"

segments.t: So he made them fall, through deception.
And when they tasted of the tree,
their private parts became apparent to them,
and they began to fasten together over themselves from the leaves of Paradise.
And their Lord called to them,
"Did I not forbid you from that tree
and tell you that Satan is to you a clear enemy?"

7:23.t: They said, "Our Lord, we have wronged ourselves, and if You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we will surely be among the losers."

segments.t: They said,
"Our Lord,
we have wronged ourselves,
and if You do not forgive us
and have mercy upon us,
we will surely be among the losers."

7:24.t: [Allāh] said, "Descend, being to one another enemies. And for you on the earth is a place of settlement and enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time."

segments.t: [Allāh] said,
"Descend, being to one another enemies.
And for you on the earth is a place of settlement
and enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time."

7:25.t: He said, "Therein you will live, and therein you will die, and from it you will be brought forth."

segments.t: He said,
"Therein you will live,
and therein you will die,
and from it you will be brought forth."

7:26.t: O children of Adam, We have bestowed upon you clothing to conceal your private parts and as adornment. But the clothing of righteousness - that is best. That is from the signs of Allāh that perhaps they will remember.

segments.t: O children of Adam,
We have bestowed upon you clothing
to conceal your private parts and as adornment.
But the clothing of righteousness -
that is best.
That is from the signs of Allāh
that perhaps they will remember.

7:27.t: O children of Adam, let not Satan tempt you as he removed your parents from Paradise, stripping them of their clothing to show them their private parts. Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe, from where you do not see them. Indeed, We have made the devils allies to those who do not believe.

segments.t: O children of Adam,
let not Satan tempt you
as he removed your parents from Paradise,
stripping them of their clothing
to show them their private parts.
Indeed, he sees you, he and his tribe,
from where you do not see them.
Indeed, We have made the devils allies
to those who do not believe.

7:28.t: And when they commit an immorality, they say, "We found our fathers doing it, and Allāh has ordered us to do it." Say, "Indeed, Allāh does not order immorality. Do you say about Allāh that which you do not know?"

segments.t: And when they commit an immorality,
they say, "We found our fathers doing it,
and Allāh has ordered us to do it."
Say, "Indeed, Allāh does not order immorality.
Do you say about Allāh that which you do not know?"

7:29.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "My Lord has ordered justice and that you direct yourselves [to the Qiblah] at every place [or time] of prostration, and invoke Him, sincere to Him in religion." Just as He originated you, you will return [to life] -

segments.t: Say, [O Muḥammad], "My Lord has ordered justice
and that you direct yourselves [to the Qiblah]
at every place [or time] of prostration,
and invoke Him, sincere to Him in religion."
Just as He originated you,
you will return [to life] -

7:3.t: Follow, [O mankind], what has been revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow other than Him any allies. Little do you remember.

segments.t: Follow, [O mankind],
what has been revealed to you from your Lord
and do not follow other than Him any allies.
Little do you remember.

7:30.t: A group [of you] He guided, and a group deserved [to be in] error. Indeed, they [i.e., the latter] had taken the devils as allies instead of Allāh while they thought that they were guided.

segments.t: A group [of you] He guided,
and a group deserved [to be in] error.
Indeed, they [i.e., the latter] had taken the devils as allies instead of Allāh
while they thought that they were guided.

7:31.t: O children of Adam, take your adornment [i.e., wear your clothing] at every masjid, and eat and drink, but be not excessive. Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.

segments.t: O children of Adam,
take your adornment [i.e., wear your clothing] at every masjid,
and eat and drink,
but be not excessive.
Indeed, He likes not those who commit excess.

7:32.t: Say, "Who has forbidden the adornment of [i.e., from] Allāh which He has produced for His servants and the good [lawful] things of provision?" Say, "They are for those who believed during the life of this world, exclusively [for them] on the Day of Resurrection." Thus do We detail the verses for a people who know.

segments.t: Say, "Who has forbidden the adornment of [i.e., from] Allāh
which He has produced for His servants
and the good [lawful] things of provision?"
Say, "They are for those who believed during the life of this world,
exclusively [for them] on the Day of Resurrection."
Thus do We detail the verses for a people who know.

7:33.t: Say, "My Lord has only forbidden immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed - and sin, and oppression without right, and that you associate with Allāh that for which He has not sent down authority, and that you say about Allāh that which you do not know."

segments.t: Say, "My Lord has only forbidden immoralities -
what is apparent of them and what is concealed -
and sin, and oppression without right,
and that you associate with Allāh that for which He has not sent down authority,
and that you say about Allāh that which you do not know."

7:34.t: And for every nation is a [specified] term. So when their time has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

segments.t: And for every nation is a [specified] term.
So when their time has come,
they will not remain behind an hour,
nor will they precede [it].

7:35.t: O children of Adam, if there come to you messengers from among you relating to you My verses [i.e., scriptures and laws], then whoever fears Allāh and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

segments.t: O children of Adam,
if there come to you messengers from among you
relating to you My verses [i.e., scriptures and laws],
then whoever fears Allāh and reforms -
there will be no fear concerning them,
nor will they grieve.

7:36.t: But the ones who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: But the ones who deny Our verses
and are arrogant toward them -
those are the companions of the Fire;
they will abide therein eternally.

7:37.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh a lie or denies His verses? Those will attain their portion of the decree until, when Our messengers [i.e., angels] come to them to take them in death, they will say, "Where are those you used to invoke besides Allāh?" They will say, "They have departed from us," and will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

segments.t: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allāh a lie
or denies His verses?
Those will attain their portion of the decree until, when Our messengers [i.e., angels] come to them to take them in death,
they will say, "Where are those you used to invoke besides Allāh?"
They will say, "They have departed from us,"
and will bear witness against themselves that they were disbelievers.

7:38.t: [Allāh] will say, "Enter among nations which had passed on before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire." Every time a nation enters, it will curse its sister until, when they have all overtaken one another therein, the last of them will say about the first of them, "Our Lord, these had misled us, so give them a double punishment of the Fire." He will say, "For each is double, but you do not know."

segments.t: [Allāh] will say,
"Enter among nations which had passed on before you of jinn and mankind into the Fire."
Every time a nation enters,
it will curse its sister until, when they have all overtaken one another therein,
the last of them will say about the first of them,
"Our Lord, these had misled us,
so give them a double punishment of the Fire."
He will say,
"For each is double, but you do not know."

7:39.t: And the first of them will say to the last of them, "Then you had not any favor over us, so taste the punishment for what you used to earn."

segments.t: And the first of them will say to the last of them,
"Then you had not any favor over us,
so taste the punishment for what you used to earn."

7:4.t: And how many cities have We destroyed, and Our punishment came to them at night or while they were sleeping at noon.

segments.t: And how many cities have We destroyed,
and Our punishment came to them at night
or while they were sleeping at noon.

7:40.t: Indeed, those who deny Our verses and are arrogant toward them - the gates of Heaven will not be opened for them, nor will they enter Paradise until a camel enters into the eye of a needle [i.e., never]. And thus do We recompense the criminals.

segments.t: Indeed, those who deny Our verses
and are arrogant toward them -
the gates of Heaven will not be opened for them,
nor will they enter Paradise
until a camel enters into the eye of a needle [i.e., never].
And thus do We recompense the criminals.

7:41.t: They will have from Hell a bed and over them coverings [of fire]. And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

segments.t: They will have from Hell a bed
and over them coverings [of fire].
And thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

7:42.t: But those who believed and did righteous deeds - We charge no soul except [within] its capacity. Those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.

segments.t: But those who believed and did righteous deeds -
We charge no soul except [within] its capacity.
Those are the companions of Paradise;
they will abide therein eternally.

7:43.t: And We will have removed whatever is within their breasts of resentment, [while] flowing beneath them are rivers. And they will say, "Praise to Allāh, who has guided us to this; and we would never have been guided if Allāh had not guided us. Certainly the messengers of our Lord had come with the truth." And they will be called, "This is Paradise, which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do."

segments.t: And We will have removed whatever is within their breasts of resentment,
[while] flowing beneath them are rivers.
And they will say,
"Praise to Allāh, who has guided us to this;
and we would never have been guided if Allāh had not guided us.
Certainly the messengers of our Lord had come with the truth."
And they will be called,
"This is Paradise, which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do."

7:44.t: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire, "We have already found what our Lord promised us to be true. Have you found what your Lord promised to be true?" They will say, "Yes." Then an announcer will announce among them, "The curse of Allāh shall be upon the wrongdoers

segments.t: And the companions of Paradise will call out to the companions of the Fire,
"We have already found what our Lord promised us to be true.
Have you found what your Lord promised to be true?"
They will say, "Yes."
Then an announcer will announce among them,
"The curse of Allāh shall be upon the wrongdoers

7:45.t: Who averted [people] from the way of Allāh and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they were, concerning the Hereafter, disbelievers."

segments.t: Who averted [people] from the way of Allāh
and sought to make it [seem] deviant
while they were, concerning the Hereafter, disbelievers."

7:46.t: And between them will be a partition [i.e., wall], and on [its] elevations are men who recognize all by their mark. And they call out to the companions of Paradise, "Peace be upon you." They have not [yet] entered it, but they long intensely.

segments.t: And between them will be a partition [i.e., wall],
and on [its] elevations are men who recognize all by their mark.
And they call out to the companions of Paradise,
"Peace be upon you."
They have not [yet] entered it,
but they long intensely.

7:47.t: And when their eyes are turned toward the companions of the Fire, they say, "Our Lord, do not place us with the wrongdoing people."

segments.t: And when their eyes are turned
toward the companions of the Fire,
they say, "Our Lord,
do not place us with the wrongdoing people."

7:48.t: And the companions of the Elevations will call to men [within Hell] whom they recognize by their mark, saying, "Of no avail to you was your gathering and [the fact] that you were arrogant."

segments.t: And the companions of the Elevations will call to men [within Hell]
whom they recognize by their mark, saying,
"Of no avail to you was your gathering
and [the fact] that you were arrogant."

7:49.t: [Allāh will say], "Are these the ones whom you [inhabitants of Hell] swore that Allāh would never offer them mercy? Enter Paradise, [O people of the Elevations]. No fear will there be concerning you, nor will you grieve."

segments.t: [Allāh will say], "Are these the ones whom you [inhabitants of Hell] swore
that Allāh would never offer them mercy?
Enter Paradise, [O people of the Elevations].
No fear will there be concerning you, nor will you grieve."

7:5.t: And their declaration when Our punishment came to them was only that they said, "Indeed, we were wrongdoers!"

segments.t: And their declaration when Our punishment came to them
was only that they said,
"Indeed, we were wrongdoers!"

7:50.t: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise, "Pour upon us some water or from whatever Allāh has provided you." They will say, "Indeed, Allāh has forbidden them both to the disbelievers

segments.t: And the companions of the Fire will call to the companions of Paradise,
"Pour upon us some water
or from whatever Allāh has provided you."
They will say,
"Indeed, Allāh has forbidden them both to the disbelievers

7:51.t: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement and whom the worldly life deluded." So today We will forget them just as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs and for having rejected Our verses.

segments.t: Who took their religion as distraction and amusement
and whom the worldly life deluded."
So today We will forget them
just as they forgot the meeting of this Day of theirs
and for having rejected Our verses.

7:52.t: And We had certainly brought them a Book which We detailed by knowledge - as guidance and mercy to a people who believe.

segments.t: And We had certainly brought them a Book
which We detailed by knowledge -
as guidance and mercy
to a people who believe.

7:53.t: Do they await except its result? The Day its result comes, those who had ignored it before will say, "The messengers of our Lord had come with the truth, so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us or could we be sent back to do other than what we used to do?" They will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

segments.t: Do they await except its result?
The Day its result comes,
those who had ignored it before will say,
"The messengers of our Lord had come with the truth,
so are there [now] any intercessors to intercede for us
or could we be sent back to do other than what we used to do?"
They will have lost themselves,
and lost from them is what they used to invent.

7:54.t: Indeed, your Lord is Allāh, who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He covers the night with the day, [another night] chasing it rapidly; and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars, subjected by His command. Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command; blessed is Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord is Allāh,
who created the heavens and earth in six days
and then established Himself above the Throne.
He covers the night with the day,
[another night] chasing it rapidly;
and [He created] the sun, the moon, and the stars,
subjected by His command.
Unquestionably, His is the creation and the command;
blessed is Allāh, Lord of the worlds.

7:55.t: Call upon your Lord in humility and privately; indeed, He does not like transgressors.

segments.t: Call upon your Lord in humility and privately;
indeed, He does not like transgressors.

7:56.t: And cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. And invoke Him in fear and aspiration. Indeed, the mercy of Allāh is near to the doers of good.

segments.t: And cause not corruption upon the earth
after its reformation.
And invoke Him in fear and aspiration.
Indeed, the mercy of Allāh is near to the doers of good.

7:57.t: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy [i.e., rainfall] until, when they have carried heavy rainclouds, We drive them to a dead land and We send down rain therein and bring forth thereby [some] of all the fruits. Thus will We bring forth the dead; perhaps you may be reminded.

segments.t: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy [i.e., rainfall]
until, when they have carried heavy rainclouds,
We drive them to a dead land
and We send down rain therein
and bring forth thereby [some] of all the fruits.
Thus will We bring forth the dead;
perhaps you may be reminded.

7:58.t: And the good land - its vegetation emerges by permission of its Lord; but that which is bad - nothing emerges except sparsely, with difficulty. Thus do We diversify the signs for a people who are grateful.

segments.t: And the good land -
its vegetation emerges by permission of its Lord;
but that which is bad -
nothing emerges except sparsely, with difficulty.
Thus do We diversify the signs
for a people who are grateful.

7:59.t: We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day."

segments.t: We had certainly sent Noah to his people,
and he said,
"O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him.
Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day."

7:6.t: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers.

segments.t: Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent,
and We will surely question the messengers.

7:60.t: Said the eminent among his people, "Indeed, we see you in clear error."

segments.t: Said the eminent among his people,
"Indeed, we see you in clear error."

7:61.t: [Noah] said, "O my people, there is not error in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: [Noah] said,
"O my people,
there is not error in me,
but I am a messenger
from the Lord of the worlds.

7:62.t: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and advise you; and I know from Allāh what you do not know.

segments.t: I convey to you the messages of my Lord and advise you;
and I know from Allāh what you do not know.

7:63.t: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you and that you may fear Allāh so you might receive mercy?"

segments.t: Then do you wonder
that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord
through a man from among you,
that he may warn you
and that you may fear Allāh
so you might receive mercy?"

7:64.t: But they denied him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We drowned those who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a blind people.

segments.t: But they denied him,
so We saved him and those who were with him in the ship.
And We drowned those who denied Our signs.
Indeed, they were a blind people.

7:65.t: And to the ʿAad [We sent] their brother Hūd. He said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him. Then will you not fear Him?"

segments.t: And to the ʿAad [We sent] their brother Hūd.
He said, "O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him.
Then will you not fear Him?"

7:66.t: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "Indeed, we see you in foolishness, and indeed, we think you are of the liars."

segments.t: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people,
"Indeed, we see you in foolishness,
and indeed, we think you are of the liars."

7:67.t: [Hūd] said, "O my people, there is not foolishness in me, but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.

segments.t: [Hūd] said,
"O my people,
there is not foolishness in me,
but I am a messenger from the Lord of the worlds.

7:68.t: I convey to you the messages of my Lord, and I am to you a trustworthy adviser.

segments.t: I convey to you the messages of my Lord,
and I am to you a trustworthy adviser.

7:69.t: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord through a man from among you, that he may warn you? And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah and increased you in stature extensively. So remember the favors of Allāh that you might succeed."

segments.t: Then do you wonder that there has come to you a reminder from your Lord
through a man from among you, that he may warn you?
And remember when He made you successors after the people of Noah
and increased you in stature extensively.
So remember the favors of Allāh that you might succeed."

7:7.t: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge, and We were not [at all] absent.

segments.t: Then We will surely relate [their deeds] to them with knowledge,
and We were not [at all] absent.

7:70.t: They said, "Have you come to us that we should worship Allāh alone and leave what our fathers have worshipped? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."

segments.t: They said,
"Have you come to us that we should worship Allāh alone
and leave what our fathers have worshipped?
Then bring us what you promise us,
if you should be of the truthful."

7:71.t: [Hūd] said, "Already have defilement and anger fallen upon you from your Lord. Do you dispute with me concerning [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allāh has not sent down any authority? Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."

segments.t: [Hūd] said,
"Already have defilement and anger fallen upon you from your Lord.
Do you dispute with me concerning [mere] names you have named them,
you and your fathers,
for which Allāh has not sent down any authority?
Then wait;
indeed, I am with you among those who wait."

7:72.t: So We saved him and those with him by mercy from Us. And We eliminated those who denied Our signs, and they were not [at all] believers.

segments.t: So We saved him and those with him
by mercy from Us.
And We eliminated those who denied Our signs,
and they were not [at all] believers.

7:73.t: And to the Thamūd [We sent] their brother Ṣāliḥ. He said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. This is the she-camel of Allāh [sent] to you as a sign. So leave her to eat within Allāh's land and do not touch her with harm, lest there seize you a painful punishment.

segments.t: And to the Thamūd [We sent] their brother Ṣāliḥ.
He said, "O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him.
There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord.
This is the she-camel of Allāh [sent] to you as a sign.
So leave her to eat within Allāh's land
and do not touch her with harm,
lest there seize you a painful punishment.

7:74.t: And remember when He made you successors after the ʿAad and settled you in the land, [and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains and carve from the mountains, homes. Then remember the favors of Allāh and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

segments.t: And remember when He made you successors after the ʿAad
and settled you in the land,
[and] you take for yourselves palaces from its plains
and carve from the mountains, homes.
Then remember the favors of Allāh
and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

7:75.t: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people to those who were oppressed - to those who believed among them, "Do you [actually] know that Ṣāliḥ is sent from his Lord?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which he was sent, are believers."

segments.t: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people
to those who were oppressed -
to those who believed among them,
"Do you [actually] know that Ṣāliḥ is sent from his Lord?"
They said, "Indeed we, in that with which he was sent, are believers."

7:76.t: Said those who were arrogant, "Indeed we, in that which you have believed, are disbelievers."

segments.t: Said those who were arrogant,
"Indeed we, in that which you have believed, are disbelievers."

7:77.t: So they hamstrung the she-camel and were insolent toward the command of their Lord and said, "O Ṣāliḥ, bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the messengers."

segments.t: So they hamstrung the she-camel
and were insolent toward the command of their Lord
and said, "O Ṣāliḥ,
bring us what you promise us,
if you should be of the messengers."

7:78.t: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

segments.t: So the earthquake seized them,
and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

7:79.t: And he [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord and advised you, but you do not like advisors."

segments.t: And he [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] turned away from them and said,
"O my people,
I had certainly conveyed to you the message of my Lord
and advised you,
but you do not like advisors."

7:8.t: And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the truth. So those whose scales are heavy - it is they who will be the successful.

segments.t: And the weighing [of deeds] that Day will be the truth.
So those whose scales are heavy -
it is they who will be the successful.

7:80.t: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people, "Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds [i.e., peoples]?

segments.t: And [We had sent] Lot when he said to his people,
"Do you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with
from among the worlds [i.e., peoples]?

7:81.t: Indeed, you approach men with desire, instead of women. Rather, you are a transgressing people."

segments.t: Indeed, you approach men with desire,
instead of women.
Rather, you are a transgressing people."

7:82.t: But the answer of his people was only that they said, "Evict them from your city! Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure."

segments.t: But the answer of his people was only that they said,
"Evict them from your city!
Indeed, they are men who keep themselves pure."

7:83.t: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].

segments.t: So We saved him and his family,
except for his wife;
she was of those who remained [with the evildoers].

7:84.t: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones]. Then see how was the end of the criminals.

segments.t: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones].
Then see how was the end of the criminals.

7:85.t: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shuʿayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allāh; you have no deity other than Him. There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord. So fulfill the measure and weight and do not deprive people of their due and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation. That is better for you, if you should be believers.

segments.t: And to [the people of] Madyan [We sent] their brother Shuʿayb.
He said, "O my people, worship Allāh;
you have no deity other than Him.
There has come to you clear evidence from your Lord.
So fulfill the measure and weight
and do not deprive people of their due
and cause not corruption upon the earth after its reformation.
That is better for you, if you should be believers.

7:86.t: And do not sit on every path, threatening and averting from the way of Allāh those who believe in Him, seeking to make it [seem] deviant. And remember when you were few and He increased you. And see how was the end of the corrupters.

segments.t: And do not sit on every path,
threatening and averting from the way of Allāh
those who believe in Him,
seeking to make it [seem] deviant.
And remember when you were few and He increased you.
And see how was the end of the corrupters.

7:87.t: And if there should be a group among you who has believed in that with which I have been sent and a group that has not believed, then be patient until Allāh judges between us. And He is the best of judges."

segments.t: And if there should be a group among you
who has believed in that with which I have been sent
and a group that has not believed,
then be patient until Allāh judges between us.
And He is the best of judges."

7:88.t: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people, "We will surely evict you, O Shuʿayb, and those who have believed with you from our city, or you must return to our religion." He said, "Even if we were unwilling?

segments.t: Said the eminent ones who were arrogant among his people,
"We will surely evict you, O Shuʿayb,
and those who have believed with you from our city,
or you must return to our religion."
He said, "Even if we were unwilling?

7:89.t: We would have invented against Allāh a lie if we returned to your religion after Allāh had saved us from it. And it is not for us to return to it except that Allāh, our Lord, should will. Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. Upon Allāh we have relied. Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth, and You are the best of those who give decision."

segments.t: We would have invented against Allāh a lie
if we returned to your religion
after Allāh had saved us from it.
And it is not for us to return to it
except that Allāh, our Lord, should will.
Our Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge.
Upon Allāh we have relied.
Our Lord, decide between us and our people in truth,
and You are the best of those who give decision."

7:9.t: And those whose scales are light - they are the ones who will lose themselves for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.

segments.t: And those whose scales are light -
they are the ones who will lose themselves
for what injustice they were doing toward Our verses.

7:90.t: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people, "If you should follow Shuʿayb, indeed, you would then be losers."

segments.t: Said the eminent ones who disbelieved among his people,
"If you should follow Shuʿayb,
indeed, you would then be losers."

7:91.t: So the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

segments.t: So the earthquake seized them,
and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

7:92.t: Those who denied Shuʿayb - it was as though they had never resided there. Those who denied Shuʿayb - it was they who were the losers.

segments.t: Those who denied Shuʿayb -
it was as though they had never resided there.
Those who denied Shuʿayb -
it was they who were the losers.

7:93.t: And he [i.e., Shuʿayb] turned away from them and said, "O my people, I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you, so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"

segments.t: And he [i.e., Shuʿayb] turned away from them and said,
"O my people,
I had certainly conveyed to you the messages of my Lord and advised you,
so how could I grieve for a disbelieving people?"

7:94.t: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied] except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship that they might humble themselves [to Allāh].

segments.t: And We sent to no city a prophet [who was denied]
except that We seized its people with poverty and hardship
that they might humble themselves [to Allāh].

7:95.t: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good, until they increased [and prospered] and said, "Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease." So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.

segments.t: Then We exchanged in place of the bad [condition], good,
until they increased [and prospered] and said,
"Our fathers [also] were touched with hardship and ease."
So We seized them suddenly while they did not perceive.

7:96.t: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allāh, We would have opened [i.e., bestowed] upon them blessings from the heaven and the earth; but they denied [the messengers], so We seized them for what they were earning.

segments.t: And if only the people of the cities had believed and feared Allāh,
We would have opened [i.e., bestowed] upon them blessings
from the heaven and the earth;
but they denied [the messengers],
so We seized them for what they were earning.

7:97.t: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them at night while they were asleep?

segments.t: Then, did the people of the cities feel secure
from Our punishment coming to them at night
while they were asleep?

7:98.t: Or did the people of the cities feel secure from Our punishment coming to them in the morning while they were at play?

segments.t: Or did the people of the cities feel secure
from Our punishment coming to them in the morning
while they were at play?

7:99.t: Then, did they feel secure from the plan of Allāh? But no one feels secure from the plan of Allāh except the losing people.

segments.t: Then, did they feel secure from the plan of Allāh?
But no one feels secure from the plan of Allāh
except the losing people.

80:1.t: He [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ) ] frowned and turned away

segments.t: He [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ) ] frowned
and turned away
From him you are distracted.

80:11.t: No! Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;

segments.t: No!
Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;

80:12.t: So whoever wills may remember it.

segments.t: So whoever wills
may remember it.
[It is recorded] in honored sheets,
Exalted and purified,
[Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
Noble and dutiful.

80:17.t: Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man; how disbelieving is he.

segments.t: Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man;
how disbelieving is he.

80:18.t: From what thing [i.e., substance] did He create him?

segments.t: From what thing [i.e., substance]
did He create him?

80:19.t: From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;

segments.t: From a sperm-drop He created him
and destined for him;

80:2.t: Because there came to him the blind man, [interrupting].

segments.t: Because there came to him the blind man,
[interrupting].

80:20.t: Then He eased the way for him;

segments.t: Then He eased the way for him;

80:21.t: Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.

segments.t: Then He causes his death
and provides a grave for him.

80:22.t: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

segments.t: Then when He wills,
He will resurrect him.

80:23.t: No! He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.

segments.t: No!
He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished
what He commanded him.

80:24.t: Then let mankind look at his food -

segments.t: Then let mankind look at his food -

80:25.t: How We poured down water in torrents,

segments.t: How We poured down water in torrents,

80:26.t: Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],

segments.t: Then We broke open the earth,
splitting [it with sprouts],

80:27.t: And caused to grow within it grain

segments.t: And caused to grow within it grain
And grapes
and herbage
And olive
and palm trees

80:3.t: But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad], that perhaps he might be purified

segments.t: But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad],
that perhaps he might be purified
And gardens

89:14.t: Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

segments.t: Indeed, your Lord
is in observation.

89:15.t: And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."

segments.t: And as for man,
when his Lord tries him
and [thus] is generous to him
and favors him,
he says, "My Lord has honored me."

89:16.t: But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."

segments.t: But when He tries him
and restricts his provision,
he says,
"My Lord has humiliated me."

89:17.t: No! But you do not honor the orphan

segments.t: No!
But you do not honor the orphan

89:18.t: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.

segments.t: And you do not encourage one another
to feed the poor.

89:19.t: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,

segments.t: And you consume inheritance,
devouring [it] altogether,
And [by] ten nights

89:20.t: And you love wealth with immense love.

segments.t: And you love wealth
with immense love.

89:21.t: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed

segments.t: No!
When the earth has been leveled -
pounded and crushed

89:22.t: And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank,

segments.t: And your Lord has come
and the angels, rank upon rank,

89:23.t: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?

segments.t: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell -
that Day, man will remember,
but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?

89:24.t: He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."

segments.t: He will say,
"Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."

89:25.t: So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,

segments.t: So on that Day,
none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,

89:26.t: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].

segments.t: And none will bind [as severely]
as His binding [of the evildoers].

89:27.t: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,

segments.t: [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,

89:28.t: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],

segments.t: Return to your Lord,
well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
And enter among My [righteous] servants

89:3.t: And [by] the even [number] and the odd

segments.t: And [by] the even [number]
and the odd
And enter My Paradise."

89:4.t: And [by] the night when it passes,

segments.t: And [by] the night
when it passes,

89:5.t: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?

segments.t: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient]
for one of perception?

89:6.t: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -

segments.t: Have you not considered
how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -
[With] Iram -
who had lofty pillars,

89:8.t: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?

segments.t: The likes of whom had never been created
in the land?

89:9.t: And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
